gelo: <entryFree id="n19371" type="main" key="ge^lo1" n="1"><orth extent="full" lang="la">gĕlo</orth>, <itype>āvi, ātum, 1</itype>, <pos>v. a.</pos> and <gen>n.</gen> <etym>gelu</etym>. <sense id="n19371.0" n="I" level="1"> <hi rend="ital">Act.</hi>, <hi rend="ital">to cause to freeze</hi>, <hi rend="ital">to congeal.—Pass.</hi>, <hi rend="ital">to be frozen</hi>, <hi rend="ital">to freeze.</hi> </sense><sense id="n19371.1" n="A" level="2"> In gen.: <cit><quote lang="la">si gelent frigora, quarto die premendam (olivam),</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:15:21" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 15, 6, 6, § 21</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">fluvius, qui ferrum gelat,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1294,001:1:50:12" default="NO"><author>Mart.</author> 1, 50, 12</bibl></cit>.—<hi rend="ital">Pass.</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">quae (alvearia fictilia) et accenduntur aestatis vaporibus et gelantur hiemis frigoribus (shortly before: nec hieme rigent, nec candent aestate),</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0845,001:9:6:2" default="NO"><author>Col.</author> 9, 6, 2</bibl></cit>.—Esp. freq. in the <hi rend="ital">part. perf.</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">amnes gelati lacusque,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:8:103" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 8, 28, 42, § 103</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">lac, Col. poët. 10, 397: caseus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:7:8:7" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> 7, 8, 7</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">manus Aquilone,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1294,001:5:9:3" default="NO"><author>Mart.</author> 5, 9, 3</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n19371.2" n="B" level="2"> In partic., <hi rend="ital">to freeze</hi>, <hi rend="ital">chill</hi>, <hi rend="ital">stiffen</hi> with fright, horror, etc.; in <hi rend="ital">pass.</hi>, <hi rend="ital">to be frozen</hi>, <hi rend="ital">chilled; to be numbed</hi> or <hi rend="ital">stiff</hi> (cf.: <cit><quote lang="la">gelu and gelidus): gelat ora pavor,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1020,001:4:497" default="NO"><author>Stat.</author> Th. 4, 497</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">timent pavidoque gelantur Pectore,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1276,001:6:95" default="NO"><author>Juv.</author> 6, 95</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">sic fata gelatis Vultibus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1020,001:4:404" default="NO"><author>Stat.</author> Th. 4, 404</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">gelato corde attonitus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0917,001:7:339" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Luc.</author> 7, 339</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">gelati orbes (i. e. oculi emortui),</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0917,001:6:541" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> 6, 541</bibl></cit>.— </sense><sense id="n19371.3" n="II" level="1"> <hi rend="ital">Neutr.</hi>, <hi rend="ital">to freeze</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">pruinae perniciosior natura, quoniam lapsa persidet gelatque,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:17:222" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 17, 24, 37, § 222</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">venae,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1020,001:4:727" default="NO"><author>Stat.</author> Th. 4, 727</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">vultus Perseos,</quote> <trans>i. e. <tr>to be petrified</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0917,001:9:681" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Luc.</author> 9, 681</bibl></cit>.—<hi rend="ital">Impers.</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">non ante demetuntur quam gelaverit,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:14:39" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 14, 3, 4, § 39</bibl></cit>; <bibl default="NO"><author>Vulg.</author> Sir. 43, 21</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>

<entryFree id="n19372" type="main" key="Ge^lo2" n="2"><orth extent="full" lang="la">Gĕlo</orth> or <orth extent="full" lang="la">Gĕlon</orth>, <itype>ōnis</itype>, <gen>m.</gen>, = <foreign lang="greek">*ge/lwn</foreign>, <sense id="n19372.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">king of Syracuse</hi>, <hi rend="ital">son of Hiero II.</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:23:30" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 23, 30</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:24:5" default="NO" valid="yes">24, 5</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,2806,001:23:4" default="NO"><author>Just.</author> 23, 4</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:8:144" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 8, 40, 61, § 144</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
gelon: <entryFree id="n19373" type="main" key="Ge^lo_n"><orth extent="full" lang="la">Gĕlōn</orth>, <itype>ontis</itype>, <gen>m.</gen> <etym><foreign lang="greek">gelw=n</foreign>, laughing</etym>, <sense id="n19373.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a fountain in Phrygia whose water caused laughter</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:31:19" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 31, 2, 16, § 19</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
geloni: <entryFree id="n19374" type="main" key="Ge^lo_ni"><orth extent="full" lang="la">Gĕlōni</orth>, <itype>ōrum</itype>, <gen>m.</gen>, = <foreign lang="greek">*gelwnoi/</foreign>, <sense id="n19374.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a Scythian people</hi>, <hi rend="ital">on the Borysthenes</hi>, <hi rend="ital">in the modern Ukraine</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0929,001:2:1:13" default="NO"><author>Mel.</author> 2, 1, 13</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:4:88" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 4, 12, 26, § 88</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,002:2:115" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> G. 2, 115</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,003:8:725" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> A. 8, 725</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0893,001:2:9:23" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Hor.</author> C. 2, 9, 23</bibl>; <bibl default="NO">2, 20, 19</bibl>; <bibl default="NO">3, 4, 35</bibl>.—In <number>sing.</number>: <orth extent="full" lang="la">Gĕlō-nus</orth>, <itype>i</itype>, <gen>m.</gen>, <hi rend="ital">the Gelonian</hi>, collect., <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,002:3:461" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> G. 3, 461</bibl>.—</sense><sense id="n19374.1" n="II" level="1"> Deriv.: <orth extent="full" lang="la">Gĕlōnus</orth>, <itype>a, um</itype>, <pos>adj.</pos>, <hi rend="ital">of</hi> or <hi rend="ital">belonging to the Geloni</hi>, <hi rend="ital">Gelonian</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">canes,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Grat.</author> Cyneg. 195</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
gelotophye: <entryFree id="n19375" type="greek" key="ge^lo_to^phy^e"><orth extent="full" lang="la">gĕlōtŏphye</orth>, <itype>ēs</itype>, <gen>f.</gen>, = <foreign lang="greek">gelwtofuh/</foreign>, <sense id="n19375.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a plant</hi>, <hi rend="ital">called also</hi> batrachion, <bibl default="NO"><author>App.</author> Herb. 8</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
gelotophyllis: <entryFree id="n19376" type="greek" key="ge^lo_to^phyllis"><orth extent="full" lang="la">gĕlōtŏphyllis</orth>, <itype>ĭdis</itype>, <gen>f.</gen>, = <foreign lang="greek">gelwto/fullis</foreign>, <sense id="n19376.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a plant that causes laughter</hi>, probably <hi rend="ital">a sort of crow-foot</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:24:164" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 24, 17, 102, § 164</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
gelous: <entryFree id="n19377" type="main" key="Ge^lo_us"><orth extent="full" lang="la">Gĕlōus</orth>, <itype>a, um</itype>, v. Gela, II. A.</entryFree>
gelum: <entryFree id="n19378" type="main" key="ge^lum"><orth extent="full" lang="la">gĕlum</orth>, <itype>i</itype>, <gen>n.</gen>, and <orth extent="full" lang="la">gĕlus</orth>, <itype>ūs</itype>, <gen>m.</gen> (<case>nom.</case> <orth extent="full" lang="la">gelu</orth>, <gen>n.</gen>, <bibl default="NO"><author>Prisc.</author> 658</bibl> P.; but only found in Liv. ap. <bibl default="NO"><author>Non.</author> 207, 30</bibl>, a corrupt passage; and freq. in Vulg., e. g. Dan. 3, 69; <sense id="n19378.0" n="I" level="1"><cit><quote lang="la">Zach. 14, 6: gelum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0550,001:6:877" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Lucr.</author> 6, 877</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0684,001:R. R. 1:45:2" default="NO"><author>Varr.</author> R. R. 1, 45, 2</bibl>; <hi rend="ital">gen.</hi> geli, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0550,001:5:205 al" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Lucr.</author> 5, 205 al.</bibl>; <case>nom.</case> gelus, Att. <cb n="GEMI" /> ap. <bibl default="NO"><author>Prisc.</author> 6, p. 685</bibl> P.; cf. <bibl default="NO"><author>Non.</author> 208, 1</bibl>, Fragm Trag. v. 390 Rib.; Afran. ap. <bibl default="NO"><author>Non.</author> 207, 32</bibl>, Com. Fragm. v. 106 Rib.; <bibl default="NO"><author>Cato</author>, R. R. 40, 4 al.</bibl>; <case>acc.</case> <itype>gelum</itype>, <gen>m.</gen>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0472,001:Orig. 2" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cat.</author> Orig. 2</bibl>, Fragm. 30; <case>abl.</case> <itype>gelu</itype>, <gen>m.</gen>, Mela, 3, 5 <hi rend="ital">ext.;</hi> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1242,001:4:12:18" default="NO"><author>Flor.</author> 4, 12, 18</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1318,002:12" default="NO"><author>Plin.</author> Pan. 12</bibl>) [root <foreign lang="greek">gal</foreign>-, to be bright; whence <foreign lang="greek">gela/w</foreign>, to laugh (cf. <foreign lang="greek">kuma/twn ge/lasma</foreign>, Aesch. Pr. 90); <foreign lang="greek">ga/la</foreign>, milk; <foreign lang="greek">galh/nh</foreign>, calm; cf.: lac, glacies; cf. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0860,001:Gr. Etym. p. 172" default="NO"><author>Curt.</author> Gr. Etym. p. 172</bibl>], <hi rend="ital">icy coldness</hi>, <hi rend="ital">frost</hi>, <hi rend="ital">cold</hi> (cf.: pruina, glacies, rigor). </sense><sense id="n19378.1" n="I" level="1"> In gen.: <cit><quote lang="la">praeusti artus, nive rigentes nervi, membra torrida gelu,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:21:40:9" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 21, 40, 9</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">nec ventus fraudi, solve geluve fuit, Ov. de Nuce, 106: et maris adstricto quae coit unda gelu,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:Tr. 2:196" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Tr. 2, 196</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">altitudo gelūs,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:8:103" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 8, 28, 42, § 103</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">geluque Flumina constiterint acuto,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0893,001:1:9:3" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Hor.</author> C. 1, 9, 3</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">rura gelu tum claudit hiems,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,002:2:317" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> G. 2, 317</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">horrida cano Bruma gelu,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 3, 442</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1020,001:5:392" default="NO"><author>Stat.</author> Th. 5, 392</bibl>.—</sense><sense id="n19378.2" n="II" level="1"> In partic., <hi rend="ital">coldness</hi>, <hi rend="ital">chill</hi> produced by death, old age, fright, etc. (cf. gelidus, II.; <usg type="style">poet.</usg>): <cit><quote lang="la">pectora pigro Stricta gelu,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0917,001:4:653" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Luc.</author> 4, 653</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">sed mihi tarda gelu saeclisque effeta senectus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,003:8:508" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> A. 8, 508</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1014,001:Troad. 624" default="NO"><author>Sen.</author> Troad. 624</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
gemebundus: <entryFree id="n19379" type="hapax" key="ge^me^bundus"><orth extent="full" lang="la">gĕmĕbundus</orth>, <itype>a, um</itype>, <pos>adj.</pos> <etym>gemo</etym>, <sense id="n19379.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">groaning</hi>, <hi rend="ital">sighing</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,006:14:188" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ov.</author> M. 14, 188</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
gemellar: <entryFree id="n19380" type="main" key="ge^mellar"><orth extent="full" lang="la">gĕmellar</orth>, <itype>āris</itype>, <gen>n.</gen> <etym>gemellus</etym>, <sense id="n19380.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a vessel for holding oil</hi> (very rare), <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0845,001:12:52:10" default="NO"><author>Col.</author> 12, 52, 10</bibl>.— Also <orth extent="full" lang="la">gĕmellārĭa</orth>, <itype>ae</itype>, <gen>f.</gen>, Aug. ap. Psa. 136 <hi rend="ital">med.</hi>; and <orth extent="full" lang="la">gĕmellārĭum</orth>, <itype>i</itype>, <gen>n.</gen>, id. ap. Psa. 80, 1 al.</sense></entryFree>
gemellipara: <entryFree id="n19381" type="main" key="ge^melli^pa^ra"><orth extent="full" lang="la">gĕmellĭpăra</orth>, <itype>ae</itype>, <gen>f.</gen> <etym>gemellus-pario</etym>, <sense id="n19381.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">twin-bearing</hi>, an epithet framed by Ovid, and applied to Latona (on account of her twin-children, Apollo and Diana): <cit><quote lang="la">dea,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,007:5:542" default="NO"><author>Ov.</author> F. 5, 542</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">divae,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,006:6:315" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> M. 6, 315</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
gemellus: <entryFree id="n19382" type="main" key="ge^mellus"><orth extent="full" lang="la">gĕmellus</orth>, <itype>a, um</itype>, <sense id="n19382.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">adj. dim.</hi> [geminus], <hi rend="ital">born at the same time</hi>, <hi rend="ital">twin-born</hi>, <hi rend="ital">twin-</hi> (mostly <usg type="style">poet.</usg>; cf. geminus). </sense><sense id="n19382.1" n="I" level="1"> <usg type="style">Lit.</usg> </sense><sense id="n19382.2" n="A" level="2"> <hi rend="ital">Adj.</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">flebat avus Phoebeque soror fratresque gemelli,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,002:8:77" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ov.</author> H. 8, 77</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">proles,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,010:6:121" default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 6, 121</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,006:9:453" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> M. 9, 453</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">fetus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,002:6:143" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> H. 6, 143</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">partus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,006:6:712" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> M. 6, 712</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:tlg,0527,031:4:2" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Vulg.</author> Cant. 4, 2</bibl>.—</sense><sense id="n19382.3" n="B" level="2"> <hi rend="ital">Subst.</hi>: <orth extent="full" lang="la">gĕmellus</orth>, <itype>i</itype>, <gen>m.</gen>, <hi rend="ital">a twin</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">gemelle Castor et gemelle Castoris,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0472,001:4:27" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cat.</author> 4, 27</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">namque est enixa gemellos,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,006:11:316" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ov.</author> M. 11, 316</bibl></cit>; cf. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,001:1:14" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> E. 1, 14</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">hac in re scilicet una Multum dissimiles, at cetera paene gemelli Fraternis animis, etc.,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Hor.</author> Ep. 1, 10, 3</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n19382.4" n="II" level="1"> <usg type="style">Transf.</usg> </sense><sense id="n19382.5" n="A" level="2"> In gen., <hi rend="ital">paired</hi>, <hi rend="ital">double</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">poma cohaerentia et gemella,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:15:51" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 15, 14, 15, § 51</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">vites,</quote> <trans><tr>that have two clusters on one stalk</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:14:21" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> 14, 2, 4, § 21</bibl></cit> (for which: <cit><quote lang="la">geminae vites,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0845,001:3:2:10" default="NO"><author>Col.</author> 3, 2, 10</bibl></cit>): <cit><quote lang="la">gemella legio,</quote> <trans><tr>formed out of two legions</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0448,002:3:4:1" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Caes.</author> B. C. 3, 4, 1</bibl></cit>; cf. geminus, II. A.—</sense><sense id="n19382.6" n="B" level="2"> <hi rend="ital">Resembling</hi> or <hi rend="ital">like</hi>, as twins: <cit><quote lang="la">par nobile fratrum, Nequitia et nugis pravorum et amore gemellum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0893,004:2:3:244" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Hor.</author> S. 2, 3, 244</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">pinus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1294,001:10:92:3" default="NO"><author>Mart.</author> 10, 92, 3</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">uniones,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1294,001:12:49:12" default="NO"><author>id.</author> 12, 49, 12</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
geminatim: <entryFree id="n19383" type="gloss" key="ge^mi^na_tim"><orth extent="full" lang="la">gĕmĭnātim</orth>, <pos>adv.</pos> <etym>gemino</etym>, <sense id="n19383.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">doubly</hi>, acc. to <bibl default="NO"><author>Diom.</author> p. 402</bibl> P. (without an example).</sense></entryFree>
geminatio: <entryFree id="n19384" type="main" key="ge^mi^na_ti^o"><orth extent="full" lang="la">gĕmĭnātĭo</orth>, <itype>ōnis</itype>, <gen>f.</gen> <etym>id.</etym>, <sense id="n19384.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a doubling</hi>: geminatio verborum habet interdum vim, leporem alias, * <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,037:3:54:206" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> de Or. 3, 54, 206</bibl>; so, <cit><quote lang="la">verborum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:9:3:67" default="NO"><author>Quint.</author> 9, 3, 67</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">vocalium,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:1:4:10" default="NO"><author>id.</author> 1, 4, 10</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">accusativi,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:7:9:10" default="NO"><author>id.</author> 7, 9, 10</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:9:3:29" default="NO"><author>id.</author> 9, 3, 29</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">in eadem vitii geminatione,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:1:5:12" default="NO"><author>id.</author> 1, 5, 12</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1254,001:13:24:4" default="NO"><author>Gell.</author> 13, 24, 4</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
geminitudo: <entryFree id="n19385" type="hapax" key="ge^mi^ni^tu_do"><orth extent="full" lang="la">gĕmĭnĭtūdo</orth>, <itype>ĭnis</itype>, <gen>f.</gen> <etym>geminus</etym>, <sense id="n19385.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">the difference between twins</hi>: habeo ego istam qui distinguam inter vos geminitudinem, i. e. <hi rend="ital">mark</hi>, Pac. ap. <bibl default="NO"><author>Non.</author> 116, 18</bibl> (Trag. Rel. v. 61 Rib.).</sense></entryFree>
gemino: <entryFree id="n19386" type="main" key="ge^mi^no"><orth extent="full" lang="la">gĕmĭno</orth>, <itype>āvi, ātum, 1</itype>, <pos>v. a.</pos> and <gen>n.</gen> <etym>id.</etym>. <sense id="n19386.0" n="I" level="1"> <hi rend="ital">Act.</hi>, <hi rend="ital">to double</hi> (class.; syn. duplico). </sense><sense id="n19386.1" n="A" level="2"> <usg type="style">Lit.</usg>: <cit><quote lang="la">favos,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0684,001:R. R. 3:16:32" default="NO"><author>Varr.</author> R. R. 3, 16, 32</bibl></cit>: ructuosus spiritus, Cael. ap. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:4:2:123" default="NO"><author>Quint.</author> 4, 2, 123</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">victoriae laetitiam,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:45:13" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 45, 13</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">semivocales,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:1:7:14" default="NO"><author>Quint.</author> 1, 7, 14</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">verba,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:9:3:28" default="NO"><author>id.</author> 9, 3, 28</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">decem vitae frater geminaverat annos,</quote> <trans>i. e. <tr>had completed his twentieth year</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,008:4:10:31" default="NO"><author>Ov.</author> Tr. 4, 10, 31</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">labor geminaverat aestum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,006:5:586" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> M. 5, 586</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">pericula,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0660,001:2:3:39" default="NO"><author>Tib.</author> 2, 3, 39</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">facinus,</quote> <trans><tr>to repeat</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,006:10:471" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ov.</author> M. 10, 471</bibl></cit>.—<usg type="style"><hi rend="ital">Absol.</hi></usg>: <cit><quote lang="la">geminabit (sc. pugnum s. plagam) nisi caves,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0134,006:2:1:19" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ter.</author> Ad. 2, 1, 19</bibl></cit>.—In <hi rend="ital">part. perf.</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">tum sole geminato, quod Tuditano et Aquillio consulibus evenerat, ctc.,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,050:2:5:14" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> N. D. 2, 5, 14</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">verba,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> Part. 6, 21</bibl></cit>; cf. <cit><quote lang="la">littera,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:1:7:29" default="NO"><author>Quint.</author> 1, 7, 29</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:1:4:11" default="NO">1, 4, 11</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">victoria,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:1:25:11" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 1, 25, 11</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">luctus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:40:55" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> 40, 55</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">urbs,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:1:13" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> 1, 13</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">onus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:2:3:2" default="NO"><author>Quint.</author> 2, 3, 2</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">vulnus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,006:12:257" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ov.</author> M. 12, 257</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">plausus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,002:2:509" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> G. 2, 509</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">consulatus,</quote> <trans><tr>repeated</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1351,005:1:3" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Tac.</author> A. 1, 3</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">invidiam fieri geminati honoris,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:39:39:9" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 39, 39, 9</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">honor,</quote> <trans><tr>augmented</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1318,002:92:1" default="NO"><author>Plin.</author> Pan. 92, 1</bibl></cit>.— <pb n="805" /> <cb n="GEMI" /> <usg type="style">Poet.</usg>: <cit><quote lang="la">quae postquam aspexit geminatus gaudia ductor Sidonius,</quote> <trans>i. e. <tr>feeling double joy</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1345,001:10:514" default="NO"><author>Sil.</author> 10, 514</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n19386.2" n="B" level="2"> <usg type="style">Transf.</usg>, <hi rend="ital">to pair</hi>, <hi rend="ital">join</hi>, or <hi rend="ital">unite</hi> two things together: <cit><quote lang="la">non ut Serpentes avibus geminentur, tigribus agni,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0893,006:13" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Hor.</author> A. P. 13</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">geminari legionum castra prohibuit,</quote> <trans><tr>the encamping of two legions together</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1348,001:life=dom.:7" default="NO"><author>Suet.</author> Dom. 7</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1020,002:1:2:239" default="NO"><author>Stat.</author> S. 1, 2, 239</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">non acuta Sic geminant Corybantes aera,</quote> <trans>i. e. <tr>strike together</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0893,001:1:16:8" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Hor.</author> C. 1, 16, 8</bibl></cit>.—In <hi rend="ital">part. perf.</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">prope geminata cacumina montium,</quote> <trans><tr>nearly of the same height</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:36:24:9" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 36, 24, 9</bibl></cit>.— * </sense><sense id="n19386.3" n="II" level="1"> <hi rend="ital">Neutr.</hi>, <hi rend="ital">to be double</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0550,001:4:451" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Lucr.</author> 4, 451</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
geminus: <entryFree id="n19387" type="main" key="ge^mi^nus"><orth extent="full" lang="la">gĕmĭnus</orth>, <itype>a, um</itype>, <pos>adj.</pos> <etym>cf.: gener, genui (gigno)</etym>, <sense id="n19387.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">born at the same time</hi>, <hi rend="ital">twin-born</hi>, <hi rend="ital">twin</hi>- (class.). </sense><sense id="n19387.1" n="I" level="1"> <usg type="style">Lit.</usg> </sense><sense id="n19387.2" n="A" level="2"> <hi rend="ital">Adj.</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">tibi sunt gemini et trigemini filii,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,012:3:1:123" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Mil. 3, 1, 123</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">filios parere,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,001:5:1:36" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Am. 5, 1, 36</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">C. et L. Fabricii fratres gemini fuerunt ex municipio Aletrinati,</quote> <trans><tr>twin-brothers</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,010:16:46" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Clu. 16, 46</bibl></cit>; <cit><quote lang="la">v. frater: sorores,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,006:4:774" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ov.</author> M. 4, 774</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0893,001:4:7:5" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Hor.</author> C. 4, 7, 5</bibl>; cf.: <cit><quote lang="la">soror gemina germana,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,012:2:4:30" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Mil. 2, 4, 30</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">pueri,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,003:8:631" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> A. 8, 631</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">proles,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 1, 274</bibl></cit>: dei (i. e. Apollo and Diana), Enn. ap. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0684,001:L. L. 7:section=16" default="NO"><author>Varr.</author> L. L. 7, § 16</bibl> Müll. (Trag. v. 425 Vahl.): <cit><quote lang="la">partus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:1:4:2" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 1, 4, 2</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">Castor,</quote> <trans>i. e. <tr>Castor and Pollux</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,004:1:746" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ov.</author> A. A. 1, 746</bibl></cit>; cf. <cit><quote lang="la">Pollux,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0893,001:3:29:64" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Hor.</author> C. 3, 29, 64</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">nec gemino bellum Trojanum orditur ab ovo,</quote> <trans>i. e. <tr>from Helen</tr>, <tr>the twin-daughter of Leda</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0893,006:147" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> A. P. 147</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">fratres, Amphion atque Zethus,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> Ep. 1, 18, 41</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">Quirini,</quote> <trans>i. e. <tr>Romulus and Remus</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1276,001:11:105" default="NO"><author>Juv.</author> 11, 105</bibl></cit>.—Comically in the <hi rend="ital">sup.: To.</hi> Hic ejus geminust frater. <hi rend="ital">Do.</hi> Hicine'st? <hi rend="ital">To.</hi> Ac geminissimus, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,014:5:2:49" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Pers. 5, 2, 49</bibl>.—</sense><sense id="n19387.3" n="B" level="2"> <hi rend="ital">Subst.</hi>: <orth extent="full" lang="la">gĕmĭni</orth>, <itype>ōrum</itype>, <gen>m.</gen>, <hi rend="ital">twins</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">Servilii, qui gemini fuerunt ... ut mater geminos internoscit consuetudine oculorum, sic, etc.,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Ac. 2, 18, 56 sq.</bibl></cit>; cf.: <cit><quote lang="la">geminorum formas esse similes,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,053:2:43:90" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Div. 2, 43, 90</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:1:6:4" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 1, 6, 4</bibl>.—Of beasts: <cit><quote lang="la">(asina) raro geminos parit,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:8:168" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 8, 43, 68, § 168</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n19387.4" n="2" level="3"> In partic. </sense><sense id="n19387.5" n="a" level="4"> <orth extent="full" lang="la">Gemini</orth>, <itype>as a constellation</itype>, <hi rend="ital">The Twins</hi> (Castor and Pollux; <cit><quote lang="la">acc. to others, Apollo and Hercules),</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:18:281" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 18, 29, 69, § 281</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0684,001:R. R. 2:1:7" default="NO"><author>Varr.</author> R. R. 2, 1, 7</bibl>; called also geminum astrum, Col. poët. 10, 312.—</sense><sense id="n19387.6" n="b" level="4"> Acc. to the Gr. <foreign lang="greek">di/dumoi</foreign>, <hi rend="ital">the testicles</hi>, i. q. testiculi (late Lat.), <bibl default="NO"><author>Sol.</author> 13</bibl>; <bibl default="NO"><author>Amm.</author> 16, 7</bibl>.—</sense><sense id="n19387.7" n="II" level="1"> <usg type="style">Transf.</usg> </sense><sense id="n19387.8" n="A" level="2"> In gen., <hi rend="ital">paired</hi>, <hi rend="ital">double</hi>, <hi rend="ital">two-fold</hi>, <hi rend="ital">both</hi>, <hi rend="ital">two</hi>, = duplex, duo: <cit><quote lang="la">gemino lucernae lumine declarari, dissensionem et seditionem moveri,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,053:2:58:120" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Div. 2, 58, 120</bibl></cit>; cf.: <cit><quote lang="la">ex unis geminas mihi conficies nuptias,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0134,001:4:1:51" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ter.</author> And. 4, 1, 51</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">et tripodes gemini,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,003:9:265" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> A. 9, 265</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">cum quaererent alii Numerium, alii Quintium, gemini nominis errore servatus est (Numerius Quintius),</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,022:38:82" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Sest. 38, 82</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">sunt geminae Somni portae, quarum altera, etc.,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,003:6:894" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> A. 6, 894</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">scopuli,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 1, 162</bibl></cit>; cf.: <cit><quote lang="la">vos, geminae voragines rei publicae,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,027:18:41" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Pis. 18, 41</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">huc geminas nunc flecte acies,</quote> <trans><tr>your pair of eyes</tr>, <tr>both eyes</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,003:6:788" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> A. 6, 788</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">tempora,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 5, 416</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">nares,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,002:4:300" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> G. 4, 300</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">cornua (Eridani),</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 4, 371</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">manus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1294,001:10:10:10" default="NO"><author>Mart.</author> 10, 10, 10</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">pedes,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,007:2:154" default="NO"><author>Ov.</author> F. 2, 154</bibl></cit>; <cit><quote lang="la">for which: pes,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,004:2:644" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> A. A. 2, 644</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">geminae (vites),</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0845,001:3:2:10" default="NO"><author>Col.</author> 3, 2, 10</bibl></cit> (for which: <cit><quote lang="la">gemellae vites,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:14:21" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 14, 2, 4, § 21</bibl></cit>): <cit><quote lang="la">aliae (percussiones numerorum) sunt geminae,</quote> <trans><tr>double</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,037:3:47:182" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> de Or. 3, 47, 182</bibl></cit>; cf.: <cit><quote lang="la">geminis vocalibus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:1:7:14" default="NO"><author>Quint.</author> 1, 7, 14</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">M gemina,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:ib. 8" default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 8</bibl></cit>: geminique tulit Chironis in antrum, <hi rend="ital">double-formed</hi> (half man, half horse), <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,006:2:630" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ov.</author> M. 2, 630</bibl>; <bibl default="NO">6, 126</bibl>; cf.: <cit><quote lang="la">corpus Tritonis (half man and half fish),</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1020,002:3:2:35" default="NO"><author>Stat.</author> S. 3, 2, 35</bibl></cit>: Cecrops (acc. to a myth, half man and half serpent, or half man and half woman; <cit><quote lang="la">or else as Egyptian and Greek),</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,006:2:555" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ov.</author> M. 2, 555</bibl></cit>: GEMINA LEGIO, <hi rend="ital">a double legion</hi> (formed out of two legions), <hi rend="ital">epithet of the tenth legion in Hispania</hi>, <bibl default="NO"><author>Inscr. Orell.</author> 72 sq.</bibl>; <bibl default="NO">1214</bibl>; <bibl default="NO">2090</bibl>; <cit><quote lang="la">3376 al. (for which: gemella legio,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0448,002:3:4:1" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Caes.</author> B. C. 3, 4, 1</bibl></cit>; cf. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1351,004:2:58" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Tac.</author> H. 2, 58</bibl>): cum geminis exsurgit mensa lucernis, <hi rend="ital">seen double</hi> by one in drink, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1276,001:6:305" default="NO"><author>Juv.</author> 6, 305</bibl>.—</sense><sense id="n19387.9" n="B" level="2"> <hi rend="ital">Resembling</hi>, <hi rend="ital">similar</hi>, <hi rend="ital">like</hi>, as twins: <cit><quote lang="la">VOLO, MI FRATER, FRATERCULO TUO CREDAS: consorti quidem in lucris atque in furtis, gemino et simillimo nequitia, improbitate, audaciā,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,005:3:66:section=155" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Verr. 2, 3, 66, § 155</bibl></cit>; cf.: <cit><quote lang="la">Dolabella et Antonius ... ecce tibi geminum in scelere par,</quote> <trans><tr>a twin-pair</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,035:11:1:2" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Phil. 11, 1, 2</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0684,001:L. L. 9:section=92" default="NO"><author>Varr.</author> L. L. 9, § 92</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">par est avaritia, similis improbitas, eadem impudentia, gemina audacia,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,002:40:118" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Rosc. Am. 40, 118 <hi rend="ital">fin.</hi></bibl></cit>; cf. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,003:18:55" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Rosc. Com. 18, 55</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">quae (memoria) est gemina litteraturae quodammodo et in dissimili genere persimilis,</quote> <trans><tr>twin-sister</tr>,</trans> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> Part. 7, 26</bibl></cit> (al. germana): illud vero geminum<cb n="GEMM" />  consiliis Catilinae et Lentuli, quod me domo mea expulistis, <hi rend="ital">like</hi>, <hi rend="ital">similar</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,027:7:16" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Pis. 7, 16</bibl>; cf.: <cit><quote lang="la">ambobus geminus cupido laudis,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1345,001:4:99" default="NO"><author>Sil.</author> 4, 99</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
gemipomus: <entryFree id="n19388" type="main" key="ge^mi^po_mus"><orth extent="full" lang="la">gĕmĭpōmus</orth>, <itype>a, um</itype>, <pos>adj.</pos> <etym>geminus+ pomum</etym>, <sense id="n19388.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">producing double fruit;</hi> transf.: papillae, Auct. Carm. ad Lydiam, 17.</sense></entryFree>
gemisco: <entryFree id="n19389" type="main" key="ge^misco"><orth extent="full" lang="la">gĕmisco</orth>, <itype>ĕre</itype>, <sense id="n19389.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">v. inch. n.</hi> [gemo], <hi rend="ital">to begin to sigh</hi> (late Lat.): <cit><quote lang="la">si buxos inflare velim, ferale gemiscunt,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Claud.</author> Rapt. Pros. 3, 130</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
gemites: <entryFree id="n19390" type="main" key="gemi_tes"><orth extent="full" lang="la">gemītes</orth>, <itype>ae</itype>, <gen>m.</gen>, <sense id="n19390.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a precious stone</hi>, <hi rend="ital">otherwise unknown</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:37:191" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 37, 11, 73, § 191</bibl> (dub.; Jan. chernitis).</sense></entryFree>
gemitorius: <entryFree id="n19391" type="main" key="Ge^mi_to_rius"><orth extent="full" lang="la">Gĕmītōrius</orth>, <itype>a, um</itype>, v. Gemoniae.</entryFree>
gemitus: <entryFree id="n19392" type="main" key="ge^mi^tus"><orth extent="full" lang="la">gĕmĭtus</orth>, <itype>ūs</itype> (archaic <sense id="n19392.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">gen. sing.</hi> gemiti, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,003:4:9:11" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Aul. 4, 9, 11</bibl>), <gen>m.</gen> <etym>gemo</etym>, <hi rend="ital">a sighing</hi>, <hi rend="ital">a sigh</hi>, <hi rend="ital">a groan</hi>, <hi rend="ital">a lamentation</hi>, <hi rend="ital">complaint</hi> (syn.: planctus, plangor, lamentatio, questus). </sense><sense id="n19392.1" n="I" level="1"> <usg type="style">Lit.</usg>: quantum luctum quantumque gemitum, quid lacrimarum quantumque fletum factum audivi, Cato ap. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1254,001:10:3:17" default="NO"><author>Gell.</author> 10, 3, 17</bibl>; cf.: <cit><quote lang="la">ut urbe tota fletus gemitusque fieret,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,002:9:24" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Rosc. Am. 9, 24</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,022:31:68" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Sest. 31, 68</bibl>: gemitum trahens, Enn. ap. <bibl default="NO"><author>Non.</author> p. 515, 26</bibl> (Trag. v. 102 Vahl.): <cit><quote lang="la">clamor, sonus, gemitus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:7:2:46" default="NO"><author>Quint.</author> 7, 2, 46</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">gemitus in dolore ... gemitus elamentabilis,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,049:2:24:57" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Tusc. 2, 24, 57</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">lacrimabilis,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,003:3:39" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> A. 3, 39</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">ingentem tollere,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 11, 37</bibl></cit>; cf.: <cit><quote lang="la">ingentem dare pectore ab imo,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 1, 485</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">gemitus toto foro,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,035:2:34:85" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Phil. 2, 34, 85</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">continuus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:11:1:34" default="NO"><author>Quint.</author> 11, 1, 34</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">sine gemitu,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:2:20:10" default="NO"><author>id.</author> 2, 20, 10</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">gemitu,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,003:2:73" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> A. 2, 73</bibl></cit>.—<hi rend="ital">Plur.</hi> (mostly <usg type="style">poet.</usg>): <cit><quote lang="la">gemitus, screatus, tussis, risus abstine,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0134,002:2:3:132" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ter.</author> Heaut. 2, 3, 132</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">quantos et virorum et mulierum gemitus esse factos (audivi)?</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,010:68:192" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Clu. 68, 192</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,021:18:39" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Har. Resp. 18, 39</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">gemitus edere,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0550,001:4:1015" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Lucr.</author> 4, 1015</bibl></cit>; cf.: <cit><quote lang="la">extremosque ciet gemitus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,002:3:517" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> G. 3, 517</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">gemitus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,003:2:288" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> A. 2, 288</bibl></cit>; <bibl default="NO">4, 409</bibl>; <bibl default="NO">6, 873</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,006:2:621" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ov.</author> M. 2, 621</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">excitare,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:9:7:4" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 9, 7, 4</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">ad gemitus vulnerum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:22:5:4" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> 22, 5, 4</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1254,001:1:26:7" default="NO"><author>Gell.</author> 1, 26, 7</bibl>; <bibl default="NO"><author>Vulg.</author> Judic. 2, 18</bibl>; Psa. 30, 10 al.—</sense><sense id="n19392.2" n="II" level="1"> <usg type="style">Poet.</usg> transf. </sense><sense id="n19392.3" n="1" level="3"> <hi rend="ital">Pain</hi>, <hi rend="ital">sorrow</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,003:2:413" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> A. 2, 413</bibl>; cf. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0550,001:5:1196" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Lucr.</author> 5, 1196</bibl>.—</sense><sense id="n19392.4" n="2" level="3"> Of inanimate things, <hi rend="ital">a deep</hi> or <hi rend="ital">hoarse sound</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">insonuere cavae gemitumque dedere cavernae,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,003:2:53" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> A. 2, 53</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">dat tellus gemitum,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 9, 709</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">dat gemitum moles,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1345,001:3:643" default="NO"><author>Sil.</author> 3, 643</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">et gemitum ingentem pelagi pulsataque saxa Audimus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,003:3:555" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> A. 3, 555</bibl></cit>.—In <number>plur.</number>: <cit><quote lang="la">plaga facit gemitus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,006:12:487" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ov.</author> M. 12, 487</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
gemma: <entryFree id="n19393" type="main" key="gemma"><orth extent="full" lang="la">gemma</orth>, <itype>ae</itype>, <gen>f.</gen> <etym>cf. Gr. <foreign lang="greek">ge/mw</foreign>, to be full; Lat. gumia; <cit><quote lang="la">lit. a fulness, swelling. The ancients supposed the original meaning to be a precious stone,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:8:6:6" default="NO"><author>Quint.</author> 8, 6, 6</bibl></cit>; cf. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,040:24:81" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Or. 24, 81</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,037:3:38:155" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> de Or. 3, 38, 155</bibl></etym>, <sense id="n19393.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a bud</hi>, <hi rend="ital">eye</hi>, or <hi rend="ital">gem</hi> on a plant. </sense><sense id="n19393.1" n="I" level="1"> <usg type="style">Lit.</usg>: <cit><quote lang="la">ineunte vere exsistit tamquam ad articulos sarmentorum ea, quae gemma dicitur,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> de Sen. 15, 53</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">(pampinus) trudit gemmas et frondes explicat omnes,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,002:2:335" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> G. 2, 335</bibl></cit>; <cit><quote lang="la">jam laeto turgent in palmite gemmae,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,001:7:48" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> E. 7, 48</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0845,001:4:29:4" default="NO"><author>Col.</author> 4, 29, 4</bibl>.—</sense><sense id="n19393.2" n="II" level="1"> <usg type="style">Transf.</usg> (from the resemblance to buds in shape and color), <hi rend="ital">a precious stone</hi>, esp. one already cut, <hi rend="ital">a jewel</hi>, <hi rend="ital">gem</hi>, the predom. signif. of the word (opp. lapillus, one that is opaque, v. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,2806,001:34:2:19:section=17" default="NO"><author>Dig.</author> 34, 2, 19, § 17</bibl>; cf. <cit><quote lang="la">also: margarita, unio): nego in Sicilia tota ... ullam gemmam aut margaritam, quicquam ex auro aut ebore factum ... quin conquisierit, etc.,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,005:4:1:section=1" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Verr. 2, 4, 1, § 1</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">pocula ex auro gemmis distincta clarissimis,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 2, 4, 27</bibl></cit>, § <cit><quote lang="la">62: vas vinarium ex una gemma pergrandi,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib.</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">Cyri ornatus Persicus multo auro multisque gemmis,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> de Sen. 17, 59</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">gemmas sunt qui non habeant,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Hor.</author> Ep. 2, 2, 180</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">cum virides gemmas collo circumdedit (mulier),</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1276,001:6:458" default="NO"><author>Juv.</author> 6, 458</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">non gemmis venale,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0893,001:2:16:7" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Hor.</author> C. 2, 16, 7</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">vitrea,</quote> <trans>i. e. <tr>a false gem</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:35:48" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 35, 6, 30, § 48</bibl></cit>; <cit><quote lang="la">also called facticia,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:37:98" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> 37, 7, 26, § 98</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">nec premit articulos lucida gemma meos,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,002:15:74" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ov.</author> H. 15, 74</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">nec sufferre queat majoris pondera gemmae,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1276,001:1:29" default="NO"><author>Juv.</author> 1, 29</bibl></cit>: usus luxuriantis aetatis signaturas pretiosis gemmis coepit insculpere, Capitol. ap. <bibl default="NO"><author>Macr.</author> S. 7, 13, 11</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:tlg,0527,002:25:7" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Vulg.</author> Exod. 25, 7</bibl> et saep. —</sense><sense id="n19393.3" n="2" level="3"> <usg type="style">Transf.</usg> </sense><sense id="n19393.4" n="a" level="4"> <hi rend="ital">Things made of precious stones.</hi> </sense><sense id="n19393.5" n="(a)" level="5"> <hi rend="ital">A drinking-vessel</hi>, <hi rend="ital">goblet</hi> or <hi rend="ital">cup</hi>, <hi rend="ital">made of a precious stone</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">nec bibit e gemma divite nostra sitis,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1224,001:3:5" default="NO"><author>Prop.</author> 3, 5</bibl></cit> (4, 4), 4; cf.: <cit><quote lang="la">ut gemmā bibat,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,002:2:506" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> G. 2, 506</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">gemmā ministrare,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1014,001:Prov. 3" default="NO"><author>Sen.</author> Prov. 3 <hi rend="ital">fin.</hi></bibl></cit>; cf. <cit><quote lang="la">also: in gemma posuere merum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,006:8:572" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ov.</author> M. 8, 572</bibl></cit>.— </sense><sense id="n19393.6" n="(b)" level="5"> <hi rend="ital">A seal ring</hi>, <hi rend="ital">signet</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">protinus impressā signat sua crimina gemmā,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,006:9:566" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ov.</author> M. 9, 566</bibl></cit>; cf. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:37:3" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 37, 1, 2, § 3</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:37:78" default="NO" valid="yes">37, 5, 20, § 78</bibl>: arguit <cb n="GEMM" /> ipsorum quos littera gemmaque, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1276,001:13:138" default="NO"><author>Juv.</author> 13, 138</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1276,001:1:68" default="NO">1, 68</bibl>.—Hence, comically: <hi rend="ital">Pl.</hi> Opsecro parentis ne meos mihi prohibeas? <hi rend="ital">Cu.</hi> Quid? ego sub gemmane apstrussos habeo tuam matrem et patrem? i. e. <hi rend="ital">under lock and key</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,008:5:2:8" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Curc. 5, 2, 8</bibl>.—</sense><sense id="n19393.7" n="b" level="4"> <hi rend="ital">A pearl</hi> (<usg type="style">poet.</usg>): legitur rubris gemma sub aequoribus. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1224,001:1:14:12" default="NO"><author>Prop.</author> 1, 14, 12</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">cedet Erythraeis eruta gemma vadis,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1294,001:8:28:14" default="NO"><author>Mart.</author> 8, 28, 14</bibl></cit>. —</sense><sense id="n19393.8" n="c" level="4"> <hi rend="ital">The eyes</hi> of the peacock's tail: <cit><quote lang="la">gemmis caudam stellantibus implet,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,006:1:723" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ov.</author> M. 1, 723</bibl></cit>; cf.: <cit><quote lang="la">gemmea cauda,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0975,001:3:18:8" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Phaedr.</author> 3, 18, 8</bibl></cit>). —</sense><sense id="n19393.9" n="B" level="2"> <usg type="style">Trop.</usg>, like <hi rend="ital">gem</hi> in English, <hi rend="ital">ornament</hi>, <hi rend="ital">beauty</hi> (post-Aug. and very rare): <cit><quote lang="la">multas in digitis, plures in carmine gemmas Invenies,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1294,001:5:11:3" default="NO"><author>Mart.</author> 5, 11, 3</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">Hesperius gemma amicorum,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Sid.</author> Ep. 4, 22</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
gemmarius: <entryFree id="n19394" type="main" key="gemma_ri^us"><orth extent="full" lang="la">gemmārĭus</orth>, <itype>a, um</itype>, <pos>adj.</pos> <etym>gemma</etym>, <sense id="n19394.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">of</hi> or <hi rend="ital">pertaining to gems</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">ars,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:tlg,0527,002:39:6" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Vulg.</author> Exod. 39, 6</bibl></cit> and 29.—Hence, <hi rend="ital">subst.</hi>: <orth extent="full" lang="la">gemmārĭus</orth>, <itype>ii</itype>, <gen>m.</gen>, <hi rend="ital">a jeweller</hi>, <bibl default="NO"><author>Inscr. Orell.</author> 4302</bibl>; cf. <bibl default="NO"><author>ib.</author> 2661</bibl>; <bibl default="NO"><author>Inscr. Murat.</author> 941, 2</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:tlg,0527,002:28:11" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Vulg.</author> Exod. 28, 11</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
gemmasco: <entryFree id="n19395" type="main" key="gemmasco"><orth extent="full" lang="la">gemmasco</orth>, <itype>ĕre</itype>, <sense id="n19395.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">v. inch. n.</hi> [gemmo, I.], <hi rend="ital">to begin to bud</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0845,001:5:10:12" default="NO"><author>Col.</author> 5, 10, 12</bibl>; Arb. 22, 1; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:17:116" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 17, 15, 25, § 116</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
gemmatus: <entryFree id="n19396" type="main" key="gemma_tus"><orth extent="full" lang="la">gemmātus</orth>, <itype>a, um</itype>, <pos>adj.</pos> <etym>gemma; cf. gemmo</etym>. <sense id="n19396.0" n="I" level="1"> (Acc. to gemma, I.) <hi rend="ital">Provided with buds</hi> or <hi rend="ital">eyes</hi>, <bibl default="NO"><author>Pall.</author> 4, 10, 2</bibl>.—</sense><sense id="n19396.1" n="II" level="1"> (Acc. to gemma, II.) <hi rend="ital">Set</hi> or <hi rend="ital">adorned with jewels</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">gemmata monilia,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,006:10:113" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ov.</author> M. 10, 113</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">gemmati magna specie anuli,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:1:11:8" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 1, 11, 8</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">gemmata potoria,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:37:17" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 37, 2, 6, § 17</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">paenula,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1348,001:life=cal.:52" default="NO"><author>Suet.</author> Calig. 52</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">pocula,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1276,001:10:27" default="NO"><author>Juv.</author> 10, 27</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
gemmesco: <entryFree id="n19397" type="main" key="gemmesco"><orth extent="full" lang="la">gemmesco</orth>, <itype>ĕre</itype>, <sense id="n19397.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">v. inch. n.</hi> [gemma, II.], <hi rend="ital">to become a gem</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:37:158" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 37, 10, 57, § 158</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
gemmeus: <entryFree id="n19398" type="main" key="gemme^us"><orth extent="full" lang="la">gemmĕus</orth>, <itype>a, um</itype>, <pos>adj.</pos> <etym>id.</etym>, <sense id="n19398.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">of precious stones</hi>, <hi rend="ital">set</hi> or <hi rend="ital">adorned with precious stones.</hi> </sense><sense id="n19398.1" n="I" level="1"> <usg type="style">Lit.</usg>: <cit><quote lang="la">mittit etiam trullam gemmeam rogatum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,005:4:27:section=63" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Verr. 2, 4, 27, § 63</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">supellex,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1014,001:Ep. 110" default="NO"><author>Sen.</author> Ep. 110 <hi rend="ital">med.</hi></bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">juga,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,007:2:74" default="NO"><author>Ov.</author> F. 2, 74</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n19398.2" n="II" level="1"> <usg type="style">Transf.</usg> </sense><sense id="n19398.3" n="A" level="2"> <hi rend="ital">Like a jewel</hi> or <hi rend="ital">precious stone</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">radix gemmeae rotunditatis,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:18:71" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 18, 7, 13, § 71</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n19398.4" n="B" level="2"> <hi rend="ital">Glittering</hi>, <hi rend="ital">shining</hi>, <hi rend="ital">sparkling</hi>, like jewels: <cit><quote lang="la">pictisque plumis gemmeam caudam explicas,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0975,001:3:18:8" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Phaedr.</author> 3, 18, 8</bibl></cit>; cf.: <cit><quote lang="la">gemmei pavones,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1294,001:3:58:13" default="NO"><author>Mart.</author> 3, 58, 13</bibl></cit> (and v. gemma, II. 2. c.): <cit><quote lang="la">Euripus viridis et gemmeus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1318,001:1:3:1" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> Ep. 1, 3, 1</bibl></cit>; cf.: <cit><quote lang="la">prata florida et gemmea,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:ib. 5:6:11" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> ib. 5, 6, 11</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">quos rumor albā gemmeus vehit pennā,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1294,001:10:3:10" default="NO"><author>Mart.</author> 10, 3, 10</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
gemmifer: <entryFree id="n19399" type="main" key="gemmi^fer"><orth extent="full" lang="la">gemmĭfer</orth>, <itype>ĕra, ĕrum</itype>, <pos>adj.</pos> <etym>gemma, II. -fero</etym>, <sense id="n19399.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">bearing</hi> or <hi rend="ital">containing gems</hi> (<usg type="style">poet.</usg> and in post-Aug. prose): <cit><quote lang="la">amnes (Acesinus et Ganges),</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:37:200" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 37, 13, 76, § 200</bibl></cit>; cf. mare (i. e. Erythraei; cf. <cit><quote lang="la">gemma, II. 2. b.),</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1224,001:3:4" default="NO"><author>Prop.</author> 3, 4</bibl></cit> (4, 3), 2: <cit><quote lang="la">corona,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1035,001:5:448" default="NO"><author>Val. Fl.</author> 5, 448</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
gemmo: <entryFree id="n19400" type="main" key="gemmo"><orth extent="full" lang="la">gemmo</orth>, <itype>āvi, ātum, 1</itype>, <pos>v. n.</pos> and <sense id="n19400.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a.</hi> [gemma]. </sense><sense id="n19400.1" n="I" level="1"> (Acc. to gemma, I.) <hi rend="ital">To put forth buds</hi>, <hi rend="ital">to bud</hi> or <hi rend="ital">gem</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">id fit antequam gemmare Aut florere quid incipit,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0684,001:R. R. 1:40:4" default="NO"><author>Varr.</author> R. R. 1, 40, 4</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0845,001:4:27:1" default="NO"><author>Col.</author> 4, 27, 1</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">gemmare vites, luxuriem esse in herbis, laetas segetes etiam rustici dicunt,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,037:3:38:155" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> de Or. 3, 38, 155</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,040:24:81" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Or. 24, 81</bibl> (cf.: <cit><quote lang="la">necessitate rustici gemmam in vitibus dicunt,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:8:6:6" default="NO"><author>Quint.</author> 8, 6, 6</bibl></cit>); v. gemma <hi rend="ital">init.</hi>—In the <hi rend="ital">part. pres.</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">gemmantem oculum caecare,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0845,001:4:24:16" default="NO"><author>Col.</author> 4, 24, 16</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">vinea,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:17:188" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 17, 22, 35, § 188</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">sarmenta,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Pall.</author> Febr. 32</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">surculi rosarum,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> Nov. 11</bibl></cit>; for which in the <hi rend="ital">part. perf.</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">melius proveniet, si ponendus ramus gemmata jam matre sumatur,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Pall.</author> Mart. 10, 2</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n19400.2" n="II" level="1"> (Acc. to gemma, II.; <usg type="style">poet.</usg> and in post-Aug. prose). </sense><sense id="n19400.3" n="A" level="2"> <hi rend="ital">Neutr.</hi>, <hi rend="ital">to be adorned with precious stones</hi>, <hi rend="ital">to sparkle with gems.</hi> </sense><sense id="n19400.4" n="1" level="3"> <usg type="style">Lit.</usg> (only in the <hi rend="ital">part. pres.</hi>): <cit><quote lang="la">gemmantia sceptra,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,006:3:264" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ov.</author> M. 3, 264</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">gemmantia litora,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Manil.</author> 4, 652</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n19400.5" n="2" level="3"> <usg type="style">Transf.</usg>, <hi rend="ital">to glitter</hi>, <hi rend="ital">sparkle</hi>, like gems: <cit><quote lang="la">herbae gemmantes rore recenti,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0550,001:2:319" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Lucr.</author> 2, 319</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0550,001:5:461" default="NO" valid="yes">5, 461</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">gemmantes explicat alas (pavo),</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1294,001:13:70" default="NO"><author>Mart.</author> 13, 70</bibl></cit>; cf.: <cit><quote lang="la">pinnae caudae (pavonis),</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0845,001:8:11:8" default="NO"><author>Col.</author> 8, 11, 8</bibl></cit>; <bibl default="NO"><author>Pall.</author> 1, 28, 2</bibl> (see also gemma, II. 2. c. and gemmeus, II. B.): <cit><quote lang="la">memphites (lapis) gemmantis naturae,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:36:56" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 36, 7, 11, § 56</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
gemmosus: <entryFree id="n19401" type="main" key="gemmo_sus"><orth extent="full" lang="la">gemmōsus</orth>, <itype>a, um</itype>, <pos>adj.</pos> <etym>gemma, II.</etym>, <sense id="n19401.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">richly set with jewels</hi> (post-class.): <cit><quote lang="la">gemmosis monilibus onustas,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>App.</author> M. 5, p. 162, 24</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
gemmula: <entryFree id="n19402" type="main" key="gemmu^la"><orth extent="full" lang="la">gemmŭla</orth>, <itype>ae</itype>, <gen>f.</gen> <lbl>dim.</lbl> <etym>gemma</etym>. <sense id="n19402.0" n="I" level="1"> <hi rend="ital">A little bud</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">gemmulae floridae,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>App.</author> M. 10, p. 253</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n19402.1" n="B" level="2"> <usg type="style">Transf.</usg>, <hi rend="ital">the sparkling pupil</hi> of the eye: App. <foreign lang="greek">*)anex</foreign>. 8.—</sense><sense id="n19402.2" n="II" level="1"> <hi rend="ital">A small gem</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">alii autem caelo et marculo gemmulas exsculpunt,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1248,001:Ep. ad M. Caes. 4:3" default="NO"><author>Fronto</author> Ep. ad M. Caes. 4, 3</bibl></cit> Mai.: carbunculi in ornamento auri. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:tlg,0527,033:32:7" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Vulg.</author> Sap. 32, 7</bibl>. <pb n="806" /> <cb n="GENA" /></sense></entryFree>
gemo: <entryFree id="n19403" type="main" key="ge^mo"><orth extent="full" lang="la">gĕmo</orth>, <itype>ŭi, ĭtum, 3</itype>, <pos>v. n.</pos> and <sense id="n19403.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a.</hi> [Gr. <foreign lang="greek">ge/mw</foreign>, to be full; hence]. </sense><sense id="n19403.1" n="I" level="1"> <hi rend="ital">Neutr.</hi>, <hi rend="ital">to sigh</hi>, <hi rend="ital">groan.</hi> </sense><sense id="n19403.2" n="A" level="2"> <usg type="style">Lit.</usg> (freq. and class.): <cit><quote lang="la">accurrit ad me Incurvus, tremulus, labiis demissis, gemens,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0134,003:2:3:44" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ter.</author> Eun. 2, 3, 44</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">cum diu occulte suspirassent, postea jam gemere, ad extremum vero loqui omnes et clamare coeperunt,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,057:2:21:2" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Att. 2, 21, 2</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">neque gementem neque plorantem,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,001:5:1:47" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Am. 5, 1, 47</bibl></cit>; cf.: <cit><quote lang="la">hos pro me lugere, hos gemere videbam,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,028:42:101" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Planc. 42, 101</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">gemere desiderio alicujus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,027:11:25" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Pis. 11, 25</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">ah gemat in terris! ista qui protulit ante,</quote> <trans><tr>let him groan in the lower world</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1224,001:2:6:31" default="NO"><author>Prop.</author> 2, 6, 31</bibl></cit>; cf. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1224,001:2:25" default="NO"><author>id.</author> 2, 25</bibl> (3, 20), 12. —Of mournful music: <cit><quote lang="la">nullo gemit hic tibicina cornu,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1276,001:2:90" default="NO"><author>Juv.</author> 2, 90</bibl></cit>; cf. <cit><quote lang="la">trop.: surda nihil gemeret grave buccina (Vergilii),</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1276,001:7:69" default="NO"><author>id.</author> 7, 69</bibl></cit>.—Of beasts, <hi rend="ital">to cry</hi>, <hi rend="ital">make a mournful noise</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">(leones) gementes,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0550,001:3:297" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Lucr.</author> 3, 297</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">gemuit noctua,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1224,001:4" default="NO"><author>Prop.</author> 4</bibl></cit>(5), 3, 59: <cit><quote lang="la">turtur ab ulmo,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,001:1:59" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> E. 1, 59</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n19403.3" n="B" level="2"> <usg type="style">Poet.</usg> transf. </sense><sense id="n19403.4" n="1" level="3"> Of things, <hi rend="ital">to groan</hi>, <hi rend="ital">creak</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">visam gementis litora Bospori,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0893,001:2:20:14" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Hor.</author> C. 2, 20, 14</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">repleti amnes,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,003:5:806" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> A. 5, 806</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">et malus celeri saucius Africo Antennaeque gemant,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0893,001:1:14:6" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Hor.</author> C. 1, 14, 6</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">gemuit sub pondere cymba,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,003:6:413" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> A. 6, 413</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">stridunt funes, curvatur arbor, gubernacula gemunt,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1318,001:9:26:4" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> Ep. 9, 26, 4</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">gemuit parvo mota fenestra sono,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,009:3:3:10" default="NO"><author>Ov.</author> P. 3, 3, 10</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">gemens rota,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,002:3:183" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> G. 3, 183</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1035,001:6:168" default="NO"><author>Val. Fl.</author> 6, 168</bibl>.—</sense><sense id="n19403.5" n="2" level="3"> In gen., of animals, <hi rend="ital">to utter complaints</hi>: feras cum hominibus gemere fecimus, Avien. Fab. praef. <hi rend="ital">fin.</hi>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1035,001:26" default="NO"><author>id.</author> 26</bibl>.—</sense><sense id="n19403.6" n="II" level="1"> <hi rend="ital">Act.</hi>, <hi rend="ital">to sigh over</hi>, <hi rend="ital">bemoan</hi>, <hi rend="ital">bewail</hi> any thing (freq. and class.). </sense><sense id="n19403.7" n="(a)" level="5"> With <hi rend="ital">acc.</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">haec gemebant boni, sperabant improbi,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,022:30:66" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Sest. 30, 66 <hi rend="ital">fin.</hi></bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">dare, quod gemerent hostes,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0550,001:5:1348" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Lucr.</author> 5, 1348</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">talia voce,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1035,001:5:37" default="NO"><author>Val. Fl.</author> 5, 37</bibl></cit>: eandem virtutem istam veniet tempus cum graviter gemes, Poët. ap. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,057:2:19:3" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Att. 2, 19, 3</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">flebiliter Ityn,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0893,001:4:12:5" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Hor.</author> C. 4, 12, 5</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">tacite tristem fortunae vicem,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0975,001:5:1:6" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Phaedr.</author> 5, 1, 6</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">multa ignominiam,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,002:3:226" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> G. 3, 226</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">casus urbis,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1276,001:3:214" default="NO"><author>Juv.</author> 3, 214</bibl></cit>.—In <hi rend="ital">pass.</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">atque hic status est, qui una voce omnium gemitur neque verbo cujusquam sublevatur,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,057:2:18:1" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Att. 2, 18, 1</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n19403.8" n="(b)" level="5"> With <hi rend="ital">inf.</hi> (<usg type="style">poet.</usg>): <cit><quote lang="la">paucis ostendi gemis,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Hor.</author> Ep. 1, 20, 4</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1020,003:1:281" default="NO"><author>Stat.</author> Ach. 1, 281</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">qui servum te gemis esse diu,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1294,001:9:93:2" default="NO"><author>Mart.</author> 9, 93, 2</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">sane murteta relinqui ... Sulphura contemni vicus gemit,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Hor.</author> Ep. 1, 15, 7</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
gemoniae: <entryFree id="n19404" type="main" key="Ge^mo_ni^ae"><orth extent="full" lang="la">Gĕmōnĭae</orth> <itype>scalae, or</itype> (more freq.) <sense id="n19404.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">absol.</hi>, <orth extent="full" lang="la">Gemoniae</orth>, <itype>ārum</itype>, <gen>f.</gen> <etym>gemo, cf. "The Bridge of Sighs"</etym>, <hi rend="ital">steps on the Aventine Hill leading to the Tiber</hi>, <hi rend="ital">to which the bodies of executed criminals were dragged by hooks to be thrown into the Tiber</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">nemo punitorum non et in Gemonias abjectus uncoque tractus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1348,001:life=tib.:61" default="NO"><author>Suet.</author> Tib. 61</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">Gemoniae,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1348,001:life=vit.:17" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Vit. 17</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1348,001:life=tib.:53" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Tib. 53</bibl>; <bibl default="NO">75</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1276,001:10:65" default="NO"><author>Juv.</author> 10, 65</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1038,001:6:9:13" default="NO"><author>Val. Max.</author> 6, 9, 13</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1351,005:3:14" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Tac.</author> A. 3, 14</bibl>; <bibl default="NO">5, 9</bibl>; <bibl default="NO">6, 25</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1351,004:3:74" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> H. 3, 74</bibl>; <bibl default="NO">85</bibl>; <cit><quote lang="la">in full: Gemoniae scalae,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1038,001:6:3:3" default="NO"><author>Val. Max.</author> 6, 3, 3</bibl></cit>.—Called also: gradus <orth extent="full" lang="la">Gemi-torii</orth>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:8:145" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 8, 40, 61, § 145</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
gemulus: <entryFree id="n19405" type="main" key="ge^mu^lus"><orth extent="full" lang="la">gĕmŭlus</orth>, <itype>a, um</itype>, <pos>adj.</pos> <etym>gemo</etym>, <sense id="n19405.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">moaning</hi>, <hi rend="ital">complaining</hi> (post-class.): <cit><quote lang="la">bubones occinunt gemulo carmine,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>App.</author> Flor. p. 349, 21</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
gemursa: <entryFree id="n19406" type="main" key="ge^mursa"><orth extent="full" lang="la">gĕmursa</orth>, <itype>ae</itype>, <gen>f.</gen> <etym>Gr. <foreign lang="greek">ge/mw</foreign>, to be full; cf. gemo</etym>, <sense id="n19406.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a small swelling between the toes</hi> (ante-class.): <cit><quote lang="la">morbus, quem gemursam appellavere prisci, inter digitos pedum nascentem,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:26:8" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 26, 1, 5, § 8</bibl></cit>; cf.: gemursa sub minimo digito pedis tuberculum, quod gemere faciat eum, qui id gerat, Paul. ex <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1236,001:page=95" default="NO"><author>Fest.</author> p. 95</bibl> Müll.</sense></entryFree>
gena: <entryFree id="n19407" type="main" key="ge^na"><orth extent="full" lang="la">gĕna</orth>, <itype>ae</itype>, and more freq. <orth extent="full" lang="la">gĕnae</orth>, <itype>ārum</itype>, <gen>f.</gen> <etym>Sanscr. hanus, jaw; ganda, cheek; cf. Gr. <foreign lang="greek">ge/nus</foreign>; Germ. Kinn</etym>, lit., the upper part of the face, from the cheek-bones to the eyelids; hence, in gen., <sense id="n19407.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a cheek; plur.</hi>, <hi rend="ital">the cheeks</hi> (cf.: bucca, mala). </sense><sense id="n19407.1" n="I" level="1"> <usg type="style">Lit.</usg>: <cit><quote lang="la">genae ab inferiore parte tutantur subjectae leniterque eminentes,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,050:2:57:143" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> N. D. 2, 57, 143</bibl></cit>; cf. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:11:156" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 11, 37, 57, § 156</bibl> sqq. </sense><sense id="n19407.2" n="(a)" level="5"> <hi rend="ital">Plur.</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">ad haec omnia exprimenda in palpebris etiam et genis est quoddam deserviens iis ministerium,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:11:3:77" default="NO"><author>Quint.</author> 11, 3, 77</bibl></cit>; cf. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:23:49" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 23, 1, 24, § 49</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">ad genarum crassitudines et oculorum albugines,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:32:98" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> 32, 9, 31, § 98</bibl></cit>: MVLIERES GENAS NE RADVNTO, Fragm. XII. Tab. ap. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,044:2:23" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Leg. 2, 23 <hi rend="ital">fin.</hi></bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:11:157" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 11, 37, 58, § 157</bibl>; Fest. s. v. radere, p. 273 Müll.: lacrimae peredere humore exsangues genas, Poët. (perh. Pacuv.) ap. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,049:3:12:26" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Tusc. 3, 12, 26</bibl>; cf.: <cit><quote lang="la">manat rara meas lacrima per genas,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Hor.</author> C, 4, 1, 34</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">lacrimis humectent ora genasque,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0550,001:1:920" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Lucr.</author> 1, 920</bibl></cit>; cf. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0550,001:2:977" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> 2, 977</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0550,001:3:469" default="NO" valid="yes">3, 469</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">pulchrae,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0893,001:4:13:8" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Hor.</author> C. 4, 13, 8</bibl></cit>: nunc primum opacat<cb n="GENE" />  flore lanugo genas, Pac. ap. Paul. ex <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1236,001:page=94" default="NO"><author>Fest.</author> p. 94</bibl> Müll. (Trag. Rel. p. 103 Rib.): <cit><quote lang="la">pilosae,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,027:1:1" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Pis. 1, 1</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">erasae,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1224,001:4" default="NO"><author>Prop.</author> 4</bibl></cit> (5), 8, 26: <cit><quote lang="la">tum mihi prima genas vestibat flore juventa,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,003:8:160" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> A. 8, 160</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">leves,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:12:10:8" default="NO"><author>Quint.</author> 12, 10, 8</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">confusa pudore sensi me totis erubuisse genis,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,002:21:112" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ov.</author> H. 21, 112</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:tlg,0527,031:1:9 al" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Vulg.</author> Cant. 1, 9 al.</bibl>—</sense><sense id="n19407.3" n="(b)" level="5"> <hi rend="ital">Sing.</hi>: atque genua comprimit arta gena, i. e. <hi rend="ital">presses</hi> (beseechingly) <hi rend="ital">the cheek close to his knee</hi>, Enn. ap. <bibl default="NO"><author>Isid.</author> Orig. 11, 1, 109</bibl> dub. (cf. Vahl. <bibl default="NO"><author>Enn.</author> p. 176</bibl>): <cit><quote lang="la">genam non leviter perstringere,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1348,001:life=cl.:15" default="NO"><author>Suet.</author> Claud. 15 <hi rend="ital">fin.</hi></bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">gena inferior, superior,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:11:156" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 11, 37, 57, § 156</bibl></cit> (v. above).—</sense><sense id="n19407.4" n="II" level="1"> <usg type="style">Transf.</usg>: genae (not in <number>sing.</number>). </sense><sense id="n19407.5" n="A" level="2"> In Ennius for palpebrae, <hi rend="ital">the eyelids</hi>: genas Ennius palpebras putat, cum dicit hoc versu: Pandite sulti' genas et corde relinquite somnum, Paul. ex Fest. s. h. v. p. 94 Müll. (Ann. v. 521 Vahl.): imprimitque genae genam, Enn. ap. <bibl default="NO"><author>Serv.</author> Verg. A. 6, 686</bibl> (Trag. v. 436 Vahl.).—</sense><sense id="n19407.6" n="B" level="2"> <hi rend="ital">The eye</hi> or <hi rend="ital">eyes</hi> (<usg type="style">poet.</usg>): <cit><quote lang="la">exustaeque tuae mox, Polypheme, genae,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1224,001:3:12" default="NO"><author>Prop.</author> 3, 12</bibl></cit> (4, 11), 26: <cit><quote lang="la">cornicum immeritas eruit ungue genas,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1224,001:4" default="NO"><author>id.</author> 4</bibl></cit> (5), 5, 16; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,009:2:8:66" default="NO"><author>Ov.</author> P. 2, 8, 66</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,002:20:206" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> H. 20, 206</bibl>.— </sense><sense id="n19407.7" n="C" level="2"> <hi rend="ital">The sockets of the eyes</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">expilatque genis oculos,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,006:13:562" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ov.</author> M. 13, 562</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
genabum: <entryFree id="n19408" type="main" key="Ge_na^bum"><orth extent="full" lang="la">Gēnăbum</orth>, <itype>i</itype>, <gen>n.</gen>, <sense id="n19408.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a city of the</hi> Carnutes, <hi rend="ital">in</hi> Gallia Lugdunensis, <hi rend="ital">on the</hi> Liger, <hi rend="ital">afterwards called</hi> Aurelianensis urbs or Civitas Aurelianorum, whence the modern name <hi rend="ital">Orleans</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0448,001:7:3" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Caes.</author> B. G. 7, 3</bibl>; <bibl default="NO">11</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0530,001:B. G. 8:5" default="NO"><author>Hirt.</author> B. G. 8, 5</bibl>; <bibl default="NO"><author>Sid.</author> Ep. 8, 15</bibl>.—</sense><sense id="n19408.1" n="II" level="1"> Deriv.: <orth extent="full" lang="la">Gē-năbensis</orth>, <itype>e</itype>, <pos>adj.</pos>, <hi rend="ital">of</hi> or <hi rend="ital">belonging to Genabum</hi>, <hi rend="ital">Genabian</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">caedes,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0448,001:7:28:4" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Caes.</author> B.
