G. 7, 28, 4</bibl></cit>.—In <number>plur.</number>: <orth extent="full" lang="la">Genabenses</orth>, <itype>ium</itype>, <gen>m.</gen>, <hi rend="ital">the inhabitants of Genabum</hi>, <hi rend="ital">Genabians</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0448,001:7:11:7" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Caes.</author> B. G. 7, 11, 7</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
genauni: <entryFree id="n19409" type="main" key="Ge^nauni"><orth extent="full" lang="la">Gĕnauni</orth>, <itype>ōrum</itype>, <gen>m.</gen>, <sense id="n19409.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a Germanic people in Rhœtia</hi>, <hi rend="ital">in the Val di Non</hi>, <hi rend="ital">neighbors of the</hi> Breuni, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0893,001:4:14:10" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Hor.</author> C. 4, 14, 10</bibl>; called also ‡ <orth extent="full" lang="la">Genaunes</orth>, <itype>ium</itype>, Inscr. ap. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:3:136" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 3, 20, 24, § 136</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
genava: <entryFree id="n19410" type="main" key="Gena_va"><orth extent="full" lang="la">Genāva</orth> (less correctly <orth extent="full" lang="la">Genna</orth> or <orth extent="full" lang="la">Genēva</orth>), <itype>ae</itype>, <gen>f.</gen>, <sense id="n19410.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a city of the Allobroges</hi>, <hi rend="ital">upon Lake Leman</hi>, <hi rend="ital">at the point where the Rhone passes from it</hi>, <hi rend="ital">Geneva</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0448,001:1:6:3" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Caes.</author> B. G. 1, 6, 3</bibl>; <bibl default="NO">1, 7, 1</bibl> sq.—Deriv.: <orth extent="full" lang="la">Genāven-sis</orth> (<orth type="alt" extent="full" lang="la">Genēv-</orth>), <itype>e</itype>, <hi rend="ital">of Geneva</hi>, <bibl default="NO"><author>Inscr. Orell.</author> 253</bibl>; <cit><quote lang="la">called Genevensis,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>ib.</author> 254</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
genealogia: <entryFree id="n19411" type="greek" key="ge^ne^a_lo^gi^a"><orth extent="full" lang="la">gĕnĕālŏgĭa</orth>, <itype>ae</itype>, <gen>f.</gen>, = <foreign lang="greek">genealogi/a</foreign>, <sense id="n19411.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a genealogy</hi>: majorum genealogia, Mess. Corvin. de Prog. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,2468,001:22" default="NO"><author>Aug.</author> 22</bibl>; <bibl default="NO"><author>Vulg.</author> 1</bibl> Esdr. 2, 62; Hebr. 7, 3 al.</sense></entryFree>
genealogus: <entryFree id="n19412" type="greek" key="ge^ne^a_lo^gus"><orth extent="full" lang="la">gĕnĕālŏgus</orth>, <itype>i</itype>, <gen>m.</gen>, = <foreign lang="greek">genealo/gos</foreign>, <sense id="n19412.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a genealogist</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">qui (dii) genealogis antiquis sic nominantur,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,050:3:17:44" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> N. D. 3, 17, 44</bibl></cit>. So of Moses, as the author of Genesis: <cit><quote lang="la">illud ait genealogus idem,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Prud.</author> Apoth. 315</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
gener: <entryFree id="n19413" type="main" key="ge^ner"><orth extent="full" lang="la">gĕner</orth>, <itype>ĕri</itype> (archaic <sense id="n19413.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">dat. plur.</hi> generibus, Att. ap. <bibl default="NO"><author>Non.</author> 487, 29</bibl>), <gen>m.</gen> <etym>root GEN, v. gigno</etym>, <hi rend="ital">a daughter's husband</hi>, <hi rend="ital">a son-in-law.</hi> </sense><sense id="n19413.1" n="I" level="1"> <usg type="style">Lit.</usg>: <cit><quote lang="la">cum soceris generi non lavantur,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,055:1:35:129" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Off. 1, 35, 129</bibl></cit>; cf.: <cit><quote lang="la">mei viri gener,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,007:4:2:87" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Cist. 4, 2, 87</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">generum nostrum ire cum adfini suo,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,019:3:1:21" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Trin. 3, 1, 21</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">et gener et affines placent,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0134,002:5:1:63" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ter.</author> Heaut. 5, 1, 63</bibl></cit>; cf. <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 4, 8, 25</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0134,001:3:3:39" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> And. 3, 3, 39</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0134,005:4:1:22" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Hec. 4, 1, 22</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">C. Fannium et Quintum Scaevolam, generos Laelii,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,043:1:12" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Rep. 1, 12</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,052:1:3" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Lael. 1, 3</bibl>; <bibl default="NO">8, 26</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,057:4:2:4" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Att. 4, 2, 4</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0448,001:5:56:3" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Caes.</author> B. G. 5, 56, 3</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:6 praef" default="NO"><author>Quint.</author> 6 praef.</bibl> § 13; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0893,001:2:4:13" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Hor.</author> C. 2, 4, 13</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,007:3:202" default="NO"><author>Ov.</author> F. 3, 202</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:tlg,0527,011:18:18" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Vulg.</author> 1 Reg. 18, 18</bibl> et saep.—Also, <hi rend="ital">a daughter's bridegroom</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0893,003:6:13" default="NO"><author>Hor.</author> Epod. 6, 13</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,003:2:344" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> A. 2, 344</bibl>; cf.: <cit><quote lang="la">generi et nurus appellatione sponsus quoque et sponsa continetur,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,2806,001:38:10:6" default="NO"><author>Dig.</author> 38, 10, 6</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n19413.2" n="II" level="1"> <usg type="style">Transf.</usg> </sense><sense id="n19413.3" n="A" level="2"> <hi rend="ital">The husband of a granddaughter</hi> or <hi rend="ital">greatgranddaughter</hi>, for progener, qui conlegam et generum adsciverat Sejanum, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1351,005:5:6" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Tac.</author> A. 5, 6</bibl>; <bibl default="NO">6, 8</bibl>; cf.: <cit><quote lang="la">generi appellatione et neptis et proneptis tam ex filio quam ex filia editarum, ceterarumque maritos contineri manifestum est,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,2806,001:50:16:136" default="NO"><author>Dig.</author> 50, 16, 136</bibl></cit>.— </sense><sense id="n19413.4" n="B" level="2"> <hi rend="ital">A sister's husband</hi>, <hi rend="ital">brother-in-law</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,2806,001:18:4" default="NO"><author>Just.</author> 18, 4</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0588,004:1" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Nep.</author> Paus. 1</bibl>.—</sense><sense id="n19413.5" n="C" level="2"> Comically, of <hi rend="ital">a daughter's paramour</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">Villius in Fausta Sullae gener, etc.,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0893,004:1:2:64" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Hor.</author> S. 1, 2, 64</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
generabilis: <entryFree id="n19414" type="main" key="ge^ne^ra_bi^lis"><orth extent="full" lang="la">gĕnĕrābĭlis</orth>, <itype>e</itype>, <pos>adj.</pos> <etym>genero</etym> (postAug.). <sense id="n19414.0" n="I" level="1"> <hi rend="ital">Act.</hi>, <hi rend="ital">that has the power of generating</hi>, <hi rend="ital">generative</hi>, <hi rend="ital">creative</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">hic est ille generabilis rerum naturae spiritus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:2:116" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 2, 45, 45, § 116</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n19414.1" n="II" level="1"> <hi rend="ital">Pass.</hi>, <hi rend="ital">that may be generated</hi> or <hi rend="ital">produced</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">opus generabile,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Manil.</author> 1, 143</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
generalis: <entryFree id="n19415" type="main" key="ge^ne^ra_lis"><orth extent="full" lang="la">gĕnĕrālis</orth>, <itype>e</itype>, <pos>adj.</pos> <etym>genus</etym>. <sense id="n19415.0" n="I" level="1"> <hi rend="ital">Of</hi> or <hi rend="ital">belonging to a kind</hi> or <hi rend="ital">species</hi>, <hi rend="ital">generic</hi> (very rare): variae volucres ut in ordine cunctae<cb n="GENE" />  Ostendant maculas generales corpore inesse, etc., <hi rend="ital">of their species</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0550,001:1:590" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Lucr.</author> 1, 590</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">cum qualis sit res, quaeritur, quia et de vi et de genere negotii controversia est, constitutio generalis vocatur,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,036:1:8:10" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Inv. 1, 8, 10</bibl></cit>. —</sense><sense id="n19415.1" n="II" level="1"> <hi rend="ital">Of</hi> or <hi rend="ital">relating to all</hi>, <hi rend="ital">general</hi> (opp. singuli and specialis; cf. universalis; <cit><quote lang="la">freq. only since the Aug. per.): et generale quoddam decorum intelligimus, quod in omni honestate versatur, et aliud huic subjectum, quod pertinet ad singulas partes honestatis,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,055:1:27:96" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Off. 1, 27, 96</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">causae, opp. singulae lites,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:7:1:64" default="NO"><author>Quint.</author> 7, 1, 64</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1014,001:Ep. 58" default="NO"><author>Sen.</author> Ep. 58 <hi rend="ital">med.</hi></bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">cum sit omnis generalis quaestio speciali potentior,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:12:2:18" default="NO"><author>Quint.</author> 12, 2, 18</bibl></cit>; cf.: <cit><quote lang="la">illud generale, hoc speciale,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:5:10:44" default="NO"><author>id.</author> 5, 10, 44</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">tractatus, opp. specialis,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:5:7:35" default="NO"><author>id.</author> 5, 7, 35</bibl></cit>; cf.: <cit><quote lang="la">ab generali tractatu ad quasdam deduci species,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:2:4:22" default="NO"><author>id.</author> 2, 4, 22</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">de re et generales quaestiones sunt et definitae,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:7:2:1" default="NO"><author>id.</author> 7, 2, 1</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">definitio,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,2806,001:28:5:4" default="NO"><author>Dig.</author> 28, 5, 4</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">pactum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,2806,001:2:14:40" default="NO"><author>ib.</author> 2, 14, 40</bibl></cit>: lex est generale jussum populi aut plebis, rogante magistratu, At. Cap. ap. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1254,001:10:20:2" default="NO"><author>Gell.</author> 10, 20, 2</bibl>.—Hence, <pos>adv.</pos>: <orth extent="full" lang="la">gĕnĕrālĭter</orth> (acc. to II.), <hi rend="ital">in general</hi>, <hi rend="ital">generally</hi> (mostly post-Aug.; cf.: <cit><quote lang="la">generatim, communiter): tempus est, id quo nunc utimur (nam ipsum quidem generaliter definire difficile est), pars quaedam aeternitatis,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,036:1:26:39" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Inv. 1, 26, 39</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">quaedam adnotasse, sed generaliter (opp. particulas etiam persequi),</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1318,001:1:8:3" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> Ep. 1, 8, 3</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">tempus generaliter et specialiter accipitur, etc.,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:5:10:42 sq" default="NO"><author>Quint.</author> 5, 10, 42 sq.</bibl></cit>; <cit><quote lang="la">so opp. specialiter,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:5:7:4" default="NO"><author>id.</author> 5, 7, 4</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:5:11:1" default="NO">5, 11, 1</bibl>; <cit><quote lang="la">opp. proprie,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:3:7:7" default="NO"><author>id.</author> 3, 7, 7</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">legare,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1251,001:Inst. 2:238" default="NO"><author>Gai.</author> Inst. 2, 238</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">stipulari,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1251,001:ib. 4:53" default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 4, 53</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">universi,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:tlg,0527,049:25:20" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Vulg.</author> Jer. 25, 20</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
generalitas: <entryFree id="n19416" type="main" key="ge^ne^ra_li^tas"><orth extent="full" lang="la">gĕnĕrālĭtas</orth>, <itype>ātis</itype>, <gen>f.</gen> <etym>generalis, II.</etym>, <sense id="n19416.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">generally</hi> (post-class.), <bibl default="NO"><author>Serv.</author> ad Verg. G. 1, 21</bibl>; <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ad Verg. A. 6, 154</bibl>; <bibl default="NO"><author>Mart. Cap.</author> 4, § 348 <hi rend="ital">fin.</hi></bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1224,001:Ep. 2:90" default="NO"><author>Symm.</author> Ep. 2, 90</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
generaliter: <entryFree id="n19417" type="main" key="ge^ne^ra_li^ter"><orth extent="full" lang="la">gĕnĕrālĭter</orth>, <pos>adv.</pos>, v. generalis <sense id="n19417.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">fin.</hi></sense></entryFree>
generasco: <entryFree id="n19418" type="hapax" key="ge^ne^rasco"><orth extent="full" lang="la">gĕnĕrasco</orth>, <itype>ĕre</itype>, <sense id="n19418.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">v. inch. n.</hi> [genero], <hi rend="ital">to be generated</hi>, <hi rend="ital">produced</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">omnia membris ex ineunte aevo,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0550,001:3:745" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Lucr.</author> 3, 745</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
generatim: <entryFree id="n19419" type="main" key="ge^ne^ra_tim"><orth extent="full" lang="la">gĕnĕrātim</orth>, <pos>adv.</pos> <etym>genus; cf. also generalis</etym>. <sense id="n19419.0" n="I" level="1"> <hi rend="ital">By kinds</hi>, <hi rend="ital">species</hi>, <hi rend="ital">classes</hi>, or <hi rend="ital">divisions</hi> (freq. and class.): <cit><quote lang="la">generatim reddita finis Crescendi rebus constat, etc.,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0550,001:1:584" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Lucr.</author> 1, 584</bibl></cit>; cf. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0550,001:1:597" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> 1, 597</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">ut cupide generatim secla propagent,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0550,001:1:20" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> 1, 20</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0550,001:1:229" default="NO" valid="yes">1, 229</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0550,001:563" default="NO" valid="yes">563</bibl>; <cit><quote lang="la">2, 347 al.: primum nomen omnium (avium): alites ab alis, volucres a volatu. Deinde generatim: de his pleraeque ab suis vocibus, ut haec upupa, cuculus, corvus, etc.,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0684,001:L. L. 5:section=75" default="NO"><author>Varr.</author> L. L. 5, § 75</bibl></cit> Müll.; cf. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0684,001:ib. 5" default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 5</bibl>, § <cit><quote lang="la">146 ib.: ergo ab universa provincia generatimque ab singulis ejus partibus diligitur,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,005:2:69:section=168" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Verr. 2, 2, 69, § 168</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">aut publice civitas istos honores habent, aut, si generatim, homines ut aratores, ut mercatores, ut navicularii,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 2, 2, 55</bibl></cit>, § 137; cf. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0448,002:3:32:1" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Caes.</author> B. C. 3, 32, 1</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">Germani suas copias castris eduxerunt generatimque constituerunt paribusque intervallis Harudes, Marcomanos, Triboccos, etc.,</quote> <trans>i. e. <tr>by nations</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0448,001:1:51:2" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> B. G. 1, 51, 2</bibl></cit> (Metaphr. <foreign lang="greek">kata\ fula/s</foreign>); cf.: <cit><quote lang="la">Galli generatim distributi in civitates,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 7, 19, 2</bibl></cit>: Caesar contione habita Cordubae omnibus generatim gratias agit: civibus Romanis, quod, etc. ... Hispanis, quod, etc. . . . Gaditanis, quod, etc., <hi rend="ital">after their kind</hi>, i. e. <hi rend="ital">according to their services</hi>, <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 2, 21, 1</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">exponere argumenta,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Ac. 2, 15, 47</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">componere,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,037:1:41:146" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> de Or. 1, 41, 146</bibl></cit>; cf. <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 1, 13, 58</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">ne omnia generatim sacra omnesque percenseam deos,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:5:52:6" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 5, 52, 6</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">qua haut dubie major aliquanto summa ex numero plaustrorum ponderibusque auri, argenti generatim ab ipso scriptis efficitur,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:45:40:1" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> 45, 40, 1</bibl></cit> Weissenb. ad loc.: <cit><quote lang="la">proprios generatim discite cultus, Agricolae,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,002:2:35" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> G. 2, 35</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n19419.1" n="II" level="1"> Opposed to specially, in particular, <hi rend="ital">generally</hi>, <hi rend="ital">in general</hi> (rare but class.): <cit><quote lang="la">singillatim potius quam generatim atque universe loquar,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,005:5:55:section=143" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Verr. 2, 5, 55, § 143</bibl></cit>; cf.: <cit><quote lang="la">neque generatim tradere, neque per singulas partes exsequi,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:5:10:100" default="NO"><author>Quint.</author> 5, 10, 100</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">omnia generatim amplecti,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,036:2:5:18" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Inv. 2, 5, 18</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">generatim ea, quae maxime nota sunt, dicam,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,027:35:86" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Pis. 35, 86</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">non nominatim, sed generatim informata proscriptio,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,057:11:6:2" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Att. 11, 6, 2</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">haec generatim praecipimus: nunc illud proprie, etc.,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0845,001:3:9:9" default="NO"><author>Col.</author> 3, 9, 9</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
generatio: <entryFree id="n19420" type="main" key="ge^ne^ra_ti^o"><orth extent="full" lang="la">gĕnĕrātĭo</orth>, <itype>ōnis</itype>, <gen>f.</gen> <etym>genero</etym>, <sense id="n19420.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a begetting</hi>, <hi rend="ital">generating</hi>, <hi rend="ital">generation</hi> (post-Aug.): <cit><quote lang="la">piscium,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:9:157" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 9, 50, 74, § 157</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:8:187" default="NO" valid="yes">8, 47, 72, § 187</bibl>: deorum = <foreign lang="greek">qeogoni/a</foreign>, a poem of Hesiod, <bibl default="NO"><author>Lact.</author> 1, 5, 8</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">Adam,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:tlg,0527,001:5:1" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Vulg.</author> Gen. 5, 1</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">Christi,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:tlg,0031,001:1:1" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Matt. 1, 1</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n19420.1" n="II" level="1"> <usg type="style">Transf.</usg>, <hi rend="ital">a</hi> <pb n="807" /> <cb n="GENE" /> <hi rend="ital">generation</hi> of men, <bibl default="NO"><author>Ambros.</author> Off. Ministr. 1, 25, 121</bibl>.—In <number>plur.</number>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:20:142 al" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 20, 13, 51, § 142 al.</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:tlg,0031,010:3:5" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Vulg.</author> Eph. 3, 5</bibl> et saep.</sense></entryFree>
generator: <entryFree id="n19421" type="main" key="ge^ne^ra_tor"><orth extent="full" lang="la">gĕnĕrātor</orth>, <itype>ōris</itype>, <gen>m.</gen> <etym>genero</etym>, <sense id="n19421.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">an engenderer</hi>, <hi rend="ital">generator</hi>, <hi rend="ital">producer</hi> (very rare): <cit><quote lang="la">nosse autem generatores suos optime poterant,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,072:chapter=11" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Univ. 11</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">Acragas ... magnanimūm quondam generator equorum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,003:3:704" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> A. 3, 704</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:tlg,0527,033:13:3" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Vulg.</author> Sap. 13, 3</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
generatorius: <entryFree id="n19422" type="main" key="ge^ne^ra_to_ri^us"><orth extent="full" lang="la">gĕnĕrātōrĭus</orth>, <itype>a, um</itype>, <pos>adj.</pos> <etym>generator</etym>, <sense id="n19422.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">of</hi> or <hi rend="ital">relating to generation</hi> (postclass.): <cit><quote lang="la">more,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Tert.</author> adv. Val. 27</bibl></cit>.—As <hi rend="ital">subst.</hi>: <orth extent="full" lang="la">gĕnĕrātōrium</orth>, <itype>ii</itype>, <gen>n.</gen>, <hi rend="ital">a means of generation</hi>, Ambros. in. Psa. 118; Serm. 18, 11.</sense></entryFree>
generatrix: <entryFree id="n19423" type="main" key="ge^ne^ra_trix"><orth extent="full" lang="la">gĕnĕrātrix</orth>, <itype>īcis</itype>, <gen>f.</gen> <etym>id.</etym>, <sense id="n19423.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">she that generates</hi> or <hi rend="ital">brings forth</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">(Aegyptus) hominum aliorumque animalium perfecunda generatrix,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0929,001:1:9:1" default="NO"><author>Mel.</author> 1, 9, 1</bibl></cit>; Ambros. de Noë, 28, 106.</sense></entryFree>
genero: <entryFree id="n19424" type="main" key="ge^ne^ro"><orth extent="full" lang="la">gĕnĕro</orth>, <itype>āvi, ātum, 1</itype>, <pos>v. a.</pos> <etym>genus</etym>, <sense id="n19424.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">to beget</hi>, <hi rend="ital">procreate</hi>, <hi rend="ital">engender</hi>, <hi rend="ital">produce</hi>, <hi rend="ital">create;</hi> in <hi rend="ital">pass.</hi>, <hi rend="ital">to spring</hi> or <hi rend="ital">descend from.</hi> </sense><sense id="n19424.1" n="I" level="1"> <usg type="style">Lit.</usg> (class.): <cit><quote lang="la">hominem generavit et ornavit deus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,044:1:9:27" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Leg. 1, 9, 27</bibl></cit>: isque (Capys) pium ex se Anchisen generat, Enn. ap. Philarg. ad <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,002:3:35" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> G. 3, 35</bibl> (Ann. v. 32 Vahl.): <cit><quote lang="la">Oebalus, quem generasse Telon Sebethide nymphā Fertur,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,003:7:734" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> A. 7, 734</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">unde nil majus generatur ipso (Jove),</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0893,001:1:12:17" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Hor.</author> C. 1, 12, 17</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">Herculis stirpe generatus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,043:2:12" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Rep. 2, 12</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">homines hominum causa esse generatos,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,055:1:7:22" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Off. 1, 7, 22</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">ita generati a natura sumus, ut, etc.,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 1, 29, 103</bibl></cit>; cf. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,043:6:15" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Rep. 6, 15</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">a quo (deo) populum Romanum generatum accepimus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,035:4:2:5" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Phil. 4, 2, 5</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">ab origine ultima stirpis Romanae generatus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0588,025:1" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Nep.</author> Att. 1</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">Tros est generatus ab illo,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,007:4:33" default="NO"><author>Ov.</author> F. 4, 33</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">fuit Argolico generatus Alemone quidam Myscelos,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,006:15:19" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> M. 15, 19</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">Trojā generatus Acestes,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,003:5:61" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> A. 5, 61</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">mulos (antiqui vocabant) quos asini et equae generarent,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:8:172" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 8, 44, 69, § 172</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">quale portentum ... nec Jubae tellus generat,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0893,001:1:22:15" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Hor.</author> C. 1, 22, 15</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">terram tanto prius animalia generare coepisse,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,2806,001:2:1" default="NO"><author>Just.</author> 2, 1 <hi rend="ital">fin.</hi></bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">atque aliam ex alia generando suffice prolem,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,002:3:65" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> G. 3, 65</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">(mundus) semperne fuerit, nullo generatus ortu: an, etc.,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,072:chapter=2" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Univ. 2</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">semina, unde essent omnia orta, generata, concreta,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,049:5:24:69" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Tusc. 5, 24, 69</bibl></cit>; cf.: <cit><quote lang="la">semina generantia ranas,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,006:15:375" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ov.</author> M. 15, 375</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">terra et hos (rubos) generat,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:9:4:5" default="NO"><author>Quint.</author> 9, 4, 5</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">terra generandis alendisque seminibus fecundior,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:10:3:2" default="NO"><author>id.</author> 10, 3, 2</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">e gramine, quod in eo loco generatum esset, etc.,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1254,001:5:6:9" default="NO"><author>Gell.</author> 5, 6, 9</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">generandi gloria mellis,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,002:4:205" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> G. 4, 205</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">ignibus generandis nutriendisque soli ipsius naturalis materia,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,2806,001:4:1" default="NO"><author>Just.</author> 4, 1</bibl></cit>.—<usg type="style"><hi rend="ital">Absol.</hi></usg>: <cit><quote lang="la">asina generare coepit,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:8:172" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 8, 44, 69, § 172</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n19424.2" n="II" level="1"> <usg type="style">Trop.</usg> (perh. only post-Aug.). </sense><sense id="n19424.3" n="A" level="2"> In gen.: <cit><quote lang="la">cetera forsitan tenuis quoque et angusta ingenii vena ... generare atque ad frugem aliquam perducere queat,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:6:2:3" default="NO"><author>Quint.</author> 6, 2, 3</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">verecundia vitium quidem, sed quae virtutes facillime generet,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:12:5:2" default="NO"><author>id.</author> 12, 5, 2</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,2806,001:25:3:7" default="NO"><author>Dig.</author> 25, 3, 7</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">peccatum generat mortem,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Vulg.</author> Jacob. 1, 15</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n19424.4" n="B" level="2"> In partic., <hi rend="ital">to bring forth</hi>, <hi rend="ital">produce</hi>, of mental productions: <cit><quote lang="la">quae (aetates) nihil dum ipsae ex se generare queunt,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:1:1:36" default="NO"><author>Quint.</author> 1, 1, 36</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">cum generabit ipse aliquid atque componet,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:1:12:12" default="NO"><author>id.</author> 1, 12, 12</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:8:6:32" default="NO">8, 6, 32</bibl>; cf. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:10:2:5" default="NO"><author>id.</author> 10, 2, 5</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">similiter decurrentium spatiorum observatione esse generatum (poëma),</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:9:4:114" default="NO"><author>id.</author> 9, 4, 114</bibl></cit>; cf. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1348,001:life=nero:52" default="NO"><author>Suet.</author> Ner. 52</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
generose: <entryFree id="n19425" type="main" key="ge^ne^ro_se_"><orth extent="full" lang="la">gĕnĕrōsē</orth>, <pos>adv.</pos>, v. generosus <sense id="n19425.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">fin.</hi></sense></entryFree>
generositas: <entryFree id="n19426" type="main" key="ge^ne^ro_si^tas"><orth extent="full" lang="la">gĕnĕrōsĭtas</orth>, <itype>ātis</itype>, <gen>f.</gen> <etym>generosus</etym>, <sense id="n19426.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">nobility</hi>, <hi rend="ital">excellence</hi>, <hi rend="ital">goodness</hi> (post-Aug.): in ipsa ove satis generositatis ostenditur brevitate crurum, ventris vestitu, i. e. <hi rend="ital">noble breed</hi> or <hi rend="ital">race</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:8:198" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 8, 48, 75, § 198</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">caprarum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:8:202" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> 8, 50, 76, § 202</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">taurorum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:8:181" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> 8, 45, 70, § 181</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">antea Caecubo erat generositas celeberrima,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:14:61" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> 14, 6, 8, § 61</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0845,001:Arb. 1:3" default="NO"><author>Col.</author> Arb. 1, 3</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0845,001:3:6:4" default="NO">3, 6, 4</bibl>; <bibl default="NO"><author>Pall.</author> Oct. 3</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:tlg,0527,033:8:3" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Vulg.</author> Sap. 8, 3</bibl>.—</sense><sense id="n19426.1" n="II" level="1"> <hi rend="ital">High spirit</hi>, <hi rend="ital">boldness</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">leonis,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:8:50" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 8, 16, 19, § 50</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
generosus: <entryFree id="n19427" type="main" key="ge^ne^ro_sus"><orth extent="full" lang="la">gĕnĕrōsus</orth> <itype>a, um</itype>, <pos>adj.</pos> <etym>genus</etym>, <sense id="n19427.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">of good</hi> or <hi rend="ital">noble birth</hi>, <hi rend="ital">noble</hi>, <hi rend="ital">eminent</hi> (class.). </sense><sense id="n19427.1" n="I" level="1"> <usg type="style">Lit.</usg>: <cit><quote lang="la">generosa ac nobilis virgo (opp. mulier ignota),</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,047:3:1:20" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Par. 3, 1, 20</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">civili generosa ab stirpe profectus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,053:1:12:20" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Div. 1, 12, 20</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">generosissima femina,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1348,001:life=tib.:49" default="NO"><author>Suet.</author> Tib. 49</bibl></cit>; cf.: <cit><quote lang="la">viderat a veteris generosam sanguine Teucri Iphis Anaxareten, humili de stirpe creatus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,006:14:698" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ov.</author> M. 14, 698</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">non quia, Maecenas, nemo generosior est te ... naso suspendis adunco Ignotos,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0893,004:1:6:2" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Hor.</author> S. 1, 6, 2</bibl></cit>; cf. <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> 24</bibl>: quamquam ego naturam unam et communem omnium existimo, sed fortissimum <cb n="GENE" /> quemque generosissimum, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0631,001:J. 85:15" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Sall.</author> J. 85, 15</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">nominibus generosus avitis,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,008:4:4:1" default="NO"><author>Ov.</author> Tr. 4, 4, 1</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">Maeoniā generose domo,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,003:10:141" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> A. 10, 141</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">miles,</quote> <trans>i. e. <tr>the Fabii</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,007:2:199" default="NO"><author>Ov.</author> F. 2, 199</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">o generosam stirpem!</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,039:58:213" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Brut. 58, 213</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">atria,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,007:1:591" default="NO"><author>Ov.</author> F. 1, 591</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">quis enim generosum dixerit hunc?</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1276,001:8:30" default="NO"><author>Juv.</author> 8, 30</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">sapiens et nobilis et generosus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1276,001:7:191" default="NO"><author>id.</author> 7, 191</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1276,001:8:224" default="NO">8, 224</bibl>.—</sense><sense id="n19427.2" n="B" level="2"> <usg type="style">Transf.</usg>, of animals, plants, etc., <hi rend="ital">of a good</hi> or <hi rend="ital">noble species</hi>, <hi rend="ital">noble</hi>, <hi rend="ital">superior</hi>, <hi rend="ital">excellent</hi> (mostly <usg type="style">poet.</usg> and in post-Aug. prose): <cit><quote lang="la">sues,</quote> <trans><tr>of a noble stock</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:11:233" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 11, 40, 95, § 233</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">pecus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,002:3:75" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> G. 3, 75</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">equus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:5:11:4" default="NO"><author>Quint.</author> 5, 11, 4</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1224,001:Ep. 4:61" default="NO"><author>Symm.</author> Ep. 4, 61</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">leones generosissimi,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:10:47" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 10, 21, 24, § 47</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">testa (i. e. concha),</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0893,004:2:4:31" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Hor.</author> S. 2, 4, 31</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">ostrea,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:32:61" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 32, 6, 21, § 61</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">generosum et lene requiro (vinum),</quote> <trans><tr>of a good sort</tr>, <tr>generous</tr>,</trans> <bibl default="NO"><author>Hor.</author> Ep. 1, 15, 18</bibl></cit>; cf. <cit><quote lang="la">vitis,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0845,001:3:2" default="NO"><author>Col.</author> 3, 2 <hi rend="ital">fin.</hi></bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0845,001:3:2:17" default="NO">3, 2, 17</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">pruna,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,006:13:818" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ov.</author> M. 13, 818</bibl></cit>; cf.: <cit><quote lang="la">generosissima mala,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:15:64" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 15, 17, 18, § 64</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">quod est pomum generosissimum? nonne quod optimum?</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:5:11:4" default="NO"><author>Quint.</author> 5, 11, 4</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">sorba,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:15:85" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 15, 21, 23, § 85</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">obsonium,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:15:118" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> 15, 29, 35, § 118</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">arbor,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:8:3:76" default="NO"><author>Quint.</author> 8, 3, 76</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">flos,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,007:5:211 al" default="NO"><author>Ov.</author> F. 5, 211 al.</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">generosos palmite colles,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,006:15:710" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> M. 15, 710</bibl></cit>; cf.: <cit><quote lang="la">insula inexhaustis Chalybum generosa metallis,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,003:10:174" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> A. 10, 174</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n19427.3" n="II" level="1"> <usg type="style">Trop.</usg> </sense><sense id="n19427.4" n="A" level="2"> Of persons, <hi rend="ital">noble-minded</hi>, <hi rend="ital">magnanimous</hi>, <hi rend="ital">generous</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">cum de imperio certamen esset cum rege generoso ac potente (Pyrrho),</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,055:3:22:86" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Off. 3, 22, 86</bibl></cit>; cf.: <cit><quote lang="la">quid homo? nonne is generosissimus qui optimus?</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:5:11:4" default="NO"><author>Quint.</author> 5, 11, 4</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">Alexander generosi spiritus imperator,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:8:149" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 8, 40, 61, § 149</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">quis enim generosum dixerit hunc qui Indignus genere,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1276,001:8:30" default="NO"><author>Juv.</author> 8, 30</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n19427.5" n="B" level="2"> Of things, <hi rend="ital">noble</hi>, <hi rend="ital">dignified</hi>, <hi rend="ital">honorable</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">humilis et minime generosus ortus amicitiae,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,052:9:29" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Lael. 9, 29</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">quaedam generosa virtus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,049:2:6:16" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Tusc. 2, 6, 16</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">Dolabella, vir simplicitatis generosissimae,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1044,001:2:125" default="NO"><author>Vell.</author> 2, 125 <hi rend="ital">fin.</hi></bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">quo generosior celsiorque est (animus),</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:1:2:3" default="NO"><author>Quint.</author> 1, 2, 3</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:2:4:4" default="NO"><author>id.</author> 2, 4, 4</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">forma magnifica et generosa quodammodo,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,039:75:261" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Brut. 75, 261</bibl></cit>; <cit><quote lang="la">quoted by Suet. paraphrastically,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1348,001:life=jul.:55" default="NO"><author>Suet.</author> Caes. 55</bibl></cit>: quicquid est in oratione generosius, Quint. prooem. 24: tamen emerui generosos vestis honores, i. e. <hi rend="ital">the dress of honor</hi> (of a mother of three children), <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1224,001:4:11:61" default="NO"><author>Prop.</author> 4, 11, 61</bibl>. —Hence, * <pos>adv.</pos>: <orth extent="full" lang="la">gĕnĕrōse</orth> (acc. to II.), <hi rend="ital">nobly</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">generosius Perire quaerens,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0893,001:1:37:21" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Hor.</author> C. 1, 37, 21</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
genesis: <entryFree id="n19428" type="greek" key="ge^ne^sis"><orth extent="full" lang="la">gĕnĕsis</orth>, <itype>is</itype>, <gen>f.</gen>, = <foreign lang="greek">ge/nesis</foreign>, <sense id="n19428.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">generation</hi>, <hi rend="ital">birth</hi>, <hi rend="ital">creation.</hi> </sense><sense id="n19428.1" n="I" level="1"> <usg type="style">Lit.</usg>: <cit><quote lang="la">in basi (statuae Minervae) quod caelatum est, Pandoras genesin appellavit (Phidias),</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:36:19" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 36, 5, 4, § 19</bibl></cit>. —</sense><sense id="n19428.2" n="B" level="2"> Genesis, <hi rend="ital">the name of the first book of Moses</hi> (the history of the creation), <bibl default="NO"><author>Tert.</author> de Or. 6</bibl>.—</sense><sense id="n19428.3" n="II" level="1"> <usg type="style">Transf.</usg>, <hi rend="ital">the star that is rising at one's birth</hi>, <hi rend="ital">a natal-star</hi>, <hi rend="ital">nativity</hi>, <hi rend="ital">horoscope</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">inspecta genesi,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1276,001:6:579" default="NO"><author>Juv.</author> 6, 579</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">nota mathematicis genesis tua,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1276,001:14:248" default="NO"><author>id.</author> 14, 248</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">quod vulgo crederetur (Mettius) genesim habere imperatoriam,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1348,001:life=vesp.:14" default="NO"><author>Suet.</author> Vesp. 14</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1348,001:life=dom.:10" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Dom. 10</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
genesta: <entryFree id="n19429" type="main" key="ge^nesta"><orth extent="full" lang="la">gĕnesta</orth> or <orth extent="full" lang="la">gĕnista</orth>, <itype>ae</itype>, <gen>f.</gen>, <sense id="n19429.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">the broomplant</hi>, <hi rend="ital">broom</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,002:2:12" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> G. 2, 12</bibl>; <bibl default="NO">434</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:19:15" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 19, 1, 2, § 15</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:24:65 al" default="NO" valid="yes">24, 9, 40, § 65 al.</bibl></sense></entryFree>
genethliacus: <entryFree id="n19430" type="greek" key="ge^nethli^a^cus"><orth extent="full" lang="la">gĕnethlĭăcus</orth>, <itype>a, um</itype>, <pos>adj.</pos>, = <foreign lang="greek">geneqliako/s</foreign>, <sense id="n19430.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">of</hi> or <hi rend="ital">belonging to one's natal hour</hi> or <hi rend="ital">nativity</hi>, <hi rend="ital">genethliacal.</hi> </sense><sense id="n19430.1" n="I" level="1"> <pos>adj.</pos>: <cit><quote lang="la">ratio,</quote> <trans><tr>the art of calculating nativities</tr>,</trans> <bibl default="NO"><author>Arn.</author> 2, 116</bibl></cit>; cf. in the foll.—</sense><sense id="n19430.2" n="II" level="1"> <pos>Subst.</pos> </sense><sense id="n19430.3" n="A" level="2"> <orth extent="full" lang="la">gene-thliacus</orth>, <itype>i</itype>, <gen>m.</gen>, <hi rend="ital">a calculator of nativities</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1254,001:14:1:1" default="NO"><author>Gell.</author> 14, 1, 1</bibl>.—</sense><sense id="n19430.4" n="B" level="2"> <orth extent="full" lang="la">genethliace</orth>, <itype>ēs</itype>, <gen>f.</gen>, <hi rend="ital">the art of calculating nativities</hi>, <hi rend="ital">genethliacs</hi>, <bibl default="NO"><author>Mart. Cap.</author> 3, § 228</bibl>; <bibl default="NO">9, § 894</bibl>.—</sense><sense id="n19430.5" n="C" level="2"> <orth extent="full" lang="la">Gene-thliacon</orth>, <itype>i</itype>, <gen>n.</gen>, <hi rend="ital">a birth-day poem</hi>, the title of a poem by Statius, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1020,002:2:7" default="NO"><author>Stat.</author> S. 2, 7</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
genethliologia: <entryFree id="n19431" type="greek" key="ge^nethli^o^lo^gi^a"><orth extent="full" lang="la">gĕnethlĭŏlŏgĭa</orth>, <itype>ae</itype>, <gen>f.</gen>, = <foreign lang="greek">geneqliologi/a</foreign>, <sense id="n19431.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">the art of calculating nativities</hi> or <hi rend="ital">casting horoscopes</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1056,001:9:6:2" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Vitr.</author> 9, 6, 2</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
genetivus: <entryFree id="n19432" type="main" key="ge^ne^ti_vus"><orth extent="full" lang="la">gĕnĕtīvus</orth> (not <orth extent="full" lang="la">gĕnĭtīvus</orth>; cf. Lachm. ad <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0550,001:II. p. 15 sq" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Lucr.</author> II. p. 15 sq.</bibl>), <itype>a, um</itype>, <pos>adj.</pos> <etym>genitus, from gigno</etym>, <sense id="n19432.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">of</hi> or <hi rend="ital">belonging to generation</hi> or <hi rend="ital">birth.</hi> </sense><sense id="n19432.1" n="I" level="1"> In gen. (rare; not in Cic.): Apollinis Genetivi ara, <hi rend="ital">the generator</hi>, <hi rend="ital">fertilizer</hi>, Cato ap. <bibl default="NO"><author>Macr.</author> S. 3, 6</bibl>; <cit><quote lang="la">for which: Phoebi Genitoris ad aras,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1035,001:5:404" default="NO"><author>Val. Fl.</author> 5, 404</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">forma prior rediit genetivaque rursus imago,</quote> <trans><tr>native</tr>, <tr>original nature</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,006:3:331" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ov.</author> M. 3, 331</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">dispersis per pectus genetivis notis,</quote> <trans><tr>birth-marks</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1348,001:life=aug.:80" default="NO"><author>Suet.</author> Aug. 80</bibl></cit>: nomina, i. e. <hi rend="ital">belonging to a family</hi> or gens, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,009:3:2:107" default="NO"><author>Ov.</author> P. 3, 2, 107</bibl>.—</sense><sense id="n19432.2" n="II" level="1"> In partic., in gram., genetivus (genit-) casus, <hi rend="ital">the genitive case</hi> (in Varr. L. L. called patricius casus): si ut Maecenas Suffenas. Asprenas dicerentur, genetivo casu non <hi rend="ital">e</hi> littera, sed <hi rend="ital">tis</hi> syllaba terminarentur,<cb n="GENI" />  <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:1:5:62" default="NO"><author>Quint.</author> 1, 5, 62</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:1:6:14" default="NO">1, 6, 14</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1348,001:life=aug.:87" default="NO"><author>Suet.</author> Aug. 87</bibl> et saep.; and with equal frequency <hi rend="ital">subst.</hi>: <orth extent="full" lang="la">gĕnĕtīvus</orth>, <itype>i</itype>, <gen>m.</gen>, <hi rend="ital">the genitive</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:1:5:63" default="NO"><author>Quint.</author> 1, 5, 63</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:1:6:14" default="NO">1, 6, 14</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1254,001:4:16:3" default="NO"><author>Gell.</author> 4, 16, 3</bibl> et saep.</sense></entryFree>
genetrix: <entryFree id="n19433" type="main" key="ge^ne^trix"><orth extent="full" lang="la">gĕnĕtrix</orth> (less freq. <orth extent="full" lang="la">gĕnĭtrix</orth>; cf. Wagn. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,002:4:363" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> G. 4, 363</bibl>, and Lachm. ad <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0550,001:II. p. 15 sq" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Lucr.</author> II. p. 15 sq.</bibl>), <itype>īcis</itype>, <gen>f.</gen> <etym>genitor</etym>, <sense id="n19433.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">she that has borne</hi> any one, or <hi rend="ital">produced</hi> any thing, <hi rend="ital">a mother</hi> (<usg type="style">poet.</usg> and in post-Aug. prose; syn. mater). </sense><sense id="n19433.1" n="I" level="1"> <usg type="style">Lit.</usg>: Venus, genetrix patris nostri (Aeneae), Enn. ap. <bibl default="NO"><author>Non.</author> 378, 16</bibl> (Ann. v. 53 Vahl.); so of <hi rend="ital">Venus</hi>, as the mother of Aeneas, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,003:1:590" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> A. 1, 590</bibl>; <bibl default="NO">8, 383</bibl>; <bibl default="NO">12, 412</bibl>; 554; <cit><quote lang="la">as the ancestress of the Romans: Aeneadūm genetrix,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0550,001:1:1" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Lucr.</author> 1, 1</bibl></cit>; <cit><quote lang="la">and of Cæsar,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1348,001:life=jul.:61" default="NO"><author>Suet.</author> Caes. 61</bibl></cit>; <bibl default="NO">78</bibl>; <bibl default="NO">84</bibl> (cf.: Venere prognatus, of Cæsar, Cael. ap. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,056:8:15:2" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Fam. 8, 15, 2</bibl>; cf. also <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1348,001:life=jul.:6" default="NO"><author>Suet.</author> Caes. 6</bibl> and 49); <cit><quote lang="la">as the mother of Amor,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,003:1:689" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> A. 1, 689</bibl></cit>; of <hi rend="ital">Cybele</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">me magna deūm genetrix his detinet oris, (also called Magna Mater),</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 2, 788</bibl></cit>; <cit><quote lang="la">so of the same,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 9, 82</bibl></cit>; 94; <cit><quote lang="la">117: genetrix Priami de gente vetusta Est mihi (shortly after: parens),</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 9, 284</bibl></cit>; cf.: <cit><quote lang="la">nec ferro ut demens genetricem occidis Orestes (shortly after: occisa parente),</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0893,004:2:3:133" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Hor.</author> S. 2, 3, 133</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">(ciconiae) genetricum senectam invicem educant,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:10:63" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 10, 23, 32, § 63</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:tlg,0527,031:3:4 al" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Vulg.</author> Cant. 3, 4 al.</bibl>—</sense><sense id="n19433.2" n="II" level="1"> <usg type="style">Transf.</usg> </sense><sense id="n19433.3" n="A" level="2"> <hi rend="ital">She that produces</hi>, <hi rend="ital">a mother</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">(tellus) magna deūm mater materque ferarum, et nostri genetrix corporis,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0550,001:2:599" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Lucr.</author> 2, 599</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">patria o mea creatrix! patria o mea genetrix!</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0472,001:63:50" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cat.</author> 63, 50</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">frugum,</quote> <trans>i. e. <tr>Ceres</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,006:5:490" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ov.</author> M. 5, 490</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">Miletus, Ioniae caput, super octoginta urbium per cuncta maria genetrix,</quote> <trans><tr>mother-city</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:5:112" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 5, 29, 31, § 112</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">Aegyptus vitiorum genetrix,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:26:4" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> 26, 1, 3, § 4</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">genetrix virtutum frugalitas,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,2806,001:20:4" default="NO"><author>Just.</author> 20, 4</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n19433.4" n="B" level="2"> <usg type="style">Poet.</usg> of a <hi rend="ital">mother-in-law</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,006:9:326" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ov.</author> M. 9, 326</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
geneva: <entryFree id="n19434" type="main" key="Ge^ne_va"><orth extent="full" lang="la">Gĕnēva</orth>, <orth type="alt" extent="full" lang="la">Genēvensis</orth>, v. Genava, Genavensis.</entryFree>
genialis: <entryFree id="n19435" type="main" key="ge^ni^a_lis"><orth extent="full" lang="la">gĕnĭālis</orth>, <itype>e</itype>, <pos>adj.</pos> <etym>Genius</etym>. <sense id="n19435.0" n="I" level="1"> <hi rend="ital">Of</hi> or <hi rend="ital">belonging to generation</hi> or <hi rend="ital">birth</hi>, <hi rend="ital">nuptial</hi>, <hi rend="ital">genial</hi> (cf.: genitalis, genetivus). </sense><sense id="n19435.1" n="A" level="2"> <hi rend="ital">Adj.</hi>: lectum illum genialem, quem biennio ante filiae suae nubenti straverat, <hi rend="ital">the bridal-bed</hi> (placed in the atrium, and dedicated to the genii of the married couple), <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,010:5:14" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Clu. 5, 14</bibl>; cf.: <cit><quote lang="la">geniales proprie sunt lecti, qui sternuntur puellis nubentibus: dicti a generandis liberis,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Serv.</author> Verg. A. 6, 603</bibl></cit>: genialis lectus qui nuptiis sternitur in honorem genii, unde et appellatus, Paul. ex <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1236,001:page=94" default="NO"><author>Fest.</author> p. 94</bibl> Müll.: <cit><quote lang="la">lectus,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Hor.</author> Ep. 1, 1, 87</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">torus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,003:6:603" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> A. 6, 603</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:30:12:21" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 30, 12, 21</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1318,002:8:1" default="NO"><author>Plin.</author> Pan. 8, 1</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">pulvinar divae,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0472,001:64:47" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cat.</author> 64, 47</bibl></cit>.— Hence <usg type="style">poet.</usg> transf.: <cit><quote lang="la">ducuntur raptae, genialis praeda, puellae,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,004:1:125" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ov.</author> A. A. 1, 125</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">bella,</quote> <trans><tr>at a wedding</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1020,003:1:113" default="NO"><author>Stat.</author> Ach. 1, 113</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">sors genialis atque fecunda,</quote> <trans><tr>productive</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:18:197" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 18, 24, 54, § 197</bibl></cit>; cf.: <cit><quote lang="la">in tantum abundante geniali copia pecudum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:17:53" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> 17, 9, 6, § 53</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n19435.2" n="B" level="2"> <hi rend="ital">Subst.</hi>: <orth extent="full" lang="la">gĕnĭālĭa</orth>, <itype>ium</itype>, <gen>n.</gen>, <hi rend="ital">the marriagebed</hi>, <hi rend="ital">marriage</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">genialibus alienis insultare,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Arn.</author> 4, 144</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n19435.3" n="II" level="1"> <hi rend="ital">Of</hi> or <hi rend="ital">belonging to enjoyment</hi>, <hi rend="ital">jovial</hi>, <hi rend="ital">pleasant</hi>, <hi rend="ital">delightful</hi>, <hi rend="ital">joyousfestive</hi>, <hi rend="ital">genial</hi>: scis enim, geniales homines ab antiquis appellatos, qui ad invitandum et largius apparandum cibum promptiores essent, Santra ap. <bibl default="NO"><author>Non.</author> 117, 18</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">festum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,007:3:523" default="NO"><author>Ov.</author> F. 3, 523</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">dies,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1276,001:4:66" default="NO"><author>Juv.</author> 4, 66</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">hiems,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,002:1:302" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> G. 1, 302</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">uva,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,006:4:14" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ov.</author> M. 4, 14</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">serta,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,010:13:929" default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 13, 929</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">rus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,002:19:9" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> H. 19, 9</bibl></cit>; cf.: <cit><quote lang="la">arva Canopi,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,001:2:13:7" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Am. 2, 13, 7</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">litus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1020,002:4:4:51" default="NO"><author>Stat.</author> S. 4, 4, 51</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">platanus,</quote> <trans>i. e. <tr>under which festivals were celebrated</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,006:10:95" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ov.</author> M. 10, 95</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">Musa,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,001:3:15:19" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Am. 3, 15, 19</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">divi,</quote> <trans>i. e. <tr>Ceres and Bacchus</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1020,001:12:618" default="NO"><author>Stat.</author> Th. 12, 618</bibl></cit>; cf. Paul. ex <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1236,001:page=95" default="NO"><author>Fest.</author> p. 95</bibl> Müll.: <cit><quote lang="la">vultus,</quote> <trans><tr>friendly</tr>,</trans> <bibl default="NO"><author>App.</author> M. 11, p. 263</bibl></cit>.—Hence, <pos>adv.</pos>: <orth extent="full" lang="la">gĕnĭālĭter</orth> (acc. to II.), <hi rend="ital">jovially</hi>, <hi rend="ital">merrily</hi>, <hi rend="ital">genially</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">festum genialiter egit,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,006:11:95" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ov.</author> M. 11, 95</bibl></cit>; <bibl default="NO"><author>App.</author> M. 10, p. 246</bibl>; <bibl default="NO"><author>Inscr. Grut.</author> 823, 2</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
genialitas: <entryFree id="n19436" type="main" key="ge^ni^a_li^tas"><orth extent="full" lang="la">gĕnĭālĭtas</orth>, <itype>ātis</itype>, <gen>f.</gen> <etym>genialis, II.</etym>, <sense id="n19436.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">joviality</hi>, <hi rend="ital">festivity</hi> (late Lat.): <cit><quote lang="la">mensae,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Amm.</author> 30, 1 <hi rend="ital">fin.</hi></bibl></cit></sense></entryFree>
genialiter: <entryFree id="n19437" type="main" key="ge^ni^a_li^ter"><orth extent="full" lang="la">gĕnĭālĭter</orth>, <pos>adv.</pos>, v. genialis <sense id="n19437.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">fin.</hi></sense></entryFree>
geniarius: <entryFree id="n19438" type="gloss" key="ge^ni^a_ri^us"><orth extent="full" lang="la">gĕnĭārĭus</orth>, <itype>ii</itype>, <gen>m.</gen> <etym>Genius</etym>, <sense id="n19438.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">one who makes images of genii</hi>, <bibl default="NO"><author>Inscr. Orell.</author> 4195</bibl>; <bibl default="NO"><author>Inscr. Grut.</author> 25, 1</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
geniatus: <entryFree id="n19439" type="main" key="ge^ni^a_tus"><orth extent="full" lang="la">gĕnĭātus</orth>, <itype>a, um</itype>, <pos>adj.</pos> <etym>Genius; cf. genialis, II.</etym>, <sense id="n19439.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">jovial</hi>, <hi rend="ital">joyous</hi>, <hi rend="ital">cheerful</hi> (late Lat. for the class. genialis): <cit><quote lang="la">fuit vultu geniatus,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Capitol.</author> Ver. 10</bibl></cit>; <bibl default="NO"><author>Cassiod.</author> Var. 3, 12 al.</bibl></sense></entryFree>
geniculatim: <entryFree id="n19440" type="hapax" key="ge^ni^cu^la_tim"><orth extent="full" lang="la">gĕnĭcŭlātim</orth>, <pos>adv.</pos> <etym>geniculum</etym>, <sense id="n19440.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">by knots</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:21:68" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 21, 11, 39, § 68</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
geniculatio: <entryFree id="n19441" type="main" key="ge^ni^cu^la_ti^o"><orth extent="full" lang="la">gĕnĭcŭlātĭo</orth>, <itype>ōnis</itype>, <gen>f.</gen> <etym>geniculatus</etym>, <sense id="n19441.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a</hi> <pb n="808" /> <cb n="GENI" /> <hi rend="ital">bending of the knee</hi>, <hi rend="ital">kneeling</hi> (post-class.), <bibl default="NO"><author>Tert.</author> ad Scap. 4</bibl>; <bibl default="NO"><author>Hier.</author> Eph. 3, 14</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
geniculatus: <entryFree id="n19442" type="main" key="ge^ni^cu^la_tus"><orth extent="full" lang="la">gĕnĭcŭlātus</orth>, <itype>a, um</itype>, <pos>adj.</pos> <etym>geniculum</etym>. <sense id="n19442.0" n="I" level="1"> <hi rend="ital">With bended knee.—Subst.</hi>: <orth extent="full" lang="la">Gĕnĭcŭ-lātus</orth>, <itype>i</itype>, <gen>m.</gen>, <hi rend="ital">The Kneeler</hi>, a constellation, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1056,001:9:6" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Vitr.</author> 9, 6 <hi rend="ital">med.</hi></bibl>—</sense><sense id="n19442.1" n="B" level="2"> <usg type="style">Transf.</usg>, in gen., <hi rend="ital">bended</hi>, <hi rend="ital">curved</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">meatus Tibridis,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Amm.</author> 18, 9</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n19442.2" n="II" level="1"> <hi rend="ital">Having knots</hi>, <hi rend="ital">knotted</hi>, <hi rend="ital">jointed</hi>, <hi rend="ital">geniculated</hi> (class.): <cit><quote lang="la">culmus,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> de Sen. 15, 51</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">harundo,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:16:158" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 16, 36, 64, § 158</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">herba totidem nodis,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:24:150" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> 24, 16, 93, § 150</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">nodi scaporum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:17:152" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> 17, 21, 35, § 152</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">cursu scandentes vites,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:14:10" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> 14, 1, 3, § 10</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
geniculo: <entryFree id="n19443" type="main" key="ge^ni^cu^lo"><orth extent="full" lang="la">gĕnĭcŭlo</orth>, <itype>āvi, 1</itype>, <pos>v. n.</pos> <etym>genu</etym>, <sense id="n19443.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">to bend the knee</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">alicui,</quote> <trans><tr>before one</tr>,</trans> <bibl default="NO"><author>Charis.</author> 260</bibl></cit> P.; <bibl default="NO"><author>Diom.</author> 294</bibl> P.</sense></entryFree>
geniculosus: <entryFree id="n19444" type="main" key="ge^ni^cu^lo_sus"><orth extent="full" lang="la">gĕnĭcŭlōsus</orth>, <itype>a, um</itype>, <pos>adj.</pos> <etym>geniculum</etym>, <sense id="n19444.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">knotty</hi> (late Lat. for the class. geniculatus): <cit><quote lang="la">virgulta,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>App.</author> Herb. 77</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
geniculum: <entryFree id="n19445" type="main" key="ge^ni^cu^lum"><orth extent="full" lang="la">gĕnĭcŭlum</orth>, <itype>i</itype>, <gen>n.</gen> <lbl>dim.</lbl> <etym>genu</etym>, <sense id="n19445.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a little knee</hi>, <hi rend="ital">a knee.</hi> </sense><sense id="n19445.1" n="I" level="1"> <usg type="style">Lit.</usg> (ante- and postclass.): <cit><quote lang="la">pueris in geniculis alligare serperastra,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0684,001:L. L. 9:section=11" default="NO"><author>Varr.</author> L. L. 9, § 11</bibl></cit> Müll.: <cit><quote lang="la">de geniculis adorare,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Tert.</author> Cor. Mil. 3</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">dissolutio geniculorum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:tlg,0527,042:2:10" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Vulg.</author> Nah. 2, 10</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n19445.2" n="II" level="1"> <usg type="style">Transf.</usg>, <hi rend="ital">a knot</hi> or <hi rend="ital">joint</hi> on the stalk of a plant, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:26:117" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 26, 11, 71, § 117</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:18:56" default="NO" valid="yes">18, 7, 10, § 56</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
geniculus: <entryFree id="n19446" type="main" key="ge^ni^cu^lus"><orth extent="full" lang="la">gĕnĭcŭlus</orth>, <itype>i</itype>, <gen>m.</gen> <lbl>dim.</lbl> <etym>genu, a little knee, transf.</etym>, in arch., <sense id="n19446.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">an angular bend where two pipes are joined together</hi>, <hi rend="ital">a knee</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1056,001:8:7" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Vitr.</author> 8, 7</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
genimen: <entryFree id="n19447" type="main" key="ge^ni^men"><orth extent="full" lang="la">gĕnĭmen</orth>, <itype>ĭnis</itype>, <gen>n.</gen> <etym>geno, gigno</etym>, <sense id="n19447.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">product</hi>, <hi rend="ital">fruit</hi>, <hi rend="ital">progeny</hi> (post-class.): <cit><quote lang="la">vitis,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:tlg,0031,001:26:29" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Vulg.</author> Matt. 26, 29</bibl></cit>.—In <number>plur.</number>: <cit><quote lang="la">viperarum,</quote> <trans><tr>brood of vipers</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:tlg,0031,003:3:7" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Vulg.</author> Luc. 3, 7</bibl></cit>; <bibl default="NO"><author>Tert.</author> Anim. 39</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
genista: <entryFree id="n19448" type="main" key="ge^nista"><orth extent="full" lang="la">gĕnista</orth>, v. genesta.</entryFree>
genita: <entryFree id="n19449" type="main" key="Ge^ni^ta"><orth extent="full" lang="la">Gĕnĭta Mana</orth>, v. Mana.</entryFree>
genitabilis: <entryFree id="n19450" type="main" key="ge^ni^ta_bi^lis"><orth extent="full" lang="la">gĕnĭtābĭlis</orth>, <itype>e</itype>, <pos>adj.</pos> <etym>geno, gigno</etym>, <sense id="n19450.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">of</hi> or <hi rend="ital">belonging to generation</hi> or <hi rend="ital">birth</hi>, <hi rend="ital">productive</hi>, <hi rend="ital">fruitful</hi>, <hi rend="ital">generative</hi> (ante- and postclass.): tempus, Lucil. ap. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0684,001:L. L. 5:section=17" default="NO"><author>Varr.</author> L. L. 5, § 17</bibl> Müll. <hi rend="ital">N. cr.</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">aura Favoni,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0550,001:1:11" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Lucr.</author> 1, 11</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">partes,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Arn.</author> 4, 146</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
genitalis: <entryFree id="n19451" type="main" key="ge^ni^ta_lis"><orth extent="full" lang="la">gĕnĭtālis</orth>, <itype>e</itype>, <pos>adj.</pos> <etym>id.</etym>, <sense id="n19451.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">of</hi> or <hi rend="ital">belonging to generation</hi> or <hi rend="ital">birth</hi>, <hi rend="ital">causing generation</hi> or <hi rend="ital">birth</hi>, <hi rend="ital">fruitful</hi>, <hi rend="ital">generative</hi>, <hi rend="ital">genital</hi> (<usg type="style">poet.</usg> and in post-Aug. prose; cf.: genialis, genetivus). </sense><sense id="n19451.1" n="I" level="1"> <hi rend="ital">Adj.</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">genitalia materiaï Corpora,</quote> <trans><tr>generative principles</tr>, <tr>elements</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0550,001:2:62" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Lucr.</author> 2, 62</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">corpora quatuor,</quote> <trans><tr>the four elements</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,006:15:239" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ov.</author> M. 15, 239</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">semina,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0550,001:5:851" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Lucr.</author> 5, 851</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,002:2:324" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> G. 2, 324</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">partes (corporis),</quote> <trans><tr>genital parts</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0550,001:4:1044" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Lucr.</author> 4, 1044</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0845,001:6:26:2" default="NO"><author>Col.</author> 6, 26, 2</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">membra,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,001:2:3:3" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ov.</author> Am. 2, 3, 3</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">loca,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0845,001:6:36:2" default="NO"><author>Col.</author> 6, 36, 2</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">arvum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,002:3:136" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> G. 3, 136</bibl></cit>; cf. <cit><quote lang="la">vulvae,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0845,001:7:9:5" default="NO"><author>Col.</author> 7, 9, 5</bibl></cit>; <cit><quote lang="la">so of plants: membra,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0845,001:3:10:12" default="NO"><author>id.</author> 3, 10, 12</bibl></cit>: locus, id. § 14; cf. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0845,001:3:6:1" default="NO"><author>id.</author> 3, 6, 1</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">profluvium,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:20:143" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 20, 13, 51, § 143</bibl></cit>; cf. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:7:61" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> 7, 14, 12, § 61</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">foedera,</quote> <trans><tr>matrimony</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1020,001:3:300" default="NO"><author>Stat.</author> Th. 3, 300</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">menses,</quote> <trans><tr>the months of pregnancy in which the child may be born</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1254,001:3:16:4" default="NO"><author>Gell.</author> 3, 16, 4</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">ros,</quote> <trans><tr>fertilizing</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:2:38" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 2, 8, 6, § 38</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">hora anni,</quote> <trans>i. e. <tr>in the spring</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:9:107" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> 9, 35, 54, § 107</bibl></cit>: dies, <hi rend="ital">birth-day</hi> (usually dies natalis), <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1351,005:16:14" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Tac.</author> A. 16, 14</bibl>; also, <cit><quote lang="la">lux,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1020,002:2:3:62" default="NO"><author>Stat.</author> S. 2, 3, 62</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">solum,</quote> <trans><tr>birth-place</tr>, <tr>natal soil</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1044,001:2:15:1" default="NO"><author>Vell.</author> 2, 15, 1</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">sedes,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Prud.</author> Cath. 10 <hi rend="ital">fin.</hi></bibl></cit> terra, <bibl default="NO"><author>Amm.</author> 27, 5 <hi rend="ital">fin.</hi></bibl>: dii, <hi rend="ital">the gods that produce everything</hi>: Romulus in caelo cum dis genitalibus aevum Degit, Enn. ap. <bibl default="NO"><author>Serv.</author> ad Verg. A. 6, 764</bibl> (Ann. v. 119 Vahl.); imitated by <bibl default="NO"><author>Aus.</author> Per. Iliad. 4</bibl>; Num. ap. Eckh. D. N. V. 7, p. 139: sterilitas, <hi rend="ital">barrenness</hi>, Trebat. ap. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1254,001:4:2:9" default="NO"><author>Gell.</author> 4, 2, 9</bibl>.—</sense><sense id="n19451.2" n="II" level="1"> <pos>Subst.</pos> </sense><sense id="n19451.3" n="A" level="2"> <orth extent="full" lang="la">Gĕnĭtālis</orth>, <itype>is</itype>, <gen>f.</gen>, <hi rend="ital">a surname of Diana</hi>, <hi rend="ital">as presiding over births</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">sive tu (Diana) Lucina probas vocari Seu Genitalis,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0893,002:16" default="NO"><author>Hor.</author> C. S. 16</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n19451.4" n="B" level="2"> <orth extent="full" lang="la">gĕ-nĭtāle</orth>, <itype>is</itype>, <gen>n.</gen> (sc. membrum; <cit><quote lang="la">v. above, I.),</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0836,001:4:1" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cels.</author> 4, 1</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:28:93" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 28, 8, 27, § 93</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:37:157" default="NO" valid="yes">37, 10, 57, § 157</bibl>; <bibl default="NO"><author>Arn.</author> 5, 18</bibl> et saep.; in <number>plur.</number>, <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> 11, 49, 110, § 263</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:1:6:36" default="NO"><author>Quint.</author> 1, 6, 36</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1276,001:6:514" default="NO"><author>Juv.</author> 6, 514</bibl>. —Hence, <pos>adv.</pos>: <orth extent="full" lang="la">gĕnĭtālĭter</orth>, <hi rend="ital">in a fertilizing manner</hi>, <hi rend="ital">fruitfully</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0550,001:4:1258" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Lucr.</author> 4, 1258</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
genitaliter: <entryFree id="n19452" type="main" key="ge^ni^ta_li^ter"><orth extent="full" lang="la">gĕnĭtālĭter</orth>, <pos>adv.</pos>, v. genitalis <sense id="n19452.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">fin.</hi></sense></entryFree>
genitor: <entryFree id="n19453" type="main" key="ge^ni^tor"><orth extent="full" lang="la">gĕnĭtor</orth>, <itype>ōris</itype>, <gen>m.</gen> <etym>root GEN, gigno</etym>, <sense id="n19453.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a begetter</hi>, <hi rend="ital">parent</hi>, <hi rend="ital">father</hi>, <hi rend="ital">creator</hi>, <hi rend="ital">sire</hi> (syn.: pater, parens). </sense><sense id="n19453.1" n="I" level="1"> <usg type="style">Lit.</usg> (class.): <cit><quote lang="la">quo (animo) nihil ab optimo et praestantissimo genitore melius procreatum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,072:chapter=8" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Univ. 8</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">imitantes genitorem et effectorem sui,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 13</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">dubio genitore creatus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,006:5:145" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ov.</author> M. 5, 145</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">Pelopis,</quote> <trans>i. e. <tr>Tantalus</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0893,001:1:28:7" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Hor.</author> C. 1, 28, 7</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">deūm,</quote> <trans>i. e. <tr>Jupiter</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,001:1:13:45" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ov.</author> Am. 1, 13, 45</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,006:14:91" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> M. 14, 91</bibl>; the same, Saturnius, Cic. poët. Div. 2, 30, 64: profundi, of <hi rend="ital">Neptune</hi>, as ruler of the sea, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,006:11:202" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ov.</author> M. 11, 202</bibl>; <cit><quote lang="la">and genitor alone,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,003:1:155" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> A. 1, 155</bibl></cit>; of <hi rend="ital">Æneas</hi>, <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 1, 716</bibl>; of <cb n="GENI" /> <hi rend="ital">Mars</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">bellorum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1345,001:3:126" default="NO"><author>Sil.</author> 3, 126</bibl></cit>; of the deified <hi rend="ital">Romulus</hi>: o Romule, Romule die! O pater, o genitor, Enn. ap. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,043:1:41:64" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Rep. 1, 41, 64</bibl> (Ann. v. 117 Vahl.); so, <cit><quote lang="la">genitorque Quirine Urbis,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,006:15:862" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ov.</author> M. 15, 862</bibl></cit> (cf.: <cit><quote lang="la">hujus urbis parens Romulus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,053:1:2:3" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Div. 1, 2, 3</bibl></cit>).—</sense><sense id="n19453.2" n="II" level="1"> <usg type="style">Transf.</usg> (<usg type="style">poet.</usg> and in post-Aug. prose): <cit><quote lang="la">qua rapitur praeceps Rhodanus genitore Lemanno,</quote> <trans><tr>source</tr>,</trans> <bibl default="NO"><author>Aus.</author> Urb. 13, 7</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">adsciscet nova, quae genitor produxerit usus,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Hor.</author> Ep. 2, 2, 119</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">o fraudum genitor,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1345,001:13:738" default="NO"><author>Sil.</author> 13, 738</bibl></cit>; cf.: <cit><quote lang="la">Graeci vitiorum omnium genitores,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:15:19" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 15, 4, 5, § 19</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
genitrix: <entryFree id="n19454" type="main" key="ge^ni^trix"><orth extent="full" lang="la">gĕnĭtrix</orth>, <itype>īcis</itype>, v. genetrix.</entryFree>
genitura: <entryFree id="n19455" type="main" key="ge^ni^tu_ra"><orth extent="full" lang="la">gĕnĭtūra</orth>, <itype>ae</itype>, <gen>f.</gen> <etym>root GEN, gigno</etym>, <sense id="n19455.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a begetting</hi>, <hi rend="ital">bearing</hi>, <hi rend="ital">birth</hi>, <hi rend="ital">generation</hi> (postAug.). </sense><sense id="n19455.1" n="I" level="1"> <usg type="style">Lit.</usg>: <cit><quote lang="la">in alitum quadrupedumque genitura esse quosdam ad conceptum impetus et terrae,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:18:202" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 18, 24, 56, § 202</bibl></cit>; cf.: <cit><quote lang="la">origo atque genitura conchae,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:9:107" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> 9, 35, 54, § 107</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n19455.2" n="II" level="1"> <usg type="style">Transf.</usg> </sense><sense id="n19455.3" n="A" level="2"> <hi rend="ital">Seed of generation</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">profluvia geniturae (virorum),</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:22:83" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 22, 22, 40, § 83</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n19455.4" n="B" level="2"> <hi rend="ital">That which is generated</hi> or <hi rend="ital">created</hi>, <hi rend="ital">a creature</hi> (eccl. Lat.): <cit><quote lang="la">spirantes (i. e. serpentes),</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Arn.</author> 1, 8</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">incredula,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Tert.</author> adv. Marc. 4, 23</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n19455.5" n="C" level="2"> In astrology, <hi rend="ital">one's natal star</hi> or <hi rend="ital">constellation</hi>, <hi rend="ital">nativity</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">reticere ipse genituram suam perseverabat,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1348,001:life=aug.:94" default="NO"><author>Suet.</author> Aug. 94</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1348,001:life=cal.:57" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Calig. 57</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1348,001:life=nero:6" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Ner. 6</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1348,001:life=vit.:3" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Vit. 3</bibl>; <bibl default="NO"><author>Eutr.</author> 7, 20</bibl>; <bibl default="NO"><author>Amm.</author> 29, 1 al.</bibl></sense></entryFree>
genitus: <entryFree id="n19456" type="main" key="ge^ni^tus1" n="1"><orth extent="full" lang="la">gĕnĭtus</orth>, <itype>a, um</itype>, <mood>Part.</mood>, from gigno.</entryFree>
