<entryFree id="n19457" type="main" key="ge^ni^tus2" n="2"><orth extent="full" lang="la">gĕnĭtus</orth>, <itype>ūs</itype>, <gen>m.</gen> <etym>gigno</etym>, <sense id="n19457.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a begetting</hi>, <hi rend="ital">bearing</hi>, <hi rend="ital">generation</hi> (post-class. and very rare): <cit><quote lang="la">libri de animalium genitu,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>App.</author> Mag. p. 297 sq.</bibl></cit></sense></entryFree>
genius: <entryFree id="n19458" type="main" key="ge^ni^us"><orth extent="full" lang="la">gĕnĭus</orth>, <itype>i</itype> (<case>voc.</case> geni, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0660,001:4:5:9" default="NO"><author>Tib.</author> 4, 5, 9</bibl> M. dub.), <gen>m.</gen> <etym>root GEN, gigno; prop., the superior or divine nature which is innate in everything, the spiritual part, spirit; hence</etym>, <sense id="n19458.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">the tutelar deity</hi> or <hi rend="ital">genius</hi> of a person, place, etc. (cf.: lares, penates). </sense><sense id="n19458.1" n="I" level="1"> In gen.: <cit><quote lang="la">genium dicebant antiqui naturalem deum uniuscujusque loci vel rei aut hominis,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Serv.</author> Verg. G. 1, 302</bibl></cit>; cf. Voss ad loc.; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,003:5:95" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> A. 5, 95</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1276,001:6:22" default="NO"><author>Juv.</author> 6, 22</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:21:62:9" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 21, 62, 9</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1294,001:7:12:10" default="NO"><author>Mart.</author> 7, 12, 10</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">eundem esse genium et larem, multi veteres memoriae prodiderunt, in queis etiam Granius Flaccus,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Censor.</author> de Die Nat. 3, 2</bibl></cit>; <bibl default="NO"><author>Prud.</author> adv. Symm. 2, 369</bibl>; <bibl default="NO">444</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">scit Genius, natale comes qui temperat astrum, Naturae deus humanae, mortalis in unum Quodque caput, vultu mutabilis, albus et ater,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Hor.</author> Ep. 2, 2, 187</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">genius tuus malus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1242,001:4:7:8" default="NO"><author>Flor.</author> 4, 7, 8</bibl></cit>. —In urgent petitions and in oaths appeals were made to the Genius of the person addressed, or to that of some eminent person: <cit><quote lang="la">te per Genium ... Obsecro et obtestor,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Hor.</author> Ep. 1, 7, 94</bibl></cit>; cf. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1014,001:Ep. 12:12" default="NO"><author>Sen.</author> Ep. 12, 12</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0660,001:4:5:8" default="NO"><author>Tib.</author> 4, 5, 8</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1348,001:life=cal.:27" default="NO"><author>Suet.</author> Calig. 27</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,2806,001:12:2:13:section=6" default="NO"><author>Dig.</author> 12, 2, 13, § 6</bibl>.— <cit><quote lang="la">On festal occasions the Genius was propitiated: cras Genium mero Curabis et porco bimestri,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0893,001:3:17:14" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Hor.</author> C. 3, 17, 14</bibl></cit>; <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> Ep. 2, 1, 144</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0893,006:210" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> A. P. 210</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0969,001:2:3" default="NO"><author>Pers.</author> 2, 3</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,001:1:8:94" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ov.</author> Am. 1, 8, 94</bibl> et saep.; cf. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0660,001:1:7:49" default="NO"><author>Tib.</author> 1, 7, 49</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">magne Geni, cape dona libens votisque faveto,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0660,001:4:5:9" default="NO"><author>id.</author> 4, 5, 9</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">acceptus Geniis December (because the Saturnalian festivals occurred in it),</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,007:3:58" default="NO"><author>Ov.</author> F. 3, 58</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">genium loci ... precatur,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,003:7:136" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> A. 7, 136</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">GENIO LOCI,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Inscr. Orell.</author> 343 sq.</bibl></cit>; <bibl default="NO">1697</bibl>; <bibl default="NO">1701</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">COLONIAE,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>ib.</author> 367</bibl></cit>; <bibl default="NO">1693</bibl> sq.: <cit><quote lang="la">MVNICIPII,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>ib.</author> 689</bibl></cit>; <bibl default="NO">1690</bibl> sq.: <cit><quote lang="la">CVRIAE,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>ib.</author> 1120</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">FORI VINARII,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>ib.</author> 4087</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">THEATRI,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>ib.</author> 1713</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">Lateranus deus est focorum et Genius,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Arn.</author> 4, 6</bibl></cit> et saep.: <cit><quote lang="la">Priapi,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Petr.</author> 21</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">Famae,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1294,001:7:12:10" default="NO"><author>Mart.</author> 7, 12, 10</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">JOVIS,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Inscr. Orell.</author> 1730</bibl></cit>; <bibl default="NO">2488</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">DEORVM,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>ib.</author> 1730</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n19458.2" n="II" level="1"> In partic. </sense><sense id="n19458.3" n="A" level="2"> With respect to the enjoyment of life. </sense><sense id="n19458.4" n="1" level="3"> <hi rend="ital">The spirit of social enjoyment</hi>, <hi rend="ital">fondness for good living</hi>, <hi rend="ital">taste</hi>, <hi rend="ital">appetite</hi>, <hi rend="ital">inclination</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">isti qui cum geniis suis belligerant, parcipromi,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,020:1:2:81" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Truc. 1, 2, 81</bibl></cit>; cf.: <cit><quote lang="la">egomet me defraudavi Animumque meum geniumque meum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,003:4:9:15" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Aul. 4, 9, 15</bibl></cit>; and: <cit><quote lang="la">suum defrudans genium,</quote> <trans><tr>sacrificing his inclinations</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0134,004:1:1:10" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ter.</author> Phorm. 1, 1, 10</bibl></cit> Ruhnk.: <cit><quote lang="la">sapis multum ad genium,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,014:1:3:28" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Pers. 1, 3, 28</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">hic quidem meliorem Genium tuum non facies,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,018:4:2:42" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Stich. 4, 2, 42</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">nunc et amico meo prosperabo et genio meo multa bona faciam,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,014:2:3:11" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Pers. 2, 3, 11</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">indulge genio: carpamus dulcia,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 5, 151</bibl></cit>.—Hence, </sense><sense id="n19458.5" n="2" level="3"> A term used by parasites for <hi rend="ital">entertainer</hi>, <hi rend="ital">patron</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">ecquis est, qui mihi commonstret Phaedromum genium meum?</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,008:2:3:22" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Curc. 2, 3, 22</bibl></cit>; <bibl default="NO">5, 2, 29</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,005:4:2:99" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Capt. 4, 2, 99</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,010:1:2:29" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Men. 1, 2, 29</bibl>. —</sense><sense id="n19458.6" n="B" level="2"> Of the intellect, <hi rend="ital">wit</hi>, <hi rend="ital">talents</hi>, <hi rend="ital">genius</hi> (very rare): <cit><quote lang="la">nemo mathematicus genium indemnatus habebit,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1276,001:6:562" default="NO"><author>Juv.</author> 6, 562</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">victurus genium debet habere liber,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1294,001:6:60:10" default="NO"><author>Mart.</author> 6, 60, 10</bibl></cit>. <cb n="GENS" /> —Hence, in a pun with the preced. signif., <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1294,001:7:78:7" default="NO"><author>Mart.</author> 7, 78, 7</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
geno: <entryFree id="n19459" type="main" key="ge^no"><orth extent="full" lang="la">gĕno</orth>, <itype>ĕre, old form of gigno</itype>, q. v.</entryFree>
genosus: <entryFree id="n19460" type="main" key="Ge^no^sus"><orth extent="full" lang="la">Gĕnŏsus</orth>, v. Genusus.</entryFree>
gens: <entryFree id="n19461" type="main" key="gens"><orth extent="full" lang="la">gens</orth>, <itype>gentis</itype>, <gen>f.</gen> <etym>root GEN, gigno, that which belongs together by birth or descent</etym>, <sense id="n19461.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a race</hi> or <hi rend="ital">clan</hi>, <hi rend="ital">embracing several families united together by a common name and by certain religious rites;</hi> orig. only patrician, but, after the granting of the connubium between patricians and plebeians, also plebeian (syn.: familia, stirps, genus; natio, populus). </sense><sense id="n19461.1" n="I" level="1"> <usg type="style">Lit.</usg>: <cit><quote lang="la">Sulla gentis patriciae (sc. Corneliae) nobilis fuit, familia prope jam exstincta majorum ignaviā,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0631,001:J. 95:3" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Sall.</author> J. 95, 3</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">vera decora, non communiter modo Corneliae gentis, sed proprie familiae suae,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:38:58:3" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 38, 58, 3</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">L. Tarquitius patriciae gentis,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:3:27:1" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> 3, 27, 1</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">apud P. Sestium patriciae gentis virum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:3:33:9" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> 3, 33, 9</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:6:11:2" default="NO" valid="yes">6, 11, 2</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">cum Marcelli ab liberti filio stirpe, Claudii patricii ejusdem hominis hereditatem, gente ad se rediisse dicerent,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,037:1:39:176" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> de Or. 1, 39, 176</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">gens Tarquiniorum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,043:2:25" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Rep. 2, 25 <hi rend="ital">fin.</hi></bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">Julia,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:1:3:2" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 1, 3, 2</bibl></cit>: L. Tarquinius duplicavit illum pristinum patrum numerum, et antiquos patres majorum gentium appellavit, quos priores sententiam rogabat; <cit><quote lang="la">a se ascitos minorum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,043:2:20" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Rep. 2, 20</bibl></cit> Mos.; cf. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:1:35:6" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 1, 35, 6</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">ex gente Domitia duae familiae claruerunt, Calvinorum et Aenobarborum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1348,001:life=nero:1" default="NO"><author>Suet.</author> Ner. 1</bibl></cit>; cf. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:2:29:4" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 2, 29, 4</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">patricii minorum gentium,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,056:9:21:2" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Fam. 9, 21, 2</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:1:47:7" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 1, 47, 7</bibl>; Capitol. ap. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1254,001:10:20:5" default="NO"><author>Gell.</author> 10, 20, 5</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">anni principio de connubio patrum et plebis C. Canuleius tribunus plebis rogationem promulgavit, qua contaminari sanguinem suum patres confundique jura gentium rebantur,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:4:1:1" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 4, 1, 1</bibl></cit>; cf. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:4:2:5" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> 4, 2, 5</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:10:8:9" default="NO" valid="yes">10, 8, 9</bibl>: uti Feceniae Hispalae gentis enuptio, tutoris optio esset, etc., <hi rend="ital">the right of marrying out of her</hi> gens, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:39:19:5" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> 39, 19, 5</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">perjurus, sine gente,</quote> <trans>i. e. <tr>of no family</tr>, <tr>of vulgar birth</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0893,004:2:5:15" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Hor.</author> S. 2, 5, 15</bibl></cit>; cf. respecting the Roman gens, Dict. of Antiq.</sense><sense id="n19461.2" n="II" level="1"> <usg type="style">Transf.</usg> </sense><sense id="n19461.3" n="A" level="2"> In a manner borrowed from the division of the senators into majorum and minorum gentium (v. above): ipsi illi majorum gentium dii qui habentur, hinc a nobis profecti in caelum reperientur, <hi rend="ital">the superior deities</hi> (the consentes), <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,049:1:13:29" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Tusc. 1, 13, 29</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">Cleanthes, qui quasi majorum est gentium Stoicus,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> Ac. 2, 41, 126</bibl></cit>.— </sense><sense id="n19461.4" n="B" level="2"> <usg type="style">Poet.</usg>, like genus and stirps, of <hi rend="ital">a single descendant</hi>, <hi rend="ital">offspring</hi> of an entire race: <cit><quote lang="la">vigilasne, deūm gens, Aenea?</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,003:10:228" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> A. 10, 228</bibl></cit> (for which: <cit><quote lang="la">Dis genite,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 9, 642</bibl></cit>): <cit><quote lang="la">Tirynthia gens est (i. e. Fabius),</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1345,001:7:35" default="NO"><author>Sil.</author> 7, 35</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">extrema viri,</quote> <trans><tr>the last descendant</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1345,001:2:185" default="NO"><author>id.</author> 2, 185</bibl></cit>.—* </sense><sense id="n19461.5" n="C" level="2"> In a contemptuous sense, like our <hi rend="ital">tribe</hi>, <hi rend="ital">brood</hi>, <hi rend="ital">crew</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">si illo die gens ista Clodiana, quod facere voluit, effecisset,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,022:38:81" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Sest. 38, 81</bibl></cit>; so, <cit><quote lang="la">Clodia,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,058:2:13:1" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Q. Fr. 2, 13, 1</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n19461.6" n="D" level="2"> In the widest sense = genus, <hi rend="ital">the race;</hi> gens humana, <hi rend="ital">the human race</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,048:5:23:65" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Fin. 5, 23, 65</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0893,001:1:3:26" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Hor.</author> C. 1, 3, 26</bibl>.—</sense><sense id="n19461.7" n="E" level="2"> Of beasts, etc., <hi rend="ital">a race</hi>, <hi rend="ital">herd</hi>, <hi rend="ital">brood</hi>, <hi rend="ital">swarm</hi> (<usg type="style">poet.</usg> and in post-Aug. prose): <cit><quote lang="la">intestino bello totae gentes consumuntur,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0845,001:9:9:6" default="NO"><author>Col.</author> 9, 9, 6</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">quos (equos) in spem statues summittere gentis,</quote> <trans><tr>of the race</tr>, <tr>breed</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,002:3:73" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> G. 3, 73</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">utque luat poenas gens haec (i. e. vulpes),</quote> <trans><tr>breed</tr>, <tr>race</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,007:4:711" default="NO"><author>Ov.</author> F. 4, 711</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n19461.8" n="F" level="1"> In a more extended sense (as also <foreign lang="greek">ge/nos</foreign>), <hi rend="ital">a race</hi>, <hi rend="ital">nation</hi>, <hi rend="ital">people</hi> (sometimes more restricted than natio and populus, and sometimes put for them; <xr><lbl>v.</lbl> <ref type="sym" targOrder="U">in the foll.</ref></xr>, and cf. Drak. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:23:42:1" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 23, 42, 1</bibl>; <cit><quote lang="la">freq. and class.): Qui gentis omnis mariaque et terras movet,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,017:prol. 1" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Rud. prol. 1</bibl></cit>: cf.: <cit><quote lang="la">nos per gentis disparat,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib.</bibl></cit> v. 10: <cit><quote lang="la">gradus plures sunt societatis hominum. Ut enim ab illa infinita discedatur, propior est ejusdem gentis, nationis, linguae, qua maxime homines conjunguntur: interius etiam est ejusdem esse civitatis,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,055:1:17:53" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Off. 1, 17, 53</bibl></cit>; cf.: <cit><quote lang="la">(Deus) non curat singulos homines ... ne civitates quidem ... ne nationes quidem et gentes,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,050:3:39:93" default="NO"><author>id.</author> N. D. 3, 39, 93</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">ita nationis nomen, non gentis evaluisse paulatim,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1351,002:2" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Tac.</author> G. 2</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">Suebi, quorum non una gens...propriis adhuc nationibus nominibusque discreti,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 38</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">atrox in Thracia bellum ortum, omnibus ejus gentis nationibus in arma accensis,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1044,001:2:98" default="NO"><author>Vell.</author> 2, 98</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">omnes exterae gentes ac nationes,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> de Imp. Pomp. 11, 31</bibl></cit>; cf.: <cit><quote lang="la">per omnes gentes nationesque,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:11:3:87" default="NO"><author>Quint.</author> 11, 3, 87</bibl></cit>; <cit><quote lang="la">for which, in an inverted order: exterae nationes ac gentes,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,007:11:25" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Font. 11, 25</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">aut gentes aut populos,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:11:1:86" default="NO"><author>Quint.</author> 11, 1, 86</bibl></cit>: inter multas regum gentiumque <pb n="809" /> <cb n="GENT" /> et populorum legationes, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:45:19:1" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 45, 19, 1</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:45:22:8" default="NO" valid="yes">45, 22, 8</bibl>; cf. <cit><quote lang="la">in an inverse order: populi et gentes,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:12:2:3" default="NO"><author>Quint.</author> 12, 2, 3</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">postquam bello subegit Aequorum magnam gentem et ferocem,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,043:2:20" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Rep. 2, 20</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">Sabina aut Volsca,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 3, 4</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">Transalpinae,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 3, 9</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">Allobrogum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,013:4:6:12" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Cat. 4, 6, 12</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">Nerviorum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0448,001:2:28:1" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Caes.</author> B. G. 2, 28, 1</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">Germanorum,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 6, 32</bibl></cit> <hi rend="ital">init.</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">Suevorum longe maxima Germanorum omnium,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 4, 1, 3</bibl></cit>; <cit><quote lang="la">so of the Etruscan nation,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:5:1:6" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 5, 1, 6</bibl></cit>; <cit><quote lang="la">and in a wider sense than populus: non ex iisdem semper populis exercitus scriptos, quamquam eadem semper gens bellum intulerit,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:6:12:4" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> 6, 12, 4</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:40:15:6" default="NO" valid="yes">40, 15, 6</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:2:50:2" default="NO" valid="yes">2, 50, 2</bibl>.—Also for civitas, <hi rend="ital">the inhabitants of a city</hi> or <hi rend="ital">town</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">Caesar Gomphos pervenit, quod est oppidum primum Thessaliae venientibus ab Epiro, quae gens ultro ad Caesarem legatos miserat,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0448,002:3:80:1" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Caes.</author> B. C. 3, 80, 1</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">atqui ad hoc, de quo agitur, non quaerimus gentem, ingenia quaerimus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,043:1:37" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Rep. 1, 37 <hi rend="ital">fin.</hi></bibl></cit>; cf.: <cit><quote lang="la">gladio pugnacissima gens Romani,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:9:3:8" default="NO"><author>Quint.</author> 9, 3, 8</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:5:48:3" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 5, 48, 3</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">Segni Condrusique, ex gente et numero Germanorum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0448,001:6:32:1" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Caes.</author> B. G. 6, 32, 1</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">in illa incorrupta maxime gente Aegyptiorum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,043:3:9:14" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Rep. 3, 9, 14</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">nos plurimis ignotissimi gentibus,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 1, 17, 26</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">jus gentium,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 1, 2, 2</bibl></cit>; cf.: <cit><quote lang="la">quod naturalis ratio inter omnes homines constituit, id ... vocatur jus gentium quasi quo jure omnes gentes utuntur,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1251,001:Inst. 1:1" default="NO"><author>Gai.</author> Inst. 1, 1</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n19461.9" n="2" level="3"> In partic. </sense><sense id="n19461.10" n="a" level="4"> As a <hi rend="ital">partit. gen.</hi>, gentium, like terrarum, for the sake of emphasis, <hi rend="ital">in the world</hi>, <hi rend="ital">on earth</hi> (freq. and class.): <cit><quote lang="la">ubicumque terrarum et gentium violatum jus civium Romanorum sit,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,005:5:55:section=143" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Verr. 2, 5, 55, § 143</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">quod ubique gentium est,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,043:2:4" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Rep. 2, 4</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">ubinam gentium sumus,</quote> <trans><tr>where in the world?</tr></trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,013:1:4:9" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Cat. 1, 4, 9</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">ubi ubi est gentium?</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,002:2:2:21" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> As. 2, 2, 21</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">obsecro, unde haec gentium?</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,007:4:1:16" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Cist. 4, 1, 16</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">ubi tu's gentium,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,017:2:5:11" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Rud. 2, 5, 11</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">quaerit quod nusquamst gentium,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,016:1:4:9" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Ps. 1, 4, 9</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">non hercle quo hinc nunc gentium aufugiam scio,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,017:3:5:44" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Rud. 3, 5, 44</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">ubivis gentium agere aetatem quam, etc.,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0134,005:3:1:4" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ter.</author> Hec. 3, 1, 4</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">an quisquam usquam gentium est aeque miser?</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 13</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">equidem te nisi nunc hodie nusquam vidi gentium,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,001:2:2:54" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Am. 2, 2, 54</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">fratrem nusquam invenio gentium,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0134,006:4:2:1" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ter.</author> Ad. 4, 2, 1</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">abeat multo malo quovis gentium, Quam hic, etc.,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0134,002:5:1:55" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Heaut. 5, 1, 55</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">res est in manibus: tu autem abes longe gentium,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,057:6:3:1" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Att. 6, 3, 1</bibl></cit>: nostri <foreign lang="greek">turannokto/noi</foreign> longe gentium absunt, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,056:12:22:2" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Fam. 12, 22, 2</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">ah! minime gentium, non faciam,</quote> <trans><tr>by no means</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0134,006:3:2:44" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ter.</author> Ad. 3, 2, 44</bibl></cit>; so, <cit><quote lang="la">minime gentium,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0134,003:4:1:11" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Eun. 4, 1, 11</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0134,004:5:8:44" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Phorm. 5, 8, 44</bibl>.—</sense><sense id="n19461.11" n="b" level="4"> Gentes, opp. to the Romans, <hi rend="ital">foreign nations</hi>, <hi rend="ital">foreigners</hi> (post-Aug. and rare): <cit><quote lang="la">maneat, quaeso, duretque gentibus si non amor nostri at certe odium sui,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1351,002:33" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Tac.</author> G. 33</bibl></cit>; Auct. B. Hisp. 17 <hi rend="ital">fin.</hi>—</sense><sense id="n19461.12" n="c" level="4"> In the eccl. fathers, gentes, like <foreign lang="greek">e)/qnos</foreign>, opp. to Jews and Christians, <hi rend="ital">pagan nations</hi>, <hi rend="ital">heathen</hi>, <hi rend="ital">gentiles</hi>, <bibl default="NO"><author>Lact.</author> 2, 13 <hi rend="ital">fin.</hi></bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:tlg,0527,027:2:1" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Vulg.</author> Psa. 2, 1</bibl> et saep.— Hence the title of Arnobius's work, Adversus Gentes.—</sense><sense id="n19461.13" n="3" level="3"> <usg type="style">Transf.</usg>, <hi rend="ital">a region</hi>, <hi rend="ital">country</hi> (very rare): <cit><quote lang="la">ut Aspim aggrederetur, qui Cataoniam tenebat: quae gens jacet supra Ciliciam,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0588,014:4" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Nep.</author> Dat. 4</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">gentes viduatas esse suis cultoribus et desolatas,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Arn.</author> 1, 4</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
gentiana: <entryFree id="n19462" type="main" key="genti^a_na"><orth extent="full" lang="la">gentĭāna</orth>, <itype>ae</itype>, <gen>f.</gen>, <sense id="n19462.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">the herb gentian</hi> (called after an Illyrian king, Gentius), <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:25:71" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 25, 7, 34, § 71</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1011,001:Comp. 167" default="NO"><author>Scrib.</author> Comp. 167</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1011,001:170" default="NO">170</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1011,001:176" default="NO">176</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
genticus: <entryFree id="n19463" type="main" key="genti^cus"><orth extent="full" lang="la">gentĭcus</orth>, <itype>a, um</itype>, <pos>adj.</pos> <etym>gens</etym>, <sense id="n19463.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">of</hi> or <hi rend="ital">belonging to a nation</hi>, <hi rend="ital">national</hi> (post-Aug.): <cit><quote lang="la">quibus more gentico continuum ferri tegimen,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1351,005:3:43" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Tac.</author> A. 3, 43</bibl></cit>; <bibl default="NO">6, 33</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">pro gentica devotione,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Tert.</author> de Anim. 39</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
gentilicius: <entryFree id="n19464" type="main" key="genti^li_ci^us"><orth extent="full" lang="la">gentĭlīcĭus</orth> or <orth extent="full" lang="la">-tĭus</orth>, <itype>a, um</itype>, <pos>adj.</pos> <etym>gentilis</etym>. <sense id="n19464.0" n="I" level="1"> <hi rend="ital">Of</hi> or <hi rend="ital">belonging to a particular clan</hi> or gens (class.; cf. <cit><quote lang="la">gentilis): an gentilicia sacra ne in bello quidem intermitti, publica sacra et Romanos deos etiam in pace deseri placet?</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:5:52:4" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 5, 52, 4</bibl></cit>; <cit><quote lang="la">v. sacrum, under sacer: sacrificia, Auct. Or. de Harusp. Resp. 15: gentilicia (nota), opp. publica,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:6:20:14" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 6, 20, 14</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">tumulus,</quote> <trans><tr>a family sepulchre</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1044,001:2:119:5" default="NO"><author>Vell.</author> 2, 119, 5</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">hereditates,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1348,001:life=jul.:1" default="NO"><author>Suet.</author> Caes. 1</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">nomina,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1348,001:life=cl.:25" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Claud. 25</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">M. Varro tradit, in Serranorum familia gentilicium esse, feminas linea veste non uti,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:19:8" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 19, 1, 2, § 8</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1318,001:6:15:1" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> Ep. 6, 15, 1</bibl>.—</sense><sense id="n19464.1" n="II" level="1"> <hi rend="ital">Of</hi> or <hi rend="ital">belonging to a nation</hi>, <hi rend="ital">national</hi> (post-class.): <cit><quote lang="la">vulgus, quos gentilicio vocabulo Chaldaeos dicere oportet, mathematicos dicit,</quote> <trans><tr>by their national name</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1254,001:1:9:6" default="NO"><author>Gell.</author> 1, 9, 6</bibl></cit>. <cb n="GENT" /></sense></entryFree>
gentilis: <entryFree id="n19465" type="main" key="genti_lis"><orth extent="full" lang="la">gentīlis</orth>, <itype>e</itype>, <pos>adj.</pos> <etym>gens</etym>. <sense id="n19465.0" n="I" level="1"> <hi rend="ital">Of</hi> or <hi rend="ital">belonging to the same clan</hi> (gens), <hi rend="ital">stock</hi>, or <hi rend="ital">race;</hi> and <hi rend="ital">subst.</hi>: <orth extent="full" lang="la">gentīlis</orth>, <itype>is</itype>, <gen>com.</gen>, <hi rend="ital">a person belonging to the same family</hi> or gens, <hi rend="ital">a relative bearing the same name</hi> (syn.: gentilicus, genticus; cf. <cit><quote lang="la">also: cognatus, agnatus, affinis): gentiles sunt, qui inter se eodem nomine sunt, qui ab ingenuis oriundi sunt, quorum majorum nemo servitutem servivit, qui capite non sunt deminuti,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,042:6:29" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Top. 6, 29</bibl></cit>: gentilis dicitur et ex eodem genere ortus et is qui simili nomine appellatur; ut ait Cincius, gentiles mihi sunt, qui meo nomine appellantur, Paul. ex <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1236,001:page=94" default="NO"><author>Fest.</author> p. 94</bibl> Müll.: SI FVRIOSVS EST AGNATORVM GENTILIVMQVE IN EO PECVNIAQVE EIVS POTESTAS ESTO, Fragm. XII. Tab. ap. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,036:2:50:148" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Inv. 2, 50, 148</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">SI AGNATVS NEC ESCIT, GENTILIS FAMILIAM NANCITOR, id. ap. Collat. Legg. Mosaic. et Rom. 16, 4: si nullus agnatus sit, eadem lex XII. tabularum gentiles ad hereditatem vocat,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1251,001:Inst. 3:17" default="NO"><author>Gai.</author> Inst. 3, 17</bibl></cit>; cf. <bibl default="NO"><author>Ulp.</author> Fragm. 26, 1</bibl> a.: tuus gentilis (<hi rend="ital">thy kinsman</hi>), Brute, M. Pennus, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,039:28:109" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Brut. 28, 109</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">sordidatus cum gentilibus clientibusque,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:3:58:1" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 3, 58, 1</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">e duobus gentilibus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1348,001:life=tib.:1" default="NO"><author>Suet.</author> Tib. 1</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">homines deorum immortalium quasi gentiles,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,072:chapter=11" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Univ. 11</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">tuus paene gentilis,</quote> <trans><tr>thy namesake</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,005:2:77:section=190" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Verr. 2, 2, 77, § 190</bibl></cit>; cf.<cit><quote lang="la">, jestingly: fuit enim (Pherecydes) meo regnante gentili (i. e. Ser. Tullio),</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,049:1:16:38" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Tusc. 1, 16, 38</bibl></cit>.—<hi rend="ital">Adj.</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">nomen,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1348,001:life=nero:41" default="NO"><author>Suet.</author> Ner. 41</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">stemma,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 37</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">monumentum Domitiorum,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 50</bibl></cit>: copia, <hi rend="ital">out of their own</hi> gens, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1348,001:life=vit.:1" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Vit. 1</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">gentile domus nostrae bonum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1351,005:2:37" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Tac.</author> A. 2, 37</bibl></cit>; cf. <cit><quote lang="la">manus (i. e. Fabii),</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,007:2:198" default="NO"><author>Ov.</author> F. 2, 198</bibl></cit>: odia, <hi rend="ital">family enmity</hi> (of Hanno towards Hannibal), <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1345,001:2:277" default="NO"><author>Sil.</author> 2, 277</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">capillo erat pone occipitium summissiore, quod gentile in illo videbatur,</quote> <trans><tr>peculiar to the family</tr>, <tr>hereditary</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1348,001:life=tib.:68" default="NO"><author>Suet.</author> Tib. 68</bibl></cit>.—Prov. (cf. the law for the insane, supra): <cit><quote lang="la">mente est captus atque ad agnatos et gentiles est deducendus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0684,001:R. R. 1:2:8" default="NO"><author>Varr.</author> R. R. 1, 2, 8</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n19465.1" n="II" level="1"> <usg type="style">Transf.</usg> * </sense><sense id="n19465.2" n="A" level="2"> Of slaves who bore the name of their masters: <cit><quote lang="la">apud antiquos singuli Marcipores Luciporesve dominorum gentiles omnem victum in promiscuo habebant,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:33:26" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 33, 1, 6, § 26</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n19465.3" n="B" level="2"> <usg type="style">Poet.</usg>, of plants: <cit><quote lang="la">non gentilia poma,</quote> <trans>i. e. <tr>foreign</tr>, <tr>exotic</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0830,001:2:41" default="NO"><author>Calp.</author> Ecl. 2, 41</bibl></cit>.— </sense><sense id="n19465.4" n="C" level="2"> In a more extended sense (acc. to gens, II. F.), <hi rend="ital">of</hi> or <hi rend="ital">belonging to the same people</hi> or <hi rend="ital">nation</hi>, <hi rend="ital">national;</hi> and <hi rend="ital">subst.</hi>, <hi rend="ital">a fellow-countryman</hi> (post-Aug.): <cit><quote lang="la">multis et validis propinquitatibus subnixus turbare gentiles nationes promptum haberet,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1351,005:11:1" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Tac.</author> A. 11, 1 <hi rend="ital">fin.</hi></bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">solum,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 3, 59</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">imperium,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 6, 32</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">religio,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 12, 34</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">levitas,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 12, 14</bibl></cit>; <cit><quote lang="la">utilitas,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 12, 17</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">lina,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1345,001:4:223" default="NO"><author>Sil.</author> 4, 223</bibl></cit>; cf. <cit><quote lang="la">metallum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1345,001:16:465" default="NO"><author>id.</author> 16, 465</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">gurges,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1020,001:9:297" default="NO"><author>Stat.</author> Th. 9, 297</bibl></cit>.—<pos>Subst.</pos>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1254,001:17:17:2" default="NO"><author>Gell.</author> 17, 17, 2</bibl>.—</sense><sense id="n19465.5" n="2" level="3"> In partic. </sense><sense id="n19465.6" n="a" level="4"> In opp. to Roman: <orth extent="full" lang="la">gentīles</orth>, <hi rend="ital">foreigners</hi>: nulli gentilium provincialis femina copuletur, Cod. Th. 3, 14, 1; 11, 30, 62; <bibl default="NO"><author>Aus.</author> Grat. Act. 4</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">cum scutariis et gentilibus,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Amm.</author> 14, 7</bibl></cit>: nullum autem ex gentilibus liberum adprobari licet, Fragm. Jur. Rom. Vat. 34 Huschke.—</sense><sense id="n19465.7" n="b" level="4"> In eccl. Lat., opp. to Jewish or Christian, <hi rend="ital">heathen</hi>, <hi rend="ital">pagan</hi>, <hi rend="ital">gentile;</hi> and <hi rend="ital">subst.</hi>: <orth extent="full" lang="la">gentīlis</orth>, <itype>is</itype>, <gen>m.</gen>, <hi rend="ital">a heathen</hi>, <hi rend="ital">a pagan</hi>: vulgus, Prud. <foreign lang="greek">stef</foreign>. 10, 464: <cit><quote lang="la">nugae,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> adv. Symm. 1, 576</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">gentilium litterarum libri,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Hier.</author> Ep. 22, 30</bibl></cit>; <bibl default="NO"><author>Vulg.</author> Tob. 1, 12</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:tlg,0031,005:14:5" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Act. 14, 5</bibl>.—<hi rend="ital">Sup.</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">Sextus Pythagorēus, homo gentilissimus,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Hier.</author> in Jerem. 4, 22</bibl></cit>.—Hence, <pos>adv.</pos>: <orth extent="full" lang="la">gentīlĭter</orth> (acc. to II. C.; late Lat.). </sense><sense id="n19465.8" n="1" level="3"> <hi rend="ital">After the manner</hi> or <hi rend="ital">in the language of a country</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">Cretes Dianam Britomarten gentiliter nominant,</quote> <trans><tr>in their native language</tr>,</trans> <bibl default="NO"><author>Sol.</author> 11, 8</bibl></cit>; <bibl default="NO">20, 8</bibl>.—</sense><sense id="n19465.9" n="2" level="3"> <hi rend="ital">Heathenishly</hi>, <bibl default="NO"><author>Fulg.</author> Discuss. Arian. 4</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:tlg,0031,009:2:14" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Vulg.</author> Gal. 2, 14</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
gentilitas: <entryFree id="n19466" type="main" key="genti_li^tas"><orth extent="full" lang="la">gentīlĭtas</orth>, <itype>ātis</itype>, <gen>f.</gen> <etym>gentilis</etym>, <sense id="n19466.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">the relationship of those who belong to the same</hi> gens. </sense><sense id="n19466.1" n="I" level="1"> <usg type="style">Lit.</usg>: <cit><quote lang="la">gentilitatum, agnationum, etc. ... jura,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,037:1:38:173" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> de Or. 1, 38, 173</bibl></cit>; cf.: <cit><quote lang="la">de toto stirpis ac gentilitatis jure dicere,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 1, 39, 176</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1318,002:37:2" default="NO"><author>Plin.</author> Pan. 37, 2</bibl>.—</sense><sense id="n19466.2" n="II" level="1"> <usg type="style">Transf.</usg> </sense><sense id="n19466.3" n="A" level="2"> Concr., <hi rend="ital">relatives bearing the same name</hi>, <hi rend="ital">kindred</hi>: omnes Tarquinios eicerent, ne quam reditionis per gentilitatem spem haberent, Varr. ap. <bibl default="NO"><author>Non.</author> 222, 17</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">gentilitas ejus Manlii cognomen ejuravit,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1224,001:Vir. Ill. 24" default="NO"><author>Aur. Vict.</author> Vir. Ill. 24</bibl></cit>; <bibl default="NO"><author>Inscr. Orell.</author> 156</bibl>; <bibl default="NO">1663</bibl>.—In <number>plur.</number>: <cit><quote lang="la">sparsas atque ut ita dicam laceras gentilitates colligere,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1318,002:39:3" default="NO"><author>Plin.</author> Pan. 39, 3</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n19466.4" n="B" level="2"> Of plants, <hi rend="ital">bearing the same name</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:23:131" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 23, 7, 65, § 131</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:12:51" default="NO" valid="yes">12, 13, 30, § 51</bibl>.—</sense><sense id="n19466.5" n="C" level="2"> In eccl. Lat., <hi rend="ital">heathenism</hi>, <hi rend="ital">paganism</hi>: gentilitas <cb n="GENU" /> (opp. Dei religio), <bibl default="NO"><author>Lact.</author> 2, 13 <hi rend="ital">fin.</hi></bibl>; <bibl default="NO"><author>Vulg.</author> Judith, 14, 6</bibl>.—</sense><sense id="n19466.6" n="2" level="3"> Concr., <hi rend="ital">the heathen, pagans</hi>, Prud. <foreign lang="greek">stef</foreign>. 10, 1086; <bibl default="NO"><author>Tert.</author> Verg. Vel. 2</bibl>; <bibl default="NO"><author>Hier.</author> ad Ephes. 5 <hi rend="ital">fin.</hi></bibl></sense></entryFree>
gentiliter: <entryFree id="n19467" type="main" key="genti_li^ter"><orth extent="full" lang="la">gentīlĭter</orth>, <pos>adv.</pos>, v. gentilis <sense id="n19467.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">fin.</hi></sense></entryFree>
gentilitius: <entryFree id="n19468" type="main" key="genti^li_ti^us"><orth extent="full" lang="la">gentĭlītĭus</orth>, <itype>a, um</itype>, v. gentilicius.</entryFree>
gentilitus: <entryFree id="n19469" type="main" key="genti_li^tus"><orth extent="full" lang="la">gentīlĭtus</orth>, <pos>adv.</pos> <etym>gentilis</etym>, <sense id="n19469.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">according to the custom of a country</hi>, <bibl default="NO"><author>Tert.</author> Pall. 3</bibl> <hi rend="ital">ext.</hi></sense></entryFree>
gentius: <entryFree id="n19470" type="main" key="Genti^us"><orth extent="full" lang="la">Gentĭus</orth>, <itype>ii</itype>, <gen>m.</gen>, <sense id="n19470.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a king of Illyria</hi>, <hi rend="ital">said to have discovered the herb</hi> gentiana, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:44:23:2" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 44, 23, 2</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:44:30:1" default="NO" valid="yes">44, 30, 1</bibl> sqq. al.</sense></entryFree>
genu: <entryFree id="n19471" type="main" key="ge^nu"><orth extent="full" lang="la">gĕnu</orth>, <itype>ūs</itype>, <gen>n.</gen> (also <sense id="n19471.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">nom. sing.</hi> <orth extent="full" lang="la">gĕnum</orth>, <gen>n.</gen>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1245,001:Ep. ad M. Caes. 5:44" default="NO"><author>Front.</author> Ep. ad M. Caes. 5, 44</bibl>; and <orth extent="full" lang="la">gĕ-nus</orth>, <gen>m.</gen>, Lucil. ap. <bibl default="NO"><author>Non.</author> 207, 28</bibl>; <hi rend="ital">gen. sing.</hi> genuis; <case>dat.</case> genui, genu, <bibl default="NO"><author>Mart. Cap.</author> 3, § 293</bibl>. —In <hi rend="ital">neutr.</hi>, <case>nom.</case> and <hi rend="ital">acc. sing.</hi> genus, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,060:chapter=45" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Arat. 45</bibl>; <bibl default="NO">46</bibl>; <bibl default="NO">399</bibl>; 403; <number>plur.</number> gēnu[dibreve]a˘, as a dissyllable, Carey's Lat. Prosody, § 47; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,003:5:432" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> A. 5, 432</bibl>; <bibl default="NO">12, 905</bibl>; <hi rend="ital">gen. plur.</hi> genuorum, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1056,001:9:6" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Vitr.</author> 9, 6</bibl> dub.; <hi rend="ital">dat. plur.</hi> genubus, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1014,001:Thyest. 406" default="NO"><author>Sen.</author> Thyest. 406</bibl>; Hippol. 667; <bibl default="NO"><author>Mart. Cap.</author> 3, § 293</bibl>; <cit><quote lang="la">but usu. genibus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0860,001:10:5:24" default="NO"><author>Curt.</author> 10, 5, 24</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1351,005:12:18" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Tac.</author> A. 12, 18</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:44:31" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 44, 31 <hi rend="ital">fin.</hi></bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,006:13:585" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ov.</author> M. 13, 585</bibl>) [kindr. with Sanscr. jānu; Gr. <foreign lang="greek">go/nu</foreign>; Goth. kniu; Germ. Knie; Engl. knee], <hi rend="ital">the knee.</hi> </sense><sense id="n19471.1" n="I" level="1"> <usg type="style">Lit.</usg>: <cit><quote lang="la">meus est ballista pugnus, cubitus catapulta est mihi, Umerus aries: tum genu ut quemque icero, ad terram dabo,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,005:4:2:17" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Capt. 4, 2, 17</bibl></cit>: hujus genus, Cic. ap. <bibl default="NO"><author>Serv.</author> ad Verg. A. 3, 22</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">fine genus vestem ritu succincta Dianae,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,006:10:536" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ov.</author> M. 10, 536</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">per aquam ferme genus tenus altam,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:44:40:8" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 44, 40, 8</bibl></cit> Drak. <hi rend="ital">N. cr.</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">in ipsa genus utriusque commissura,</quote> <trans><tr>knee-joint</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:11:250" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 11, 45, 103, § 250</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">sedatis tibi doloribus genus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1248,001:Ep. p. 134" default="NO"><author>Fronto</author> Ep. p. 134</bibl></cit> Rom.: <cit><quote lang="la">dolorem genus suscitare,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1248,001:ib" default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib.</bibl></cit> p. 138: <cit><quote lang="la">ne quem in cursu capite aut cubito offendam aut genu,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,008:2:3:3" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Curc. 2, 3, 3</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">genu mehercule M. Antonium vidi, cum contente pro se ipse lege Varia diceret, terram tangere,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,049:2:24:57" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Tusc. 2, 24, 57</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">genua inediā succidunt,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,008:2:3:30" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Curc. 2, 3, 30</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">dumque virent genua,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0893,003:13:4" default="NO"><author>Hor.</author> Epod. 13, 4</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">genuum junctura,</quote> <trans><tr>knee-joint</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,006:2:823" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ov.</author> M. 2, 823</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">genuumque tumebat orbis,</quote> <trans><tr>knee-pan</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,010:8:809" default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 8, 809</bibl></cit>: ad genua accidere, Enn. ap. <bibl default="NO"><author>Non.</author> 517, 16</bibl> (Com. Rel. v. 9 Vahl.): <cit><quote lang="la">procidere,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1014,001:Contr. 7:17:12" default="NO"><author>Sen.</author> Contr. 7, 17, 12</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">ad genua se alicui submittere,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1348,001:life=tib.:20" default="NO"><author>Suet.</author> Tib. 20</bibl></cit>; cf.: <cit><quote lang="la">genua amplexus genibusque volutans Haerebat,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,003:3:607" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> A. 3, 607</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">atqui pol hodie non feres, ni genua confricantur,</quote> <trans>i. e. <tr>be clasped in earnest entreaty</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,002:3:3:80" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> As. 3, 3, 80</bibl></cit>; so, <cit><quote lang="la">fricare,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>ib.</author> 88</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">nunc tibi amplectimur genua egentes opum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,017:1:5:16" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Rud. 1, 5, 16</bibl></cit>; cf.: <cit><quote lang="la">exurgite a genibus,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib.</bibl></cit> v. 22: advolvi, Sall. Fragm. ap. <bibl default="NO"><author>Serv.</author> Verg. A. 1, 311</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1351,005:1:13" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Tac.</author> A. 1, 13 <hi rend="ital">fin.</hi></bibl>; <bibl default="NO">6, 49</bibl>; <bibl default="NO">15, 71</bibl>; <cit><quote lang="la">for which: genibus se advolvere or advolvi,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:8:37" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 8, 37 <hi rend="ital">fin.</hi></bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:28:34:4" default="NO" valid="yes">28, 34, 4</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1044,001:2:80" default="NO"><author>Vell.</author> 2, 80 <hi rend="ital">fin.</hi></bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">nixi genibus ab senatu petierunt, ne, etc.,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:43:2:2" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 43, 2, 2</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">muta metu terram genibus summissa petebat,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0550,001:1:92" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Lucr.</author> 1, 92</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">corde et genibus tremit,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0893,001:1:23:8" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Hor.</author> C. 1, 23, 8</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">jus imperiumque Phraates Caesaris accepit genibus minor,</quote> <trans>i. e. <tr>kneeling</tr>, <tr>beseeching</tr>,</trans> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> Ep. 1, 12, 28</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:tlg,0031,011:2:10" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Vulg.</author> Phil. 2, 10</bibl> saep.: <cit><quote lang="la">genu ponere,</quote> <trans><tr>to bow the knee</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0860,001:4:6:28" default="NO"><author>Curt.</author> 4, 6, 28</bibl></cit>; so, <cit><quote lang="la">alicui,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0860,001:8:7:13" default="NO"><author>id.</author> 8, 7, 13</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">genu flectere, Hier. in. Eph. 3, 14: inflexo genu adorare aliquem,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1014,001:Herc. Fur. 410" default="NO"><author>Sen.</author> Herc. Fur. 410</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">nixi genibus,</quote> <trans><tr>on bended knees</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:43:2:2" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 43, 2, 2</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">per tua genua te opsecro,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,008:5:2:31" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Curc. 5, 2, 31</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">genua incerare deorum,</quote> <trans>i. e. <tr>to attach to the statues of the gods wax tablets with prayers written on them</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1276,001:10:55" default="NO"><author>Juv.</author> 10, 55</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n19471.2" n="II" level="1"> <usg type="style">Transf.</usg>, of plants, <hi rend="ital">a knot</hi>, <hi rend="ital">joint</hi>, usually called geniculum: <cit><quote lang="la">a genibus (ferulae) exeuntia folia,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:13:123" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 13, 22, 42, § 123</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
genua: <entryFree id="n19472" type="main" key="Ge^nu^a"><orth extent="full" lang="la">Gĕnŭa</orth>, <itype>ae</itype>, <gen>f.</gen>, <sense id="n19472.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a celebrated seaport town of Liguria</hi>, <hi rend="ital">a famous market for timber</hi>, now <hi rend="ital">Genoa</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0929,001:2:4:9" default="NO"><author>Mel.</author> 2, 4, 9</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:3:48" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 3, 5, 7, § 48</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:28:46" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 28, 46</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:30:1 al" default="NO" valid="yes">30, 1 al.</bibl>; <hi rend="ital">its inhabitants</hi> are called ‡ <orth extent="full" lang="la">Gĕnŭātes</orth> and ‡ <orth extent="full" lang="la">Gĕnŭenses</orth>, <bibl default="NO"><author>Inscr. Orell.</author> 3121</bibl> (of the year A. U. C. 637, B. C. 117); v. also Genava.</sense></entryFree>
genualia: <entryFree id="n19473" type="hapax" key="ge^nu^a_li^a"><orth extent="full" lang="la">gĕnŭālĭa</orth>, <itype>ĭum</itype>, <gen>n.</gen> <etym>genu</etym>, <sense id="n19473.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">garters</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,006:10:593" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ov.</author> M. 10, 593</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
genucilius: <entryFree id="n19474" type="main" key="Genucilius"><orth extent="full" lang="la">Genucilius</orth>, <itype>ii</itype>, <gen>m.</gen>, <sense id="n19474.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a Roman proper name</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,056:13:53:1" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Fam. 13, 53, 1</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
genuinus: <entryFree id="n19475" type="main" key="ge^nu^i_nus1" n="1"><orth extent="full" lang="la">gĕnŭīnus</orth>, <itype>a, um</itype>, <pos>adj.</pos> <etym>geno, gigno</etym>, <sense id="n19475.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">innate</hi>, <hi rend="ital">native</hi>, <hi rend="ital">natural.</hi> </sense><sense id="n19475.1" n="I" level="1"> <usg type="style">Lit.</usg> (rare but class.): genuinae domesticaeque virtutes, * <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,043:2:15:29" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Rep. 2, 15, 29</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">naturales et genuini honores,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1254,001:2:2:9" default="NO"><author>Gell.</author> 2, 2, 9</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">pietas,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,2806,001:43:28:3:section=4" default="NO"><author>Dig.</author> 43, 28, 3, § 4</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">nequitia,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>App.</author> M. 9, p. 230</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n19475.2" n="II" level="1"> <usg type="style">Transf.</usg>, <hi rend="ital">genuine</hi>, <hi rend="ital">authentic</hi> (post-class.): <cit><quote lang="la">comoedia Plauti,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1254,001:3:3:7" default="NO"><author>Gell.</author> 3, 3, 7</bibl></cit>. <pb n="810" /> <cb n="GENU" /></sense></entryFree>

<entryFree id="n19476" type="main" key="ge^nu^i_nus2" n="2"><orth extent="full" lang="la">gĕnŭīnus</orth>, <itype>a, um</itype>, <pos>adj.</pos> <etym>genae; cf. Paul. ex <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1236,001:page=94" default="NO"><author>Fest.</author> p. 94</bibl> Müll.</etym>, <sense id="n19476.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">of</hi> or <hi rend="ital">belonging to the cheek</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">dentes,</quote> <trans><tr>jaw-teeth</tr>, <tr>back-teeth</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,050:2:54:134" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> N. D. 2, 54, 134</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:11:166" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 11, 37, 63, § 166</bibl>; also as <hi rend="ital">subst.</hi>: <orth extent="full" lang="la">gĕnŭīni</orth>, <itype>orum</itype>, <gen>m.</gen>, <bibl default="NO"><author>Verg.</author> Cat. 5, 36</bibl>; and in <number>sing.</number>: <orth extent="full" lang="la">gĕnŭīnus</orth>, <itype>i</itype>, <gen>m.</gen>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1276,001:5:69" default="NO"><author>Juv.</author> 5, 69</bibl>.—Prov.: genuinum frangere in aliquo, <hi rend="ital">to break one's jaw-tooth on a person</hi>, i. e. <hi rend="ital">to criticise him severely</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0969,001:1:115" default="NO"><author>Pers.</author> 1, 115</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
genus: <entryFree id="n19477" type="greek" key="ge^nus1" n="1"><orth extent="full" lang="la">gĕnus</orth>, <itype>ĕris</itype>, <gen>n.</gen> <etym>= <foreign lang="greek">ge/nos</foreign>, root GEN, gigno, gens</etym>, <sense id="n19477.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">birth</hi>, <hi rend="ital">descent</hi>, <hi rend="ital">origin;</hi> and concr., <hi rend="ital">a race</hi>, <hi rend="ital">stock</hi>, etc. (cf.: familia, gens, stirps). </sense><sense id="n19477.1" n="I" level="1"> <usg type="style">Lit.</usg> </sense><sense id="n19477.2" n="A" level="2"> In gen.: bono genere gnati, Cato ap. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1254,001:10:3:17" default="NO"><author>Gell.</author> 10, 3, 17</bibl>; cf.: <cit><quote lang="la">ii, qui nobili genere nati sunt,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,005:5:70:section=180" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Verr. 2, 5, 70, § 180</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">amplissimo genere natus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0448,001:4:12:4" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Caes.</author> B. G. 4, 12, 4</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">genere regio natus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,043:1:33" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Rep. 1, 33</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">C. Laelius, cum ei quidam malo genere natus diceret, indignum esse suis majoribus, at hercule, inquit, tu tuis dignus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,037:2:71:286" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> de Or. 2, 71, 286</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">genere et nobilitate et pecunia sui municipii facile primus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,002:6:15" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Rosc. Am. 6, 15</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">esse genere divino,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,043:2:2" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Rep. 2, 2</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">contempsisti L. Murenae genus, extulisti tuum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,014:7:15" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Mur. 7, 15</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">hic sacra, hic genus, hic majorum multa vestigia,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,044:2:1:3" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Leg. 2, 1, 3</bibl></cit>; cf. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,039:58:212" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Brut. 58, 212</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,043:1:18" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Rep. 1, 18</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">adulescens, cujus spei nihil praeter genus patricium deesset,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:6:34:11" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 6, 34, 11</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">in famam generis ac familiae,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:3:11:12" default="NO"><author>Quint.</author> 3, 11, 12</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:5:10:24" default="NO">5, 10, 24</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">genus Lentulorum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:6:3:67" default="NO"><author>id.</author> 6, 3, 67</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">Atys, genus unde Atii duxere Latini,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,003:5:568" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> A. 5, 568</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">fortuna non mutat genus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0893,003:4:6" default="NO"><author>Hor.</author> Epod. 4, 6</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">virginem plebei generis petiere juvenes, alter virgini genere par, alter, etc.,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:4:9:4" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 4, 9, 4</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">qui sibi falsum nomen imposuerit, genus parentesve finxerit, etc.,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Plaut.</author> Sent. 5, 25, 11</bibl></cit>.—<hi rend="ital">Plur.</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">summis gnati generibus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,013:5:2:20" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Most. 5, 2, 20</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n19477.3" n="B" level="2"> In partic., <hi rend="ital">birth</hi>, for <hi rend="ital">high</hi> or <hi rend="ital">noble birth</hi> (mostly <usg type="style">poet.</usg>): <cit><quote lang="la">cum certi propter divitias aut genus aut aliquas opes rem publicam tenent, est factio,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,043:3:14" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Rep. 3, 14</bibl></cit>: pol mihi fortuna magis nunc defit quam genus, Enn. ap. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,049:3:19:44" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Tusc. 3, 19, 44</bibl> (Trag. v. 394 Vahl.): <cit><quote lang="la">et genus et virtus, nisi cum re vilior alga est,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0893,004:2:5:8" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Hor.</author> S. 2, 5, 8</bibl></cit>; cf.: <cit><quote lang="la">et genus et formam regina pecunia donat,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> Ep. 1, 6, 37</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">non, Torquate, genus, non te facundia, non te Restituet pietas,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0893,001:4:7:23" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> C. 4, 7, 23</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">jactes et genus et nomen inutile,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 1, 14, 13</bibl></cit>; cf.: <cit><quote lang="la">cui genus et quondam nomen natique fuissent,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,003:5:621" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> A. 5, 621</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">nunc jam nobis patribus vobisque plebei promiscuus consulatus patet, nec generis, ut ante, sed virtutis est praemium,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:7:32:14" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 7, 32, 14</bibl></cit>; cf. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:4:4:7" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> 4, 4, 7</bibl>.</sense><sense id="n19477.4" n="II" level="1"> <usg type="style">Transf.</usg> </sense><sense id="n19477.5" n="A" level="2"> Like gens and stirps, <hi rend="ital">a descendant</hi>, <hi rend="ital">offspring</hi>, <hi rend="ital">child;</hi> and collect., <hi rend="ital">descendants</hi>, <hi rend="ital">posterity</hi>, <hi rend="ital">race</hi> (<usg type="style">poet.</usg>): neve tu umquam in gremium extollas liberorum ex te genus, Enn. ap. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,040:46:155" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Or. 46, 155</bibl> (Trag. v. 347 Vahl.): <cit><quote lang="la">credo equidem, genus esse deorum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,003:4:12" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> A. 4, 12</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">Uraniae genus, Hymen,</quote> <trans>i. e. <tr>her son</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0472,001:61:2" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cat.</author> 61, 2</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">audax Iapeti,</quote> <trans>i. e. <tr>his son Prometheus</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0893,001:1:3:27" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Hor.</author> C. 1, 3, 27</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">Jovis,</quote> <trans>i. e. <tr>Perseus</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,006:4:609" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ov.</author> M. 4, 609</bibl></cit>; cf. also <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1224,001:2:2:9" default="NO"><author>Prop.</author> 2, 2, 9</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0893,001:2:14:18" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Hor.</author> C. 2, 14, 18</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">genus Adrasti,</quote> <trans>i. e. <tr>Diomede</tr>, <tr>grandson of Adrastus</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,007:6:433" default="NO"><author>Ov.</author> F. 6, 433</bibl></cit>; <cit><quote lang="la">so of a grandson,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,006:2:743" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> M. 2, 743</bibl></cit>; cf. <cit><quote lang="la">nepotum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0893,001:3:17:4" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Hor.</author> C. 3, 17, 4</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">Tantali genus,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 2, 18, 37</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">Danai,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 2, 14, 18</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">Messi clarum genus Osci,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0893,004:1:5:54" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> S. 1, 5, 54</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">ab alto Demissum genus Aenea,</quote> <trans>i. e. <tr>Octavianus</tr>, <tr>as the adopted son of Julius Cœsar</tr>,</trans> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 2, 5, 63</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">sive neglectum genus et nepotes Respicis auctor,</quote> <trans>i. e. <tr>the Romans</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0893,001:1:2:35" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> C. 1, 2, 35</bibl></cit>; cf. <bibl default="NO"><author>ib.</author> 3, 6, 18</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">regium genus,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 2, 4, 15</bibl></cit>. —</sense><sense id="n19477.6" n="B" level="2"> Of an assemblage of objects (persons, animals, plants, inanimate or abstract things) which are related or belong together in consequence of a resemblance in natural qualities; <hi rend="ital">a race</hi>, <hi rend="ital">stock</hi>, <hi rend="ital">class</hi>, <hi rend="ital">sort</hi>, <hi rend="ital">species</hi>, <hi rend="ital">kind</hi> (in this signif. most freq. in all periods and kinds of writing). </sense><sense id="n19477.7" n="1" level="3"> In gen. </sense><sense id="n19477.8" n="a" level="4"> Of living things: ne genus humanum temporis longinquitate occideret, propter hoc marem cum femina esse coniunctum, Cic. ap. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0845,001:12:1" default="NO"><author>Col.</author> 12, 1</bibl> (Fragm. <bibl default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> 1, 5</bibl> Baiter): <cit><quote lang="la">quod ex infinita societate generis humani ita contracta res est, etc.,</quote> <trans><tr>of the human race</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,052:5:20" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Lael. 5, 20</bibl></cit>; cf. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,043:1:2" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Rep. 1, 2 <hi rend="ital">fin.</hi></bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">o deorum quicquid in caelo regit Terras et humanum genus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0893,003:5:2" default="NO"><author>Hor.</author> Epod. 5, 2</bibl></cit>; <cit><quote lang="la">for which: consulere generi hominum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,043:3:12" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Rep. 3, 12</bibl></cit>; cf.: <cit><quote lang="la">cum omni hominum genere,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 2, 26</bibl></cit>; <bibl default="NO"><author>Hor.</author> Ep. 2, 1, 7</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">solivagum genus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,043:1:25" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Rep. 1, 25</bibl></cit>: potens vir cum inter sui corporis homines tum etiam ad plebem, quod haudquaquam inter id genus contemptor ejus <cb n="GENU" /> habebatur, i. e. <hi rend="ital">among the Plebeians</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:6:34:5" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 6, 34, 5</bibl>: Graium genus, <hi rend="ital">the Grecian race</hi>, Enn. ap. Prob. ad <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,001:6:31" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> E. 6, 31</bibl> (Ann. v. 149 Vahl.): <cit><quote lang="la">virtus est propria Romani generis atque seminis,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,035:4:5:13" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Phil. 4, 5, 13</bibl></cit>; cf. <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> Ac. 2, 27, 86</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">Ubii, paulo quam sunt ejusdem generis et ceteris humaniores,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0448,001:4:3:3" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Caes.</author> B. G. 4, 3, 3</bibl></cit>; cf. <cit><quote lang="la">also: impellit alios (Aeduos) iracundia et temeritas, quae maxime illi hominum generi est innata,</quote> <trans><tr>race of men</tr>,</trans> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 7, 42, 2</bibl></cit>; so, like gens, of <hi rend="ital">nations</hi>, <hi rend="ital">peoples</hi>, <hi rend="ital">tribes</hi>: ferox, Sall. Fragm. ap. Arus. Mess. s. v. insolens, p. 241 Lind. (Hist. 1, 14 Gerl.); <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:34:7:6" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 34, 7, 6</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">implacidum (Genauni),</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0893,001:4:14:10" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Hor.</author> C. 4, 14, 10</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">durum ac velox (Ligures),</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1242,001:2:3:4" default="NO"><author>Flor.</author> 2, 3, 4</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">omne in paludes diffugerat,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1242,001:3:10:14" default="NO"><author>id.</author> 3, 10, 14</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">Graecorum,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Fl. 4, 9</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">Numidarum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:30:12:18" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 30, 12, 18</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">genus omne nomenque Macedonum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:13:44:6" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> 13, 44, 6</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0588,021:2" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Nep.</author> Reg. 2</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">Italici generis multi mortales,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0631,001:J. 47:1" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Sall.</author> J. 47, 1</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">Illyriorum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:27:32:4" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 27, 32, 4</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:27:48:10" default="NO" valid="yes">27, 48, 10</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:42:47" default="NO" valid="yes">42, 47</bibl> <hi rend="ital">fin.</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">Scytharum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,2806,001:2:3:16" default="NO"><author>Just.</author> 2, 3, 16</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1351,004:2:4" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Tac.</author> H. 2, 4</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1348,001:life=nero:37" default="NO"><author>Suet.</author> Ner. 37</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1044,001:2:118:1" default="NO"><author>Vell.</author> 2, 118, 1</bibl>.—In <number>plur.</number>: <cit><quote lang="la">conventus is, qui ex variis generibus constaret,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0448,002:2:36:1" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Caes.</author> B. C. 2, 36, 1</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">olim isti fuit generi quondam quaestus apud saeclum prius ... est genus hominum, qui se primos esse omnium rerum volunt,</quote> <trans><tr>class of men</tr>, <tr>profession</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0134,003:2:2:15" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ter.</author> Eun. 2, 2, 15</bibl></cit> and 17: <cit><quote lang="la">firmi et stabiles et constantes (amici), cujus generis est magna penuria,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,052:17:62" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Lael. 17, 62</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">saepius genus ejus hominis (sc. procuratoris rei publicae) erit in reliqua nobis oratione tractandum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,043:2:29" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Rep. 2, 29 <hi rend="ital">fin.</hi></bibl></cit>; cf.: <cit><quote lang="la">genus aliud tyrannorum,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 1, 44</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">judicum genus et forma,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,035:5:5:13" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Phil. 5, 5, 13</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">istius generis asoti,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,048:2:8:23" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Fin. 2, 8, 23</bibl></cit>; cf.: <cit><quote lang="la">omnium ejus generis poëtarum haud dubie proximus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:10:1:85" default="NO"><author>Quint.</author> 10, 1, 85</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">liberrimum hominum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:10:12:2:section=22" default="NO"><author>id.</author> 10, 12, 2, § 22</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">irritabile vatum,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Hor.</author> Ep. 2, 2, 102</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">hoc omne (ambubajarum, etc.),</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0893,004:1:2:2" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> S. 1, 2, 2</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">hominum virile, muliebre,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,036:1:24:35" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Inv. 1, 24, 35</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">equidem fabulam et fictam rem ducebam esse, virorum omne genus in aliqua insula conjuratione muliebri ab stirpe sublatum esse,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:34:2:3" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 34, 2, 3</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">cedat consulari generi praetorium,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,028:6:15" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Planc. 6, 15</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">ad militare genus = ad milites,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:24:32:2" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 24, 32, 2</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">alia militaris generis turba,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:44:45:13" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> 44, 45, 13</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">castellani, agreste genus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:34:27:9" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> 34, 27, 9</bibl></cit> Weissenb. ad loc.—<hi rend="ital">Sing.</hi> with <hi rend="ital">plur. predicate</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">Ministrantibus sibi omni genere turpium personarum,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Capitol.</author> Ver. 4</bibl></cit>.—In <number>plur.</number>: <cit><quote lang="la">eorum hominum ... genera sunt duo,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0448,001:6:13:1" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Caes.</author> B. G. 6, 13, 1</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">tria auditorum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:3:4:6" default="NO"><author>Quint.</author> 3, 4, 6</bibl></cit>.— Repeated in the <hi rend="ital">relative-clause</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">duo genera semper in hac civitate fuerunt ... quibus ex generibus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,022:45:96" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Sest. 45, 96</bibl></cit>.—In the <case>acc.</case>, of <hi rend="ital">description</hi> (v. Roby's Gram. 2, p. 42 sq.): <cit><quote lang="la">quot et quod genus pastores habendi,</quote> <trans><tr>of what kind</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0684,001:R. R. 2:10:1" default="NO"><author>Varr.</author> R. R. 2, 10, 1</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">quod genus ii sunt, etc.,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Auct. Her.</author> 2, 30, 48</bibl></cit>; cf. in the foll.—</sense><sense id="n19477.9" n="(b)" level="5"> Of animals, plants, etc.: genus altivolantum, <hi rend="ital">the race of birds</hi>, Enn. ap. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,053:1:48:107" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Div. 1, 48, 107</bibl> (Ann. v. 84 Vahl.); cf.: genu' pennis condecoratum, id. Fragm. ap. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0684,001:L. L. 5:section=59" default="NO"><author>Varr.</author> L. L. 5, § 59</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">lanigerum, id. Fragm. ap. Paul. ex Fest. s. v. Cyprio, p. 59 Müll.: squamigerum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0550,001:1:162" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Lucr.</author> 1, 162</bibl></cit>; cf. <cit><quote lang="la">piscium,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0893,001:1:2:9" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Hor.</author> C. 1, 2, 9</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">silvestre,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0550,001:5:1411" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Lucr.</author> 5, 1411</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">omne ferarum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0550,001:5:1338" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> 5, 1338</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">acre leonum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0550,001:5:862" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> 5, 862</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">malefici generis plurima animalia,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0631,001:J. 17:6" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Sall.</author> J. 17, 6</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">diversum confusa genus panthera camelo,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Hor.</author> Ep. 2, 1, 195</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">animantūm propagare genus,</quote> <trans><tr>to propagate the race</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0550,001:1:195" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Lucr.</author> 1, 195</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">ad genus faciendum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,2806,001:2:9" default="NO"><author>Just.</author> 2, 9 <hi rend="ital">fin.</hi></bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">juxta genus suum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:tlg,0527,001:1:11" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Vulg.</author> Gen. 1, 11</bibl></cit> saep.— <hi rend="ital">Plur.</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">quae vero et quam varia genera bestiarum vel cicurum vel ferarum!</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,050:2:39:99" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> N. D. 2, 39, 99</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">piscium genera,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:5:10:21" default="NO"><author>Quint.</author> 5, 10, 21</bibl></cit>.—In the <case>acc.</case>, of <hi rend="ital">description</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">porticus avibus omne genus oppletae,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0684,001:R. R. 3:5:11" default="NO"><author>Varr.</author> R.
