R. 3, 5, 11</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">pascuntur omne genus objecto frumento,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0684,001:ib. 3:6" default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 3, 6</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">boves et id genus pecua,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>App.</author> M. 2, p. 115, 4</bibl></cit>; <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> Flor. p. 37</bibl>. —</sense><sense id="n19477.10" n="b" level="4"> Of inanim. and abstr. things, <hi rend="ital">kind</hi>, <hi rend="ital">sort</hi>, <hi rend="ital">description</hi>, <hi rend="ital">class</hi>, <hi rend="ital">order</hi>, <hi rend="ital">character</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">genus ullum materiaï,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0550,001:2:304" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Lucr.</author> 2, 304</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">cum is (sol) quoque efficiat, ut omnia floreant et in suo quaeque genere pubescant,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,050:2:15:41" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> N. D. 2, 15, 41</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">naves omni genere armorum ornatissimae,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0448,001:3:14:2" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Caes.</author> B. G. 3, 14, 2</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">cibi genus,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 4, 1, 9</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">cum omni genere commeatus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:30:36:2" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 30, 36, 2</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">frugum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:38:15:9" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> 38, 15, 9</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">hoc sphaerae genus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,043:1:14" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Rep. 1, 14</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">hoc triplex rerum publicarum genus,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 2, 23</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">regale civitatis,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib.</bibl></cit>; cf.: <cit><quote lang="la">totum regiae civitatis,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 2, 29</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">novum imperii,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 2, 32</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">ipsum istud genus orationis exspecto,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 1, 24</bibl></cit> <hi rend="ital">fin.</hi>; cf.: dulce orationis,<cb n="GENU" />  <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,040:13:42" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Or. 13, 42</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">qua re esset hoc bellum genere ipso necessarium,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> de Imp. Pomp. 10, 27</bibl></cit>; cf.: <cit><quote lang="la">genus hoc erat pugnae, quo, etc.,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0448,001:1:48:4" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Caes.</author> B. G. 1, 48, 4</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">potestas annua (consulum) genere ipso ac jure regia,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,043:2:32" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Rep. 2, 32</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">genus vitae ... genus aetatis,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,055:1:32:117" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Off. 1, 32, 117</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">optimum emendandi,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:10:4:2" default="NO"><author>Quint.</author> 10, 4, 2</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">dicendi,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,055:1:1:3" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Off. 1, 1, 3</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:8:3:56" default="NO"><author>Quint.</author> 8, 3, 56</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:12:10:69" default="NO">12, 10, 69</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">simplex rectumque loquendi,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:9:3:3" default="NO"><author>id.</author> 9, 3, 3</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">omnis generis tormenta,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:32:16:10" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 32, 16, 10</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">praeda ingens omnis generis,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:27:5:9" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> 27, 5, 9</bibl></cit>; so, <cit><quote lang="la">omnis generis, with tela,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:38:26:4" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> 38, 26, 4</bibl></cit>; <cit><quote lang="la">with naves,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:34:8:5" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> 34, 8, 5</bibl></cit>; <cit><quote lang="la">with eloquentia,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:39:40:7" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> 39, 40, 7</bibl></cit>, etc.—Repeated in the <hi rend="ital">relative-clause</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">erat haec (ratio) ex eodem genere, quod ego maxime genus ex sociorum litteris reperire cupiebam,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,005:2:74:section=183" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Verr. 2, 2, 74, § 183</bibl></cit>.—In <number>plur.</number>: <cit><quote lang="la">Caesar haec genera munitionis instituit,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0448,001:7:72:1" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Caes.</author> B. G. 7, 72, 1</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">disserere de generibus et de rationibus civitatum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,043:2:11" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Rep. 2, 11</bibl></cit>; cf. <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 1, 26</bibl>; <cit><quote lang="la">28: genera juris institutorum, morum consuetudinumque describere,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 3, 10</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">genera furandi,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,005:2:7:section=18" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Verr. 2, 2, 7, § 18</bibl></cit>.—In the <case>acc.</case>, of <hi rend="ital">description</hi>: omne, hoc, id, quod genus, for omnis, ejus, hujus, cujus generis, <hi rend="ital">of every</hi>, <hi rend="ital">of this</hi>, <hi rend="ital">of which kind</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">sub urbe hortum omne genus, coronamenta omne genus,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Cato</author>, R. R. 8, 2</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0684,001:R. R. 1:29:1" default="NO"><author>Varr.</author> R. R. 1, 29, 1</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">omne genus simulacra feruntur,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0550,001:4:735" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Lucr.</author> 4, 735</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">si hoc genus rebus non proficitur,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0684,001:R. R. 2:1:23" default="NO"><author>Varr.</author> R. R. 2, 1, 23</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0684,001:L. L. 9:section=110" default="NO"><author>id.</author> L. L. 9, § 110</bibl> Müll.; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0550,001:6:917" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Lucr.</author> 6, 917</bibl> and <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0893,004:2:6:44" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Hor.</author> S. 2, 6, 44</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">in id genus verbis,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0684,001:L. L. 10:section=79" default="NO"><author>Varr.</author> L. L. 10, § 79</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0684,001:8:7:108:section=17" default="NO">8, 7, 108, § 17</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">in id genus libris,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1254,001:3:8:1" default="NO"><author>Gell.</author> 3, 8, 1</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">scis me ante orationes aut aliquid id genus solitum scribere,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,057:13:12:3" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Att. 13, 12, 3</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">vitanda sunt illa, quae propinqua videntur: quod genus, fidentiae contrarium est diffidentia, etc.,</quote> <trans><tr>for example</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,036:2:54:165" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Inv. 2, 54, 165</bibl></cit>; so <bibl default="NO"><author>ib.</author> 2, 52, 157</bibl>; <bibl default="NO">2, 54, 162</bibl>; <bibl default="NO">2, 57, 172</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0550,001:4:271" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Lucr.</author> 4, 271</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0550,001:6:1058" default="NO" valid="yes">6, 1058</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">lege jus est id quod populi jussu sanctum est, quod genus: ut in jus eas cum voceris,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Auct. Her.</author> 2, 13, 19</bibl></cit>; cf. <cit><quote lang="la">ib. sqq.— In gen.: i. q. res or aliquid: ut in omni genere hujus populi (Graeci) consuetudinem videretur imitatus,</quote> <trans><tr>in all respects</tr>, <tr>in everything</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,043:2:20" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Rep. 2, 20</bibl></cit>; cf.: <cit><quote lang="la">innumerabiles res sunt, in quibus te quotidie in omni genere desiderem,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,058:2:2" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Q. Fr. 2, 2 <hi rend="ital">fin.</hi></bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">incredibile est, quam me in omni genere delectarit,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,057:16:5:2" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Att. 16, 5, 2</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">medici assiduitas et tota domus in omni genere diligens,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 12, 33, 2</bibl></cit>; <cit><quote lang="la">7, 1, 2: qui in aliquo genere aut inconcinnus aut multus est, is ineptus dicitur,</quote> <trans><tr>in any respect whatever</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,037:2:4:17" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> de Or. 2, 4, 17</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">qua de re et de hoc genere toto pauca cognosce,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,058:1:2:2:section=4" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Q. Fr. 1, 2, 2, § 4</bibl></cit>.—Adverb.: in genus, <hi rend="ital">in general</hi>, <hi rend="ital">generally</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">sermones in genus communes,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1254,001:4:1" default="NO"><author>Gell.</author> 4, 1 <hi rend="ital">fin.</hi></bibl></cit>—</sense><sense id="n19477.11" n="2" level="3"> In partic. </sense><sense id="n19477.12" n="a" level="4"> In philos. lang., opp. partes, and comprising them within itself, <hi rend="ital">a general term</hi>, <hi rend="ital">logical genus</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">genus est id, quod sui similes communione quadam, specie autem differentes, duas aut plures complectitur partes,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,037:1:42:189" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> de Or. 1, 42, 189</bibl></cit>; cf.: genus est, quod plures partes amplectitur, ut animal; <cit><quote lang="la">pars est, quae subest generi, ut equus. Sed saepe eadem res alii genus, alii pars est: nam homo animalis pars est, Thebani aut Trojani genus,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> de Inv. 1, 22, 32</bibl></cit>: genus est, quod partes aliquas amplectitur, ut cupiditas; <cit><quote lang="la">pars est, quae subest generi, ut cupiditati amor, avaritia,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 1, 28, 42</bibl></cit>; cf. <cit><quote lang="la">also: genus est notio ad plures differentias pertinens,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,042:7:31" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Top. 7, 31</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">nec vero sine philosophorum disciplina genus et speciem cujusque rei cernere neque eam definiendo explicare nec tribuere in partes possumus, etc.,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,040:4:16" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Or. 4, 16</bibl></cit>; cf. <bibl default="NO"><author>ib.</author> 33, 117</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">formae dicendi specie dispares, genere laudabiles,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,037:3:9:34" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> de Or. 3, 9, 34</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">perturbationes sunt genere quatuor, partibus plures,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,049:3:11:24" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Tusc. 3, 11, 24</bibl></cit>; cf. <bibl default="NO"><author>ib.</author> 5, 25, 71</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">et conjuncta quaeremus, et genera et partes generibus subjectas, et similitudines, etc.,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,037:2:39:166" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> de Or. 2, 39, 166</bibl></cit>; <cit><quote lang="la">opp. species and pars,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0684,001:R. R. 3:3:3" default="NO"><author>Varr.</author> R. R. 3, 3, 3</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n19477.13" n="b" level="4"> In gram., <hi rend="ital">gender</hi>: transversi sunt (ordines) qui ab recto casu obliqui declinantur, ut albus, albi, albo; <cit><quote lang="la">directi sunt, qui ab recto casu in rectos declinantur, ut albus, alba, album. Transversorum ordinum partes appellantur casus, directorum genera: utrisque inter se implicatis forma,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0684,001:L. L. 10:section=22" default="NO"><author>Varr.</author> L. L. 10, § 22</bibl></cit> Müll.: <cit><quote lang="la">quod ad verborum temporalium rationem attinet, cum partes sint quatuor: temporum, personarum, generum, divisionum, etc.,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0684,001:9:section=95" default="NO"><author>ib.</author> 9, § 95</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">in nominibus tria genera,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:1:4:23" default="NO"><author>Quint.</author> 1, 4, 23</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">barbarismum fieri per numeros aut genera,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:1:5" default="NO"><author>id.</author> 1, 5</bibl></cit>, <pb n="811" /> <cb n="GERG" /> 16; <cit><quote lang="la">9, 3, 6: in verbis quoque quis est adeo imperitus, ut ignoret genera et qualitates, etc.,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:1:4:27" default="NO"><author>id.</author> 1, 4, 27</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
<entryFree id="n19478" type="main" key="ge^nus2" n="2"><orth extent="full" lang="la">gĕnus</orth>, <itype>ūs</itype>, v. genu.</entryFree>
genusus: <entryFree id="n19479" type="main" key="Ge^nu^sus"><orth extent="full" lang="la">Gĕnŭsus</orth> (also <orth extent="full" lang="la">Gĕnŏs-</orth>), <itype>i</itype>, <gen>m.</gen>, <sense id="n19479.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a river of Grecian Illyria</hi>, <hi rend="ital">north of Apollonia</hi>, now <hi rend="ital">Tjerma</hi> or <hi rend="ital">Skumbi</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0448,002:3:75 sq" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Caes.</author> B. C. 3, 75 sq.</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0917,001:5:462" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Luc.</author> 5, 462</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:44:30:10" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 44, 30, 10</bibl> and 12.</sense></entryFree>
geodes: <entryFree id="n19480" type="greek" key="ge^o_des"><orth extent="full" lang="la">gĕōdes</orth>, <itype>is</itype>, <gen>m.</gen>, = <foreign lang="greek">gew/dhs</foreign> (earth-like, earthy), <sense id="n19480.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a precious stone</hi>, <hi rend="ital">otherwise unknown</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:36:140" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 36, 19, 32, § 140</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
geographia: <entryFree id="n19481" type="greek" key="ge^o_gra^phi^a"><orth extent="full" lang="la">gĕōgrăphĭa</orth>, <itype>ae</itype>, <gen>f.</gen>, = <foreign lang="greek">gewgrafi/a</foreign>, <sense id="n19481.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">geography</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">de geographia dabo operam, ut tibi satisfaciam,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,057:2:4:3" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Att. 2, 4, 3</bibl></cit> (cf. <bibl default="NO"><author>ib.</author> 2, 6, 1</bibl>).</sense></entryFree>
geographicus: <entryFree id="n19482" type="greek" key="ge^o_gra^phi^cus"><orth extent="full" lang="la">gĕōgrăphĭcus</orth>, <itype>a, um</itype>, <pos>adj.</pos>, = <foreign lang="greek">gewgrafiko/s</foreign>, <sense id="n19482.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">geographical</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">stili,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Amm.</author> 23, 6, 13</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">perplexitas,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> 31, 2</bibl></cit> (written as Greek, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,057:2:6:1" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Att. 2, 6, 1</bibl>).</sense></entryFree>
geometres: <entryFree id="n19483" type="greek" key="ge^o_me_^tres"><orth extent="full" lang="la">gĕōmē^tres</orth>, <itype>ae</itype> (also <orth extent="full" lang="la">gĕōmē^tra</orth>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1224,001:Ep. 14:2" default="NO"><author>Aur. Vict.</author> Ep. 14, 2</bibl>; <sense id="n19483.0" n="I" level="1"><cit><quote lang="la">and gĕŏmetra, ae,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Sid.</author> Ep. 4, 11</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">ge[dibreve]omētrēs, trisyl.,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1276,001:3:76" default="NO"><author>Juv.</author> 3, 76</bibl></cit>), <gen>m.</gen>, = <foreign lang="greek">gewme/trhs</foreign>, <hi rend="ital">a geometer</hi>, <hi rend="ital">geometrician</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">quomodo geometres cernere ea potest quae aut nulla sunt aut internosci a falsis non possunt?</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Ac. 2, 7, 22</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">geometres,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:1:10:6" default="NO"><author>Quint.</author> 1, 10, 6</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1276,001:3:76" default="NO"><author>Juv.</author> 3, 76</bibl>.—<hi rend="ital">Dat.</hi> geometrae, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:1:12:6" default="NO"><author>Quint.</author> 1, 12, 6</bibl>.—<hi rend="ital">Acc.</hi> geometren, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:1:10:4" default="NO"><author>id.</author> 1, 10, 4</bibl>.— <hi rend="ital">Plur.</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">geometrae,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,055:3:7:33" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Off. 3, 7, 33</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,054:8:15" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Fat. 8, 15</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:12:11:20" default="NO"><author>Quint.</author> 12, 11, 20</bibl>; Fragm. Jur. Rom. Vatic. 150 Huschke.—<hi rend="ital">Dat.</hi> geometris, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:1:10:18" default="NO"><author>id.</author> 1, 10, 18</bibl>.—<hi rend="ital">Acc.</hi> geometras, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:5:10:7" default="NO"><author>id.</author> 5, 10, 7</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
geometria: <entryFree id="n19484" type="greek" key="ge^o_me_^tri_^a"><orth extent="full" lang="la">gĕōmē^trī^a</orth>, <itype>ae</itype>, <gen>f.</gen>, = <foreign lang="greek">gewmetri/a</foreign>, <sense id="n19484.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">geometry</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">in geometria lineamenta, formae, intervalla, magnitudines,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,037:1:42:187" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> de Or. 1, 42, 187</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,043:1:10" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Rep. 1, 10</bibl>; <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> Ac. 2, 33, 106</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,053:2:3:10" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Div. 2, 3, 10</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,049:1:2:5" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Tusc. 1, 2, 5</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,055:1:6:19" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Off. 1, 6, 19</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:1:10:34 sq" default="NO"><author>Quint.</author> 1, 10, 34 sq.</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:1:12:14" default="NO">1, 12, 14</bibl> et saep.</sense></entryFree>
geometrice: <entryFree id="n19485" type="main" key="ge^o_me_^tri^ce"><orth extent="full" lang="la">gĕōmē^trĭce</orth>, <itype>ēs</itype>, see the foll. art. II. B.</entryFree>
geometricus: <entryFree id="n19486" type="greek" key="ge^o_me_^tri^cus"><orth extent="full" lang="la">gĕōmē^trĭcus</orth>, <itype>a, um</itype>, <pos>adj.</pos>, = <foreign lang="greek">gewmetriko/s</foreign>, <sense id="n19486.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">of</hi> or <hi rend="ital">belonging to geometry</hi>, <hi rend="ital">geometrical</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">geometricum quiddam explicare,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,053:2:59:122" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Div. 2, 59, 122</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">quaedam de dimensione,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,049:1:24:57" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Tusc. 1, 24, 57</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">formae,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,043:1:17" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Rep. 1, 17</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">rationes,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> Ac. 2, 36, 117</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n19486.1" n="II" level="1"> <pos>Subst.</pos> </sense><sense id="n19486.2" n="A" level="2"> <orth extent="full" lang="la">gĕōmē^trĭcus</orth>, i. <gen>m.</gen>, <hi rend="ital">a geometer</hi>, <hi rend="ital">geometrician</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">reprehensi a geometricis sunt historici,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:1:10:40" default="NO"><author>Quint.</author> 1, 10, 40</bibl></cit> Spald. <hi rend="ital">N. cr.</hi>—</sense><sense id="n19486.3" n="B" level="2"> <orth extent="full" lang="la">gĕōmē^trĭce</orth>, <itype>ēs</itype>, <gen>f.</gen>, <hi rend="ital">geometry</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:35:76" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 35, 10, 36, § 76</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1056,001:10:11:2" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Vitr.</author> 10, 11, 2</bibl>.—</sense><sense id="n19486.4" n="C" level="2"> <orth extent="full" lang="la">gĕōmē^trĭ-ca</orth>, <itype>ōrum</itype>, <gen>n.</gen>, <hi rend="ital">geometry</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">geometrica discere,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,048:1:6:20" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Fin. 1, 6, 20</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">aliquem interrogare quaedam geometrica de dimensione quadrati,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,049:1:24:57" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Tusc. 1, 24, 57</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
georgi: <entryFree id="n19487" type="main" key="Ge^o_rgi"><orth extent="full" lang="la">Gĕōrgi</orth>, <itype>ōrum</itype>, <gen>m.</gen> (<foreign lang="greek">*gewrgoi/</foreign>, i. e. the husbandmen), <sense id="n19487.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">the name of a Sarmatian people</hi>, <hi rend="ital">near the Crimea</hi>, opp. the Nomades, Mela, 2, 1, 5 and 11; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:4:83" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 4, 12, 26, § 83</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
georgicus: <entryFree id="n19488" type="greek" key="ge^o_rgi^cus"><orth extent="full" lang="la">gĕōrgĭcus</orth>, <itype>a, um</itype>, <pos>adj.</pos>, = <foreign lang="greek">gewrgiko/s</foreign>, <sense id="n19488.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">of</hi> or <hi rend="ital">belonging to husbandry</hi>, <hi rend="ital">agricultural</hi>, <hi rend="ital">georgic</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">carmen,</quote> <trans>i. e. <tr>the Georgics</tr>, <tr>the title of an agricultural poem by Virgil</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0845,001:7:5:10" default="NO"><author>Col.</author> 7, 5, 10</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0845,001:10" default="NO">10</bibl> praef. 3.—<pos>Subst.</pos> </sense><sense id="n19488.1" n="A" level="2"> <orth extent="full" lang="la">Gĕōrgĭca</orth>, <itype>ōrum</itype>, <gen>n.</gen>: <cit><quote lang="la">Vergilius hunc Ennii versum secutus in Georgicis suis,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1254,001:18:5:7" default="NO"><author>Gell.</author> 18, 5, 7</bibl></cit>. And in a Greek form: <cit><quote lang="la">in primo Georgicōn,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1254,001:13:20:4" default="NO"><author>id.</author> 13, 20, 4</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n19488.2" n="B" level="2"> <orth extent="full" lang="la">Gĕōrgĭcon</orth>, <itype>i</itype>, <gen>n.</gen>, <hi rend="ital">a book on husbandry</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0845,001:11:3:2" default="NO"><author>Col.</author> 11, 3, 2</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
georgos: <entryFree id="n19489" type="main" key="Ge^o_rgos"><orth extent="full" lang="la">Gĕōrgos</orth>, <itype>i</itype>, <gen>m.</gen> = [<foreign lang="greek">gewrgo/s</foreign>], <sense id="n19489.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">the title of a comedy by Menander</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:11:3:91" default="NO"><author>Quint.</author> 11, 3, 91</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
gepidae: <entryFree id="n19490" type="main" key="Gepi^dae"><orth extent="full" lang="la">Gepĭdae</orth>, <itype>ārum</itype>, <gen>m.</gen>, <sense id="n19490.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a Gothic tribe in Scythia</hi>, Jornand de Reb. Get. 17 al.</sense></entryFree>
geraesticus: <entryFree id="n19491" type="main" key="Ge^raesti^cus"><orth extent="full" lang="la">Gĕraestĭcus portus</orth>, <sense id="n19491.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a harbor near the town of Teos</hi>, <hi rend="ital">in Ionia</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:37:27:9" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 37, 27, 9</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
geraestus: <entryFree id="n19492" type="main" key="Ge^raestus"><orth extent="full" lang="la">Gĕraestus</orth> or <orth extent="full" lang="la">-os</orth>, <itype>i</itype>, <gen>f.</gen>, <sense id="n19492.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">the principal town of Eubœa</hi>, <hi rend="ital">near the promontory</hi> Geraestus or Geraestum, <hi rend="ital">opposite to the promontory of Sunium</hi>, now <hi rend="ital">Geresto</hi>, or, acc. to others, <hi rend="ital">Kastri</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:31:45:10" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 31, 45, 10</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0929,001:2:7:9" default="NO"><author>Mel.</author> 2, 7, 9</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:4:63 sq" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 4, 12, 21, § 63 sq.</bibl></sense></entryFree>
geranion: <entryFree id="n19493" type="greek" key="ge^ra^ni^on"><orth extent="full" lang="la">gĕrănĭon</orth> or <orth extent="full" lang="la">-um</orth>, <itype>ii</itype>, <gen>n.</gen>, = <foreign lang="greek">gera/nion</foreign>, <sense id="n19493.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">the plant stork's-bill</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:26:108" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 26, 11, 68, § 108</bibl> sqq.</sense></entryFree>
geranitis: <entryFree id="n19494" type="greek" key="ge^ra^ni_tis"><orth extent="full" lang="la">gĕrănītis</orth>, <itype>ĭdis</itype>, <gen>f.</gen>, = <foreign lang="greek">gerani=tis</foreign>, <sense id="n19494.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a precious stone</hi>, <hi rend="ital">otherwise unknown</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:37:187" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 37, 11, 72, § 187</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
gerdius: <entryFree id="n19495" type="greek" key="gerdi^us"><orth extent="full" lang="la">gerdĭus</orth>, <itype>ii</itype>, <gen>m.</gen>, = <foreign lang="greek">ge/rdios</foreign>, <sense id="n19495.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a weaver</hi> (ante- and post-class.), Lucil. ap. <bibl default="NO"><author>Non.</author> 118, 10</bibl>; Firm. 8, 25 <hi rend="ital">med.</hi></sense></entryFree>
gerens: <entryFree id="n19496" type="main" key="ge^rens"><orth extent="full" lang="la">gĕrens</orth>, <itype>ntis</itype>, <sense id="n19496.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">P.</hi> and <pos>P. a.</pos> of gero; v. gero <hi rend="ital">fin.</hi></sense></entryFree>
gergovia: <entryFree id="n19497" type="main" key="Gergo^vi^a"><orth extent="full" lang="la">Gergŏvĭa</orth>, <itype>ae</itype>, <gen>f.</gen> <sense id="n19497.0" n="I" level="1"> <hi rend="ital">A town of the Arverni</hi>, <hi rend="ital">in Aquitanian Gaul</hi>, perh. in the neighborhood of the modern <hi rend="ital">Clermont</hi>, now <cb n="GERM" /> <hi rend="ital">Jargean</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0448,001:7:4" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Caes.</author> B. G. 7, 4</bibl>; <bibl default="NO">34</bibl>; <bibl default="NO">36</bibl>; 44.—</sense><sense id="n19497.1" n="II" level="1"> <hi rend="ital">A town of the Boii</hi>, <hi rend="ital">to the east of the Liger</hi>, perh. the mod. <hi rend="ital">Charlieu</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0448,001:7:9" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Caes.</author> B. G. 7, 9 <hi rend="ital">fin.</hi></bibl></sense></entryFree>
geritio: <entryFree id="n19498" type="main" key="geri^ti^o"><orth extent="full" lang="la">gerĭtĭo</orth>, v. l. for gestio, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,2806,001:11:7:14:section=8" default="NO"><author>Dig.</author> 11, 7, 14, § 8</bibl>.</entryFree>
germalensis: <entryFree id="n19499" type="main" key="Germa^lensis"><orth extent="full" lang="la">Germălensis</orth>, <itype>e</itype>, <sense id="n19499.0" n="I" level="1"><xr><lbl>v.</lbl> <ref type="sym" targOrder="U">the foll.</ref></xr> art.</sense></entryFree>
germalus: <entryFree id="n19500" type="main" key="Germa^lus"><orth extent="full" lang="la">Germălus</orth> (also <orth extent="full" lang="la">Cerm-</orth>; cf. Müll. ad Paul. ex <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1236,001:page=55" default="NO"><author>Fest.</author> p. 55</bibl>), <sense id="n19500.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a depression in the Palatine Hill</hi>, <hi rend="ital">towards the Tiber</hi>, <hi rend="ital">a part of the Septimontium</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0684,001:L. L. 5:section=53" default="NO"><author>Varr.</author> L. L. 5, § 53</bibl> Müll.; Fest. s. v. Septimontio, p. 348; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,057:4:3:3" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Att. 4, 3, 3</bibl>; cf.: Germalus a germanis Romulo et Remo, quod ad ficum Ruminalem ibi inventi, quo aqua hiberna Tiberis eos detulerat in alveolo expositos, Varr. l. l.: Cermalus locus in Urbe sic nominatus, Paul. ex Fest. s. h. v. p. 55.—Hence, <pos>adj.</pos>: <orth extent="full" lang="la">Germălensis</orth>, e: Germalense Quinticeps apud aedem Romuli, Varr. l. l.</sense></entryFree>
germane: <entryFree id="n19501" type="main" key="germa_ne"><orth extent="full" lang="la">germāne</orth>, <pos>adv.</pos>, v. germanus <sense id="n19501.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">fin.</hi></sense></entryFree>
germani: <entryFree id="n19502" type="main" key="Germa_ni"><orth extent="full" lang="la">Germāni</orth>, <itype>ōrum</itype>, <gen>m.</gen>, = <foreign lang="greek">*germanoi/</foreign>, <sense id="n19502.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">the Germans</hi>, <hi rend="ital">between the Rhine</hi>, <hi rend="ital">the Danube</hi>, <hi rend="ital">the Vistula</hi>, <hi rend="ital">and the sea; the eastern neighbors of the Gauls</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0448,001:2:4" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Caes.</author> B. G. 2, 4</bibl>; <bibl default="NO">4, 1</bibl>; <bibl default="NO">6, 11</bibl>; 21 sq.; Tac. G. passim; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,057:14:9:3" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Att. 14, 9, 3</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,025:13:33" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Prov. Cons. 13, 33</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,026:14:32" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Balb. 14, 32</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,027:33:81 al" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Pis. 33, 81 al.</bibl>—<hi rend="ital">Sing.</hi>: <orth extent="full" lang="la">Germānus</orth>, <itype>i</itype>, <gen>m.</gen>, <hi rend="ital">a German</hi>, in a pun with germanus, own brother; v. 1. germanus, I. B.—</sense><sense id="n19502.1" n="II" level="1"> Derivv. </sense><sense id="n19502.2" n="A" level="2"> <orth extent="full" lang="la">Germānus</orth>, <itype>a, um</itype>, <pos>adj.</pos>, <hi rend="ital">Germanic</hi>, <hi rend="ital">German</hi> (<usg type="style">poet.</usg>): <cit><quote lang="la">herbae,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,004:3:163" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ov.</author> A. A. 3, 163</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">pubes,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0969,001:6:44" default="NO"><author>Pers.</author> 6, 44</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n19502.3" n="B" level="2"> <orth extent="full" lang="la">Germānĭa</orth>, <itype>ae</itype>, <gen>f.</gen>, <hi rend="ital">the country of the Germans</hi>, <hi rend="ital">Germany</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0448,001:4:4" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Caes.</author> B. G. 4, 4</bibl>; <bibl default="NO">5, 13</bibl>; <bibl default="NO">6, 11</bibl>; 24 sq.; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0448,002:1:7" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> B. C. 1, 7</bibl>; <bibl default="NO">3, 87</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0893,001:4:5:26" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Hor.</author> C. 4, 5, 26</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0893,003:16:7 al" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Epod. 16, 7 al.</bibl> —Divided into <hi rend="ital">Upper</hi> and <hi rend="ital">Lower Germany</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">superior,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1351,005:1:31" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Tac.</author> A. 1, 31</bibl></cit>; <bibl default="NO">6, 30</bibl>; <bibl default="NO">12, 27</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1351,004:1:12 al" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> H. 1, 12 al.</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">inferior,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1351,005:1:31" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> A. 1, 31</bibl></cit>; <bibl default="NO">4, 73</bibl>; <bibl default="NO">11, 18</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1351,004:1:9" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> H. 1, 9</bibl>; <bibl default="NO">52</bibl> sq.; <cit><quote lang="la">also called Germania prima and secunda,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Amm.</author> 15, 11, 7 sq.</bibl></cit>— <usg type="style">Transf.</usg>, = Germani, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,002:1:509" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> G. 1, 509</bibl>.— Hence, in <number>plur.</number>: <orth extent="full" lang="la">Germānĭae</orth>, <itype>ārum</itype>, <gen>f.</gen>, <hi rend="ital">the whole of Germany</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1351,005:1:34" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Tac.</author> A. 1, 34</bibl>; <bibl default="NO">46</bibl>; <bibl default="NO">57</bibl>; 2, 26, 73; 3, 46 et saep.—</sense><sense id="n19502.4" n="C" level="2"> <orth extent="full" lang="la">Germānĭ-cus</orth>, <itype>a, um</itype>, <pos>adj.</pos>, <hi rend="ital">of</hi> or <hi rend="ital">belonging to the Germans</hi>, <hi rend="ital">Germanic</hi>, <hi rend="ital">German.</hi> </sense><sense id="n19502.5" n="1" level="3"> <hi rend="ital">Adj.</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">saltus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:9:36" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 9, 36</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">mare,</quote> <trans><tr>the Baltic</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:4:103" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 4, 16, 30, § 103</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">gentes,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:4:98" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> 4, 13, 28, § 98</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">sermo,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1348,001:life=cal.:47" default="NO"><author>Suet.</author> Calig. 47</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">bellum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0448,001:4:16" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Caes.</author> B. G. 4, 16</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1348,001:life=aug.:20" default="NO"><author>Suet.</author> Aug. 20</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1348,001:life=tib.:9 al" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Tib. 9 al.</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">exercitus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1351,005:1:22" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Tac.</author> A. 1, 22</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1351,004:1:19" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> H. 1, 19</bibl>; <bibl default="NO">26 al.</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">expeditio (Caligulae),</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1348,001:life=cal.:43" default="NO"><author>Suet.</author> Calig. 43</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">victoria,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1348,001:life=vesp.:2" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Vesp. 2</bibl></cit>: Calendae, i. e. <hi rend="ital">the</hi> 1<hi rend="ital">st of September</hi> (named Germanicus on account of the victory obtained over the Germans), <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1294,001:9:2:4" default="NO"><author>Mart.</author> 9, 2, 4</bibl> (cf. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1348,001:life=cal.:15" default="NO"><author>Suet.</author> Calig. 15</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1348,001:life=dom.:13" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Dom. 13</bibl>; and <bibl default="NO"><author>Macr.</author> S. 1, 12</bibl>): <cit><quote lang="la">persona,</quote> <trans><tr>a clay figure of a German</tr>, <tr>as a bugbear for Roman children</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1294,001:14:176" default="NO"><author>Mart.</author> 14, 176</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n19502.6" n="2" level="3"> <hi rend="ital">Subst.</hi>: <orth extent="full" lang="la">Germānĭcus</orth>, <itype>i</itype>, <gen>m.</gen> </sense><sense id="n19502.7" n="a" level="4"> <hi rend="ital">A surname of several generals who gained victories over the Germans.</hi>—Esp. </sense><sense id="n19502.8" n="(a)" level="5"> Nero Claudius Drusus Germanicus, <hi rend="ital">the son of Livia</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1348,001:life=cl.:1 sq" default="NO"><author>Suet.</author> Claud. 1 sq.</bibl>; <bibl default="NO">27</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1348,001:life=vit.:8" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Vit. 8</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1348,001:life=dom.:13" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Dom. 13</bibl>; <bibl default="NO"><author>Spart.</author> Carac. 5</bibl>.—</sense><sense id="n19502.9" n="(b)" level="5"> Germanicus Caesar, <hi rend="ital">son of the preceding</hi>, <hi rend="ital">and brother of the emperor Claudius</hi>, <bibl default="NO"><author>Suet.</author> Cal. 1</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1351,005:1:35 al" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Tac.</author> A. 1, 35 al.</bibl> He translated the <hi rend="ital">Phaenomena</hi> of Aratus, <bibl default="NO"><author>Lact.</author> 1, 21, 38</bibl>.—</sense><sense id="n19502.10" n="b" level="4"> (sc. nummus), <hi rend="ital">a gold coin struck by the emperor Domitian</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1276,001:6:205" default="NO"><author>Juv.</author> 6, 205</bibl>.—</sense><sense id="n19502.11" n="D" level="2"> <orth extent="full" lang="la">Ger-mānĭcĭānus</orth>, <itype>a, um</itype>, <pos>adj.</pos>, <hi rend="ital">stationed</hi> or <hi rend="ital">serving in Germany</hi> (post-Aug. and only milit.): <cit><quote lang="la">exercitus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1348,001:life=otho:8" default="NO"><author>Suet.</author> Oth. 8</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1348,001:life=vesp.:6" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Vesp. 6</bibl>; <bibl default="NO"><author>Eutr.</author> 7, 11</bibl>.—Also <hi rend="ital">absol.</hi>: <orth extent="full" lang="la">Germānĭciā-ni</orth>, <itype>ōrum</itype>, <gen>m.</gen>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1348,001:life=tib.:25" default="NO"><author>Suet.</author> Tib. 25</bibl>; Galb. 20.—</sense><sense id="n19502.12" n="E" level="2"> <orth extent="full" lang="la">Germānĭcĭensis</orth>, <itype>e</itype>, <pos>adj.</pos>, <hi rend="ital">German</hi>, <hi rend="ital">Germanic</hi>, <bibl default="NO"><author>Cassiod.</author> Hist. Eccl. 12, 4</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
germanitas: <entryFree id="n19503" type="main" key="germa_ni^tas"><orth extent="full" lang="la">germānĭtas</orth>, <itype>ātis</itype>, <gen>f.</gen> <etym>1. germanus</etym>, <sense id="n19503.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">the relation between brothers and sisters</hi>, <hi rend="ital">brotherhood</hi>, <hi rend="ital">sisterhood.</hi> </sense><sense id="n19503.1" n="I" level="1"> <usg type="style">Lit.</usg>: <cit><quote lang="la">moveant te horum lacrimae, moveat pietas, moveat germanitas,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,033:11:33" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Lig. 11, 33</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">subituram vobis aliquando germanitatis memoriam (between Perseus and Demetrius as sons of Philip),</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:40:8:10" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 40, 8, 10</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">nexus germanitatis,</quote> <trans><tr>the bond of sisterhood</tr>,</trans> <bibl default="NO"><author>App.</author> M. 2, p. 115</bibl></cit>; cf.: <cit><quote lang="la">inter Judam et Israël,</quote> <trans><tr>brotherhood</tr>, <tr>amity</tr>,</trans> <bibl default="NO"><author>Vulg.</author> Zech. 11, 14</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n19503.2" n="II" level="1"> <usg type="style">Transf.</usg> </sense><sense id="n19503.3" n="A" level="2"> <hi rend="ital">The relationship of the inhabitants of cities which are colonies of one mother-city</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">ab ea germanitate fraternam sibi cum iis caritatem esse,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:37:56:7" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 37, 56, 7</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n19503.4" n="B" level="2"> Of inanim. and abstr. things, <hi rend="ital">a union</hi>, <hi rend="ital">resemblance</hi>, <hi rend="ital">similarity</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">unde nomen ambobus (Bosporis) et jam quaedam in dissociatione germanitas concors,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:6:2" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 6, 1, 1, § 2</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">malorum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:15:51" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> 15, 14, 15, § 51</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">vini,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:14:59" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> 14, 6, 8, § 59</bibl></cit>: <cb n="GERM" /> digitorum, speciosa germanitas, of the toes, Lact. Opif. Dei, 13, 8.—</sense><sense id="n19503.5" n="C" level="2"> <hi rend="ital">A sister</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">germanitatis stupra,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,021:20:42" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Har. Resp. 20, 42</bibl></cit>; <bibl default="NO"><author>App.</author> M. 5, p. 171, 5</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
germanitus: <entryFree id="n19504" type="main" key="germa_ni^tus"><orth extent="full" lang="la">germānĭtus</orth>, <pos>adv.</pos> <etym>1. germanus</etym>, <sense id="n19504.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">in a brotherly manner</hi>, <hi rend="ital">faithfully</hi>, <hi rend="ital">truly</hi> (anteand post-class.): <cit><quote lang="la">germanitus fideliter, dictum a germanitate,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Non.</author> 118, 14</bibl></cit>; Pompon. ap. Non. l. l.; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,2468,001:Ep. 120:34" default="NO"><author>Aug.</author> Ep. 120, 34</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
germanus: <entryFree id="n19505" type="main" key="germa_nus1" n="1"><orth extent="full" lang="la">germānus</orth>, <itype>a, um</itype>, <pos>adj.</pos> <etym>v. germen</etym>, of brothers and sisters who have the same parents, or at least the same father, <sense id="n19505.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">full</hi>, <hi rend="ital">own</hi> (very freq. and class.). </sense><sense id="n19505.1" n="I" level="1"> <usg type="style">Lit.</usg> </sense><sense id="n19505.2" n="A" level="2"> <hi rend="ital">Adj.</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">spes mihi est vos inventuros fratres germanos duos Geminos, una matre natos et patre uno uno die,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,010:5:9:43" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Men. 5, 9, 43</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">frater,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,005:5:4:18" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Capt. 5, 4, 18</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0134,001:1:5:57" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ter.</author> And. 1, 5, 57</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,007:17:36" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Font. 17, 36</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,005:1:49:section=128" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Verr. 2, 1, 49, § 128</bibl>; v. frater; <cit><quote lang="la">and cf.: L. Cicero frater noster, cognatione patruelis, amore germanus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,048:5:1:1" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Fin. 5, 1, 1</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">soror germana,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,003:2:1:3" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Aul. 2, 1, 3</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,020:2:4:87" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Truc. 2, 4, 87</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,031:27:73" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Mil. 27, 73</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0588,005:1" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Nep.</author> Cim. 1</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">bimembres (i. e. Centauri),</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,006:12:240" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ov.</author> M. 12, 240</bibl></cit>.—<usg type="style">Poet.</usg>, to denote intimate friendship: soror, of a nurse, Enn. ap. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,053:1:20:40" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Div. 1, 20, 40</bibl> (Ann. v. 42 Vahl.); cf. also <hi rend="ital">absol.</hi>: germana, ib. (v. 48 Vahl.).—</sense><sense id="n19505.3" n="B" level="2"> <hi rend="ital">Subst.</hi>: <orth extent="full" lang="la">germānus</orth>, <itype>i</itype>, <gen>m.</gen>, and <orth extent="full" lang="la">germāna</orth>, <itype>ae</itype>, <gen>f.</gen>, <hi rend="ital">an own</hi> or <hi rend="ital">full brother</hi>, <hi rend="ital">own</hi> or <hi rend="ital">full sister</hi> (rare): <cit><quote lang="la">nunc tu mihi es germanus pariter corpore et animo,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0134,006:5:8:34" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ter.</author> Ad. 5, 8, 34</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">haec germanus Eryx quondam tuus arma gerebat,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,003:5:412" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> A. 5, 412</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,006:5:13" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ov.</author> M. 5, 13</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">germanae justa dat ante suae,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,007:3:560" default="NO"><author>id.</author> F. 3, 560</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,006:6:613" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> M. 6, 613</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">(Dryades) Omnes germanae Cererem cum vestibus atris Maerentes adeunt,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,010:8:781" default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 8, 781</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:tlg,0527,001:27:35 al" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Vulg.</author> Gen. 27, 35 al.</bibl>—<usg type="style">Poet.</usg>, of animals, Att. ap. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,053:1:22:44" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Div. 1, 22, 44</bibl>.—In a pun with Germanus, a German: <cit><quote lang="la">Cimber hic fuit, a quo fratrem necatum hoc Ciceronis dicto notatum est: Germanum Cimber occidit,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:8:3:29" default="NO"><author>Quint.</author> 8, 3, 29</bibl></cit>; so in <number>plur.</number>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1044,001:2:67" default="NO"><author>Vell.</author> 2, 67 <hi rend="ital">fin.</hi></bibl>—</sense><sense id="n19505.4" n="II" level="1"> <usg type="style">Transf.</usg> </sense><sense id="n19505.5" n="A" level="2"> <hi rend="ital">Of</hi> or <hi rend="ital">belonging to brothers and sisters</hi>, <hi rend="ital">brotherly</hi>, <hi rend="ital">sisterly</hi> (very rare); <cit><quote lang="la">nunc tu mihi amicus es in germanum modum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,006:3:4:25" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Cas. 3, 4, 25</bibl></cit>; so, <cit><quote lang="la">casus (fratrum),</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,2806,001:27:3" default="NO"><author>Just.</author> 27, 3 <hi rend="ital">fin.</hi></bibl></cit>—</sense><sense id="n19505.6" n="B" level="2"> In gen., <hi rend="ital">genuine</hi>, <hi rend="ital">real</hi>, <hi rend="ital">actual</hi>, <hi rend="ital">true</hi> (a favorite expression of Cicero): <cit><quote lang="la">illi veteres germanique Campani,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,011:2:35:97" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Agr. 2, 35, 97</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">germanos se putant esse Thucydidas,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,040:9:32" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Or. 9, 32</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">magni et germani Attici,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 26, 90</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">germani hujus artis magistri,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,037:2:38:160" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> de Or. 2, 38, 160</bibl></cit>; <cit><quote lang="la">germani Luperci,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,024:11:26" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Cael. 11, 26</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">scio me asinum germanum fuisse,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,057:4:5:3" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Att. 4, 5, 3</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">di (te) omnes perdant, oboluisti allium, Germana illuvies, rusticus, hircus, hara suis,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,013:1:1:39" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Most. 1, 1, 39</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">haec est mea et hujus fratris mei germana patria: hinc enim orti stirpe antiquissima sumus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,044:2:1:3" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Leg. 2, 1, 3</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">ille Theodoromedes fuit germano nomine,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,005:2:2:38" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Capt. 2, 2, 38</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">germana justitia,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,055:3:17:69" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Off. 3, 17, 69</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">haec germana ironia est,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,039:86:296" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Brut. 86, 296</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">gerrae germanae,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,015:1:1:9" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Poen. 1, 1, 9</bibl></cit>.—<hi rend="ital">Sup.</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">germanissimus Stoicus,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Ac. 2, 43, 132</bibl></cit>.—Hence, <pos>adv.</pos>: <orth extent="full" lang="la">germāne</orth>, <hi rend="ital">faithfully</hi>, <hi rend="ital">truly</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">germane fraterneque rescribere,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,058:2:15" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Q. Fr. 2, 15</bibl></cit>, b, 2; August. Civ. Dei, 2, 13.</sense></entryFree>
<entryFree id="n19506" type="main" key="Germa_nus2" n="2"><orth extent="full" lang="la">Germānus</orth>, <itype>a, um</itype>, v. Germani, II. A.</entryFree>
germen: <entryFree id="n19507" type="main" key="germen"><orth extent="full" lang="la">germen</orth>, <itype>ĭnis</itype>, <gen>n.</gen> <etym>Sanscr. root grabh-, grah-, to conceive; garbh-as, child; whence, <foreign lang="greek">bre/fos</foreign> (for <foreign lang="greek">gre/fos</foreign>), germanus, perh. gremium</etym>, <sense id="n19507.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a sprig</hi>, <hi rend="ital">offshoot</hi>, <hi rend="ital">sprout</hi>, <hi rend="ital">bud</hi> (<usg type="style">poet.</usg> and in post-Aug. prose). </sense><sense id="n19507.1" n="I" level="1"> <usg type="style">Lit.</usg>: <cit><quote lang="la">huc aliena ex arbore germen Includunt,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,002:2:76" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> G. 2, 76</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">serotino germine malus, tardissimo suber,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:16:98" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 16, 25, 41, § 98</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:tlg,0527,005:11:17" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Vulg.</author> Deut. 11, 17</bibl> et saep.—In <number>plur.</number>: <cit><quote lang="la">inque novos soles audent se germina tuto Credere,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,002:2:332" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> G. 2, 332</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:18:94" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 18, 10, 21, § 94</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">auctumni maturet germina Virgo,</quote> <trans><tr>fruits</tr>,</trans> <bibl default="NO"><author>Claud.</author> Laud. Stil. 2, 465</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">impleratque uterum generoso germine,</quote> <trans><tr>fœtus</tr>, <tr>embryo</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,006:9:280" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ov.</author> M. 9, 280</bibl></cit>; so, <cit><quote lang="la">celsa Tonantis,</quote> <trans>i. e. <tr>daughter</tr>,</trans> <bibl default="NO"><author>Claud.</author> Rapt. Pros. 2, 76</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">servile,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,2806,001:18:3" default="NO"><author>Just.</author> 18, 3 <hi rend="ital">fin.</hi></bibl></cit>; and of <hi rend="ital">puppies</hi>, <hi rend="ital">whelps</hi>, <bibl default="NO"><author>Nemes.</author> Cyneg. 155</bibl>.—</sense><sense id="n19507.2" n="B" level="2"> <usg type="style">Transf.</usg>: <cit><quote lang="la">cara maris,</quote> <trans>i. e. <tr>precious stones</tr>,</trans> <bibl default="NO"><author>Claud.</author> Ep. ad Ser. 14</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">frontis,</quote> <trans>i. e. <tr>a horn</tr>,</trans> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> Rapt. Pros. 1, 129</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n19507.3" n="II" level="1"> <usg type="style">Trop.</usg>, <hi rend="ital">a germ</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">rabies unde illaec germina surgunt,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0550,001:4:1083" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Lucr.</author> 4, 1083</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">germen ab aethere trahere,</quote> <trans><tr>origin</tr>,</trans> <bibl default="NO"><author>Prud.</author> Cath. 10, 32</bibl></cit>: germine nobilis Eulalia, id. <foreign lang="greek">stef</foreign>. 3, 1.</sense></entryFree>
germinasco: <entryFree id="n19508" type="main" key="germi^nasco"><orth extent="full" lang="la">germĭnasco</orth>, <itype>ĕre</itype>, <sense id="n19508.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">v. inch. n.</hi> [germen], <hi rend="ital">to sprout</hi>, <hi rend="ital">shoot</hi>, Ambros. de Caïn et Abel, 2, 8, § 26. <pb n="812" /> <cb n="GERO" /></sense></entryFree>
germinatio: <entryFree id="n19509" type="main" key="germi^na_ti^o"><orth extent="full" lang="la">germĭnātĭo</orth>, <itype>ōnis</itype>, <gen>f.</gen> <etym>germino</etym>, <sense id="n19509.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a sprouting forth</hi>, <hi rend="ital">budding</hi>, <hi rend="ital">germination.</hi> </sense><sense id="n19509.1" n="I" level="1"> <usg type="style">Lit.</usg>: <cit><quote lang="la">palmitis,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0845,001:4:24:18" default="NO"><author>Col.</author> 4, 24, 18</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">tria tempora germinationis,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:17:134" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 17, 18, 30, § 134</bibl></cit>; cf. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:16:98" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> 16, 25, 41, § 98</bibl>.—In <number>plur.</number>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:17:16" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 17, 2, 2, § 16</bibl>. —</sense><sense id="n19509.2" n="II" level="1"> <usg type="style">Transf.</usg>, concr., <hi rend="ital">a sprout</hi>, <hi rend="ital">shoot</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">accumuletur germinatio terrā, donec robur planta capiat,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:17:124" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 17, 17, 28, § 124</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
germinatus: <entryFree id="n19510" type="main" key="germi^na_tus"><orth extent="full" lang="la">germĭnātus</orth>, <itype>ūs</itype>, <gen>m.</gen> <etym>id.</etym>, <sense id="n19510.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a sprouting forth</hi>, <hi rend="ital">putting forth</hi>, <hi rend="ital">germination</hi> (less freq. than germinatio): <cit><quote lang="la">oleam, si capra depaverit primo germinatu, sterilescere,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:15:34" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 15, 8, 8, § 34</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">serotino quaedam germinatu florent maturantque celeriter,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:16:102" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> 16, 25, 41, § 102</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
germino: <entryFree id="n19511" type="main" key="germi^no"><orth extent="full" lang="la">germĭno</orth>, <itype>āvi, ātum, 1</itype>, <pos>v. n.</pos> and <sense id="n19511.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a.</hi> [germen] (post-Aug.). </sense><sense id="n19511.1" n="I" level="1"> <hi rend="ital">Neutr.</hi>, <hi rend="ital">to sprout forth</hi>, <hi rend="ital">put forth</hi>, <hi rend="ital">bud</hi>, <hi rend="ital">germinate</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">asparagus altissime germinat,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:19:146" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 19, 8, 42, § 146</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:13:129" default="NO" valid="yes">13, 24, 46, § 129</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:16:97" default="NO" valid="yes">16, 25, 41, § 97</bibl> sqq. et saep. —</sense><sense id="n19511.2" n="II" level="1"> <hi rend="ital">Act.</hi>, <hi rend="ital">to put forth</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">pennas,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:30:101" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 30, 11, 30, § 101</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">capillum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:7:42" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> 7, 6, 5, § 42</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n19511.3" n="2" level="3"> <hi rend="ital">to beget</hi>, <hi rend="ital">produce</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:tlg,0527,048:45:8" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Vulg.</author> Isa. 45, 8</bibl>; <bibl default="NO">61, 11</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
gero: <entryFree id="n19512" type="main" key="ge^ro1" n="1"><orth extent="full" lang="la">gĕro</orth>, <itype>gessi, gestum</itype> (<sense id="n19512.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">Part. gen. plur. sync.</hi> gerentum, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,020:2:1:13" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Truc. 2, 1, 13</bibl>; <hi rend="ital">imper.</hi> ger, like dic, duc, fac, fer, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0472,001:27:2" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cat.</author> 27, 2</bibl>), <itype>3</itype>, <pos>v. a.</pos> <etym>root gas-, to come, go; Zend, jah, jahaiti, come; gero (for geso), in caus. sense, to cause to come; cf. Gr. <foreign lang="greek">basta/zw</foreign>, from <foreign lang="greek">bastos</foreign> = gestus</etym>, <hi rend="ital">to bear about with one</hi>, <hi rend="ital">to bear</hi>, <hi rend="ital">carry</hi>, <hi rend="ital">to wear</hi>, <hi rend="ital">have</hi> (in the lit. signif. mostly <usg type="style">poet.</usg>, not in Cic., Cæs., Sall., or Quint.; but instead of it ferre, portare, vehere, sustinere, etc.; but in the trop. signif. freq. and class.). </sense><sense id="n19512.1" n="I" level="1"> <usg type="style">Lit.</usg> </sense><sense id="n19512.2" n="A" level="2"> In gen.: <cit><quote lang="la">(vestem ferinam) qui gessit primus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0550,001:5:1420" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Lucr.</author> 5, 1420</bibl></cit>; so, <cit><quote lang="la">vestem,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,006:11:276" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ov.</author> M. 11, 276</bibl></cit> (with induere vestes), <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0588,014:3" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Nep.</author> Dat. 3</bibl>; cf.: <cit><quote lang="la">coronam Olympiacam capite,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1348,001:life=nero:25" default="NO"><author>Suet.</author> Ner. 25</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">ornamenta,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1348,001:life=jul.:84" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Caes. 84</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">angues immixtos crinibus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,006:4:792" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ov.</author> M. 4, 792</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">clipeum (laeva),</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,010:4:782" default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 4, 782</bibl></cit>; cf.: <cit><quote lang="la">galeam venatoriam in capite, clavam dextra manu, copulam sinistra,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0588,014:3" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Nep.</author> Dat. 3</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">ramum, jaculum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,006:12:442" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ov.</author> M. 12, 442</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">spicea serta,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,010:2:28" default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 2, 28</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">vincla,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,010:4:681" default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 4, 681</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">venabula corpore fixa,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,010:9:206" default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 9, 206</bibl></cit>; cf.: <cit><quote lang="la">tela (in pectore fixus),</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,010:6:228" default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 6, 228</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">Vulcanum (i. e. ignem) in cornu conclusum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,001:1:1:185" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Am. 1, 1, 185</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">spolia ducis hostium caesi suspensa fabricato ad id apte ferculo gerens,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:1:10:5" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 1, 10, 5</bibl></cit>; cf.: <cit><quote lang="la">Horatius trigemina spolia prae se gerens,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:1:26:2" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> 1, 26, 2</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">onera,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0684,001:L. L. 6:section=77" default="NO"><author>Varr.</author> L. L. 6, § 77</bibl></cit> Müll.: uterum or partum gerere, <hi rend="ital">to be pregnant</hi>, <hi rend="ital">be with young;</hi> so, gerere partum, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:8:187" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 8, 47, 72, § 187</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">uterum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:8:151" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> 8, 40, 62, § 151</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">centum fronte oculos centum cervice gerebat Argus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,001:3:4:19" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ov.</author> Am. 3, 4, 19</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">lumen unum media fronte,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,006:13:773" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> M. 13, 773</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">cornua fronte,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,010:15:596" default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 15, 596</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">virginis os habitumque gerens et virginis arma,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,003:1:315" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> A. 1, 315</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">virginis ora,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,006:5:553" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ov.</author> M. 5, 553</bibl></cit>; cf.: <cit><quote lang="la">quae modo bracchia gessit, Crura gerit,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,010:5:455" default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 5, 455</bibl></cit> sq.: <cit><quote lang="la">Coae cornua matres Gesserunt tum,</quote> <trans>i. e. <tr>were turned into cows</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,010:7:364" default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 7, 364</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">principio (morbi) caput incensum fervore gerebant,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0550,001:6:1145" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Lucr.</author> 6, 1145</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">qui umbrata gerunt civili tempora quercu,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,003:6:772" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> A. 6, 772</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">tempora tecta pelle lupi,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,006:12:380" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ov.</author> M. 12, 380</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">(Hector) squalentem barbam et concretos sanguine crines Vulneraque illa gerens, quae, etc.,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,003:2:278" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> A. 2, 278</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">capella gerat distentius uber,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0893,004:1:1:110" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Hor.</author> S. 1, 1, 110</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n19512.3" n="b" level="4"> Of inanimate things: <cit><quote lang="la">semina rerum permixta gerit tellus discretaque tradit,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0550,001:6:790" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Lucr.</author> 6, 790</bibl></cit>; cf.: <cit><quote lang="la">(terram) multosque lacus multasque lacunas In gremio gerere et rupes deruptaque saxa,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0550,001:ib. 6:539" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> ib. 6, 539</bibl></cit>; Enn. ap. <bibl default="NO"><author>Non.</author> 66, 26</bibl> (Sat. 23, p. 157 Vahl.); and: <cit><quote lang="la">quos Oceano propior gerit India lucos,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,002:2:122" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> G. 2, 122</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">speciem ac formam similem gerit ejus imago,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0550,001:4:52" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Lucr.</author> 4, 52</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n19512.4" n="B" level="2"> In partic. (very rare). </sense><sense id="n19512.5" n="1" level="3"> With respect to the term. ad quem, <hi rend="ital">to bear</hi>, <hi rend="ital">carry</hi>, <hi rend="ital">bring</hi> to a place: <cit><quote lang="la">(feminae puerique) saxa in muros munientibus gerunt,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:28:19:13" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 28, 19, 13</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">neque eam voraginem conjectu terrae, cum pro se quisque gereret, expleri potuisse,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:7:6:2" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> 7, 6, 2</bibl></cit>; cf. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:37:5:1" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> 37, 5, 1</bibl>. —<usg type="style"><hi rend="ital">Absol.</hi></usg>: <cit><quote lang="la">si non habebis unde irriges, gerito inditoque leniter,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Cato</author>, R. R. 151, 4</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:7:6:2" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 7, 6, 2</bibl> Drak.—Prov.: <cit><quote lang="la">non pluris refert, quam si imbrem in cribrum geras,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,016:1:1:100" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Ps. 1, 1, 100</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n19512.6" n="2" level="3"> With the accessory idea of production, <hi rend="ital">to bear</hi>, <hi rend="ital">bring forth</hi>, <hi rend="ital">produce</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">quae (terra) quod gerit fruges, Ceres (appellata est),</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0684,001:L. L. 5:section=64" default="NO"><author>Varr.</author> L. L. 5, § 64</bibl></cit> Müll.; cf. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0660,001:2:4:56" default="NO"><author>Tib.</author> 2, 4, 56</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">violam nullo terra serente gerit,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,008:3:12:6" default="NO"><author>Ov.</author> Tr. 3, 12, 6</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">arbores (Oete),</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,006:9:230" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> M. 9, 230</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">malos (platani),</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,002:2:70" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> G. 2, 70</bibl></cit>: <cb n="GERO" /> frondes (silva), <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,006:11:615" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ov.</author> M. 11, 615</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">terra viros urbesque gerit silvasque ferasque Fluminaque et Nymphas et cetera numina ruris,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,006:2:16" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ov.</author> M. 2, 16</bibl></cit>.</sense><sense id="n19512.7" n="II" level="1"> <usg type="style">Trop.</usg> </sense><sense id="n19512.8" n="A" level="2"> In gen., <hi rend="ital">to bear</hi>, <hi rend="ital">have</hi>, <hi rend="ital">entertain</hi>, <hi rend="ital">cherish</hi>: vos etenim juvenes animum geritis muliebrem, illa virago viri, Poët. ap. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,055:1:18:61" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Off. 1, 18, 61</bibl>; cf.: <cit><quote lang="la">fortem animum gerere,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0631,001:J. 107:1" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Sall.</author> J. 107, 1</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">parem animum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0631,001:ib. 54:1" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> ib. 54, 1</bibl></cit> Kritz.: <cit><quote lang="la">animum invictum advorsum divitias,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0631,001:ib. 43:5" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> ib. 43, 5</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">animum super fortunam,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0631,001:ib. 64:2" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> ib. 64, 2</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">mixtum gaudio ac metu animum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:32:11:5" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 32, 11, 5</bibl></cit>; cf. also <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,003:9:311" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> A. 9, 311</bibl>; and <xr><lbl>v.</lbl> <ref type="sym" targOrder="U">infra</ref></xr> B. 3.: aeque inimicitiam atque amicitiam in frontem promptam gero, Enn. ap. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1254,001:19:8:6" default="NO"><author>Gell.</author> 19, 8, 6</bibl> (Trag. v. 8 Vahl.): <cit><quote lang="la">personam,</quote> <trans><tr>to support a character</tr>, <tr>play a part</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,055:1:32:115" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Off. 1, 32, 115</bibl></cit>; cf.: <cit><quote lang="la">est igitur proprium munus magistratus, intelligere, se gerere personam civitatis debereque ejus dignitatem et decus sustinere,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 1, 34, 132</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,2468,001:Doctr. Christ. 4:29" default="NO"><author>Aug.</author> Doctr. Christ. 4, 29 <hi rend="ital">init.</hi></bibl>; <cit><quote lang="la">id. Civ. Dei, 1, 21 al.: mores, quos ante gerebant, Nunc quoque habent,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,006:7:655" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ov.</author> M. 7, 655</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">et nos aliquod nomenque decusque Gessimus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,003:2:89" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> A. 2, 89</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">seu tu querelas sive geris jocos Seu rixam et insanos amores Seu facilem, pia testa (i. e. amphora), somnum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0893,001:3:21:2" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Hor.</author> C. 3, 21, 2</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">in dextris vestris jam libertatem, opem ... geritis,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0860,001:4:14" default="NO"><author>Curt.</author> 4, 14 <hi rend="ital">fin.</hi></bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">plumbeas iras,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,015:3:6:18" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Poen. 3, 6, 18</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">iras,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0134,005:3:1:30" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ter.</author> Hec. 3, 1, 30</bibl></cit>: M. Catonem illum Sapientem cum multis graves inimicitias gessisse accepimus propter Hispanorum injurias, Cic. Div. ap. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0013,001:20:66" default="NO"><author>Caecil.</author> 20, 66</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">veteres inimicitias cum Caesare,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0448,002:1:3:4" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Caes.</author> B. C. 1, 3, 4</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">muliebres inimicitias cum aliqua,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,024:14:32" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Cael. 14, 32</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">inimicitias hominum more,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,034:11:30" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Deiot. 11, 30</bibl></cit>: simultatem cum aliquo pro re publica, Anton. ap. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,057:14:13" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Att. 14, 13</bibl>, A, 3; cf. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1348,001:life=vesp.:6" default="NO"><author>Suet.</author> Vesp. 6</bibl>; and <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,003:12:48" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> A. 12, 48</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">de amicitia gerenda praeclarissime scripti libri,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,056:3:8:5" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Fam. 3, 8, 5</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">amicitiam,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0588,014:10" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Nep.</author> Dat. 10 <hi rend="ital">fin.</hi></bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">praecipuum in Romanos gerebant odium,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:28:22:2" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 28, 22, 2</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">cum fortuna mutabilem gerentes fidem,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:8:24:6" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> 8, 24, 6</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">utrique imperii cupiditatem insatiabilem gerebant,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,2806,001:17:1" default="NO"><author>Just.</author> 17, 1</bibl></cit> <hi rend="ital">fin. —Absol.</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">ad ea rex, aliter atque animo gerebat, placide respondit,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0631,001:J. 72:1" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Sall.</author> J. 72, 1</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n19512.9" n="B" level="2"> In partic. </sense><sense id="n19512.10" n="1" level="3"> Gerere se aliquo modo, <hi rend="ital">to bear</hi>, <hi rend="ital">deport</hi>, <hi rend="ital">behave</hi>, or <hi rend="ital">conduct one's self</hi>, <hi rend="ital">to act</hi> in any manner: <cit><quote lang="la">in maximis rebus quonam modo gererem me adversus Caesarem, usus tuo consilio sum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,056:11:27:5" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Fam. 11, 27, 5</bibl></cit>; cf. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,055:1:28:98" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Off. 1, 28, 98</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">ut, quanto superiores sumus, tanto nos geramus summissius,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 1, 26, 90</bibl></cit>; so, <cit><quote lang="la">se liberius (servi),</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,043:1:43" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Rep. 1, 43</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">se inconsultius,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:41:10:5" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 41, 10, 5</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">se valde honeste,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,057:6:1:13" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Att. 6, 1, 13</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">se perdite,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 9, 2</bibl></cit>, A, 2: <cit><quote lang="la">se turpissime (illa pars animi),</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,049:2:21:48" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Tusc. 2, 21, 48</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">se turpiter in legatione,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1318,001:2:12:4" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> Ep. 2, 12, 4</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">sic in provincia nos gerimus, quod ad abstinentiam attinet, ut, etc.,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,057:5:17:2" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Att. 5, 17, 2</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">sic me in hoc magistratu geram, ut, etc.,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,011:1:8:26" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Agr. 1, 8, 26</bibl></cit>; cf.: <cit><quote lang="la">nunc ita nos gerimus, ut, etc.,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 2, 22, 3</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">uti sese victus gereret, exploratum misit,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0631,001:J. 54:2" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Sall.</author> J. 54, 2</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">se medium gerere,</quote> <trans><tr>to remain neutral</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:2:27:3" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 2, 27, 3</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n19512.11" n="b" level="4"> In a like sense also post-class.: gerere aliquem, <hi rend="ital">to behave</hi> or <hi rend="ital">conduct one's self as</hi> any one (like agere aliquem): <cit><quote lang="la">nec heredem regni sed regem gerebat,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,2806,001:32:3:1" default="NO"><author>Just.</author> 32, 3, 1</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1318,002:44:2" default="NO"><author>Plin.</author> Pan. 44, 2</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">tu civem patremque geras,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Claud.</author> IV. Cons. Hon. 293</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">aedilem,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>App.</author> M. 1, p. 113</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">captivum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1014,001:Troad. 714" default="NO"><author>Sen.</author> Troad. 714</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n19512.12" n="c" level="4"> Gerere se et aliquem, <hi rend="ital">to treat</hi> one's self and another in any manner: <cit><quote lang="la">interim Romae gaudium ingens ortum cognitis Metelli rebus, ut seque et exercitum more majorum gereret,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0631,001:J. 55:1" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Sall.</author> J. 55, 1</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">meque vosque in omnibus rebus juxta geram,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0631,001:ib. 85:47" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> ib. 85, 47</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n19512.13" n="d" level="4"> Pro aliquo se gerere, <hi rend="ital">to assume to be</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">querentes, quosdam non sui generis pro colonis se gerere,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:32:2:6" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 32, 2, 6</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">eum, qui sit census, ita se jam tum gessisse pro cive,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,016:5:11" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Arch. 5, 11</bibl></cit> dub.—</sense><sense id="n19512.14" n="2" level="3"> Gerere prae se aliquid (for the usual prae se ferre), <hi rend="ital">to show</hi>, <hi rend="ital">exhibit</hi>, <hi rend="ital">manifest</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">affectionis ratio perspicuam solet prae se gerere conjecturam, ut amor, iracundia, molestia, etc.,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,036:2:9:30" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Inv. 2, 9, 30</bibl></cit>; cf.: <cit><quote lang="la">prae se quandam gerere utilitatem,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 2, 52, 157</bibl></cit>: animum altum et erectum prae se gerebat, Auct. B. Afr. 10 <hi rend="ital">fin.</hi>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,2468,001:de Lib. Arbit. 3:21:61 al" default="NO"><author>Aug.</author> de Lib.
