Arbit. 3, 21, 61 al.</bibl>; <cit><quote lang="la">so gerere alone: ita tum mos erat, in adversis voltum secundae fortunae gerere, moderari animo in secundis,</quote> <trans><tr>to assume</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:42:63:11" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 42, 63, 11</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n19512.15" n="3" level="3"> With the accessory idea of activity or exertion, <hi rend="ital">to sustain the charge of</hi> any undertaking or business, <cb n="GERO" /> <hi rend="ital">to administer</hi>, <hi rend="ital">manage</hi>, <hi rend="ital">regulate</hi>, <hi rend="ital">rule</hi>, <hi rend="ital">govern</hi>, <hi rend="ital">conduct</hi>, <hi rend="ital">carry on</hi>, <hi rend="ital">wage</hi>, <hi rend="ital">transact</hi>, <hi rend="ital">accomplish</hi>, <hi rend="ital">perform</hi> (cf.: facio, ago).—In <hi rend="ital">pass.</hi> also in gen., <hi rend="ital">to happen</hi>, <hi rend="ital">take place</hi>, <hi rend="ital">be done</hi> (hence, res gesta, <hi rend="ital">a deed</hi>, and res gestae, <hi rend="ital">events</hi>, <hi rend="ital">occurrences</hi>, <hi rend="ital">acts</hi>, <hi rend="ital">exploits;</hi> <xr><lbl>v.</lbl> <ref type="sym" targOrder="U">the foll.</ref></xr>): tertium gradum agendi esse dicunt, ubi quid faciant; <cit><quote lang="la">in eo propter similitudinem agendi et faciundi et gerundi quidam error his, qui putant esse unum. Potest enim aliquid facere et non agere, ut poëta facit fabulam et non agit: contra actor agit et non facit. ... Contra imperator quod dicitur res gerere, in eo neque facit neque agit, sed gerit, id est sustinet, translatum ab his qui onera gerunt, quod hi sustinent,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0684,001:L. L. 6:section=77" default="NO"><author>Varr.</author> L. L. 6, § 77</bibl></cit> Müll.: <cit><quote lang="la">omnia nostra, quoad eris Romae, ita gerito, regito, gubernato, ut nihil a me exspectes,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,057:16:2:2" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Att. 16, 2, 2</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">gerere et administrare rem publicam,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,048:3:20:68" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Fin. 3, 20, 68</bibl></cit>; cf. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,043:2:1" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Rep. 2, 1</bibl> and 12: <cit><quote lang="la">rem publicam,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 1, 7</bibl></cit>; 1, 8; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,056:2:7:3" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Fam. 2, 7, 3</bibl> et saep.: <cit><quote lang="la">magistratum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,022:37:79" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Sest. 37, 79</bibl></cit>; cf. <cit><quote lang="la">potestatem,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,005:2:55:section=138" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Verr. 2, 2, 55, § 138</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">consulatum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,011:1:8:25" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Agr. 1, 8, 25</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,022:16:37" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Sest. 16, 37</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">duumviratum,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 8, 19</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">tutelam alicujus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,2806,001:23:2:68" default="NO"><author>Dig.</author> 23, 2, 68</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,2806,001:27:1:22 al" default="NO">27, 1, 22 al.</bibl>: multi suam rem bene gessere et publicam patria procul, Enn. ap. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,056:7:6:1" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Fam. 7, 6, 1</bibl> (Trag. v. 295 Vahl.); so, <cit><quote lang="la">rem, of private affairs,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,014:4:3:34" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Pers. 4, 3, 34</bibl></cit>; <bibl default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> de Sen. 7, 22 al.</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">aliquid per aes et libram gerere,</quote> <trans><tr>to transact by coin and balance</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1251,001:Inst. 3:173" default="NO"><author>Gai.</author> Inst. 3, 173</bibl></cit>; cf. Weissenb. ad <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:6:14" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 6, 14</bibl>.—Of war: etsi res bene gesta est, Enn. ap. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,037:3:42:168" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> de Or. 3, 42, 168</bibl> (Ann. v. 512 Vahl.): vi geritur res, id. ap. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1254,001:20:10" default="NO"><author>Gell.</author> 20, 10</bibl> (Ann. v. 272 ib.); cf.: <cit><quote lang="la">gladiis geri res coepta est,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:28:2:6" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 28, 2, 6</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">ubi res ferro geratur,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:10:39:12" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> 10, 39, 12</bibl></cit>: qui rem cum Achivis gesserunt statim, Enn. ap. <bibl default="NO"><author>Non.</author> 393, 14</bibl> (Trag. v. 39 Vahl.); cf. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,001:1:1:84" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Am. 1, 1, 84</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">Alexander ... passurus gestis aequanda pericula rebus,</quote> <trans><tr>exploits</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1276,001:14:314" default="NO"><author>Juv.</author> 14, 314</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">miranda quidem, sed nuper gesta referemus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1276,001:15:28" default="NO"><author>id.</author> 15, 28</bibl></cit>.—Of public affairs, affairs of government: <cit><quote lang="la">magnae res temporibus illis a fortissimis viris summo imperio praeditis, dictatoribus atque consulibus, belli domique gerebantur,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,043:2:32" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Rep. 2, 32 <hi rend="ital">fin.</hi></bibl></cit>; <bibl default="NO">2, 24</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">a rebus gerendis senectus abstrahit,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> de Sen. 6, 15</bibl></cit>; cf. § 17: quid quod homines infima fortuna, nulla spe rerum gerendarum (<hi rend="ital">public business</hi>), opifices denique, delectantur historia? maximeque eos videre possumus res gestas (<hi rend="ital">public events</hi> or <hi rend="ital">occurrences</hi>) audire et legere velle, qui a spe gerendi absunt, confecti senectute, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,048:5:19:52" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Fin. 5, 19, 52</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">sin per se populus interfecit aut ejecit tyrannum, est moderatior, quoad sentit et sapit et sua re gesta laetatur,</quote> <trans><tr>their deed</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,043:1:42" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Rep. 1, 42</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">ut pleraque senatus auctoritate gererentur,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 2, 32</bibl></cit>; cf. <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 1, 27</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">haec dum Romae geruntur,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> Quint. 6, 28</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">ut iis, qui audiunt, tum geri illa fierique videantur,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,037:2:59:241" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> de Or. 2, 59, 241</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">susceptum negotium,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,056:13:5:1" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Fam. 13, 5, 1</bibl></cit>; cf.: <cit><quote lang="la">si ipse negotium meum gererem, nihil gererem, nisi consilio tuo,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,057:13:3:1" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Att. 13, 3, 1</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">negotium bene, male, etc.,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,003:11:32" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Rosc. Com. 11, 32</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,013:2:10:21" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Cat. 2, 10, 21</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0448,001:3:18:5" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Caes.</author> B. G. 3, 18, 5</bibl> et saep.; cf.: <cit><quote lang="la">quid negotii geritur?</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Quint. 13, 42</bibl></cit>: annos multos bellum gerentes summum summā industriā, Enn. ap. <bibl default="NO"><author>Non.</author> 402, 3</bibl> (Trag. v. 104 Vahl.); cf.: <cit><quote lang="la">bello illo maximo, quod Athenienses et Lacedaemonii summa inter se contentione gesserunt,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,043:1:16" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Rep. 1, 16</bibl></cit>; so, <cit><quote lang="la">bella,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 5, 2</bibl></cit>: pacem an bellum gerens, v. Andrews and Stoddard's Gram. § 323, 1 (2); <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0631,001:J. 46" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Sall.</author> J. 46 <hi rend="ital">fin.</hi></bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">bella multa felicissime,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,043:2:9" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Rep. 2, 9</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">bellum cum aliquo,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,022:2:4" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Sest. 2, 4</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,053:1:46:103" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Div. 1, 46, 103</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0448,001:1:1:4" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Caes.</author> B. G. 1, 1, 4</bibl> et saep.: <cit><quote lang="la">bello gesto,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:5:43:1" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 5, 43, 1</bibl></cit>: mea mater de ea re gessit morem morigerae mihi, <hi rend="ital">performed my will</hi>, i. e. <hi rend="ital">complied with my wishes</hi>, <hi rend="ital">gratified</hi>, <hi rend="ital">humored me</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,007:1:1:87" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Cist. 1, 1, 87</bibl>; cf.: <cit><quote lang="la">geram tibi morem et ea quae vis, ut potero, explicabo,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,049:1:9:17" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Tusc. 1, 9, 17</bibl></cit>: morem alicui (in aliqua re), Enn. ap. <bibl default="NO"><author>Non.</author> 342, 24</bibl> (Trag. v. 241 Vahl.): <cit><quote lang="la">sine me in hac re gerere mihi morem,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0134,002:5:1:74" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ter.</author> Heaut. 5, 1, 74</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,005:2:3:44" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Capt. 2, 3, 44</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,010:5:2:37" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Men. 5, 2, 37</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,012:2:1:58" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Mil. 2, 1, 58</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,043:3:5" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Rep. 3, 5</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,050:2:1:3" default="NO"><author>id.</author> N. D. 2, 1, 3</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,001:2:2:13" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ov.</author> Am. 2, 2, 13</bibl> et saep.; also without <case>dat.</case>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,013:3:2:36" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Most. 3, 2, 36</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0134,006:3:3:77" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ter.</author> Ad. 3, 3, 77</bibl>.—<hi rend="ital">Pass.</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">ut utrique a me mos gestus esse videatur,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,057:2:16:3" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Att. 2, 16, 3</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,013:1:3:69" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Most. 1, 3, 69</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0134,003:1:2:108" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ter.</author> Eun. 1, 2, 108</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0134,006:2:2:6" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Ad. 2, 2, 6</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0588,002:7:3 al" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Nep.</author> Them. 7, 3 al.</bibl>—With a play upon this meaning and that in II. A.: magna, inquit, <pb n="813" /> <cb n="GERU" /> bella gessi: <cit><quote lang="la">magnis imperiis et provinciis praefui. Gere igitur animum laude dignum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,047:5:2:37" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Par. 5, 2, 37</bibl></cit>.—<usg type="style"><hi rend="ital">Absol.</hi></usg>: <cit><quote lang="la">cum superiores alii fuissent in disputationibus perpoliti, quorum res gestae nullae invenirentur, alii in gerendo probabiles, in disserendo rudes,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,043:1:8" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Rep. 1, 8</bibl></cit>; cf. <cit><quote lang="la">the passage,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,048:5:19:52" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Fin. 5, 19, 52</bibl></cit> supra: <cit><quote lang="la">Armeniam deinde ingressus prima parte introitus prospere gessit,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1044,001:2:102:2" default="NO"><author>Vell.</author> 2, 102, 2</bibl></cit> (where others unnecessarily insert rem), <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:25:22:1" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 25, 22, 1</bibl>; cf. <cit><quote lang="la">also: sive caesi ab Romanis forent Bastarnae ... sive prospere gessissent,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:40:58" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> 40, 58 <hi rend="ital">fin.</hi></bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">cum Persis et Philippus qui cogitavit, et Alexander, qui gessit, hanc bellandi causam inferebat, etc.,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,043:3:9" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Rep. 3, 9</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n19512.16" n="4" level="3"> Of time, <hi rend="ital">to pass</hi>, <hi rend="ital">spend</hi> (mostly post-Aug.; not in Cic.): ut (Tullia) cum aliquo adolescente primario conjuncta aetatem gereret, Sulp. ap. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,056:4:5:3" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Fam. 4, 5, 3</bibl>; cf.: <cit><quote lang="la">pubertatis ac primae adolescentiae tempus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1348,001:life=dom.:1" default="NO"><author>Suet.</author> Dom. 1</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">vitam,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Petr.</author> 63</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1035,001:6:695" default="NO"><author>Val. Fl.</author> 6, 695</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">annum gerens aetatis sexagesimum et nonum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1348,001:life=vesp.:24" default="NO"><author>Suet.</author> Vesp. 24</bibl></cit>.—Hence, <orth extent="full" lang="la">gĕrens</orth>, <itype>entis</itype>, <pos>P. a.</pos> (acc. to II. B. 3.), <hi rend="ital">managing</hi>, <hi rend="ital">conducting</hi>, etc.; with <hi rend="ital">gen.</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">rei male gerentes,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,020:1:2:43" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Truc. 1, 2, 43</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">sui negotii bene gerens,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Quint. 19, 62</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>

<entryFree id="n19513" type="hapax" key="ge^ro2" n="2"><orth extent="full" lang="la">gĕro</orth>, <itype>ōnis</itype>, <gen>m.</gen> <etym>1. gero</etym>, <sense id="n19513.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a carrier;</hi> connected per hyphen with foras: <cit><quote lang="la">ite, ite hac, simul eri damnigeruli, foras gerones, Bonorum hamaxagogae,</quote> <trans><tr>that carry off</tr>, <tr>ravishers</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,020:2:7:1" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Truc. 2, 7, 1</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
geronium: <entryFree id="n19514" type="main" key="Ge^ro_ni^um"><orth extent="full" lang="la">Gĕrōnĭum</orth> or <orth extent="full" lang="la">Gĕrūnĭum</orth>, <itype>ii</itype>, <gen>n.</gen>, <sense id="n19514.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a small city</hi> or <hi rend="ital">fortress in Appulia</hi>, now called <hi rend="ital">Gerione</hi> or <hi rend="ital">Girone</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:22:18:7" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 22, 18, 7</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:23:9" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>ib.</author> 23, 9</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:24 sq" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>ib.</author> 24 sq.</bibl></sense></entryFree>
gerontea: <entryFree id="n19515" type="greek" key="ge^ronte_a"><orth extent="full" lang="la">gĕrontēa</orth>, <itype>ae</itype>, <gen>f.</gen>, = <foreign lang="greek">gerontei/a</foreign>, <sense id="n19515.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">the plant groundsel</hi>, <hi rend="ital">called also</hi> senecio <hi rend="ital">and</hi> erigeron, Senecio vulgaris, Linn.; <bibl default="NO"><author>App.</author> Herb. 75</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
gerontocomium: <entryFree id="n19516" type="greek" key="ge^ronto^co^mi_um"><orth extent="full" lang="la">gĕrontŏcŏmīum</orth>, <itype>ii</itype>, <gen>n.</gen>, = <foreign lang="greek">gerontokomei=on</foreign>, <sense id="n19516.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a public hospital</hi> or <hi rend="ital">alms-house for poor old people</hi>, <bibl default="NO"><author>Cod. Just.</author> 1, 2, 19</bibl>; <bibl default="NO">22</bibl>; <bibl default="NO">23</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
gerontodidasculus: <entryFree id="n19517" type="main" key="Ge^ronto^di^dascu^lus"><orth extent="full" lang="la">Gĕrontŏdĭdascŭlus</orth>, <itype>i</itype>, <gen>m.</gen> (= <foreign lang="greek">gerontodida/skalos</foreign>, an old man's teacher), <sense id="n19517.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">the title of one of the satires of Varro</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0684,001:Frag. p. 279" default="NO"><author>Varr.</author> Frag. p. 279</bibl> Bip.</sense></entryFree>
gerrae: <entryFree id="n19518" type="greek" key="gerrae"><orth extent="full" lang="la">gerrae</orth>, <itype>ārum</itype>, <gen>f.</gen>, = <foreign lang="greek">ge/rra</foreign>, orig. wattled twigs; hence, transf., <sense id="n19518.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">trifles</hi>, <hi rend="ital">stuff</hi>, <hi rend="ital">nonsense</hi>: gerrae crates vimineae. Athenienses cum Syracusas obsiderent et crebro gerras poscerent, irridentes Siculi gerras clamitabant. Unde factum est, ut gerrae pro nugis et contemptu dicantur, Paul. ex Fest. s. h. v. p. 94; cf. id. s. v. cerrones, p. 40 Müll. <hi rend="ital">N. cr.</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">tuae blanditiae mihi sunt, quod dici solet, Gerrae germanae atque edepol liroe liroe,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,015:1:1:9" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Poen. 1, 1, 9</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">maximae,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,009:2:2:49" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Ep. 2, 2, 49</bibl></cit>; cf. Aus. ldyll. 11 praef.—As an <hi rend="ital">interject.</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">gerrae! nae tu illud verbum actutum inveneris,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,019:3:3:31" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Trin. 3, 3, 31</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,002:3:3:10" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> As. 3, 3, 10</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
gerres: <entryFree id="n19519" type="main" key="gerres"><orth extent="full" lang="la">gerres</orth>, <itype>is</itype>, <gen>m.</gen>, <sense id="n19519.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">an inferior salted seafish</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:32:148" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 32, 11, 53, § 148</bibl> Sill. (al. girres), <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1294,001:12:32:15" default="NO"><author>Mart.</author> 12, 32, 15</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1294,001:3:77:7" default="NO">3, 77, 7</bibl>; cf.: gerres <foreign lang="greek">maini/des</foreign>, Gloss. Philox.—Prov.: <cit><quote lang="la">addere garo gerrem,</quote> <trans>i. e. <tr>to add to what is precious something worthless</tr>,</trans> <bibl default="NO"><author>Arn.</author> 5, 188</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
gerro: <entryFree id="n19520" type="hapax" key="gerro"><orth extent="full" lang="la">gerro</orth><itype />, (archaic orthogr.: ‡ cerrones leves et inepti, Paul. ex <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1236,001:v. p. 40" default="NO"><author>Fest.</author> v. p. 40</bibl> Müll.), <itype>ōnis</itype>, <gen>m.</gen> <etym>gerrae</etym>, <sense id="n19520.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a trifler</hi>, <hi rend="ital">idle fellow</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">gerro, iners, fraus, heluo, Ganeo, damnosus!</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0134,002:5:4:10" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ter.</author> Heaut. 5, 4, 10</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
gerula: <entryFree id="n19521" type="main" key="ge^ru^la"><orth extent="full" lang="la">gĕrŭla</orth>, <itype>ae</itype>, <gen>f.</gen> <etym>gero</etym>, <sense id="n19521.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">she that bears</hi> or <hi rend="ital">carries</hi>, <bibl default="NO"><author>Tert.</author> Anim. 19 <hi rend="ital">fin.</hi></bibl>; <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> adv. Jud. 9 <hi rend="ital">med.</hi></bibl>; <bibl default="NO"><author>App.</author> M. 6, p. 181</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">navis gerula sacrorum,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Sol.</author> 1</bibl></cit> <hi rend="ital">fin.—A working bee</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:11:24" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 11, 10, 10, § 24</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
gerulifigulus: <entryFree id="n19522" type="hapax" key="ge^ru^li^fi^gu^lus"><orth extent="full" lang="la">gĕrŭlĭfĭgŭlus</orth>, <itype>i</itype>, <gen>m.</gen> <etym>gerulus + figulus</etym>, comic, <sense id="n19522.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">an accessory</hi>, <hi rend="ital">abettor</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">flagiti,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,004:3:1:14" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Bacch. 3, 1, 14</bibl></cit>; cf. 1. gerulus, I. B.</sense></entryFree>
gerulum: <entryFree id="n19523" type="main" key="ge^ru^lum"><orth extent="full" lang="la">gĕrŭlum</orth>, <itype>i</itype>, <gen>n.</gen> <etym>gero</etym>, <sense id="n19523.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a bearer</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">cornua potuum gerula,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Sol.</author> 20, 5</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
gerulus: <entryFree id="n19524" type="main" key="ge^ru^lus"><orth extent="full" lang="la">gĕrŭlus</orth>, <itype>i</itype>, <gen>m.</gen> <etym>id.</etym>. <sense id="n19524.0" n="A" level="2"> <hi rend="ital">A bearer</hi>, <hi rend="ital">carrier</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">nae ille alium gerulum (argenti) quaerat sibi,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,004:4:9:79" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Bacch. 4, 9, 79</bibl></cit>; <bibl default="NO"><author>Hor.</author> Ep. 2, 2, 72</bibl>; Col. poët. 10, 310; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1348,001:life=cal.:40" default="NO"><author>Suet.</author> Calig. 40</bibl>; <bibl default="NO"><author>Sid.</author> Ep. 8, 13</bibl>; <bibl default="NO"><author>Inscr. Orell.</author> 575</bibl>; <bibl default="NO">874</bibl>; <bibl default="NO">976</bibl>; Schol. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1276,001:6:477" default="NO"><author>Juv.</author> 6, 477</bibl>.—</sense><sense id="n19524.1" n="B" level="2"> <hi rend="ital">One who does</hi> something, <hi rend="ital">a doer</hi>: gerulus <foreign lang="greek">o( pra/ttwn, o( prakth/r</foreign>, Gloss. Philox.; cf. gerulifigulus.</sense></entryFree>
gerundium: <entryFree id="n19525" type="main" key="ge^rundi^um"><orth extent="full" lang="la">gĕrundĭum</orth>, <itype>ii</itype>, <gen>n.</gen> <etym>id.</etym>, in gram., <sense id="n19525.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a gerund</hi>, <bibl default="NO"><author>Diom.</author> p. 350</bibl> P.; <bibl default="NO"><author>Prisc.</author> p. 808</bibl> ib. al.; also called <orth extent="full" lang="la">gĕrundīvus mŏdus</orth>, <bibl default="NO"><author>Serv.</author> p. 1788</bibl> P.</sense></entryFree>
gerunium: <entryFree id="n19526" type="main" key="Ge^ru_ni^um"><orth extent="full" lang="la">Gĕrūnĭum</orth>, <itype>ii</itype>, v. Geronium. <cb n="GEST" /></entryFree>
gerusia: <entryFree id="n19527" type="greek" key="ge^ru_si^a"><orth extent="full" lang="la">gĕrūsĭa</orth>, <itype>ae</itype>, <gen>f.</gen>, = <foreign lang="greek">gerousi/a</foreign>, <sense id="n19527.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">the place of meeting for a council of old men</hi>, <hi rend="ital">senatehouse</hi> in a Grecian city (= senaculum), <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0684,001:L. L. 5:32:section=156" default="NO"><author>Varr.</author> L. L. 5, 32, § 156</bibl>.—</sense><sense id="n19527.1" n="II" level="1"> <hi rend="ital">A public hospital</hi> or <hi rend="ital">retreat in Sardes</hi>, <hi rend="ital">for old men who had deserved well of their country</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1056,001:4:8" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Vitr.</author> 4, 8</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:35:172" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 35, 14, 49, § 172</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1318,001:10:42" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> Ep. 10, 42</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
geryon: <entryFree id="n19528" type="main" key="Ge_ry^on"><orth extent="full" lang="la">Gēryon</orth>, <itype>ōnis</itype>, and <orth extent="full" lang="la">Gēryŏnēs</orth>, <itype>ae</itype> (cf. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0684,001:L. L. 9:section=90" default="NO"><author>Varr.</author> L. L. 9, § 90</bibl> Müll.; archaic <sense id="n19528.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">gen. sing.</hi>, Geryonaī, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0550,001:5:28" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Lucr.</author> 5, 28</bibl>.—<hi rend="ital">Abl.</hi> scanned Gērȳŏne, <bibl default="NO"><author>Sid.</author> Carm. 13, 13</bibl>), <gen>m.</gen>, = <foreign lang="greek">*ghruw/n</foreign> and <foreign lang="greek">*ghruo/nhs</foreign>, <hi rend="ital">a mythic king in Spain having three bodies</hi>, <hi rend="ital">whose oxen were carried off by Hercules</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0550,001:5:28" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Lucr.</author> 5, 28</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,003:7:662" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> A. 7, 662</bibl>; <bibl default="NO">8, 202</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,002:9:92" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ov.</author> H. 9, 92</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0893,001:2:14:8" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Hor.</author> C. 2, 14, 8</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1345,001:13:201" default="NO"><author>Sil.</author> 13, 201</bibl>; Hyg. Fab. praef. <hi rend="ital">fin.—Plur.</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">in hac (Erythia insula) Geryones habitasse a quibusdam existimantur,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:4:120" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 4, 22, 36, § 120</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">Geryonis oraculum,</quote> <trans><tr>at Patavium</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1348,001:life=tib.:14" default="NO"><author>Suet.</author> Tib. 14</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n19528.1" n="II" level="1"> Derivv. </sense><sense id="n19528.2" n="A" level="2"> <orth extent="full" lang="la">Gēryŏ-nācĕus</orth>, <itype>a, um</itype>, <pos>adj.</pos>, <hi rend="ital">Geryonian</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">genere Geryonaceo,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,003:3:6:18" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Aul. 3, 6, 18</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n19528.3" n="B" level="2"> <orth extent="full" lang="la">Gē-ryŏnēus</orth>, <itype>a, um</itype>, <pos>adj.</pos>, <hi rend="ital">Geryonian</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">caedes,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>App.</author> M. 2 <hi rend="ital">fin.</hi></bibl></cit></sense></entryFree>
geseoretae: <entryFree id="n19529" type="gloss" key="geseore_tae"><orth extent="full" lang="la">geseorētae</orth>, <itype>ārum</itype>, <gen>f.</gen>, <sense id="n19529.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a sort of boat</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1254,001:10:25:5" default="NO"><author>Gell.</author> 10, 25, 5</bibl> dub.</sense></entryFree>
gessius: <entryFree id="n19530" type="main" key="Gessius"><orth extent="full" lang="la">Gessius</orth>, <itype>ii</itype>, <gen>m.</gen>, <sense id="n19530.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a Roman family name</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1351,004:5:10" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Tac.</author> H. 5, 10</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
gesta: <entryFree id="n19531" type="main" key="gesta"><orth extent="full" lang="la">gesta</orth>, <itype>ōrum</itype>, <gen>n.</gen> <etym>gero, II. B. 3.</etym>, <sense id="n19531.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">deeds</hi>, <hi rend="ital">acts</hi> (rare for res gestae): <cit><quote lang="la">obscuriora sunt ejus gesta,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0588,013:4:6" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Nep.</author> Timoth. 4, 6</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0588,001:Hann. 13:3" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Hann. 13, 3</bibl>; Sisenn. ap. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1254,001:12:15:2" default="NO"><author>Gell.</author> 12, 15, 2</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:8:40:5" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 8, 40, 5</bibl>: fide gestorum comprobatā, Vet. Cuj. Jurec. Consult. 9, 6 Huschke; <cit><quote lang="la">David,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:tlg,0527,015:29:29" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Vulg.</author> 1 Par. 29, 29</bibl></cit>; 1 Macc. 13, 42.</sense></entryFree>
gestabilis: <entryFree id="n19532" type="main" key="gesta_bi^lis"><orth extent="full" lang="la">gestābĭlis</orth>, <itype>e</itype>, <pos>adj.</pos> <etym>gesto</etym>, <sense id="n19532.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">portable</hi> (late Lat.), <bibl default="NO"><author>Cassiod.</author> Varr. 1, 45</bibl>; Ambros. de Noë et Arca, 15, 52 <hi rend="ital">fin.</hi></sense></entryFree>
gestamen: <entryFree id="n19533" type="main" key="gesta_men"><orth extent="full" lang="la">gestāmen</orth>, <itype>inis</itype>, <gen>n.</gen> <etym>id.</etym>. <sense id="n19533.0" n="I" level="1"> <hi rend="ital">That which is borne</hi> or <hi rend="ital">worn</hi>, <hi rend="ital">a burden</hi>, <hi rend="ital">load; ornaments</hi>, <hi rend="ital">accoutrements</hi>, <hi rend="ital">arms</hi>, etc. (<usg type="style">poet.</usg> and in post-Aug. prose): <cit><quote lang="la">clipeus, magni gestamen Abantis,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,003:3:286" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> A. 3, 286</bibl></cit>; <cit><quote lang="la">so of a shield,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1345,001:5:349" default="NO"><author>Sil.</author> 5, 349</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">hoc Priami gestamen erat,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,003:7:246" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> A. 7, 246</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">haruspices religiosum id gestamen (sc. margaritas) amoliendis periculis arbitrantur,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:32:23" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 32, 2, 11, § 23</bibl></cit>; cf. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:37:111" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> 37, 8, 33, § 111</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">speculum, gestamen Othonis,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1276,001:2:99" default="NO"><author>Juv.</author> 2, 99</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">(asini),</quote> <trans><tr>a burden</tr>, <tr>load</tr>,</trans> <bibl default="NO"><author>App.</author> M. 7, p. 197</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">gestaminis lapsi tinnitus,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Amm.</author> 16, 5, 4</bibl></cit>.—<hi rend="ital">Plur.</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">cognovi clipeum laevae gestamina nostrae,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,006:15:163" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ov.</author> M. 15, 163</bibl></cit>; cf.: <cit><quote lang="la">ista decent humeros gestamina nostros,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,010:1:457" default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 1, 457</bibl></cit>; <cit><quote lang="la">13, 116: sua virgo Deae gestamina reddit,</quote> <trans>i. e. <tr>a necklace</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1035,001:6:671" default="NO"><author>Val. Fl.</author> 6, 671</bibl></cit>; <bibl default="NO"><author>App.</author> M. 11, p. 258</bibl>; <bibl default="NO">3</bibl>, p. 141.—</sense><sense id="n19533.1" n="II" level="1"> <hi rend="ital">That with</hi> or <hi rend="ital">in which any thing is carried.</hi> </sense><sense id="n19533.2" n="A" level="2"> <hi rend="ital">A litter</hi>, <hi rend="ital">sedan</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">quotiens per urbes incederet, lecticae gestamine fastuque erga patrias epulas,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1351,005:2:2" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Tac.</author> A. 2, 2</bibl></cit>; cf.: <cit><quote lang="la">Agrippina gestamine sellae Baias pervecta,</quote> <trans><tr>a sedan - chair</tr>,</trans> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 14, 4</bibl></cit>; so, <cit><quote lang="la">sellae,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 15, 57</bibl></cit> (for which: <cit><quote lang="la">gestatoria sella,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1348,001:life=nero:26" default="NO"><author>Suet.</author> Ner. 26</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1348,001:life=vit.:16" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Vit. 16</bibl>).—</sense><sense id="n19533.3" n="B" level="2"> <hi rend="ital">A carriage</hi>, <hi rend="ital">vehicle</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">in eodem gestamine sedem poscit,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 11, 33</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n19533.4" n="C" level="2"> <hi rend="ital">Any means of conveyance</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">comes celsi vehitur gestamine conti,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1035,001:6:71" default="NO"><author>Val. Fl.</author> 6, 71</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">lento gestamine vilis aselli,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Sedul.</author> 4, 297</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
gestatio: <entryFree id="n19534" type="main" key="gesta_ti^o"><orth extent="full" lang="la">gestātĭo</orth>, <itype>ōnis</itype>, <gen>f.</gen> <etym>id.</etym>. <sense id="n19534.0" n="I" level="1"> <hi rend="ital">Act.</hi>, <hi rend="ital">a bearing</hi>, <hi rend="ital">carrying</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">infantium gestationes,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Lact.</author> 3, 22 <hi rend="ital">fin.</hi></bibl></cit>—</sense><sense id="n19534.1" n="II" level="1"> <hi rend="ital">Pass.</hi> (not ante-Aug.), <hi rend="ital">a being carried</hi> or <hi rend="ital">conveyed about</hi> (in a litter, carriage, boat, etc.), <hi rend="ital">a riding</hi>, <hi rend="ital">driving</hi> or <hi rend="ital">sailing for pleasure.</hi> </sense><sense id="n19534.2" n="A" level="2"> <usg type="style">Lit.</usg>: <cit><quote lang="la">gestatio quoque longis et jam inclinatis morbis aptissima est, etc. ... Genera autem gestationis plura sunt. Lenissima est navi vel in portu vel in flumine, vehementior vel in alto navi ... vel lectica, etiamnum acrior vehiculo,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0836,001:2:15" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cels.</author> 2, 15</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1014,001:Ep. 55" default="NO"><author>Sen.</author> Ep. 55</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">solitus etiam in gestatione ludere (aleam),</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1348,001:life=cl.:33" default="NO"><author>Suet.</author> Claud. 33</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1348,001:life=vesp.:21" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Vesp. 21</bibl>.—</sense><sense id="n19534.3" n="B" level="2"> <usg type="style">Transf.</usg>, <hi rend="ital">a place where one is carried to take the air</hi>, <hi rend="ital">a promenade</hi>, etc.: <cit><quote lang="la">gestatio in modum circi,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1318,001:5:6:17" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> Ep. 5, 6, 17</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:2:17:13" default="NO" valid="yes">2, 17, 13</bibl>; <bibl default="NO"><author>Inscr. Orell.</author> 4336</bibl>; <bibl default="NO"><author>Inscr. Grut.</author> 201, 8</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
gestator: <entryFree id="n19535" type="main" key="gesta_tor"><orth extent="full" lang="la">gestātor</orth>, <itype>ōris</itype>, <gen>m.</gen> <etym>id.</etym> (post-Aug.). <sense id="n19535.0" n="I" level="1"> <hi rend="ital">A bearer</hi>, <hi rend="ital">carrier.</hi> delphinus gestator collusorque puerorum, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1318,001:9:33:8" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> Ep. 9, 33, 8</bibl>.—</sense><sense id="n19535.1" n="II" level="1"> <hi rend="ital">One who rides out to take the air</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1294,001:4:64:19" default="NO"><author>Mart.</author> 4, 64, 19</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
gestatorius: <entryFree id="n19536" type="main" key="gesta_to_ri^us"><orth extent="full" lang="la">gestātōrĭus</orth>, <itype>a, um</itype>, <pos>adj.</pos> <etym>id.</etym>, <sense id="n19536.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">that serves for carrying</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">sella,</quote> <trans><tr>a sedan-chair</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1348,001:life=nero:26" default="NO"><author>Suet.</author> Ner. 26</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1348,001:life=vit.:16" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Vit. 16</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:tlg,0527,024:3:27" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Vulg.</author> 2 Macc. 3, 27</bibl> (for which: <cit><quote lang="la">gestamen sellae,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1351,005:14:4" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Tac.</author> A. 14, 4</bibl></cit>; <bibl default="NO">15, 57</bibl>). <cb n="GEST" /></sense></entryFree>
gestatrix: <entryFree id="n19537" type="hapax" key="gesta_trix"><orth extent="full" lang="la">gestātrix</orth>, <itype>īcis</itype>, <gen>f.</gen> <etym>gesto</etym>, <sense id="n19537.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">she that bears</hi> or <hi rend="ital">carries</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1035,001:4:605" default="NO"><author>Val. Fl.</author> 4, 605</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
gestatus: <entryFree id="n19538" type="hapax" key="gesta_tus"><orth extent="full" lang="la">gestātus</orth>, <itype>ūs</itype>, <gen>m.</gen> <etym>id.</etym>, <sense id="n19538.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a bearing</hi>, <hi rend="ital">carrying</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">adeo teneris cerasis, ut gestatum non tolerent,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:15:103" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 15, 25, 30, § 103</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
gesticularius: <entryFree id="n19539" type="main" key="gesti^cu^la_ri^us"><orth extent="full" lang="la">gestĭcŭlārĭus</orth>, <itype>ii</itype>, <gen>m.</gen> <etym>gesticulus</etym>, <sense id="n19539.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a pantomime</hi>, <bibl default="NO"><author>Amm.</author> 24, 4</bibl>, and <orth extent="full" lang="la">gestĭcŭ-lāria</orth>, <itype>ae</itype>, <gen>f.</gen>, <hi rend="ital">a female pantomime</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1254,001:1:5" default="NO"><author>Gell.</author> 1, 5 <hi rend="ital">fin.</hi></bibl></sense></entryFree>
gesticulatio: <entryFree id="n19540" type="main" key="gesti^cu^la_tio"><orth extent="full" lang="la">gestĭcŭlātio</orth>, <itype>ōnis</itype>, <gen>f.</gen> <etym>gesticulor</etym>, <sense id="n19540.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">pantomimic motion</hi>, <hi rend="ital">gesticulation</hi> (postAug.; <cit><quote lang="la">syn. gestus): nec sine molli quadam digitorum gesticulatione,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1348,001:life=tib.:68" default="NO"><author>Suet.</author> Tib. 68</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">inaffectata,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>App.</author> M. 10, p. 254, 18</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">pronunciatio gesticulationibus molesta,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:11:3:183" default="NO"><author>Quint.</author> 11, 3, 183</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
gesticulator: <entryFree id="n19541" type="main" key="gesti^cu^la_tor"><orth extent="full" lang="la">gestĭcŭlātor</orth>, <itype>ōris</itype>, <gen>m.</gen> <etym>id.</etym>, <sense id="n19541.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a posturemaker</hi>, <hi rend="ital">pantomime</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">corporis,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0845,001:1 praef" default="NO"><author>Col.</author> 1 praef.</bibl></cit> § <cit><quote lang="la">3: Atellanus,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Tert.</author> Spect. 17</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
gesticulor: <entryFree id="n19542" type="main" key="gesti^cu^lor"><orth extent="full" lang="la">gestĭcŭlor</orth>, <itype>ātus, 1</itype>, <sense id="n19542.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">v. dep. n.</hi> and <hi rend="ital">a.</hi> [gesticulus], <hi rend="ital">to make mimic</hi> or <hi rend="ital">pantomimic gestures</hi>, <hi rend="ital">to gesticulate</hi> (perhaps not anteAug.; cf.: <cit><quote lang="la">gestum agere,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,037:2:57:233" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> de Or. 2, 57, 233</bibl></cit>): <cit><quote lang="la">scissor ad symphoniam gesticulatus laceravit obsonium,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Petr.</author> 36</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">gesticulandi saltandique studium,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1348,001:life=dom.:8" default="NO"><author>Suet.</author> Dom. 8</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1245,001:Orat. 1" default="NO"><author>Front.</author> Orat. 1</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">jocularia carmina lasciveque modulata, quae vulgo notuerunt, etiam gesticulatus est,</quote> <trans><tr>he represented in pantomime</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1348,001:life=nero:42" default="NO"><author>Suet.</author> Ner. 42</bibl></cit>.—<mood>Part.</mood> in <hi rend="ital">pass.</hi> signif.: <cit><quote lang="la">gesticulati motus,</quote> <trans><tr>pantomimic movements</tr>,</trans> <bibl default="NO"><author>Sol.</author> 27 <hi rend="ital">fin.</hi></bibl></cit></sense></entryFree>
gesticulus: <entryFree id="n19543" type="main" key="gesti^cu^lus"><orth extent="full" lang="la">gestĭcŭlus</orth>, <itype>i</itype>, <gen>m.</gen> <lbl>dim.</lbl> <etym>2. gestus</etym>, <sense id="n19543.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a mimic gesture</hi>, <hi rend="ital">gesticulation</hi> (post-class.): <cit><quote lang="la">digitorum,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Tert.</author> Apol. 19</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
gestio: <entryFree id="n19544" type="main" key="gesti^o1" n="1"><orth extent="full" lang="la">gestĭo</orth>, <itype>ōnis</itype>, <gen>f.</gen> <etym>gero</etym>. <sense id="n19544.0" n="I" level="1"> <hi rend="ital">A managing</hi>, <hi rend="ital">doing</hi>, <hi rend="ital">performing</hi> (perh. only in the foll. passages; <cit><quote lang="la">syn.: actio, administratio): in gestione autem negotii, etc.,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,036:1:26:38" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Inv. 1, 26, 38</bibl></cit>; cf. <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 2, 12, 39</bibl>.—</sense><sense id="n19544.1" n="II" level="1"> <hi rend="ital">A behaving</hi>, <hi rend="ital">acting</hi> in any manner, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,2806,001:11:7:14:section=8" default="NO"><author>Dig.</author> 11, 7, 14, § 8</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>

<entryFree id="n19545" type="main" key="gesti^o2" n="2"><orth extent="full" lang="la">gestĭo</orth>, <itype>īvi, or ĭi, ītum, 4</itype> (archaic <sense id="n19545.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">imperf.</hi> gestibat, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1254,001:15:2:1" default="NO"><author>Gell.</author> 15, 2, 1</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">gestibant,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,002:2:2:49" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> As. 2, 2, 49</bibl></cit>), <pos>v. n.</pos> <etym>2. gestus, I.</etym>, <hi rend="ital">to use passionate gestures</hi>, <hi rend="ital">to throw one's self about</hi> (espec. for joy), <hi rend="ital">to be transported</hi>, <hi rend="ital">to exult</hi>, <hi rend="ital">to be joyful</hi>, <hi rend="ital">cheerful</hi> (cf.: exsilio, exsulto): gestit, qui subitā felicitate exhilaratus nimio corporis motu praeter consuetudinem exsultat, Paul. ex <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1236,001:page=96" default="NO"><author>Fest.</author> p. 96</bibl> Müll.; cf. <bibl default="NO"><author>Serv.</author> Verg. G. 1, 387</bibl> (freq. and class.). </sense><sense id="n19545.1" n="I" level="1"> <usg type="style">Lit.</usg>; constr. with <case>abl.</case> or <hi rend="ital">absol.</hi> </sense><sense id="n19545.2" n="(a)" level="5"> With <case>abl.</case>: <cit><quote lang="la">quorum alter laetitiā gestiat, alter dolore crucietur,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,048:2:4:14" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Fin. 2, 4, 14</bibl></cit>; cf.: <cit><quote lang="la">voluptate nimiā gestire,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,055:1:29:102" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Off. 1, 29, 102</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">inani laetitia exsultans et temere gestiens,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,049:5:6:16" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Tusc. 5, 6, 16</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">Veliterni coloni gestientes otio,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:6:36:1" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 6, 36, 1</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">cur non gestiret taurus equae contrectatione, equus vaccae,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,050:1:27:77" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> N. D. 1, 27, 77</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0845,001:8:15:4" default="NO"><author>Col.</author> 8, 15, 4</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">secundis rebus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:45:19:7" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 45, 19, 7</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n19545.3" n="(b)" level="5"> <usg type="style"><hi rend="ital">Absol.</hi></usg>: <cit><quote lang="la">quid est, quod sic gestis?</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0134,003:3:5:10" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ter.</author> Eun. 3, 5, 10</bibl></cit>; cf. <bibl default="NO"><author>ib.</author> 7</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">hac (eloquentiā) deducimus perterritos a timore, hac gestientes comprimimus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,050:2:59:148" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> N. D. 2, 59, 148</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">tum gestit aper, cum sese Martia tigris Abstulit,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1035,001:3:634" default="NO"><author>Val. Fl.</author> 3, 634</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">cum laetitia, ut adepta jam aliquid concupitum, efferatur et gestiat,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,049:4:6:12" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Tusc. 4, 6, 12</bibl></cit>; cf. <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib.</bibl> § 13.—* </sense><sense id="n19545.4" n="B" level="2"> <usg type="style">Trop.</usg>, in speaking, <hi rend="ital">to enlarge at will</hi>, <hi rend="ital">to digress</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">quapropter historiae nonnumquam ubertas in aliqua exercendi stili parte ponenda, et dialogorum libertate gestiendum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:10:5:15" default="NO"><author>Quint.</author> 10, 5, 15</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n19545.5" n="II" level="1"> <usg type="style">Transf.</usg>, <hi rend="ital">to desire eagerly</hi> or <hi rend="ital">passionately</hi>, <hi rend="ital">to long for;</hi> constr. usually with <hi rend="ital">inf.</hi>, rarely with <case>abl.</case> or <hi rend="ital">absol.</hi> </sense><sense id="n19545.6" n="(a)" level="5"> With <hi rend="ital">inf.</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">roga, obsecro hercle, gestio promittere,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,016:1:1:114" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Ps. 1, 1, 114</bibl></cit>; <bibl default="NO">4, 6, 11</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">machaera, quae gestit stragem facere,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,012:1:1:8" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Mil. 1, 1, 8</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">moecho abdomen adimere,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 5, 1, 5</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">gestio scire ista omnia,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,057:4:11:1" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Att. 4, 11, 1</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">Antonius senatum delere gestit,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,035:6:14" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Phil. 6, 14</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">nihil erat, quod Zeno mutare gestiret,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,048:4:4:8" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Fin. 4, 4, 8</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">transfuga divitum Partes linquere gestio,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0893,001:3:16:24" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Hor.</author> C. 3, 16, 24</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">fuge, quo descendere gestis,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> Ep. 1, 20, 5</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">quod gestiat animus aliquid agere in re publica,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,057:2:7:4" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Att. 2, 7, 4</bibl></cit>.—With <hi rend="ital">pass. inf.</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">equidem illam moveri gestio,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,002:4:1:43" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> As. 4, 1, 43</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">ipsum gestio dari mihi in conspectum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0134,004:2:1:30" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ter.</author> Phorm. 2, 1, 30</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1318,002:39:2" default="NO"><author>Plin.</author> Pan. 39, 2</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1254,001:16:13:4" default="NO"><author>Gell.</author> 16, 13, 4</bibl>.—</sense><sense id="n19545.7" n="(b)" level="5"> With <case>abl.</case>: <cit><quote lang="la">(cygnos) nunc currere in undas, Et studio incassum videas gestire lavandi,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,002:1:387" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> G. 1, 387</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n19545.8" n="(g)" level="5"> <usg type="style"><hi rend="ital">Absol.</hi></usg>: gestiunt pugni mihi. <hi rend="ital">my fists itch to be at you</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,001:1:1:167" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Am. 1, 1, 167</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">dudum scapulae gestibant mihi,</quote> <trans>i. e. <tr>were longing for the whip</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,002:2:2:49" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> As. 2, 2, 49</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">inridere ne videare et gestire admodum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,013:3:2:126" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Most. 3, 2, 126</bibl></cit>. <pb n="814" /> <cb n="GEST" /></sense></entryFree>
gestito: <entryFree id="n19546" type="main" key="gesti^to"><orth extent="full" lang="la">gestĭto</orth>, <itype>āvi, ātum, 1</itype>, <pos>v. freq. a.</pos> <etym>gesto</etym>, <sense id="n19546.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">to carry often</hi> or <hi rend="ital">much</hi>, <hi rend="ital">to be wont to carry</hi> or <hi rend="ital">bear</hi> (ante- and post-class.): <cit><quote lang="la">mea haec (crepundia) herilis gestitavit filia,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,007:4:2:83 sq" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Cist. 4, 2, 83 sq.</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">istum anulum (pater),</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,008:5:2:4" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Curc. 5, 2, 4</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">machaeram feriatam,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,012:1:1:7" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Mil. 1, 1, 7</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,015:1:2:186" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Poen. 1, 2, 186</bibl>: qui pectus purum et firmum gestitat, Enn. ap. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1254,001:7:17:10" default="NO"><author>Gell.</author> 7, 17, 10</bibl> (Trag. v. 340 Vahl.): <cit><quote lang="la">poma,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Sol.</author> 45</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
gesto: <entryFree id="n19547" type="main" key="gesto"><orth extent="full" lang="la">gesto</orth>, <itype>āvi, ātum, 1</itype>, <pos>v. freq. a.</pos> and <gen>n.</gen> <etym>gero</etym>. <sense id="n19547.0" n="I" level="1"> <hi rend="ital">Act.</hi>, <hi rend="ital">to bear</hi>, <hi rend="ital">to carry</hi>, <hi rend="ital">to have; to wear</hi>, <hi rend="ital">wield</hi> (mostly <usg type="style">poet.</usg> and in postAug. prose; for fero, porto, gero, habeo). </sense><sense id="n19547.1" n="A" level="2"> <usg type="style">Lit.</usg>: <cit><quote lang="la">quae olim parva gestavit crepundia,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,017:4:4:36" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Rud. 4, 4, 36</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">quae nisi fecissem, frustra Telamone creatus Gestasset laeva taurorum tergora septem (i. e. scutum),</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,006:13:347" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ov.</author> M. 13, 347</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">clavos trabales et cuneos manu ahena (Necessitas),</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0893,001:1:35:19" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Hor.</author> C. 1, 35, 19</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">gemmam digito,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:2:158" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 2, 63, 63, § 158</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">coronam lauream capite,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1348,001:life=tib.:69" default="NO"><author>Suet.</author> Tib. 69</bibl></cit>; cf. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,006:2:366" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ov.</author> M. 2, 366</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">ferrum et scopulos gestare in corde,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,010:7:33" default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 7, 33</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">non obtunsa adeo gestamus pectora,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,003:1:567" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> A. 1, 567</bibl></cit>; cf.: <cit><quote lang="la">neque jam livida gestat armis Brachia,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0893,001:1:8:10" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Hor.</author> C. 1, 8, 10</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">mercem sine fucis,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0893,004:1:2:83" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> S. 1, 2, 83</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">quem ego puerum tantillum in manibus gestavi meis,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0134,006:4:2:24" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ter.</author> Ad. 4, 2, 24</bibl></cit>: post cervicibus fractis caput abscidit, idque affixum gestari jussit in pilo, * <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,035:11:2:5" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Phil. 11, 2, 5</bibl>; cf. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1044,001:2:27:3" default="NO"><author>Vell.</author> 2, 27, 3</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">agnam lecticā,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0893,004:2:3:214" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Hor.</author> S. 2, 3, 214</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">dorso, sicut jumenta, onera gestare,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0860,001:4:2" default="NO"><author>Curt.</author> 4, 2</bibl></cit>; cf.: <cit><quote lang="la">arma umeris,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:27:48:16" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 27, 48, 16</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">in umeris,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:tlg,0527,048:46:7" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Vulg.</author> Isa. 46, 7</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">suum in pectore testem,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1276,001:13:198" default="NO"><author>Juv.</author> 13, 198</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">cur in hoc digito gestaretur annulus,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Macr.</author> Sat. 7, 13, 11</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">lorum in collo pro bullae decore,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 1, 6, 13</bibl></cit>.—<usg type="style"><hi rend="ital">Absol.</hi></usg>: <cit><quote lang="la">(elephantos) decem annis gestare in utero vulgus existimat,</quote> <trans><tr>to go with young</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:8:28" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 8, 10, 10, § 28</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">ex urbe atque Italia irritamenta gulae gestabantur,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1351,004:2:62" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Tac.</author> H. 2, 62</bibl></cit>; cf. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1014,001:Q. N. 5" default="NO"><author>Sen.</author> Q. N. 5 <hi rend="ital">fin.</hi></bibl>—</sense><sense id="n19547.2" n="2" level="3"> In partic., gestari, <hi rend="ital">to be carried about</hi> (in a litter, carriage, boat, etc.), <hi rend="ital">to take the air</hi>, <hi rend="ital">to ride</hi>, <hi rend="ital">drive</hi>, <hi rend="ital">sail</hi>, etc., <hi rend="ital">for pleasure</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">nunc exerceamur, nunc gestemur, nunc prandeamus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1014,001:Ep. 122" default="NO"><author>Sen.</author> Ep. 122 <hi rend="ital">med.</hi></bibl></cit>; cf. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1294,001:12:17:3" default="NO"><author>Mart.</author> 12, 17, 3</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">gestatus bijugis Regulus esset equis,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1294,001:1:13:8" default="NO"><author>id.</author> 1, 13, 8</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">porticus in qua gestetur dominus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1276,001:7:179" default="NO"><author>Juv.</author> 7, 179</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">equus gestandi gratia commodatum,</quote> <trans><tr>for the sake of a ride</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1251,001:Inst. 3:196" default="NO"><author>Gai.</author> Inst. 3, 196</bibl></cit>; cf. in the foll. II.—</sense><sense id="n19547.3" n="B" level="2"> <usg type="style">Trop.</usg>: <cit><quote lang="la">hicine non gestandus in sinu est?</quote> <trans>i. e. <tr>to be dearly loved</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0134,006:4:5:75" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ter.</author> Ad. 4, 5, 75</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">tu quidem Meum animum gestas: scis, quid acturus siem,</quote> <trans><tr>know my wish</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,011:3:3:11" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Merc. 3, 3, 11</bibl></cit>; cf.: <cit><quote lang="la">rex te ergo in oculis ... gestare,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0134,003:3:1:11" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ter.</author> Eun. 3, 1, 11</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n19547.4" n="2" level="3"> In partic., <hi rend="ital">to carry about</hi>, <hi rend="ital">to report</hi>, <hi rend="ital">blab</hi>, <hi rend="ital">tell</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">homines qui gestant quique auscultant crimina,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,016:1:5:12" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Ps. 1, 5, 12</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">pessimum genus hominum videbatur, qui verba gestarent: sunt qui vitia gestant,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1014,001:Ep. 123" default="NO"><author>Sen.</author> Ep. 123</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n19547.5" n="II" level="1"> <hi rend="ital">Neutr.</hi>, like veho, in the signif. of I. A. 2., <hi rend="ital">to be carried out</hi>, <hi rend="ital">to ride</hi>, <hi rend="ital">drive</hi>, <hi rend="ital">sail</hi>, etc., <hi rend="ital">to take the air</hi> (very rare): <cit><quote lang="la">simul gestanti, conspecto delatore ejus, Vis, inquit, etc.,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1348,001:life=dom.:11" default="NO"><author>Suet.</author> Dom. 11</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">ne ad gestandum quidem umquam aliter iter ingressus, quam ut, etc.,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1348,001:life=gal.:8" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Galb. 8</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
gestor: <entryFree id="n19548" type="main" key="gestor"><orth extent="full" lang="la">gestor</orth>, <itype>ōris</itype>, <gen>m.</gen> <etym>id.</etym>. * <sense id="n19548.0" n="I" level="1"> <hi rend="ital">A tale-bearer</hi>, <hi rend="ital">tattler</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">homines qui gestant quique auscultant crimina, Si meo arbitratu liceat, omnes pendeant, Gestores linguis, auditores auribus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,016:1:5:12" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Ps. 1, 5, 12</bibl></cit>.—* </sense><sense id="n19548.1" n="II" level="1"> <hi rend="ital">A manager</hi>, <hi rend="ital">performer</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">negotiorum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,2806,001:49:1:24" default="NO"><author>Dig.</author> 49, 1, 24</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
gestuosus: <entryFree id="n19549" type="main" key="gestu^o_sus"><orth extent="full" lang="la">gestŭōsus</orth>, <itype>a, um</itype>, <pos>adj.</pos> <etym>2. gestus, I.</etym>, <sense id="n19549.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">full of gestures</hi>, <hi rend="ital">full of action</hi> (post-class.): <cit><quote lang="la">manus argutae admodum et gestuosae,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1254,001:1:5:2" default="NO"><author>Gell.</author> 1, 5, 2</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">puelli incessu,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>App.</author> M. 10, p. 253</bibl></cit>; cf. <cit><quote lang="la">gressus,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 11</bibl></cit>, p. 262, 18.</sense></entryFree>
gestus: <entryFree id="n19550" type="main" key="gestus1" n="1"><orth extent="full" lang="la">gestus</orth>, <itype>a, um</itype>, <mood>Part.</mood>, from gero.</entryFree>

<entryFree id="n19551" type="main" key="gestus2" n="2"><orth extent="full" lang="la">gestus</orth>, <itype>ūs</itype>, <gen>m.</gen> <etym>gero</etym>. <sense id="n19551.0" n="I" level="1"> <usg type="style">Lit.</usg> (the bearing, i. e. motion of the body, or of a part of the body, esp. of the hand or arm), <hi rend="ital">carriage</hi>, <hi rend="ital">posture</hi>, <hi rend="ital">attitude</hi>, <hi rend="ital">motion</hi>, <hi rend="ital">gesture</hi> (class.; cf. actus). </sense><sense id="n19551.1" n="A" level="2"> In gen.: <cit><quote lang="la">gestum imitari,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0550,001:4:343" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Lucr.</author> 4, 343</bibl></cit>; cf. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0550,001:367" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>ib.</author> 367</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">a forma removeatur omnis viro non dignus ornatus, et huic simile vitium in gestu motuque caveatur,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,055:1:36:130" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Off. 1, 36, 130</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">nunc gestus mihi vultusque est capiundus novus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0134,004:5:6:50" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ter.</author> Phorm. 5, 6, 50</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">hoc quidem Zeno gestu conficiebat,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Ac. 2, 47, 145</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">gratificatur mihi gestu accusator,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,026:6:14" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Balb. 6, 14</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">gestum manus Ceycis habebat,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,006:11:673" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ov.</author> M. 11, 673</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">ab avium gestu gestuque,</quote> <trans><tr>motion</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1348,001:life=aug.:7" default="NO"><author>Suet.</author> Aug. 7</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">quo gestu gallina secetur,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1276,001:5:124" default="NO"><author>Juv.</author> 5, 124</bibl></cit>.—<hi rend="ital">Plur.</hi>: nec flecti cervix nec <cb n="GIBB" /> brachia reddere gestus, Nec pes ire potest, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,006:6:308" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ov.</author> M. 6, 308</bibl>.—</sense><sense id="n19551.2" n="B" level="2"> In partic., <hi rend="ital">a gesture</hi>, <hi rend="ital">gesticulation</hi> of actors or orators according to the rules of art: <cit><quote lang="la">numquam agit hunc versum Roscius eo gestu, quo potest, sed abjicit prorsus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,037:3:26:102" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> de Or. 3, 26, 102</bibl></cit>; cf. <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> Quint. 24, 77</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">gestus histrionis,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,057:6:1:8" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Att. 6, 1, 8</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">convenit igitur in gestu nec venustatem conspiciendam nec turpitudinem esse, ne aut histriones aut operarii videamur esse,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Auct. Her.</author> 3, 15, 26</bibl></cit>; cf.: <cit><quote lang="la">vox et gestus subito sumi et aliunde arripi non potest,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,037:1:59:252" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> de Or. 1, 59, 252</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">omnis actio in duas partes divisa, vocem gestumque,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:11:3:14" default="NO"><author>Quint.</author> 11, 3, 14</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:2:59:242" default="NO"><author>id.</author> 2, 59, 242</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">tardiore et consideratiore gestu uti,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Auct. Her.</author> 3, 15, 27</bibl></cit>: jactantior, Cael. ap. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:11:1:51" default="NO"><author>Quint.</author> 11, 1, 51</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">acer atque instans,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:11:3:92" default="NO"><author>Quint.</author> 11, 3, 92</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">certus sed paulo productior,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:ib" default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib.</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">comicus magis quam oratorius,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:ib. 125" default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 125</bibl></cit> et saep.—<hi rend="ital">Plur.</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">histrionum nonnulli gestus ineptiis non vacant,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,055:1:36:130" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Off. 1, 36, 130</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">alterni,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:6:3:65" default="NO"><author>Quint.</author> 6, 3, 65</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">breves,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:11:3:100" default="NO"><author>id.</author> 11, 3, 100</bibl></cit>: quae (concinnitas) verborum collocationem illuminat his luminibus, quae Graeci quasi aliquos gestus orationis <foreign lang="greek">sxh/mata</foreign> appellant, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,040:25:83" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Or. 25, 83</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:9:1:13" default="NO"><author>Quint.</author> 9, 1, 13</bibl>; <cit><quote lang="la">and without quasi,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1254,001:11:13:10" default="NO"><author>Gell.</author> 11, 13, 10</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">Urbicus risum movet gestibus Autonoes,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1276,001:6:72" default="NO"><author>Juv.</author> 6, 72</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n19551.3" n="II" level="1"> (Acc. to gero, II. B. 3.) <hi rend="ital">A management</hi>, <hi rend="ital">administration</hi> (post-class.), <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,2806,001:26:10:3:section=9" default="NO"><author>Dig.</author> 26, 10, 3, § 9</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,2806,001:7:23" default="NO"><author>ib.</author> 7, 23</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,2806,001:5:section=2" default="NO"><author>ib.</author> 5, § 2</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
gesum: <entryFree id="n19552" type="main" key="ge_sum"><orth extent="full" lang="la">gēsum</orth>, <itype>i</itype>, v. gaesum.</entryFree>
getae: <entryFree id="n19553" type="main" key="Ge^tae"><orth extent="full" lang="la">Gĕtae</orth>, <itype>ārum</itype>, <gen>m.</gen>, = <foreign lang="greek">*ge/tai</foreign>, <sense id="n19553.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a Thracian tribe on the Danube</hi>, <hi rend="ital">bordering on the Dacians</hi>, <hi rend="ital">the Getœ</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,057:9:10:3" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Att. 9, 10, 3</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0929,001:2:2:3" default="NO"><author>Mel.</author> 2, 2, 3</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:4:41" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 4, 11, 18, § 41</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:4:80" default="NO" valid="yes">4, 12, 25, § 80</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,057:9:10:3" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Att. 9, 10, 3</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,002:3:462" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> G. 3, 462</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,009:3:4:92" default="NO"><author>Ov.</author> P. 3, 4, 92</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0893,001:3:24:11" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Hor.</author> C. 3, 24, 11</bibl>; <bibl default="NO">4, 15, 22</bibl>.—In <number>sing.</number>: <orth extent="full" lang="la">Gĕta</orth>, <itype>ae</itype>, <gen>m.</gen>, <hi rend="ital">a Getan</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,009:1:8:6" default="NO"><author>Ov.</author> P. 1, 8, 6</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1014,001:Hippol. 167" default="NO"><author>Sen.</author> Hippol. 167</bibl>; in the Gr. form, <orth extent="full" lang="la">Gĕtes</orth>, <itype>ae</itype>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,009:1:2:108" default="NO"><author>Ov.</author> P. 1, 2, 108</bibl>; <bibl default="NO">2, 1, 66</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0917,001:2:54 al" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Luc.</author> 2, 54 al.</bibl>—</sense><sense id="n19553.1" n="B" level="2"> <usg type="style">Transf.</usg>: <orth extent="full" lang="la">Gĕta</orth>, <itype>ae</itype>, <gen>m.</gen>, <hi rend="ital">a Roman surname;</hi> as C. Licinius Geta, <hi rend="ital">consul</hi> A. U. C. 638, <hi rend="ital">censor</hi> 646, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,010:42:119" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Clu. 42, 119</bibl>; and Geta, <hi rend="ital">brother and coregent of the emperor Caracalla</hi>, Spart. Ant. Geta, 1 sqq. Also <hi rend="ital">the name of a Greek slave</hi>, Ter. Ad. and Phorm.—</sense><sense id="n19553.2" n="II" level="1"> Derivv. </sense><sense id="n19553.3" n="A" level="2"> <orth extent="full" lang="la">Gĕtes</orth>, <itype>ae</itype>, <hi rend="ital">adj. m.</hi>, <hi rend="ital">of</hi> or <hi rend="ital">belonging to the Getœ</hi>, <hi rend="ital">Getan</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">poëta,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,009:4:13:17" default="NO"><author>Ov.</author> P. 4, 13, 17</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">Hebrus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1014,001:Herc. Oet. 1041" default="NO"><author>Sen.</author> Herc. Oet. 1041</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n19553.4" n="B" level="2"> <orth extent="full" lang="la">Gĕtĭcus</orth>, <itype>a, um</itype>, <pos>adj.</pos>, <hi rend="ital">Getan</hi>, in <usg type="style">poet.</usg> transf. also for <hi rend="ital">Thracian</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">gens,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,008:5:7:13" default="NO"><author>Ov.</author> Tr. 5, 7, 13</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">arma,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,009:2:8:69" default="NO"><author>id.</author> P. 2, 8, 69</bibl></cit>; <cit><quote lang="la">hence also: maritus Veneris (i.e. Mars),</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1020,002:1:2:53" default="NO"><author>Stat.</author> S. 1, 2, 53</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">sermo,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,009:4:13:19" default="NO"><author>Ov.</author> P. 4, 13, 19</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">lyra,</quote> <trans>i. e. <tr>of the Thracian Orpheus</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1020,002:3:1:17" default="NO"><author>Stat.</author> S. 3, 1, 17</bibl></cit>; cf. <cit><quote lang="la">plectrum,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 2, 2, 61</bibl></cit>: volucres, i. e. <hi rend="ital">the swallows</hi> (because Progne, wife of the Thracian king Tereus, was changed into a swallow), <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1020,001:12:478" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Th. 12, 478</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">(aqua) frigidior Geticis pruinis,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1276,001:5:50" default="NO"><author>Juv.</author> 5, 50</bibl></cit>—<hi rend="ital">Adv.</hi>: <orth extent="full" lang="la">Gĕtĭce</orth>, <hi rend="ital">like the Getœ</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">loqui,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,008:5:12:58" default="NO"><author>Ov.</author> Tr. 5, 12, 58</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
gethyum: <entryFree id="n19554" type="greek" key="ge_thy^um"><orth extent="full" lang="la">gēthyum</orth>, <itype>yi</itype>, <gen>n.</gen>, = <foreign lang="greek">gh/quon</foreign>, <sense id="n19554.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a kind of onion</hi>, <hi rend="ital">leek</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:19:105" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 19, 6, 32, § 105</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:19:117" default="NO" valid="yes">19, 7, 35, § 117</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
getice: <entryFree id="n19555" type="main" key="Ge^ti^ce"><orth extent="full" lang="la">Gĕtĭce</orth>, <pos>adv.</pos>, v. Getae, II. B. <sense id="n19555.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">fin.</hi></sense></entryFree>
geticus: <entryFree id="n19556" type="main" key="Ge^ti^cus"><orth extent="full" lang="la">Gĕtĭcus</orth>, <itype>a, um</itype>, v. Getae, II. B.</entryFree>
getuli: <entryFree id="n19557" type="main" key="Ge_tu_li_"><orth extent="full" lang="la">Gētūlī</orth>, <itype>and its derivatives</itype>, v. Gaetuli.</entryFree>
geum: <entryFree id="n19558" type="main" key="ge_um"><orth extent="full" lang="la">gēum</orth>, <itype>i</itype>, <gen>n.</gen>, <sense id="n19558.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">the herb bennet</hi>, <hi rend="ital">avens</hi>, Geum urbanum, Linn.; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:26:37" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 26, 7, 21, § 37</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
gibba: <entryFree id="n19559" type="main" key="gibba"><orth extent="full" lang="la">gibba</orth>, <itype>ae</itype>, v. 1. gibbus, II. B.</entryFree>
gibber: <entryFree id="n19560" type="main" key="gibber1" n="1"><orth extent="full" lang="la">gibber</orth>, <itype>ĕra, ĕrum</itype>, <pos>adj.</pos> <etym>like gibbus; kindr. to Sanscr. kubya, hunch-backed; Gr. <foreign lang="greek">kufo/s, ku/ptw</foreign></etym>, <sense id="n19560.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">crook-backed</hi>, <hi rend="ital">hunch-backed</hi>, <hi rend="ital">hump-backed.</hi> </sense><sense id="n19560.1" n="I" level="1"> <usg type="style">Lit.</usg>: <cit><quote lang="la">(boves) ne gibberi, sed spina leviter remissa,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0684,001:R. R. 2:5:7" default="NO"><author>Varr.</author> R. R. 2, 5, 7</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">gallinae,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0684,001:ib. 3:9:18" default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 3, 9, 18</bibl></cit>; cf.: <cit><quote lang="la">genus gallinarum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:10:74" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 10, 26, 38, § 74</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">Clesippus fullo, gibber praeterea et alio foedus aspectu,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:34:3:6" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> 34, 3, 6</bibl></cit>; cf. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1348,001:life=gal.:3" default="NO"><author>Suet.</author> Galb. 3</bibl>: tuber, Maecen. poët. ap. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1014,001:Ep. 101:11" default="NO"><author>Sen.</author> Ep. 101, 11</bibl>.—* </sense><sense id="n19560.2" n="II" level="1"> <usg type="style">Transf.</usg>, <hi rend="ital">protuberant</hi>: gibberum pro exstanti et eminenti, Varr. ap. <bibl default="NO"><author>Non.</author> 452, 5</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">cum capite gibbero,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 6, 24</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>

<entryFree id="n19561" type="main" key="gibber2" n="2"><orth extent="full" lang="la">gibber</orth>, <itype>ĕris</itype>, <gen>m.</gen> <etym>1. gibber</etym>, <sense id="n19561.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a hunch</hi> or <hi rend="ital">hump on the back</hi> (post-Aug.), <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:8:179" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 8, 45, 70, § 179</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">quod erat aucto gibbere,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>App.</author> Flor. p. 350</bibl></cit>; cf. also 1. gibbus, II.</sense></entryFree>
gibberosus: <entryFree id="n19562" type="main" key="gibbe^ro_sus"><orth extent="full" lang="la">gibbĕrōsus</orth>, <itype>a, um</itype>, <pos>adj.</pos> <etym>2. gibber</etym>, <sense id="n19562.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">badly hump-backed</hi> or <hi rend="ital">hunch-backed.</hi> </sense><sense id="n19562.1" n="I" level="1"> <usg type="style">Lit.</usg>, Auct. ap. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1348,004:9" default="NO"><author>Suet.</author> Gram. 9</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">vel protervi vel gibberosi vel curvi vel pruriginosi, etc.,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,2806,001:21:1:3" default="NO"><author>Dig.</author> 21, 1, 3</bibl></cit> (al. gibbosi).—</sense><sense id="n19562.2" n="II" level="1"> <usg type="style">Trop.</usg>: <cit><quote lang="la">sermones,</quote> <trans><tr>crooked</tr>, <tr>twisted</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1248,001:, Eloqu. p. 231" default="NO"><author>Fronto</author>, Eloqu. p. 231</bibl></cit> Mai. <cb n="GIGN" /></sense></entryFree>
gibbosus: <entryFree id="n19563" type="main" key="gibbo_sus"><orth extent="full" lang="la">gibbōsus</orth>, <itype>a, um</itype>, v. the preceding art. I. <sense id="n19563.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">fin.</hi></sense></entryFree>
gibbus: <entryFree id="n19564" type="main" key="gibbus1" n="1"><orth extent="full" lang="la">gibbus</orth>, <itype>a, um</itype>, <pos>adj.</pos> <etym>cf. <foreign lang="greek">ku/ptw, kufo/s</foreign>, bent, bowed, crooked; v. gibber</etym>, <sense id="n19564.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">hunched</hi>, <hi rend="ital">humped</hi>, <hi rend="ital">gibbous.</hi> </sense><sense id="n19564.1" n="I" level="1"> <hi rend="ital">Adj.</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">calvaria ex interiore parte concava, extrinsecus gibba,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0836,001:8:1" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cels.</author> 8, 1</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n19564.2" n="II" level="1"> <pos>Subst.</pos> </sense><sense id="n19564.3" n="A" level="2"> <orth extent="full" lang="la">gibbus</orth>, <itype>i</itype>, <gen>m.</gen>, <hi rend="ital">a hunch</hi>, <hi rend="ital">hump</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1276,001:10:294" default="NO"><author>Juv.</author> 10, 294</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1276,001:309" default="NO">309</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1276,001:6:109" default="NO">6, 109</bibl>.— </sense><sense id="n19564.4" n="B" level="2"> <orth extent="full" lang="la">gibba</orth>, <itype>ae</itype>, <gen>f.</gen>, the same, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1348,001:life=dom.:23" default="NO"><author>Suet.</author> Dom. 23</bibl>. —</sense><sense id="n19564.5" n="2" level="3"> <usg type="style">Transf.</usg>, <hi rend="ital">a hump-like swelling</hi>, <hi rend="ital">protuberance</hi>, <bibl default="NO"><author>Amm.</author> 23, 4</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>

<entryFree id="n19565" type="main" key="gibbus2" n="2"><orth extent="full" lang="la">gibbus</orth>, <itype>i</itype>, <sense id="n19565.0" n="I" level="1"><xr><lbl>v.</lbl> <ref type="sym" targOrder="U">the preced.</ref></xr> art. II. A.</sense></entryFree>
gigantomachia: <entryFree id="n19566" type="main" key="Gi^ganto^machi^a"><orth extent="full" lang="la">Gĭgantŏmachĭa</orth>, <itype>ae</itype>, <gen>f.</gen>, = <foreign lang="greek">*gigantomaxi/a</foreign>, <sense id="n19566.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">the battle of the giants</hi>, the title of a poem by Claudian.</sense></entryFree>
