gigas: <entryFree id="n19567" type="main" key="Gi^ga_s"><orth extent="full" lang="la">Gĭgās</orth>, <itype>antis</itype>, <gen>m.</gen>, = <foreign lang="greek">*gi/gas</foreign>, <sense id="n19567.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a giant;</hi> usually in <number>plur.</number>: <orth extent="full" lang="la">Gĭgantes</orth>, <itype>um</itype>, <gen>m.</gen>, = <foreign lang="greek">*gi/gantes</foreign>, <hi rend="ital">the fabled sons of Earth and Tartarus</hi>, <hi rend="ital">giants with snakes for legs</hi>, <hi rend="ital">who stormed the heavens</hi>, <hi rend="ital">but were smitten by Jupiter with lightning and buried under Ætna.—Sing.</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,009:2:10:24" default="NO"><author>Ov.</author> P. 2, 10, 24</bibl>; <case>acc.</case> giganta, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1020,001:5:569" default="NO"><author>Stat.</author> Th. 5, 569</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1294,001:9:51:6" default="NO"><author>Mart.</author> 9, 51, 6</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">gigantem,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Vulg.</author> Sirach, 47, 4</bibl></cit>.—<hi rend="ital">Plur.</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,007:5:35" default="NO"><author>Ov.</author> F. 5, 35</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,006:1:152" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> M. 1, 152</bibl>; <bibl default="NO">5, 319</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0893,001:2:19:22" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Hor.</author> C. 2, 19, 22</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,050:2:28:70" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> N. D. 2, 28, 70</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">gigantum more bellare,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> de Sen. 2, 5</bibl></cit>; Hyg. Fab. praef. (cf. also <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,002:1:278 sq" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> G. 1, 278 sq.</bibl>); <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1224,001:3:5:39" default="NO"><author>Prop.</author> 3, 5, 39</bibl> (dub.; <cit><quote lang="la">Müll. nocentum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1224,001:4:4:39" default="NO"><author>id.</author> 4, 4, 39</bibl></cit>).—</sense><sense id="n19567.1" n="II" level="1"> Deriv. <orth extent="full" lang="la">Gĭgan-tēus</orth>, <itype>a, um</itype>, <pos>adj.</pos>, <hi rend="ital">of</hi> or <hi rend="ital">belonging to the giants</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">bellum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,008:2:71" default="NO"><author>Ov.</author> Tr. 2, 71</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">sanguis,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Verg.</author> Cul. 27</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">triumphus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0893,001:3:1:7" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Hor.</author> C. 3, 1, 7</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">tropaea,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,007:5:555" default="NO"><author>Ov.</author> F. 5, 555</bibl></cit>: ora litoris, i. e. <hi rend="ital">at Cumœ</hi>, <hi rend="ital">in Campania</hi> (where, according to the myth, the giants dwelt in the Phlegræan Fields, and fought with the gods), <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1224,001:1:20:9" default="NO"><author>Prop.</author> 1, 20, 9</bibl> (cf. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1345,001:12:143 sq" default="NO"><author>Sil.</author> 12, 143 sq.</bibl>): <cit><quote lang="la">genus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:tlg,0527,004:13:34" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Vulg.</author> Num. 13, 34</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n19567.2" n="2" level="3"> <usg type="style">Transf.</usg>, <hi rend="ital">gigantic</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">corpus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1345,001:5:436" default="NO"><author>Sil.</author> 5, 436</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
gigeria: <entryFree id="n19568" type="main" key="gi^ge_ri^a"><orth extent="full" lang="la">gĭgērĭa</orth>, <itype>ōrum</itype>, <gen>n.</gen>, <sense id="n19568.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">the cooked entrails of poultry</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">gigeria intestina gallinarum cum hisetica (perh. hepatica, al. isiciis) cocta. Lucilius, lib. VIII.: gigeria sunt sive adeo hepatia,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Non.</author> 119, 20 sq.</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">gigeria optime facta,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Petr.</author> 66</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">pullorum coquere,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,2003,001:4:2" default="NO"><author>Apic.</author> 4, 2 <hi rend="ital">med.</hi></bibl></cit>!*? The explanation in Paul. ex <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1236,001:page=95" default="NO"><author>Fest.</author> p. 95</bibl> Müll., gigeria ex multis obsoniis decerpta, is evidently corrupt.</sense></entryFree>
gignentia: <entryFree id="n19569" type="main" key="gignentia"><orth extent="full" lang="la">gignentia</orth>, <itype>ĭum</itype>, <gen>n.</gen>, see gigno <sense id="n19569.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">fin.</hi></sense></entryFree>
gigno: <entryFree id="n19570" type="main" key="gigno"><orth extent="full" lang="la">gigno</orth>, <itype>gĕnŭi, gĕnĭtum, 3</itype> (archaic primary form of the <sense id="n19570.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">pres.</hi> <orth extent="full" lang="la">gĕno</orth>, ĕre: <cit><quote lang="la">genit,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0684,001:R. R. 2:2:19" default="NO"><author>Varr.</author> R. R. 2, 2, 19</bibl></cit>: genunt, Varr. ap. <bibl default="NO"><author>Prisc.</author> p. 898</bibl> P.: <cit><quote lang="la">genat,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0684,001:R. R. 1:31:4" default="NO"><author>Varr.</author> R. R. 1, 31, 4</bibl></cit>: genitur, Auct. ap. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,036:2:42:122" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Inv. 2, 42, 122</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,037:2:32:141" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> de Or. 2, 32, 141</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">genuntur,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0684,001:R. R. 2:6:3" default="NO"><author>Varr.</author> R. R. 2, 6, 3</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">genamur,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Censor.</author> 3, 1</bibl></cit>; <hi rend="ital">inf. pass.</hi> geni, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0550,001:3:797" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Lucr.</author> 3, 797</bibl>; <hi rend="ital">gen. gerund.</hi> genendi, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0684,001:R. R. 1:40:1" default="NO"><author>Varr.</author> R. R. 1, 40, 1</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">genendo,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Censor.</author> 3, 1</bibl></cit>; <bibl default="NO"><author>Arn.</author> 4, 21</bibl>; <hi rend="ital">inf. pres. pass.</hi> gignier, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0550,001:3:623" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Lucr.</author> 3, 623</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0550,001:6:246" default="NO" valid="yes">6, 246</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0550,001:807" default="NO" valid="yes">807</bibl>), <pos>v. a.</pos> <etym>root gen-; Sanscr. ǵan-, ǵanami, beget; gātis, birth; Gr. <foreign lang="greek">gen</foreign>- in <foreign lang="greek">gi/gnomai, ge/nos, gunh/</foreign>; Lat. genus, genius, gener, gens; also nascor (gn-; cf. gnatus), natura; cf. <foreign lang="greek">ga/mos, gambro/s</foreign> (v. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0860,001:Gr. Etym. 536" default="NO"><author>Curt.</author> Gr. Etym. 536</bibl>); gigno for gigeno, redupl. like <foreign lang="greek">gi/gnomai</foreign></etym>, <hi rend="ital">to beget</hi>, <hi rend="ital">bear</hi>, <hi rend="ital">bring forth</hi>, <hi rend="ital">produce;</hi> in <hi rend="ital">pass.</hi>, <hi rend="ital">to be born</hi>, <hi rend="ital">to spring</hi>, <hi rend="ital">arise</hi>, <hi rend="ital">proceed;</hi> of animate and inanimate subjects and objects (syn.: creo, genero, pario). </sense><sense id="n19570.1" n="I" level="1"> <usg type="style">Lit.</usg>: Saturno, quem Coelus genuit, Enn. ap. <bibl default="NO"><author>Non.</author> 197, 9</bibl> (Ann. v. 27 Vahl.): <cit><quote lang="la">sextus (Hercules) hic ex Alcumena, quem Juppiter genuit,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,050:3:16:42" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> N. D. 3, 16, 42</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">nec Hecubam causam interitus fuisse Trojanis, quod Alexandrum genuerit, nec Tyndareum Agamemnoni, quod Clytaemnestram,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,054:15:34" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Fat. 15, 34</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">quaecumque animal pariunt, in capita gignunt,</quote> <trans><tr>bring forth their young with the head foremost</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:10:183" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 10, 64, 84, § 183</bibl></cit>. So of the human mother (mostly post-Aug.): <cit><quote lang="la">idcirco, inquit Lacaena, genueram (filium),</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,049:1:42:102" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Tusc. 1, 42, 102</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">e septem liberis, quos ipsa genuisset, unum superesse,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0860,001:10:5:23" default="NO"><author>Curt.</author> 10, 5, 23</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">rectius Lolliam induci, quando nullos liberos genuisset,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1351,005:12:2" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Tac.</author> A. 12, 2 <hi rend="ital">init.</hi></bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1038,001:7:7:4" default="NO"><author>Val. Max.</author> 7, 7, 4</bibl>; so, <cit><quote lang="la">ex aliquo,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0860,001:8:3:3" default="NO"><author>Curt.</author> 8, 3, 3</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1351,005:12:3" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Tac.</author> A. 12, 3</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">pisces ova cum genuerunt, relinquunt,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,050:2:51:129" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> N. D. 2, 51, 129</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">ova,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:11:204" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 11, 37, 80, § 204</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">omnia quae terra gignat (shortly before, pariat),</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,050:1:2:4" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> N. D. 1, 2, 4</bibl></cit>; cf. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,048:5:11:33" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Fin. 5, 11, 33</bibl>: o Romule, Romule die, Qualem te patriae custodem di genuerunt! Enn. ap. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,043:1:41:64" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Rep. 1, 41, 64</bibl> (Ann. v. 116 Vahl.); cf.: <cit><quote lang="la">ut idem deus urbem hanc gentibus, vos huic urbi genuisse videatur,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,035:14:12:32" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Phil. 14, 12, 32</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">ita ut plurimum (aurum) Asturia gignat,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:33" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 33</bibl></cit>. <pb n="815" /> <cb n="GING" /> 4, 21, § <cit><quote lang="la">78: India eos (beryllos) gignit,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:37:76" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> 37, 5, 20, § 76</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">ad majora quaedam natura nos genuit et conformavit,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,048:1:7:23" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Fin. 1, 7, 23</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">deus animum ex sua mente et divinitate genuit,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,072:chapter=8" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Univ. 8</bibl></cit>.—<hi rend="ital">Pass.</hi>, usu. with <case>abl.</case>, of either or both parents: <cit><quote lang="la">Meri bellatores gignuntur,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,012:4:2:85" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Mil. 4, 2, 85</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">nuper erat genitus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,006:10:522" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ov.</author> M. 10, 522</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">qui antecedente anno genitum eum scribant,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1348,001:life=tib.:5" default="NO"><author>Suet.</author> Tib. 5</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">septimo mense geniti,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:11:158" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 11, 37, 59, § 158</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">pellice genitus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:40:9:2" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 40, 9, 2</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1348,001:life=aug.:17" default="NO"><author>Suet.</author> Aug. 17</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">Jove genitus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0860,001:8:10:1" default="NO"><author>Curt.</author> 8, 10, 1</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0860,001:9:8:22" default="NO">9, 8, 22</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">juvenes eadem matre geniti,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0860,001:6:14:4" default="NO"><author>id.</author> 6, 14, 4</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:1:3:3" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 1, 3, 3</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1348,001:life=aug.:17" default="NO"><author>Suet.</author> Aug. 17</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1348,001:life=tib.:7" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Tib. 7</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1348,001:life=nero:5" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Ner. 5 <hi rend="ital">fin.</hi></bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">genitum fratre adoptaverat,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1318,001:8:18:2" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> Ep. 8, 18, 2</bibl></cit>.—Also with <hi rend="ital">de</hi>, <hi rend="ital">ab</hi>, <hi rend="ital">ex</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">De quo Remulusque feroxque Acrota sunt geniti,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,006:14:617" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ov.</author> M. 14, 617</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">genitus de sanguine,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,010:1:748" default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 1, 748</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,002:16:117" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> H. 16, 117</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">de Jove,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1254,001:13:1:3" default="NO"><author>Gell.</author> 13, 1, 3</bibl></cit> (cf. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,043:2:19:34" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Rep. 2, 19, 34</bibl>): <cit><quote lang="la">filium ab eo genitum nominare,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,2806,001:12:7:10" default="NO"><author>Just.</author> 12, 7, 10</bibl></cit>; <cit><quote lang="la">but: a se (= ex se) genitum esse Vitellium,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1351,004:3:64" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Tac.</author> H. 3, 64</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">puer ex ea genitus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0860,001:8:10:36" default="NO"><author>Curt.</author> 8, 10, 36</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">(vacca) e terra genita,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,006:1:615" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ov.</author> M. 1, 615</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">dis genite et geniture deos,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,003:9:642" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> A. 9, 642</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">dis genitus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:1:10:9" default="NO"><author>Quint.</author> 1, 10, 9</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">adolescentis in omnium virtutum exempla geniti,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1044,001:2:116:2" default="NO"><author>Vell.</author> 2, 116, 2</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">quae in terris gignantur, ad usum hominum omnia creari,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,055:1:7:22" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Off. 1, 7, 22</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">nec enim id esset principium, quod gigneretur aliunde,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,043:6:25" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Rep. 6, 25</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">ubi tus gignitur,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,019:4:2:89" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Trin. 4, 2, 89</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">Corycium nemus, ubi crocum gignitur,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0860,001:3:4" default="NO"><author>Curt.</author> 3, 4 <hi rend="ital">fin.</hi></bibl></cit>—<usg type="style">Poet.</usg> with <hi rend="ital">inf.</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">omne potens animal leti genitumque nocere,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0917,001:6:485" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Luc.</author> 6, 485</bibl></cit>.—<usg type="style"><hi rend="ital">Absol.</hi></usg>: <cit><quote lang="la">ut in gignendo, in educando perfacile appareat,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,048:2:33:109" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Fin. 2, 33, 109</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">hae (mulieres), quae gignunt, imbecillos edunt,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0836,001:2:1" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cels.</author> 2, 1 <hi rend="ital">med.</hi></bibl></cit></sense><sense id="n19570.2" n="II" level="1"> <usg type="style">Trop.</usg>, <hi rend="ital">to produce</hi>, <hi rend="ital">occasion</hi>, <hi rend="ital">cause</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">multa nobis blandimenta natura ipsa genuit,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,024:17:41" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Cael. 17, 41</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">haec ipsa virtus amicitiam et gignit et continet,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,052:6:20" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Lael. 6, 20</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">ludus genuit trepidum certamen et iram, Ira truces inimicitias et funebre bellum,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Hor.</author> Ep. 1, 19, 48</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">qui genuit in hac urbe dicendi copiam,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,039:73:255" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Brut. 73, 255</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">praeceptiones,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Auct. Her.</author> 4, 3, 5</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">probationes,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:5:1:1" default="NO"><author>Quint.</author> 5, 1, 1</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">mel gignit insaniam,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:21:177" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 21, 13, 45, § 177</bibl></cit>; cf.: <cit><quote lang="la">baccharis odor somnum gignit,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:21:132" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> 21, 19, 77, § 132</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">alium sitim gignit,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:20:57" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> 20, 6, 23, § 57</bibl></cit>.—In <hi rend="ital">pass.</hi>, <hi rend="ital">to be born</hi>, <hi rend="ital">to spring</hi>, <hi rend="ital">arise</hi>, <hi rend="ital">proceed</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">cum ipse (Cato) sui generis initium ac nominis ab se gigni et propagari vellet,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,005:5:70:section=180" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Verr. 2, 5, 70, § 180</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">ex hac maxima libertate tyrannis gignitur et illa injustissima et durissima servitus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,043:1:44" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Rep. 1, 44</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">et aegritudines et metus et reliquae perturbationes omnes gignuntur ex ea (intemperantia),</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,049:4:9:22" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Tusc. 4, 9, 22</bibl></cit>: Plato eas (<foreign lang="greek">i)de/as</foreign>) gigni negat et ait semper esse, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,040:3:10" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Or. 3, 10</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">ipsi autem intelligamus natura gigni sensum diligendi et benevolentiae caritatem,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,052:9:32" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Lael. 9, 32</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">odia etiam gigni sempiterna (opp. exstingui familiaritates),</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 10, 35</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">in animorum permotione gignenda,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,037:3:30:118" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> de Or. 3, 30, 118</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">de gignenda et comparanda sapientia,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1254,001:13:8:1" default="NO"><author>Gell.</author> 13, 8, 1</bibl></cit>.—Hence, <orth extent="full" lang="la">gignentĭa</orth>, <itype>ĭum</itype>, <gen>n.</gen> (fruit-bearing), <hi rend="ital">organic bodies</hi>, <hi rend="ital">things that grow</hi>, as plants, trees, etc.: <cit><quote lang="la">loca nuda gignentium,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0631,001:J. 79:6" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Sall.</author> J. 79, 6</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">ilex aucta in altitudinem, quo cuncta gignentium natura fert,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0631,001:ib. 93:4" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> ib. 93, 4</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">animam animantium omnium non corpoream esse ... omniumque gignentium esse seniorem,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>App.</author> Dogm. Plat. p. 193</bibl></cit>; opp. animalia, Lact. de Ira Dei, 1, 13.</sense></entryFree>
gilbus: <entryFree id="n19571" type="main" key="gilbus"><orth extent="full" lang="la">gilbus</orth>, v. gilvus.</entryFree>
gillo: <entryFree id="n19572" type="main" key="gillo1" n="1"><orth extent="full" lang="la">gillo</orth>, <itype>ōnis</itype>, <gen>m.</gen>, <sense id="n19572.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a cooling-vessel</hi>, <hi rend="ital">cooler</hi> for liquids, Poët. in <bibl default="NO"><author>Anthol. Lat.</author> 2, p. 369</bibl> and 406 Burm.; cf. <foreign lang="greek">bauka/lion</foreign> gillo, Gloss. Philox.</sense></entryFree>

<entryFree id="n19573" type="main" key="Gillo2" n="2"><orth extent="full" lang="la">Gillo</orth>, <itype>ōnis</itype>, <gen>m.</gen>, <sense id="n19573.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">the name of a legacyhunter</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1276,001:1:40" default="NO"><author>Juv.</author> 1, 40</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
gilvus: <entryFree id="n19574" type="main" key="gilvus"><orth extent="full" lang="la">gilvus</orth> (in late Lat. also <orth extent="full" lang="la">gilbus</orth>; <sense id="n19574.0" n="I" level="1"><xr><lbl>v.</lbl> the letter <ref targOrder="U">B</ref></xr>), <itype>a, um</itype>, <pos>adj.</pos> <etym>kindr. with Germ. gelb.; Engl. yellow; Sanscr. gāura</etym>, <hi rend="ital">pale yellow</hi>: equi, Varr. ap. <bibl default="NO"><author>Non.</author> 80, 2</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,002:3:83" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> G. 3, 83</bibl>; <bibl default="NO"><author>Pall.</author> Mart. 13, 4</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
gindes: <entryFree id="n19575" type="main" key="Gindes"><orth extent="full" lang="la">Gindes</orth>, <itype>is</itype>, v. Gyndes.</entryFree>
gingidion: <entryFree id="n19576" type="greek" key="gingi^di^on"><orth extent="full" lang="la">gingĭdĭon</orth>, <itype>ii</itype>, <gen>n.</gen>, = <foreign lang="greek">giggi/dion</foreign>, <sense id="n19576.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a small Syrian plant;</hi> acc. to Sprengel, <hi rend="ital">the French carrot</hi>, Daucus gingidium, Linn.; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:20:33" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 20, 5, 16, § 33</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
gingilismus: <entryFree id="n19577" type="greek" key="gingi^lismus"><orth extent="full" lang="la">gingĭlismus</orth>, <itype>i</itype>, <gen>m.</gen>, = <foreign lang="greek">gigglismo/s</foreign>, <sense id="n19577.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">pealing laughter</hi>, <bibl default="NO"><author>Petr.</author> 73, 4</bibl> (where others read <orth extent="full" lang="la">gingĭlĭphos</orth> in the same signification).</sense></entryFree>
gingiva: <entryFree id="n19578" type="main" key="gi^ngi_va"><orth extent="full" lang="la">gĭngīva</orth>, <itype>ae</itype>, <gen>f.</gen>, <sense id="n19578.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a gum</hi>: inter dentem <cb n="GLAC" /> et gingivam, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0836,001:6:13" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cels.</author> 6, 13</bibl>; cf. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0472,001:39:19" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cat.</author> 39, 19</bibl>; so in <number>sing.</number>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:30:26" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 30, 3, 8, § 26</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1276,001:10:200" default="NO"><author>Juv.</author> 10, 200</bibl>.— In <number>plur.</number>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0836,001:6:13" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cels.</author> 6, 13</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0836,001:7:12" default="NO" valid="yes">7, 12</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0836,001:2:1" default="NO" valid="yes">2, 1</bibl>; 2, 7 et saep.; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:29:37" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 29, 2, 10, § 37</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:30:24" default="NO" valid="yes">30, 3, 8, § 24</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0472,001:97:6" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cat.</author> 97, 6</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
gingivula: <entryFree id="n19579" type="main" key="gingi_vu^la"><orth extent="full" lang="la">gingīvŭla</orth>, <itype>ae</itype>, <gen>f.</gen> <lbl>dim.</lbl> <etym>gingiva</etym>, <sense id="n19579.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a small gum</hi> (post-class. and very rare), <bibl default="NO"><author>App.</author> Mag. p. 277</bibl>; <bibl default="NO"><author>Veg.</author> Vet. 2, 22</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
gingriator: <entryFree id="n19580" type="gloss" key="gingria_tor"><orth extent="full" lang="la">gingriātor</orth> <itype>tibicen</itype>, Paul. ex <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1236,001:page=95" default="NO"><author>Fest.</author> p. 95</bibl> Müll. <sense id="n19580.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">N. cr.</hi></sense></entryFree>
gingrina: <entryFree id="n19581" type="main" key="gingri_na"><orth extent="full" lang="la">gingrīna</orth>, <itype>ae</itype>, <gen>f.</gen> <etym>‡ gingrio</etym>, <sense id="n19581.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a kind of small flute</hi>, <bibl default="NO"><author>Sol.</author> 5</bibl>; Paul. ex Fest. s. v. gingrio, p. 95 Müll.</sense></entryFree>
gingrire: <entryFree id="n19582" type="gloss" key="gingri_re"><orth extent="full" lang="la">gingrīre</orth> anserum vocis proprium est. Unde genus quoddam tibiarum exiguarum gingrinae, Paul. ex <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1236,001:page=95" default="NO"><author>Fest.</author> p. 95</bibl> Müll.; cf. the foll. art.</entryFree>
gingritus: <entryFree id="n19583" type="main" key="gingri_tus"><orth extent="full" lang="la">gingrītus</orth>, <itype>ūs</itype>, <gen>m.</gen> <etym>‡ gingrĭo</etym>, <sense id="n19583.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">the cackling of geese</hi> (post-class.), <bibl default="NO"><author>Arn.</author> 6, 205</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
gingrum: <entryFree id="n19584" type="gloss" key="gingrum"><orth extent="full" lang="la">gingrum</orth> <foreign lang="greek">fwnh\ xhno/s</foreign>, Gloss. Philox.</entryFree>
ginnus: <entryFree id="n19585" type="main" key="ginnus"><orth extent="full" lang="la">ginnus</orth>, <itype>i</itype>, v. hinnus.</entryFree>
git: <entryFree id="n19586" type="main" key="git"><orth extent="full" lang="la">git</orth> (also <orth extent="full" lang="la">gith</orth> and <orth extent="full" lang="la">gicti</orth>, acc. to <bibl default="NO"><author>Charis.</author> p. 106</bibl> P.), <itype>indecl.</itype> <gen>n.</gen>, <sense id="n19586.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a planc</hi>, <hi rend="ital">called also</hi> melanthion <hi rend="ital">and</hi> melanspermon, <hi rend="ital">Roman coriander</hi>, Nigella sativa, Linn.; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:20:182 sq" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 20, 17, 71, § 182 sq.</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:19:167" default="NO" valid="yes">19, 8, 52, § 167</bibl> sq.; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0836,001:2:33" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cels.</author> 2, 33</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0845,001:6:34:1" default="NO"><author>Col.</author> 6, 34, 1</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1011,001:Comp. 131 al" default="NO"><author>Scrib.</author> Comp. 131 al.</bibl></sense></entryFree>
gitanae: <entryFree id="n19587" type="main" key="Gita_nae"><orth extent="full" lang="la">Gitānae</orth>, <itype>ārum</itype>, <gen>f.</gen>, <sense id="n19587.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a city of Epirus</hi>, <hi rend="ital">near Corcyra</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:42:38:1" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 42, 38, 1</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
glabellus: <entryFree id="n19588" type="main" key="gla^bellus"><orth extent="full" lang="la">glăbellus</orth>, <itype>a, um</itype>, <sense id="n19588.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">adj. dim.</hi> [glaber], <hi rend="ital">without hair</hi>, <hi rend="ital">smooth</hi> (post-class.): <cit><quote lang="la">corpus Cupidinis,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>App.</author> M. 5, p. 168, 28</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">feminal,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 2</bibl></cit>, p. 122, 11: <cit><quote lang="la">Apollo corpore glabellus,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> Flor. 1, p. 341</bibl></cit>; <bibl default="NO"><author>Mart. Cap.</author> 2, 34</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
glaber: <entryFree id="n19589" type="main" key="gla^ber"><orth extent="full" lang="la">glăber</orth>, <itype>bra, brum</itype>, <pos>adj.</pos> <etym>root <foreign lang="greek">glaf-, gla/fw</foreign>, to hollow out, <foreign lang="greek">glafuro/s</foreign>; cf. scalpo</etym>, <sense id="n19589.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">without hair</hi>, <hi rend="ital">smooth</hi>, <hi rend="ital">bald</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">oves glabrae quam haec est manus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,019:2:4:140" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Trin. 2, 4, 140</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">si quem glabrum facere velis,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0684,001:R. R. 1:2:26" default="NO"><author>Varr.</author> R. R. 1, 2, 26</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">oves ventre glabro,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0684,001:ib. 2:2:6" default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 2, 2, 6</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">colla boum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0845,001:6:14:7" default="NO"><author>Col.</author> 6, 14, 7</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">crure glaber,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1294,001:12:38:4" default="NO"><author>Mart.</author> 12, 38, 4</bibl></cit>: glaber erat tamquam rien, Plaut. Fragm. ap. Fest. s. v. rienes, p. 276 and 277 Müll.: hordeum, Turran. ap. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:18:75" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 18, 7, 15, § 75</bibl>: tapete, Turp. ap. <bibl default="NO"><author>Non.</author> 542, 18</bibl>.—<hi rend="ital">Comp.</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">tu istum gallum glabriorem reddes mihi, quam volsus ludiu'st,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,003:2:9:6" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Aul. 2, 9, 6</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">maritus cucurbitā glabrior,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>App.</author> M. 5, p. 163</bibl></cit>,—</sense><sense id="n19589.1" n="II" level="1"> <usg type="style">Transf.</usg>, as <hi rend="ital">subst.</hi>: <orth extent="full" lang="la">glăber</orth>, <itype>bri</itype>, <gen>m.</gen>, <hi rend="ital">a young</hi> (<hi rend="ital">beardless</hi>) <hi rend="ital">slave</hi>, <hi rend="ital">favorite slave</hi> of the Romans, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0472,001:61:142" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cat.</author> 61, 142</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0975,001:4:5:22" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Phaedr.</author> 4, 5, 22</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1014,001:Ep. 47" default="NO"><author>Sen.</author> Ep. 47</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1014,001:Brev. Vit. 12" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Brev. Vit. 12</bibl>; <bibl default="NO"><author>Inscr. Orell.</author> 694</bibl>; <bibl default="NO">2911</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
glabraria: <entryFree id="n19590" type="hapax" key="gla^bra_ri^a"><orth extent="full" lang="la">glăbrārĭa</orth>, <itype>ae</itype>, <gen>f.</gen> <etym>glaber</etym>, in a comic double sense, <sense id="n19590.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">she who loves smooth-skinned slaves</hi>, and <hi rend="ital">she who is shorn smooth</hi>, i. e. robbed of her money, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1294,001:4:28:7" default="NO"><author>Mart.</author> 4, 28, 7</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
glabresco: <entryFree id="n19591" type="hapax" key="gla^bresco"><orth extent="full" lang="la">glăbresco</orth>, <itype>ĕre</itype>, <sense id="n19591.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">v. inch. n.</hi> [id.], <hi rend="ital">to grow smooth</hi>, <hi rend="ital">bare</hi>, <hi rend="ital">bald</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0845,001:2:19:2" default="NO"><author>Col.</author> 2, 19, 2</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
glabreta: <entryFree id="n19592" type="hapax" key="gla^bre_ta"><orth extent="full" lang="la">glăbrēta</orth>, <itype>ōrum</itype>, <gen>n.</gen> <etym>id.</etym>, <sense id="n19592.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">bare places</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0845,001:2:9:9" default="NO"><author>Col.</author> 2, 9, 9</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
glabrio: <entryFree id="n19593" type="main" key="Glabri^o"><orth extent="full" lang="la">Glabrĭo</orth>, <itype>ōnis</itype>, <gen>m.</gen> <etym>id.</etym>, <sense id="n19593.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a surname in the</hi> gens Acilia, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:33:34" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 33, 34</bibl>; <bibl default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> de Imp. Pomp. 9, 26 al.</bibl></sense></entryFree>
glabritas: <entryFree id="n19594" type="hapax" key="gla^bri^tas"><orth extent="full" lang="la">glăbrĭtas</orth>, <itype>ātis</itype>, <gen>f.</gen> <etym>id.</etym>, <sense id="n19594.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">smoothness of the skin</hi>, <hi rend="ital">baldness</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">calvitiis et glabritatibus rasi,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Arn.</author> 3, 108</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
glabro: <entryFree id="n19595" type="hapax" key="gla^bro"><orth extent="full" lang="la">glăbro</orth>, <itype>āre</itype>, <pos>v. a.</pos> <etym>id.</etym>, <sense id="n19595.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">to make bare</hi>, <hi rend="ital">to deprive of hair</hi> or <hi rend="ital">bristles</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0845,001:12:55:4" default="NO"><author>Col.</author> 12, 55, 4</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
glacialis: <entryFree id="n19596" type="main" key="gla^ci^a_lis"><orth extent="full" lang="la">glăcĭālis</orth>, <itype>e</itype>, <pos>adj.</pos> <etym>glacies</etym>, <sense id="n19596.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">icy</hi>, <hi rend="ital">frozen</hi>, <hi rend="ital">full of ice</hi> (<usg type="style">poet.</usg> and in post-Aug. prose; <cit><quote lang="la">syn.: frigidus, algidus, gelidus, rigidus). hiems,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,003:3:285" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> A. 3, 285</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,006:2:30" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ov.</author> M. 2, 30</bibl>; cf. <cit><quote lang="la">frigus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,010:9:582" default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 9, 582</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">polus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,010:2:173" default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 2, 173</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">Scythia,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,010:8:790" default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 8, 790</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">regio (opp. perfervida),</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0845,001:3:1:3" default="NO"><author>Col.</author> 3, 1, 3</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">Oceanus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1276,001:2:1" default="NO"><author>Juv.</author> 2, 1</bibl></cit>; cf. <cit><quote lang="la">pontus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0917,001:1:18" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Luc.</author> 1, 18</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
glacies: <entryFree id="n19597" type="main" key="gla^ci^es"><orth extent="full" lang="la">glăcĭes</orth>, <itype>ēi</itype>, <gen>f.</gen> <etym>root in Gr. <foreign lang="greek">ga/la, galakt</foreign>-; cf. <foreign lang="greek">glaga/w</foreign>, to be milky, etc.; Germ. Gletscher; v. gelu</etym>, <sense id="n19597.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">ice</hi> (cf.; gelu, pruina). </sense><sense id="n19597.1" n="I" level="1"> <usg type="style">Lit.</usg>: <cit><quote lang="la">sol glaciem dissolvit,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0550,001:6:963" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Lucr.</author> 6, 963</bibl></cit>; so <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0550,001:878" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>ib.</author> 878</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">ne teneras glacies secet aspera plantas,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,001:10:49" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> E. 10, 49</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0893,001:2:9:5" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Hor.</author> C. 2, 9, 5</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,006:2:808" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ov.</author> M. 2, 808</bibl>; <bibl default="NO">13, 795</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:8:103" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 8, 28, 42, § 103</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">lubrica,</quote> <trans><tr>slippery ice</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:21:36:7" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 21, 36, 7</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">Maeotica,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1276,001:4:42" default="NO"><author>Juv.</author> 4, 42</bibl></cit> et saep.—In <number>plur.</number>: <cit><quote lang="la">glacies,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,002:4:517" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> G. 4, 517</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">glacierum,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Sid.</author> Ep. 4, 6 <hi rend="ital">fin.</hi></bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:tlg,0527,056:3:70" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Vulg.</author> Dan. 3, 70</bibl>.—* </sense><sense id="n19597.2" n="II" level="1"> <usg type="style">Transf.</usg>, <hi rend="ital">hardness</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">tum glacies aeris flamma devicta liquescit,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0550,001:1:493" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Lucr.</author> 1, 493</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
glacio: <entryFree id="n19598" type="main" key="gla^ci^o"><orth extent="full" lang="la">glăcĭo</orth>, <itype>āvi, ātum, 1</itype>, <pos>v. a.</pos> and <gen>n.</gen> <etym>glacies</etym> (not ante-Aug.). <sense id="n19598.0" n="I" level="1"> <hi rend="ital">Act.</hi>, <hi rend="ital">to make</hi> or <hi rend="ital">turn into ice;</hi> in <hi rend="ital">pass.</hi>, <hi rend="ital">to freeze</hi>, <hi rend="ital">congeal.</hi> </sense><sense id="n19598.1" n="A" level="2"> <usg type="style">Lit.</usg>: positas ut glaciet nives Puro numine<cb n="GLAD" />  Juppiter, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0893,001:3:10:7" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Hor.</author> C. 3, 10, 7</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">humor glaciatur arescitve in gemmas,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:8:137" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 8, 38, 57, § 137</bibl></cit>; cf. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:2:105" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> 2, 39, 39, § 105</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">ruptis vasis (vini) stetere glaciatae moles,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:14:132" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> 14, 21, 27, § 132</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:24:116" default="NO" valid="yes">24, 13, 72, § 116</bibl>.—</sense><sense id="n19598.2" n="2" level="3"> <usg type="style">Transf.</usg>, <hi rend="ital">to render hard</hi> or <hi rend="ital">solid</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">nec dubium quin fici ramulis glaciatus caseus jucundissime sapiat,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0845,001:7:8:2" default="NO"><author>Col.</author> 7, 8, 2</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n19598.3" n="B" level="2"> <usg type="style">Trop.</usg>: <cit><quote lang="la">stupet anxius alto Corda metu glaciante pater,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1020,001:10:622" default="NO"><author>Stat.</author> Th. 10, 622</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n19598.4" n="II" level="1"> <hi rend="ital">Neutr.</hi>, <hi rend="ital">to become hard</hi>, <hi rend="ital">to harden</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">(unguentum) fit hieme, quoniam aestate non glaciat, nisi acceptā cerā,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:29:56" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 29, 3, 13, § 56</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
gladiarius: <entryFree id="n19599" type="gloss" key="gla^di^a_ri^us"><orth extent="full" lang="la">glădĭārĭus</orth>, <itype>a, um</itype>, <pos>adj.</pos> <etym>gladius</etym>, <sense id="n19599.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">of</hi> or <hi rend="ital">belonging to swords</hi>, <hi rend="ital">sword-</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">negotiator,</quote> <trans><tr>a sword-dealer</tr>,</trans> <bibl default="NO"><author>Inscr. Orell.</author> 4247</bibl></cit>.—<hi rend="ital">Subst.</hi>: ‡ <orth extent="full" lang="la">gladiarius</orth>, <itype>ii</itype>, <gen>m.</gen>, <hi rend="ital">a sword-cutler</hi>, <bibl default="NO"><author>Inscr. Orell.</author> 4197</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
gladiator: <entryFree id="n19600" type="main" key="gla^di^a_tor"><orth extent="full" lang="la">glădĭātor</orth>, <itype>ōris</itype>, <gen>m.</gen> <etym>gladius; cf. digladior</etym>, <sense id="n19600.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a swordsman</hi>, <hi rend="ital">fighter</hi> in the public games, <hi rend="ital">a gladiator</hi> (cf.: lanista, mirmillo, secutor, retiarius, bestiarius, pugil, athleta). </sense><sense id="n19600.1" n="I" level="1"> <usg type="style">Lit.</usg>: <cit><quote lang="la">athletae et gladiatores,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,040:68:228" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Or. 68, 228</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">gladiatorum spectaculum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,049:2:17:41" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Tusc. 2, 17, 41</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">ut emat gladiatores,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,015:19:55" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Sull. 19, 55</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">ut gladiatoribus imperari solet,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,022:37:80" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Sest. 37, 80</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">nobiles,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,035:3:14:35" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Phil. 3, 14, 35</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">tam bonus gladiator rudem tam cito accepisti,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 2, 29, 74</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">quis tota Italia veneficus, quis gladiator, quis latro, quis sicarius, etc.,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,013:2:4:7" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Cat. 2, 4, 7</bibl></cit>.—As a term of reproach: <cit><quote lang="la">Gracchorum potentiam majorem fuisse arbitramini quam hujus gladiatoris (i. e. Antonii) futura sit?</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,035:5:12:32" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Phil. 5, 12, 32</bibl></cit>; <bibl default="NO">7, 6, 17</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,005:3:62:section=146" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Verr. 2, 3, 62, § 146</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">vetus proverbium est, gladiatorem in arena capere consilium,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1014,001:Ep. 22:1" default="NO"><author>Sen.</author> Ep. 22, 1</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">(gladiatorum) emptio et venditio, an locatio et conductio,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1251,001:Inst. 3:146" default="NO"><author>Gai.</author> Inst. 3, 146</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n19600.2" n="B" level="2"> <usg type="style">Transf.</usg>, in <number>plur.</number>, <hi rend="ital">a combat of gladiators</hi>, <hi rend="ital">gladiatorial exhibition</hi>: rumor venit datum iri gladiatores; populus convolat, Ter. Hec. prol. alt. 32; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,022:64:133" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Sest. 64, 133</bibl> and 135; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1348,001:life=tit.:7" default="NO"><author>Suet.</author> Tit. 7</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">edere,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1348,001:life=aug.:45" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Aug. 45</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1348,001:life=dom.:4" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Dom. 4</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">edendis gladiatoribus praesedit,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1351,005:1:76" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Tac.</author> A. 1, 76</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">locum gladiatoribus dare,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,057:2:1:5" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Att. 2, 1, 5</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,035:9:7:16" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Phil. 9, 7, 16</bibl>; <hi rend="ital">abl. absol.</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">gladiatoribus,</quote> <trans><tr>at a show of gladiators</tr>,</trans> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 2, 19, 3</bibl></cit>; cf.: ut Romam vitet gladiatoribus, Lucil. ap. <bibl default="NO"><author>Non.</author> 165, 14</bibl>; Asin. Poll. ap. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,056:10:32:3" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Fam. 10, 32, 3</bibl>; cf.: <cit><quote lang="la">gladiatores, quod spectaculum inter epulas erat, eo ornatu armarunt (Campani), etc.,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:9:40:17" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 9, 40, 17</bibl></cit>.—* </sense><sense id="n19600.3" n="II" level="1"> <hi rend="ital">A swordcutler</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">carpentarii, scandularii, gladiatores, aquilices, tubarii, etc.,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,2806,001:50:6:6" default="NO"><author>Dig.</author> 50, 6, 6</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
gladiatorie: <entryFree id="n19601" type="main" key="gla^di^a_to_ri^e_"><orth extent="full" lang="la">glădĭātōrĭē</orth>, <pos>adv.</pos>, v. gladiatorius <sense id="n19601.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">fin.</hi></sense></entryFree>
gladiatorius: <entryFree id="n19602" type="main" key="gla^di^a_to_ri^us"><orth extent="full" lang="la">glădĭātōrĭus</orth>, <itype>a, um</itype>, <pos>adj.</pos> <etym>gladiator</etym>, <sense id="n19602.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">of</hi> or <hi rend="ital">belonging to gladiators</hi>, <hi rend="ital">gladiatorial.</hi> </sense><sense id="n19602.1" n="I" level="1"> <hi rend="ital">Adj.</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">ludus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,013:2:5:9" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Cat. 2, 5, 9</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">certamen,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,037:2:78:317" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> de Or. 2, 78, 317</bibl></cit>: familia, <hi rend="ital">a band</hi> or <hi rend="ital">troop of gladiators</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,022:64:134" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Sest. 64, 134</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0448,002:3:21:4" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Caes.</author> B. C. 3, 21, 4</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0631,001:C. 30:7" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Sall.</author> C. 30, 7</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">munus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1348,001:life=jul.:10" default="NO"><author>Suet.</author> Caes. 10</bibl></cit>; <bibl default="NO">39</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1348,001:life=tib.:7" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Tib. 7</bibl>; <bibl default="NO">37</bibl>; <bibl default="NO">40</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1348,001:life=cal.:18" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Calig. 18</bibl>; <bibl default="NO">26</bibl> et saep.: <cit><quote lang="la">consessus,</quote> <trans><tr>spectators assembled at gladiatorial shows</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,022:58:124" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Sest. 58, 124</bibl></cit>; cf. <cit><quote lang="la">locus,</quote> <trans><tr>a place for witnessing the same</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,014:35:73" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Mur. 35, 73</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">gladiatoria corporis firmitas,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,035:2:25:63" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Phil. 2, 25, 63</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">animus,</quote> <trans>i. e. <tr>desperate</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0134,004:5:7:71" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ter.</author> Phorm. 5, 7, 71</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">ad munus gladiatorium edendum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:28:21:1" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 28, 21, 1</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">spectaculum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:ib" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> ib.</bibl></cit> § 2; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1351,005:14:17" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Tac.</author> A. 14, 17</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">Venus, i. e. clinopale, concubitus,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>App.</author> M. 2, p. 121</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n19602.2" n="II" level="1"> <hi rend="ital">Subst.</hi>: <orth extent="full" lang="la">glădĭātōrĭum</orth>, <itype>ii</itype>, <gen>n.</gen> (sc. praemium, auctoramentum), <hi rend="ital">the hire</hi> or <hi rend="ital">pay of gladiators</hi>, for which freemen engaged as gladiators in the public games: <cit><quote lang="la">gladiatorio accepto decem talentis,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:44:31" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 44, 31</bibl></cit> <hi rend="ital">fin.— Adv.</hi>: <orth extent="full" lang="la">glădĭātōrĭe</orth>, <hi rend="ital">in the manner of a gladiator</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">quae gladiatorie, quae lenonice faceret,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Lampr.</author> Comm. 15, § 4</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
gladiatura: <entryFree id="n19603" type="main" key="gla^di^a_tu_ra"><orth extent="full" lang="la">glădĭātūra</orth>, <itype>ae</itype>, <gen>f.</gen> <etym>gladius, gladiator</etym>, <sense id="n19603.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a fighting of gladiators</hi>, or <hi rend="ital">their profession</hi> (post-Aug. and very rare): <cit><quote lang="la">adduntur e servitiis gladiaturae destinati,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1351,005:3:43" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Tac.</author> A. 3, 43</bibl></cit>: ut requiem gladiaturae haberet, Schol. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1276,001:6:105" default="NO"><author>Juv.</author> 6, 105</bibl>; Firm. 5, 27.</sense></entryFree>
gladiolum: <entryFree id="n19604" type="main" key="gla^di^o^lum"><orth extent="full" lang="la">glădĭŏlum</orth>, <itype>i</itype>, v. gladiolus, I.</entryFree>
gladiolus: <entryFree id="n19605" type="main" key="gla^di^o^lus"><orth extent="full" lang="la">glădĭŏlus</orth>, <itype>i</itype>, <gen>m.</gen> <lbl>dim.</lbl> <etym>gladius</etym>. <sense id="n19605.0" n="I" level="1"> <hi rend="ital">A small sword</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">lingulam veteres dixere gladiolum oblongum, in speciem linguae factum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1254,001:10:25:3" default="NO"><author>Gell.</author> 10, 25, 3</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">gladiolo solito cinctus,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>App.</author> M. 2, p. 122</bibl></cit>; <bibl default="NO">3</bibl>, p. 131.—In <number>plur.</number> heterocl. <orth extent="full" lang="la">glădĭŏla</orth>: <cit><quote lang="la">nec gladiola (quisquam ferat), atqui Messala dixit,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:1:6:42" default="NO"><author>Quint.</author> 1, 6, 42</bibl></cit> (cf. gladius <hi rend="ital">init.</hi>).—</sense><sense id="n19605.1" n="B" level="2"> <orth extent="full" lang="la">Glădĭŏlus</orth>, <itype>i</itype>, <hi rend="ital">title of a comedy by Livius Andronicus</hi>, Fest. s. v. pedibus, p. 210 b. Müll.—</sense><sense id="n19605.2" n="II" level="1"> <pb n="816" /> <cb n="GLAE" /> <hi rend="ital">The sword-lily</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:21:65" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 21, 11, 38, § 65</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:21:107" default="NO" valid="yes">21, 17, 67, § 107</bibl> sq.; al. <bibl default="NO"><author>Pall.</author> 1, 37</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
gladium: <entryFree id="n19606" type="main" key="gla^di^um"><orth extent="full" lang="la">glădĭum</orth>, <itype>ii</itype>, <gen>n.</gen>, v. gladius <sense id="n19606.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">init.</hi></sense></entryFree>
gladius: <entryFree id="n19607" type="main" key="gla^di^us"><orth extent="full" lang="la">glădĭus</orth>, <itype>ĭi</itype>, <gen>m.</gen> (also archaic <orth extent="full" lang="la">glă-dĭum</orth>, <itype>ii</itype>, <gen>n.</gen>, Lucil. ap. <bibl default="NO"><author>Non.</author> 208, 13</bibl>; cf. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0684,001:L. L. 9:section=81" default="NO"><author>Varr.</author> L. L. 9, § 81</bibl> Müll.; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:1:5:16" default="NO"><author>Quint.</author> 1, 5, 16</bibl>; v. gladiola under gladiolus, I.) [perh. akin to clades, cardo; cf. <foreign lang="greek">klada/sai</foreign>, to brandish], <sense id="n19607.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a sword</hi> (syn. the <usg type="style">poet.</usg> ensis, acc. to <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:10:1:11" default="NO"><author>Quint.</author> 10, 1, 11</bibl>; cf. also: spatha, acinaces, sica, pugio). </sense><sense id="n19607.1" n="I" level="1"> <usg type="style">Lit.</usg>: <cit><quote lang="la">arripuit gladium,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,005:4:4:7" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Capt. 4, 4, 7</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,006:2:4:28" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Cas. 2, 4, 28</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">eripite isti gladium, quae sui est impos animi,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,006:3:5:9" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Cas. 3, 5, 9</bibl></cit>: succincti gladiis media regione cracentes, Enn. ap. Paul. ex <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1236,001:page=53" default="NO"><author>Fest.</author> p. 53</bibl> Müll. (Ann. v. 497 Vahl.): contecti gladiis, id. ap. Philarg. ad <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,002:4:230" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> G. 4, 230</bibl> (Ann. v. 415 ib.): <cit><quote lang="la">occursat ocius gladio comminusque rem gerit Varenus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0448,001:5:44:11" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Caes.</author> B. G. 5, 44, 11</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">pila miserunt, celeriterque gladios strinxerunt,</quote> <trans><tr>drew</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0448,002:3:93:1" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> B. C. 3, 93, 1</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">gladium stringere,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,035:2:9:21" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Phil. 2, 9, 21</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,003:12:278" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> A. 12, 278</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">destringere,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0448,001:1:25:2" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Caes.</author> B. G. 1, 25, 2</bibl></cit>; <bibl default="NO">7, 12</bibl> <hi rend="ital">fin.</hi>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0448,002:1:46:1" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> B. C. 1, 46, 1</bibl>; <bibl default="NO">1, 47, 3</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,055:3:31:112" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Off. 3, 31, 112</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,013:3:1:2" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Cat. 3, 1, 2</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:27:13:9" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 27, 13, 9</bibl> et saep.: <cit><quote lang="la">educere,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0448,001:5:44:8" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Caes.</author> B. G. 5, 44, 8</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,057:4:3:3" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Att. 4, 3, 3</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0631,001:C. 51:36" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Sall.</author> C. 51, 36</bibl>; cf.: <cit><quote lang="la">educere e vagina,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,036:2:4:14" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Inv. 2, 4, 14</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">nudare,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,007:2:693" default="NO"><author>Ov.</author> F. 2, 693</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">recondere in vaginam,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,036:2:4:14" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Inv. 2, 4, 14</bibl></cit>; cf. <cit><quote lang="la">condere,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:8 praef" default="NO"><author>Quint.</author> 8 praef.</bibl></cit> § <cit><quote lang="la">15: xiphion gladi praebet speciem,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:25:138" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 25, 11, 89, § 138</bibl></cit>.— </sense><sense id="n19607.2" n="b" level="4"> Prov. </sense><sense id="n19607.3" n="(a)" level="5"> Suo sibi hunc gladio jugulo, <hi rend="ital">fight him with his own weapons</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0134,006:5:8:35" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ter.</author> Ad. 5, 8, 35</bibl>; cf. <cit><quote lang="la">the same,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,008:29:82" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Caecin. 29, 82</bibl></cit>.— </sense><sense id="n19607.4" n="(b)" level="5"> Cum illum (Clodium) plumbeo gladio jugulatum iri tamen diceret (Hortensius), i. e. <hi rend="ital">with very little trouble</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,057:1:16:2" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Att. 1, 16, 2</bibl>. —</sense><sense id="n19607.5" n="(g)" level="5"> Ignem gladio scrutare, <hi rend="ital">stir the fire with a sword</hi> (= <foreign lang="greek">pu=r maxai/ra| skaleu/ein</foreign>, Pythag. ap. Diog. Laert. 8, 17), <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0893,004:2:3:276" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Hor.</author> S. 2, 3, 276</bibl>.—</sense><sense id="n19607.6" n="(d)" level="5"> Gladium alicui dare qui se occidat, <hi rend="ital">to give one the means of ruining himself</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,019:1:2:92" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Trin. 1, 2, 92</bibl>.—</sense><sense id="n19607.7" n="II" level="1"> <usg type="style">Transf.</usg> </sense><sense id="n19607.8" n="A" level="2"> <hi rend="ital">Murder</hi>, <hi rend="ital">death</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">cum tanta praesertim gladiorum sit impunitas,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,035:1:11:27" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Phil. 1, 11, 27</bibl></cit>; cf. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,056:10:2:1" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Fam. 10, 2, 1</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1044,001:2:3:3" default="NO"><author>Vell.</author> 2, 3, 3</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1044,001:2:125:2" default="NO">2, 125, 2</bibl>; <cit><quote lang="la">gladiorum licentia,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,056:4:9" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Fam. 4, 9 <hi rend="ital">fin.</hi></bibl></cit>; <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> 2, 22, 2</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">qui universas provincias regunt, jus gladii habent,</quote> <trans>i. e. <tr>the power of life and death</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,2806,001:1:18:6:section=8" default="NO"><author>Dig.</author> 1, 18, 6, § 8</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">potestas gladii,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,2806,001:2:1:3" default="NO"><author>ib.</author> 2, 1, 3</bibl></cit>; <bibl default="NO"><author>Capitol.</author> Gord. 9</bibl>.—</sense><sense id="n19607.9" n="B" level="2"> <hi rend="ital">A gladiatorial combat</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">qui cum maxime dubitat, utrum se ad gladium locet an ad cultrum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1014,001:Ep. 87" default="NO"><author>Sen.</author> Ep. 87 <hi rend="ital">med.</hi></bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">comparare homines ad gladium,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Lact.</author> 6, 12 <hi rend="ital">fin.</hi></bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">servus ad gladium vel ad bestias vel in metallum damnatus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,2806,001:29:2:25" default="NO"><author>Dig.</author> 29, 2, 25</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n19607.10" n="C" level="2"> Gladius vomeris, <hi rend="ital">a ploughshare</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:18:172" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 18, 18, 48, § 172</bibl>.—</sense><sense id="n19607.11" n="D" level="2"> <hi rend="ital">The sword-fish</hi>, also called xiphias (<foreign lang="greek">cifi/as</foreign>), <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:9:3" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 9, 2, 1, § 3</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:9:54" default="NO" valid="yes">9, 15, 21, § 54</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:32:145" default="NO" valid="yes">32, 11, 53, § 145</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
glaeba: <entryFree id="n19608" type="main" key="glaeba"><orth extent="full" lang="la">glaeba</orth> (less correctly <orth extent="full" lang="la">glēba</orth>), <itype>ae</itype>, <gen>f.</gen> <etym>cf. globus</etym>. <sense id="n19608.0" n="I" level="1"> Prop., <hi rend="ital">a small piece</hi> or <hi rend="ital">lump of earth</hi>, <hi rend="ital">a clod</hi> (cf. gramen, herba, faenum, caespes): <cit><quote lang="la">ingens,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0550,001:6:553" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Lucr.</author> 6, 553</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">glaebis terrarum saepe friatis,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0550,001:1:887" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> 1, 887</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">fecundae,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0550,001:1:212" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> 1, 212</bibl></cit>; so <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,002:1:94" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> G. 1, 94</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0893,001:3:6:39" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Hor.</author> C. 3, 6, 39</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">si glaebis aut saxis aut fustibus aliquem de fundo praecipitem egeris ... non esse arma cespites neque glaebas, etc.,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,008:21:60" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Caecin. 21, 60</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">omnes, qui ullam agri glaebam possiderent,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,005:3:11:section=28" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Verr. 2, 3, 11, § 28</bibl></cit>; so, <cit><quote lang="la">nec ulli glaeba ulla agri assignaretur,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:4:11" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 4, 11</bibl></cit>; cf. <cit><quote lang="la">also: non adimi cuiquam glaebam,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,011:3:1:3" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Agr. 3, 1, 3</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">nam priusquam in os injecta glaeba est, locus ille, ubi crematum est corpus, nihil habet religionis,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,044:2:22:57" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Leg. 2, 22, 57</bibl></cit>; cf. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0684,001:L. L. 5:4:9:section=23" default="NO"><author>Varr.</author> L. L. 5, 4, 9, § 23</bibl>; <cit><quote lang="la">and Fest. s. v. praecidanea, p. 223: ex fundo glaeba sumebatur,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1251,001:Inst. 4:17" default="NO"><author>Gai.</author> Inst. 4, 17</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">ornare glaebam virentem,</quote> <trans>i. e. <tr>an altar built of turf</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1276,001:12:85" default="NO"><author>Juv.</author> 12, 85</bibl></cit>; v. also glaebula.—</sense><sense id="n19608.1" n="II" level="1"> <usg type="style">Transf.</usg> </sense><sense id="n19608.2" n="A" level="2"> <hi rend="ital">Land</hi>, <hi rend="ital">soil</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">terra antiqua potens armis atque ubere glaebae,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,003:1:531" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> A. 1, 531</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">glebae felices,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>App.</author> M. p. 102, 7</bibl></cit>.— </sense><sense id="n19608.3" n="B" level="2"> Of other things, <hi rend="ital">a piece</hi>, <hi rend="ital">lump</hi>, <hi rend="ital">mass</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">sevi ac picis glaebae,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0448,001:7:25" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Caes.</author> B. G. 7, 25</bibl></cit>; so, <cit><quote lang="la">turis,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0550,001:3:328" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Lucr.</author> 3, 328</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1020,001:6:60" default="NO"><author>Stat.</author> Th. 6, 60</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">marmoris,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:36:50" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 36, 6, 8, § 50</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">salis,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:31:7:39" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> 31, 7, 39</bibl></cit>, <foreign lang="greek">z</foreign> 73: <cit><quote lang="la">sulphuris,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:35:175" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> 35, 15, 50, § 175</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">lactis,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Nemes.</author> Ecl. 3 <hi rend="ital">fin.</hi></bibl></cit>—</sense><sense id="n19608.4" n="C" level="2"> (Late Lat.), = pensio or canon praedio incumbens, <hi rend="ital">a tax imposed upon the land of senators</hi>, Cod. Th. 6, 2, 10; <bibl default="NO"><author>ib.</author> 12, 1, 138</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1224,001:Ep. 4:61" default="NO"><author>Symm.</author> Ep. 4, 61</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
glaebalis: <entryFree id="n19609" type="main" key="glaeba_lis"><orth extent="full" lang="la">glaebālis</orth> (<orth type="alt" extent="full" lang="la">glēb-</orth>), <itype>e</itype>, <pos>adj.</pos> <etym>glaeba</etym>. <sense id="n19609.0" n="I" level="1"> <hi rend="ital">Of</hi> or <hi rend="ital">relating to clods</hi> (post-class.): <cit><quote lang="la">agger,</quote> <trans><tr>consisting of clods</tr>,</trans> <bibl default="NO"><author>Amm.</author> 23, 5, 15</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n19609.1" n="II" level="1"> In law Lat. (acc. to glaeba, II. A.), <hi rend="ital">of</hi> or <hi rend="ital">relating to lands</hi>: collatio, <hi rend="ital">a tax paid from</hi> <cb n="GLAN" /> <hi rend="ital">lands</hi>, <hi rend="ital">land-tax</hi>, Cod. Th. 6, 2, 3; 4, 8, 11 et saep.</sense></entryFree>
glaebarius: <entryFree id="n19610" type="main" key="glaeba_ri^us"><orth extent="full" lang="la">glaebārĭus</orth> (<orth type="alt" extent="full" lang="la">glēb-</orth>), <itype>a, um</itype>, <pos>adj.</pos> <etym>glaeba</etym>, <sense id="n19610.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">of</hi> or <hi rend="ital">relating to clods</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">e quis (bubus) ut dicti valentes glaebarii, qui facile proscindunt glebas,</quote> <trans><tr>clod-breakers</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0684,001:L. L. 7:4:95:section=74" default="NO"><author>Varr.</author> L. L. 7, 4, 95, § 74</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
glaebatim: <entryFree id="n19611" type="main" key="glaeba_tim"><orth extent="full" lang="la">glaebātim</orth> (<orth type="alt" extent="full" lang="la">glēb-</orth>), <pos>adv.</pos> <etym>id.</etym>, <sense id="n19611.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">by clods</hi> (post-class.): <cit><quote lang="la">agros glaebatim metiri,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Lact.</author> Mort. Pers. 23, 2</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
glaebatio: <entryFree id="n19612" type="main" key="glaeba_ti^o"><orth extent="full" lang="la">glaebātĭo</orth> (<orth type="alt" extent="full" lang="la">glēb-</orth>), <itype>ōnis</itype>, <gen>f.</gen> <etym>id.</etym>, <sense id="n19612.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a tax levied on land</hi>, <hi rend="ital">land-tax</hi>, Cod. Th. 6, 2, 12.</sense></entryFree>
glaebosus: <entryFree id="n19613" type="main" key="glaebo_sus"><orth extent="full" lang="la">glaebōsus</orth> (<orth type="alt" extent="full" lang="la">glēb-</orth>), <itype>a, um</itype>, <pos>adj.</pos> <etym>id.</etym>, <sense id="n19613.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">full of clods</hi>, <hi rend="ital">cloddy</hi> (post-Aug.), <bibl default="NO"><author>App.</author> M. 1, 2</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">terra glaebosior,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:35:191" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 35, 16, 53, § 191</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
glaebula: <entryFree id="n19614" type="main" key="glaebu^la"><orth extent="full" lang="la">glaebŭla</orth> (<orth type="alt" extent="full" lang="la">glēb-</orth>), <itype>ae</itype>, <gen>f.</gen> <lbl>dim.</lbl> <etym>id.</etym>. <sense id="n19614.0" n="I" level="1"> Prop., <hi rend="ital">a small clod</hi> or <hi rend="ital">lump of earth</hi> (postAug.): <cit><quote lang="la">frumenta lapillisque carent et glaebulis, quas per trituram fere terrena remittit area,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0845,001:1:6:23" default="NO"><author>Col.</author> 1, 6, 23</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1038,001:5:3:3" default="NO"><author>Val. Max.</author> 5, 3, 3</bibl> <hi rend="ital">ext.</hi>—</sense><sense id="n19614.1" n="II" level="1"> <usg type="style">Meton.</usg> </sense><sense id="n19614.2" n="A" level="2"> <hi rend="ital">A little farm</hi>, <hi rend="ital">small piece of land</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">saturabat glaebula talis patrem ipsum turbamque casae,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1276,001:14:166" default="NO"><author>Juv.</author> 14, 166</bibl></cit>; <bibl default="NO"><author>App.</author> M. 9, p. 233</bibl>.—</sense><sense id="n19614.3" n="B" level="2"> Of other things, <hi rend="ital">a small piece</hi>, <hi rend="ital">little lump</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">myrrhae,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1056,001:8:3" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Vitr.</author> 8, 3</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">nivis,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1011,001:Comp. 199" default="NO"><author>Scrib.</author> Comp. 199</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">ex metallo,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1318,001:10:16:3" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> Ep. 10, 16, 3</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
glaebulentus: <entryFree id="n19615" type="main" key="glaebu^lentus"><orth extent="full" lang="la">glaebŭlentus</orth> (<orth type="alt" extent="full" lang="la">glēb-</orth>), <itype>a, um</itype>, <pos>adj.</pos> <etym>id.</etym>, <sense id="n19615.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">cloddy</hi>, <hi rend="ital">consisting of earth</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">animalia,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>App.</author> de Deo Socr. p. 46</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
glaesaria: <entryFree id="n19616" type="main" key="Glaesa_ri^a"><orth extent="full" lang="la">Glaesārĭa</orth> (<orth type="alt" extent="full" lang="la">Glēs-</orth>), <itype>ae</itype> (sc. insula), <gen>f.</gen> <etym>glaesum</etym>, <sense id="n19616.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">an amber island in the North Sea</hi>, also called Burcana, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:4:97" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 4, 13, 27, § 97</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:37:42" default="NO" valid="yes">37, 3, 11, § 42</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
glaesum: <entryFree id="n19617" type="main" key="glaesum"><orth extent="full" lang="la">glaesum</orth> (<orth type="alt" extent="full" lang="la">glēsum</orth>, <orth type="alt" extent="full" lang="la">glessum</orth>), <itype>i</itype>, <gen>n.</gen> <etym>cf. Germ. Glas; gleissen = glänzen, to glimmer; Engl. glass</etym>, <sense id="n19617.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">amber</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1351,002:45" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Tac.</author> G. 45</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:37:42" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 37, 3, 11, § 42</bibl>.—Hence, <orth extent="full" lang="la">glaesārĭus</orth>, <itype>a, um</itype>, <pos>adj.</pos>, <hi rend="ital">of amber</hi>, <hi rend="ital">amber-</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">insula,</quote> <trans><tr>which produces amber</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:4:97" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 4, 13, 27, § 97</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:37:42" default="NO" valid="yes">37, 3, 11, § 42</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
glamae: <entryFree id="n19618" type="main" key="glamae"><orth extent="full" lang="la">glamae</orth>, v. gramiae.</entryFree>
glandarius: <entryFree id="n19619" type="main" key="glanda_ri^us"><orth extent="full" lang="la">glandārĭus</orth>, <itype>a, um</itype>, <pos>adj.</pos> <etym>glans</etym>, <sense id="n19619.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">of</hi> or <hi rend="ital">belonging to acorns</hi> or <hi rend="ital">mast</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">silva,</quote> <trans><tr>producing acorns</tr>,</trans> <bibl default="NO"><author>Cato</author>, R. R. 1, 7</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0684,001:R. R. 1:7:9" default="NO"><author>Varr.</author> R. R. 1, 7, 9</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
glandifer: <entryFree id="n19620" type="main" key="glandi^fer"><orth extent="full" lang="la">glandĭfer</orth>, <itype>ĕra, ĕrum</itype>, <pos>adj.</pos> <etym>glans-fero</etym>, <sense id="n19620.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">acorn-bearing</hi>, <hi rend="ital">glandiferous</hi> (very rare): <cit><quote lang="la">quercus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0550,001:5:939" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Lucr.</author> 5, 939</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,044:1:1:2" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Leg. 1, 1, 2</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
glandionida: <entryFree id="n19621" type="hapax" key="glandi^o^ni^da"><orth extent="full" lang="la">glandĭŏnĭda</orth>, <itype>ae</itype>, <gen>f.</gen> <etym>glandium</etym>, i. q. glandium, <sense id="n19621.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a savory kernel</hi> or <hi rend="ital">glandule</hi> in pork: <cit><quote lang="la">suilla,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,010:1:3:27" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Men. 1, 3, 27</bibl></cit> Ritschl (al. glandionicam).</sense></entryFree>
glandium: <entryFree id="n19622" type="main" key="glandi^um"><orth extent="full" lang="la">glandĭum</orth>, <itype>ii</itype>, <gen>n.</gen> <etym>glans</etym>, <sense id="n19622.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a delicate kernel</hi> or <hi rend="ital">glandule</hi> in meat, esp. in pork, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,008:2:3:44" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Curc. 2, 3, 44</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,005:4:4:7" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Capt. 4, 4, 7</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,018:2:2:36" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Stich. 2, 2, 36</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:8:209" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 8, 51, 77, § 209</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:16:185" default="NO" valid="yes">16, 38, 73, § 185</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
glando: <entryFree id="n19623" type="main" key="glando"><orth extent="full" lang="la">glando</orth>, <itype>ĭnis</itype>, <gen>f.</gen> <etym>id.</etym>, in late Latin for glans, <sense id="n19623.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">an acorn</hi>, <bibl default="NO"><author>Avien.</author> Perieg. 285</bibl>; <bibl default="NO">1189</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
glandulae: <entryFree id="n19624" type="main" key="glandu^lae"><orth extent="full" lang="la">glandŭlae</orth>, <itype>ārum</itype>, <gen>f.</gen> <lbl>dim.</lbl> <etym>id.; lit., a little acorn; hence, transf.</etym>. <sense id="n19624.0" n="I" level="1"> <hi rend="ital">The glands of the throat</hi>, called also tonsillae: <cit><quote lang="la">in ipsis cervicibus glandulae positae sunt, quae interdum cum dolore intumescunt,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0836,001:4:1" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cels.</author> 4, 1</bibl></cit>. —</sense><sense id="n19624.1" n="B" level="2"> <hi rend="ital">Swollen glands in the neck</hi>, <hi rend="ital">enlarged tonsils</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0836,001:2:1" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cels.</author> 2, 1 <hi rend="ital">fin.</hi></bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0836,001:8:4" default="NO" valid="yes">8, 4</bibl>.—</sense><sense id="n19624.2" n="II" level="1"> I. q. glandium, <hi rend="ital">the neck-piece</hi>, <hi rend="ital">delicate bits</hi>, esp. of pork, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1294,001:3:82:21" default="NO"><author>Mart.</author> 3, 82, 21</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1294,001:7:20:4" default="NO">7, 20, 4</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,2003,001:4:1:section=117" default="NO"><author>Apic.</author> 4, 1, § 117</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
glandulosus: <entryFree id="n19625" type="hapax" key="glandu^lo_sus"><orth extent="full" lang="la">glandŭlōsus</orth>, <itype>a, um</itype>, <pos>adj.</pos> <etym>glandulae, II.</etym>, <sense id="n19625.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">full of kernels</hi>, <hi rend="ital">glandulous</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">cervix suis,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0845,001:7:9:1" default="NO"><author>Col.</author> 7, 9, 1</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
glanis: <entryFree id="n19626" type="greek" key="glanis"><orth extent="full" lang="la">glanis</orth>, <itype>is and ĭdis</itype>, and <orth extent="full" lang="la">glanus</orth>, <itype>i</itype>, <gen>m.</gen>, = <foreign lang="greek">gla/nis</foreign> and <foreign lang="greek">gla/nos</foreign>, <sense id="n19626.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a kind of shad</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:9:145" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 9, 43, 67, § 145</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:32:128" default="NO" valid="yes">32, 10, 45, § 128</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:32:148" default="NO" valid="yes">32, 11, 53, § 148</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
glans: <entryFree id="n19627" type="main" key="glans"><orth extent="full" lang="la">glans</orth>, <itype>glandis</itype>, <gen>f.</gen> <etym>kindr. with <foreign lang="greek">ba/lanos</foreign></etym>, <sense id="n19627.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">an acorn</hi>, and, in gen., <hi rend="ital">any acorn-shaped fruit</hi>, <hi rend="ital">beechnut</hi>, <hi rend="ital">chestnut</hi>, etc. </sense><sense id="n19627.1" n="I" level="1"> <usg type="style">Lit.</usg>: <cit><quote lang="la">bubus glandem prandio depromere,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,020:3:1:2" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Truc. 3, 1, 2</bibl></cit>; <bibl default="NO"><author>Cato</author>, R. R. 54</bibl>; <bibl default="NO">60</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0845,001:6:3" default="NO"><author>Col.</author> 6, 3</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:16:15 sq" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 16, 5, 6, § 15 sq.</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0550,001:5:1416" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Lucr.</author> 5, 1416</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,040:9:31" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Or. 9, 31</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,002:1:148" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> G. 1, 148</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,006:1:106" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ov.</author> M. 1, 106</bibl> et saep.: <cit><quote lang="la">glandis appellatione omnis fructus continetur, ut Javolenus ait,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,2806,001:50:16:236" default="NO"><author>Dig.</author> 50, 16, 236</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n19627.2" n="II" level="1"> <usg type="style">Transf.</usg> </sense><sense id="n19627.3" n="A" level="2"> <hi rend="ital">An acorn-shaped ball</hi> of lead or clay which was hurled at the enemy, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0550,001:6:179" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Lucr.</author> 6, 179</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0550,001:307" default="NO" valid="yes">307</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0448,001:5:43:1" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Caes.</author> B. G. 5, 43, 1</bibl>; <bibl default="NO">7, 81, 4</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0631,001:J. 57:4" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Sall.</author> J. 57, 4</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:38:20:1" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 38, 20, 1</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:21:7" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>ib.</author> 21, 7</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:29:6" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>ib.</author> 29, 6</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,003:7:686" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> A. 7, 686</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,006:14:826 al" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ov.</author> M. 14, 826 al.</bibl>—A leaden ball of this kind was found with the inscription ROMA FERI (i. e. O dea Roma, feri hostem!), <bibl default="NO"><author>Inscr. Orell.</author> 4932</bibl>.—</sense><sense id="n19627.4" n="B" level="2"> <hi rend="ital">The glans</hi> penis, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0836,001:7:25" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cels.</author> 7, 25</bibl>; cf. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1294,001:12:75:3" default="NO"><author>Mart.</author> 12, 75, 3</bibl>. <cb n="GLEU" /></sense></entryFree>
